title: Teams & Enterprise
body: Teams & Enterprise Help Topics Teams & Enterprise Teams & Enterprise Managing Teams Teams If you need more than one SurveyMonkey account for your organization, sign up for a team. Team plans offer consolidated billing, seat management, a Library with shared images and templates, and collaboration features that help your team work together to create, send, and analyze surveys. Team Seats, Roles, and Permissions Your seat type and role on a team controls what permissions you have within your account and how you can work together with your team. Managing Seats on Your Team The Primary Admin or Admin of a team can add seats, invite people to join your team, and manage existing seats on your team from the My Team section of your account. Team Billing Learn all about how billing works for teams. The Primary Admin of a team is in charge of the consolidated billing for all accounts on the team. Manage Accounts with SCIM Use SCIM to keep SurveyMonkey accounts up to date with information stored in an identity provider (IdP). Manage Your Team’s Surveys If you are a Primary Admin, Admin or Division Admin, you can see the surveys created by people on your team and help manage those surveys. Managing Seats on Your Enterprise Team The Primary Admin or Admin of an Enterprise team can add seats, invite people to join your team, and manage existing seats on your team from the My Team section of your account. Consolidating Accounts for Enterprise The consolidation of individual and team accounts into one Enterprise account. Teams If you need more than one SurveyMonkey account for your organization, sign up for a team. Team plans offer consolidated billing, seat management, a Library with shared images and templates, and collaboration features that help your team work together to create, send, and analyze surveys. Team Seats, Roles, and Permissions Your seat type and role on a team controls what permissions you have within your account and how you can work together with your team. Managing Seats on Your Team The Primary Admin or Admin of a team can add seats, invite people to join your team, and manage existing seats on your team from the My Team section of your account. Team Billing Learn all about how billing works for teams. The Primary Admin of a team is in charge of the consolidated billing for all accounts on the team. Manage Accounts with SCIM Use SCIM to keep SurveyMonkey accounts up to date with information stored in an identity provider (IdP). Manage Your Team’s Surveys If you are a Primary Admin, Admin or Division Admin, you can see the surveys created by people on your team and help manage those surveys. Managing Seats on Your Enterprise Team The Primary Admin or Admin of an Enterprise team can add seats, invite people to join your team, and manage existing seats on your team from the My Team section of your account. Consolidating Accounts for Enterprise The consolidation of individual and team accounts into one Enterprise account. Collaborating With Your Team Sharing Surveys with Others You can share surveys with people on or outside your team if you have an Enterprise account or a Full Access seat on a team. Your plan type determines the ways you can share surveys, if people can reshare your surveys, and if you have the option to automatically share surveys with your entire team or workgroup. Working with Others on Surveys We have some great collaboration features to help you work with other people on surveys, no matter what kind of SurveyMonkey account you have. Managing Brand Assets in the Library The library is where Full Access seat team members can find and use shared assets to create surveys. These shared assets include images, documents, templates, themes, and questions. Primary Admins and Admins can also add or manage library items. Divisions A Division is a sub-group within your Enterprise team, with its own admins, users, and division library. Primary Admins and Admins can add divisions for different departments, offices, clients, or any other groups you want to manage separately or give unique branding assets. Workgroups Enterprise Workgroups help organize team members with a shared purpose to work together on projects. Survey Permissions to Shared Surveys When a survey is shared, people are given a level of access to each section of the survey. A team member's default access level is determined by their role, but it may be possible to edit the level of permissions some one has. The highest level of access available to people outside of your team is View Only. Getting Feedback on Surveys and Results You can invite others to give feedback on your survey design by sharing your survey preview link or sending an invite to comment. Once you collect survey responses, you can use a Shared Data Page to invite others to give feedback on your survey results. Discover Teams at Your Company Team Discovery helps people find existing SurveyMonkey teams from their company and makes it easier for Primary Admins to invite people to join their team. Sharing Surveys with Others You can share surveys with people on or outside your team if you have an Enterprise account or a Full Access seat on a team. Your plan type determines the ways you can share surveys, if people can reshare your surveys, and if you have the option to automatically share surveys with your entire team or workgroup. Working with Others on Surveys We have some great collaboration features to help you work with other people on surveys, no matter what kind of SurveyMonkey account you have. Managing Brand Assets in the Library The library is where Full Access seat team members can find and use shared assets to create surveys. These shared assets include images, documents, templates, themes, and questions. Primary Admins and Admins can also add or manage library items. Divisions A Division is a sub-group within your Enterprise team, with its own admins, users, and division library. Primary Admins and Admins can add divisions for different departments, offices, clients, or any other groups you want to manage separately or give unique branding assets. Workgroups Enterprise Workgroups help organize team members with a shared purpose to work together on projects. Survey Permissions to Shared Surveys When a survey is shared, people are given a level of access to each section of the survey. A team member's default access level is determined by their role, but it may be possible to edit the level of permissions some one has. The highest level of access available to people outside of your team is View Only. Getting Feedback on Surveys and Results You can invite others to give feedback on your survey design by sharing your survey preview link or sending an invite to comment. Once you collect survey responses, you can use a Shared Data Page to invite others to give feedback on your survey results. Discover Teams at Your Company Team Discovery helps people find existing SurveyMonkey teams from their company and makes it easier for Primary Admins to invite people to join their team. Enterprise Features Enterprise Team Seats, Roles and Permissions Learn how your seat and role on an Enterprise team controls what account permissions you have and how you can work together. Enterprise Settings Settings let Primary Admins set default options and permissions for their entire Enterprise team. Single Sign-On (SSO) Single Sign-On (SSO) enables people on your team to use their corporate login credentials to log in to SurveyMonkey. Your organization can control who can access your SurveyMonkey team and create authentication policies for increased security. Custom Question Bank Custom Question Bank lets Primary Admins and Admins add custom questions to their team’s Library. Full Access seats on the team can add the questions to their survey from the Question Bank. HIPAA Compliance and SurveyMonkey HIPAA is a United States law that regulates the collection and handling of “protected health information” (PHI). Certain organizations called “covered entities” and their business associates are required to comply with HIPAA. You can collect PHI in surveys if you enable HIPAA features on your team. Custom Sender Name and Email Domain A Custom Sender Name and Email Domain is a branded display name and email address for when you send surveys with the Email Invitation. It's what survey-takers see in the From field of the email asking them to take your survey. Using a Custom Sender Name and Email Domain can improve email deliverability and your survey-takers are more likely to respond to your survey when they recognize your familiar and trusted brand. Account Control Account Control lets you lock down your organization's email domain so that every SurveyMonkey account using your company's email domain becomes part of your Enterprise team. Team Activity The Activity tab lets Primary Admins and Admins know what's been happening in their Enterprise Team. User Report Learn how the User Report provides Enterprise Admins visibility into their team's activity. Learn about Enterprise Features Team management tools, integrations, and solutions for your organization. Custom Roles The Primary Admin or Admin of an Enterprise team can customize roles, and invite seats for a more personalized experience. Just select roles and permissions under your Enterprise settings. Professional Services Enterprise customers can get a consultation from our Expert Services team. Contact Sales or your Customer Success Manager for more information. Enhanced Sensitive Data Protection The Enhanced Sensitive Data Protection (ESDP) feature offers additional security benefits when using SurveyMonkey. Learn tips and best practices that you should follow—in SurveyMonkey, and anywhere online—to keep your account and data safe and secure. Welcome to SurveyMonkey Enterprise Get Set Up to Send Text Messages Does your organization want to send surveys via the Text Message collector? If you’re interested, start the process to set your organization up with their unique, pre-verified phone number to distribute text message surveys. You’ll need a phone number for each region you’re planning to send text messages to. title: Your Account
body: Your Account Help Topics Your Account Your Account Login & Password Single Sign-On (SSO) Single Sign-On (SSO) enables people on your team to use their corporate login credentials to log in to SurveyMonkey. Your organization can control who can access your SurveyMonkey team and create authentication policies for increased security. Logging in to Your Account Learn how to log in to SurveyMonkey, all about account verification, and how to troubleshoot login issues. Your Login Details Change your login details from My Account. Verify your email to make sure you can get account information from us. Forgot Login Details If you can't log in because you forgot your login details, try these troubleshooting steps to get back into your account. SurveyMonkey Mobile Apps Learn more about the three mobile apps SurveyMonkey has available for download. SurveyMonkey Login Updates We're updating the way you log in to SurveyMonkey to make it simpler and more secure. This article has details to help you prepare for the transition. Two-factor Authentication (2FA) Get added security to your SurveyMonkey account by confirming your identity via mobile device at login. Device Registration Single Sign-On (SSO) Single Sign-On (SSO) enables people on your team to use their corporate login credentials to log in to SurveyMonkey. Your organization can control who can access your SurveyMonkey team and create authentication policies for increased security. Logging in to Your Account Learn how to log in to SurveyMonkey, all about account verification, and how to troubleshoot login issues. Your Login Details Change your login details from My Account. Verify your email to make sure you can get account information from us. Forgot Login Details If you can't log in because you forgot your login details, try these troubleshooting steps to get back into your account. SurveyMonkey Mobile Apps Learn more about the three mobile apps SurveyMonkey has available for download. Two-factor Authentication (2FA) Get added security to your SurveyMonkey account by confirming your identity via mobile device at login. Device Registration Managing Your Account Changing the Language on Your Account You can easily switch the language you use when browsing SurveyMonkey in the footer. You can also save your language preference from the My Account page. Contacting Support About an Account If you need to contact support about an account, we're here to help! To keep your account and data secure, we may need to confirm account ownership or billing details before we send you account information. Account Response Limits Free plans have a response limit per survey. Monthly plans have an account-wide response limit per month, and you’ll be billed response overages or billable responses if you exceed the limit. For larger response limits, we recommend an annual plan. How to Opt Out or Unsubscribe You can manage the types of marketing emails you receive, the SurveyMonkey accounts that can send you survey invitations, emails you receive from SurveyMonkey Contribute, and the cookies we use. Allow List Information for SurveyMonkey If you're having trouble accessing SurveyMonkey or not receiving emails from us, we recommend adding our domains and IP addresses to your allow list (sometimes known as a whitelist). Canceling or Deleting Your SurveyMonkey Account To cancel a paid subscription, go to your Billing Details from My Account and cancel auto-renew. Or you can delete your account, if you don't want to keep it or your survey data any longer. Trying Paid Features When building your survey on the free plan, you have the chance to try some paid features before sending your survey. To keep the paid features, upgrade your account to send your survey or remove the features and send your survey on the free plan. Managing AI Feature Access Learn how to manage access to AI features on your Teams or Enterprise plan. title: Privacy & Legal
body: Privacy & Legal Help Topics Privacy & Legal Privacy & Legal Privacy & Data Your SurveyMonkey Data Learn about how long we retain your surveys and data, data privacy and security, and where we store your data. Account Types and Account Ownership Learn all about account and data ownership. Protecting Your SurveyMonkey Account and Data Learn tips and best practices that you should follow—in SurveyMonkey, and anywhere online—to keep your account and data safe and secure. SurveyMonkey and Privacy Rights SurveyMonkey is complying with applicable privacy regulations like the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA). Our features help you to be compliant. Avoiding Scams We’ve become aware of scams such as job offers, fake coupons, or checks that say they’re sponsored by SurveyMonkey. These are not from us—they’re sent by scammers. Learn how to identify fakes and report scams like this so you and others can stay safer online. Data Collection and Privacy Best Practices Follow these best practices for limiting the personal information you collect in surveys and sharing how you intend to handle the data you collect. Data Processing Agreements, Storage, and Transfers (EU) European customers can learn about where SurveyMonkey stores customer data, Data Processing Agreements (DPA), and the EU-US Privacy Shield and Swiss-US Privacy Shield. Are my survey responses anonymous and secure? It's up to each survey creator to decide to collect responses anonymously or to capture respondents’ personal information. URLs beginning with https:// are sent via SSL encryption. Read our Privacy Notice and Security Statement for more details. SurveyMonkey Audience Policies Get links to SurveyMonkey Audience privacy, confidentiality, and legal information, learn what to do if your survey contains potentially offensive content, and review the Acceptable Uses Policy to ensure that the content of your survey meets our requirements. Benchmark Data Benchmark data comes from SurveyMonkey customers who used Question Bank questions in their surveys. You can opt out or exclude your data from benchmarks. Enhanced Sensitive Data Protection The Enhanced Sensitive Data Protection (ESDP) feature offers additional security benefits when using SurveyMonkey. Learn tips and best practices that you should follow—in SurveyMonkey, and anywhere online—to keep your account and data safe and secure. Report a Security Issue Policy & Legal Legal Center Pages If you have questions about our cookies, security, or terms, visit our Legal Center. SurveyMonkey and IRB Guidelines Review the potential IRB guidelines for using SurveyMonkey as a tool to survey research participants. HIPAA Compliance and SurveyMonkey HIPAA is a United States law that regulates the collection and handling of “protected health information” (PHI). Certain organizations called “covered entities” and their business associates are required to comply with HIPAA. You can collect PHI in surveys if you enable HIPAA features on your team. Customer Complaints and Dispute Resolution If you have a complaint with respect to your quality of service, billing or invoicing, or you have any concerns about our terms of use or policies, we urge you to contact us so we can try to resolve your complaint or concern as quickly as possible. SurveyMonkey’s DMCA Agent Please read this article for the contact information for our Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) agent. Citing SurveyMonkey or SurveyMonkey Audience Please read this article for details about referencing SurveyMonkey in papers or articles. title: Integrations
body: Integrations Help Topics Integrations Integrations Automate Tasks Using SurveyMonkey for Salesforce The SurveyMonkey for Salesforce integration lets you automate workflows to trigger surveys and push survey data back to Salesforce records for in-context analysis. Using Zapier with SurveyMonkey Zapier allows you to integrate SurveyMonkey with hundreds of other apps to automate tasks in your workflow. Export Responses to a Google Sheet Export Responses to Microsoft Excel Connect your SurveyMonkey account with Microsoft Excel to export survey responses to a new worksheet saved to OneDrive. This automation can help you share data across silos, merge responses with your operational data, slice and dice, or kick off other automated processes. SurveyMonkey for Salesforce: Web Link Encryption Post Responses Automatically in Microsoft Teams Connect your SurveyMonkey account with Microsoft Teams so you can automatically post survey responses in a Microsoft Teams channel or chat, in real time. Automate with Quick Actions in Connect The Connect Apps section of your survey is the place to connect your survey data to your business apps to automate data sharing, collaborate smarter, and save time. Automating with quick actions helps to improve information sharing, iterate on survey feedback, and save time. Post Responses Automatically in Slack Connect your SurveyMonkey account with Slack so you can automatically post survey responses in public or private Slack channels, in real time. You can set up the workflow so all responses post to Slack or set conditions based on a specific set of responses to target notifications and encourage the right people to take action. SurveyMonkey for Salesforce: Sending Reminder Emails Use Salesforce templates and flows to send reminder emails to people who haven't taken your survey. SurveyMonkey for Salesforce: Mapping Multiple Surveys to a Custom Salesforce Object You can map responses from multiple surveys to the same Salesforce object. Update the layout of your Salesforce object so you can view all of your responses. SurveyMonkey for Salesforce: Creating a Case Closed Survey Use the SurveyMonkey for Salesforce integration to automatically send a survey after closing a case. You'll need to do some setup in Salesforce. SurveyMonkey for Salesforce: Creating Reports and Dashboards Create Salesforce reports using the responses you mapped from SurveyMonkey. You can also filter and view results in SurveyMonkey. SurveyMonkey for Salesforce: Measuring Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) Measure and track Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) with SurveyMonkey. Then, send responses to Salesforce to create reports and act on results. SurveyMonkey for Salesforce: Measuring Net Promoter® Score Measure and track Net Promoter® Score with SurveyMonkey. Then, send responses to Salesforce to create reports and act on results. SurveyMonkey for Salesforce: Managed Package SurveyMonkey for Salesforce offers a managed package that can create mappings for you. Learn how to use and build reports from the managed package. SurveyMonkey for Salesforce: Lightning Flows and Components If you use our Salesforce integration, you may have access to our Lightning Flows and Components. Lightning Flows and Components let you send surveys directly from Salesforce objects. Getting Started with SurveyMonkey for Salesforce Learn how to get started using our Salesforce integration. The SurveyMonkey for Salesforce integration helps you push survey data back to Salesforce for in-context analysis. Zendesk Integration Send SurveyMonkey surveys to your Zendesk customers. SurveyMonkey API We offer API capabilities and partnerships with a variety of companies. The SurveyMonkey for Salesforce integration helps you push survey data back to Salesforce for in-context analysis. Zendesk Integration Send SurveyMonkey surveys to your Zendesk customers. SurveyMonkey API We offer API capabilities and partnerships with a variety of companies. Share Contacts & Send Surveys Microsoft Teams Integration SurveyMonkey's integration with Microsoft Teams lets you create polls, surveys, or quizzes and collect data directly in Teams. You can also set up notifications to let the team know when there are new responses or comments. Zoom Integration The Zoom integration lets you get real-time input from people attending your Zoom meeting. You can do a multi-question survey or a single-question poll directly in the Zoom meeting to capture feedback in the moment. You can share the results during the meeting or review them later in your SurveyMonkey account. HootSuite Integration View your SurveyMonkey survey results, and send your survey through social media, directly from your HootSuite dashboard. Sending Surveys via Mailchimp The integration lets you design a survey in SurveyMonkey and distribute it through a SurveyMonkey email template in Mailchimp. SurveyMonkey API We offer API capabilities and partnerships with a variety of companies. You can also set up notifications to let the team know when there are new responses or comments. You can do a multi-question survey or a single-question poll directly in the Zoom meeting to capture feedback in the moment. You can share the results during the meeting or review them later in your SurveyMonkey account. SurveyMonkey API We offer API capabilities and partnerships with a variety of companies. Sync & Analyze Data Microsoft Power BI Integration SurveyMonkey's Microsoft Power BI integration lets you connect SurveyMonkey response data to Power BI Desktop. Power BI lets you create data models, visually display your data with charts and graphs, and create reports. OneDrive Integration SurveyMonkey's Integration with Microsoft OneDrive lets you create and store a file of your survey or results in OneDrive where you can share them with others. Tableau Integration SurveyMonkey's Tableau integration lets you set up Extracts to export your response data to Tableau. Marketo Integration You can create or update leads in Marketo based on contact information collected in SurveyMonkey, and attach survey response data to leads in Marketo. The Marketo integration is available as an add-on at an additional cost. Google Add-Ons Use the SurveyMonkey for Google Forms add-on to import your form into a SurveyMonkey survey. Use the SurveyMonkey for Google Sheets add-on to import your survey results directly into Google Sheets. title: Solutions
body: Solutions Help Topics Solutions Solutions COVID-19 Covid-19 Symptom Tracking Survey The COVID-19 Symptom Tracking and Risk Assessment survey is a tool to help your employees return to work safely. Start with a template with key questions to help make decisions about coming in to work. Based on people's answers, they'll be put into groups and you can set up a custom message to help guide their next steps. Return to Work Solutions Return to Work solutions are a way for HR leaders to understand employees’ feelings about working remotely, returning to work, and working in shared spaces. Start with an editable survey template with guided setup, decide how frequently you want to send the survey out, and access automatically created reports with insights from your results. Covid-19 Symptom Tracking Survey The COVID-19 Symptom Tracking and Risk Assessment survey is a tool to help your employees return to work safely. Start with a template with key questions to help make decisions about coming in to work. Based on people's answers, they'll be put into groups and you can set up a custom message to help guide their next steps. Return to Work Solutions Return to Work solutions are a way for HR leaders to understand employees’ feelings about working remotely, returning to work, and working in shared spaces. Start with an editable survey template with guided setup, decide how frequently you want to send the survey out, and access automatically created reports with insights from your results. Market Research Creative and Concept Testing Solutions Expert Solutions help you quickly customize a concept test, collect quality response data from your target market, and receive presentation-ready reports. Usage and Attitudes Our Usage & Attitudes solution helps you learn about your customers’ preferences, habits, and purchase behaviors that drive attributes like frequency of use and likelihood to purchase. Idea Screening Solution Idea Screening lets you quickly test and rank early stage product, marketing, or brand creative ideas so you know which are best to invest in. Price Optimization (Van Westendorp) The Price Optimization (Van Westendorp) solution helps you figure out the right pricing strategy for your product or service by measuring how much your target market is willing to pay. Using SurveyMonkey for Market Research Learn how to use SurveyMonkey Audience for market research and get valuable insight about your target audience. Feature Importance (MaxDiff) The Feature Importance solution uses MaxDiff methodology to help you understand what items or features matter most to your audience. This is helpful when you’re prioritizing new products or features and want to know what your customers care about most. This is helpful when you’re prioritizing new products or features and want to know what your customers care about most. SurveyMonkey Audience Panel Buying Responses with SurveyMonkey Audience Buy an Audience project if you need people to take your survey. You can target the types of people you want to hear from based on specific attributes, like country, gender, age-range, income, employment status, and more. How to Reach a Target Audience When you buy responses you can choose from hundreds of targeting options or add screening questions to reach your target audience. If you use disqualification logic, you'll need to estimate a qualification rate so we know how many people to send your survey to. SurveyMonkey Audience Design Guidelines Follow these survey requirements and best practices to run a successful SurveyMonkey Audience project! SurveyMonkey Audience Custom Balancing Custom balancing lets you customize the gender or age group you're targeting when buying Audience responses. Calculating the Number of Respondents You Need To calculate the number of respondents you need (known as your sample size), use our sample size calculator or refer to our suggested sample sizes. Response Rate Your response rate is the percentage of people who respond to your survey. In general, long or complicated surveys have a low response rate. Read our tips to ensure you're doing all you can to get the best response rate possible. SurveyMonkey Contribute SurveyMonkey Contribute lets you earn rewards for completing surveys and donate to charity. To edit your SurveyMonkey Contribute account settings, sign in and click My Account from the upper-right corner of your dashboard. Audience Credits Audience Credits let you pay for your SurveyMonkey Audience responses in advance. You pay one invoice upfront, then use credits to pay for individual projects. You can also use credits to pay for concept testing. SurveyMonkey Audience for Academics Professors, grad students, and undergrads use SurveyMonkey Audience to get the research respondents they need in a fraction of the time it used to take them. Read this article for information we've found to be helpful for those interested in running an academic research project with us. title: Build
body: Build Help Topics Build Build Programs Site Dashboard: Overview The following article will outline the Site Dashboard section of your site. This section allows you to organize, manage, and perform actions on your list of Programs. Program Categories: Overview This article will outline how program categories can be useful for you in your site as well as how to manage your program categories. How to Move a Program to Trash In this article, we will walk you through how to delete a program, how to revert a deleted program, and what happens when a program has been deleted. How to Launch a Program Launching your program means it will become live and you can start accepting applications. How to Duplicate a Program The following article will outline why duplicating a program can be a useful process, how to duplicate a program in your site, and what exactly will be duplicated. How to Create a Program Category Program categories allow you to group multiple programs under one umbrella to assist with site organization and reporting needs. How to Create a Program Creating a program in your SurveyMonkey Apply site is an essential step to getting started. You can create a single program or multiple depending on the requirements of your process. How to Categorize Programs Within SurveyMonkey Apply it is possible to create and update categories for your programs. Program categories allow you to group multiple programs under one umbrella which can be quite useful for site organization and reporting. How to Allow a Program to Accept Multiple Applications When creating a program in build mode administrators can set limits for how many applications each applicant can complete for that specific program. This article covers how to enable multiple applications for your programs. Collaborators: Overview Enabling Collaborators on a program allows a user to add additional members to their application. This is useful for applications requiring collaboration and multi-user access without those users needing to share a login account for access. How to Allow a Program to Accept Multiple Applications When creating a program in build mode administrators can set limits for how many applications each applicant can complete for that specific program. This article covers how to enable multiple applications for your programs. Collaborators: Overview Enabling Collaborators on a program allows a user to add additional members to their application. This is useful for applications requiring collaboration and multi-user access without those users needing to share a login account for access. Workflow and Stages Workflow: Overview The purpose of this article is to help you as an administrator to understand your workflow in your SurveyMonkey Apply site. Stages: Overview This article will help you to better understand what a stage is and why it is important in your site. How to Set Up an Application Stage This article will walk you through how to successfully set up an application stage in your site. How to Set Up an Advanced Review Stage This article will walk you through how to successfully set up an Advanced Review Stage in your site. Advanced Review Stages are useful if you wish to add more detailed questions to your reviewers about the submissions they are reviewing. How to Set Up a Simple Review Stage This article will walk you through how to successfully setup a Simple Review Stage in your site. How to Set Up a Review Stage Group If your process requires multiple reviewer stages to be completed at the same time then you can set up a group of reviewer stages, also referred to as Concurrent Reviews. This will allow for multiple review forms to be completed concurrently before the application moves forward. How to Set Up a Holding Stage This article will walk you through how to successfully set up a holding stage in your site. A holding stage can be used for stages of the application process that do not have any tasks for applicants to complete. How to Set a Deadline on a Stage It is common for Administrators to require the tasks within their stages to be completed by a specific date. How to Rename a Stage When a program is created, a stage called “Application Stage” is created by default. You may wish to change the name of this stage or future stages you implement. How to Rearrange Stages This article will explain how to rearrange the stages in your program Workflow and why you may wish to rearrange them. How to Delete a Stage This article will walk through how to delete a stage, and the implications involved with deleting a stage that contains tasks and application data. How to Archive Tasks to Preserve Collected Data This article outlines the steps you will need to take in order to archive a form within your Workflow How to Add or Duplicate a Stage Whether you are just starting to build your Workflow or wish to expand on it, you may wish to add a new stage. In some cases, you may also wish to create a new stage by duplicating one that already exists. How to Archive Tasks to Preserve Collected Data This article outlines the steps you will need to take in order to archive a form within your Workflow How to Add or Duplicate a Stage Whether you are just starting to build your Workflow or wish to expand on it, you may wish to add a new stage. In some cases, you may also wish to create a new stage by duplicating one that already exists. Tasks Verify Charity Status Task This article will outline how to add a Verify Charity Status Task, the basic settings of the task, and what happens on the user's end with interacting with the task. Tasks: Overview Tasks in your site allow you to collect the data from your users in order to make meaningful decisions about awarding your applicants in your site. Reusable Applicant Tasks Reusable Applicant Tasks is a setting that allows you to create a task for applicants that can be shared across multiple programs. Make a Payment Task This article will discuss how to create a Payment task in your site and the different payment processors that can be used in SurveyMonkey Apply. How to Set a Deadline on an Applicant Task You can set a deadline on an applicant task to ensure that your applicants complete that task by a certain date. How to Hide/Show Tasks This article will walk through how to Hide and Show tasks from applicants within the site. How to Duplicate a Task Duplicating a task is useful when a task needs to be completed more than once by the applicant and will have similar settings to the original task. How to Delete a Task This article will walk through how to delete an applicant task, how to delete a reviewer task, and the implications involved with deleting a task that contains application data. How to Add/Edit an Applicant Task Applicant tasks are the optional and required tasks to be completed by the applicant in order for their application to be complete and successful throughout the application process. Get a Recommendation Task The "Get a Recommendation" task is useful when applicants are required to provide a reference or multiple references in support of their application. Fill out a Form Task The "Fill out a Form" task allows a range of information to be gathered from your applicants using a variety of question types. Attach File Task The "Attach File" task allows a user to upload a piece of information that may be required for further advancement in the application process. Accepted File Formats for Attachments This article will outline the accepted file formats of each task in your site. The accepted formats can be customized by you as an administrator in some tasks to suit the needs of your process. These formats can be altered within the Options (or File Options) tab of the Document/Image, Portfolio, and Attach File tasks listed below. “Complete an External Task” Task The "Complete an External Task" task is useful in cases where your application process may require an applicant to complete something that cannot easily be integrated and tracked with the current site infrastructure. Verify Charity Status Task This article will outline how to add a Verify Charity Status Task, the basic settings of the task, and what happens on the user's end with interacting with the task. Forms How to use Advanced Branching Logic to Dynamically Change your Form Branching Logic can be used within your form to customize the behaviour of a form based on the responses that a user gives to a question within the form. How to Set Up an Advanced Review (Ranking) Form The following article will provide guidance in regards to building Advanced Review Forms. How to Safely Make Changes to a Live Form This guide aims to help administrators know what they can and cannot safely edit within a live form during and after data collection. How to Create/Edit a Form Forms allow you to collect data from your site’s users including applicants, reviewers, and recommenders. How to Build a Budget Form If you require your applicants to complete a budget within your site this can be achieved internally within your form. How to Archive Questions within a Form to Preserve Collected Data The purpose of this documentation is to outline the steps you will need to take in order to archive a question within an established form. How to Add Validation to a Text Response Question Adding Validation to a Text Response question or choice type can be useful if you wish to add restrictions to the response that is given by the user. How to Add Translations to a Form This article will outline how to add translations to your form so that users can choose which language to view and complete the form in. How to add an Identifier to a Question Identifiers are used as an internal way of referring to a question in the site. Forms: Overview Forms allow you to collect user data that will help you make decisions in your application process. Form Question Types: Overview SurveyMonkey Apply has 16 different question types to help you collect the data you need within a form task. Form Builder: Overview This article will walk through the various sections of the Form Builder and different actions you can take within the Form Builder. How to use Advanced Branching Logic to Dynamically Change your Form Branching Logic can be used within your form to customize the behaviour of a form based on the responses that a user gives to a question within the form. How to Add Translations to a Form This article will outline how to add translations to your form so that users can choose which language to view and complete the form in. How to add an Identifier to a Question Identifiers are used as an internal way of referring to a question in the site. Forms: Overview Forms allow you to collect user data that will help you make decisions in your application process. Form Question Types: Overview SurveyMonkey Apply has 16 different question types to help you collect the data you need within a form task. Form Builder: Overview This article will walk through the various sections of the Form Builder and different actions you can take within the Form Builder. Form Question Types Text Response Question A Text Response question type accepts open-ended data either in a single line or multiline format. Single Column Question The Single Column Question type allows you to create a question with a combination of question types such as text response, dropdown, or checkboxes. Signature Question The Signature question type allows users to sign the form using their cursor or a touch screen. Section Heading Question The Section Heading question type lets you include text within a form without asking a question. It's used for introductions, explanatory text, or pictures in your form. Rating Scale Question The Rating Scale question type is, in essence, a Likert question. It is commonly used for reviewer ranking questions where you wish for your reviewers to rank submissions from 1-5 based on various criteria. Ranking Question A Ranking question allows the user to rank answers in an order of importance, or significance. The user simply drags-and-drops their answer choices from the left column to the right column in their chosen order. Multiple Choice Question The multiple choice question type lets a user select one answer per question. Multi-Column Question A Multi-Column question can have different question types within each column. JavaScript Question SurveyMonkey Apply provides the ability to include your own JavaScript code. The JavaScript question type allows for all such code to live under one location Hidden Field Question Hidden fields are questions that are only visible while editing the form as an Administrator. File Upload Question The File Upload question allows a user to upload a piece of information directly within the form they are editing. Dropdown Question The choices in this question will appear in a dropdown format. The user may select one answer from options that appear in a dropdown list. Drill Down Question Drill Down questions allow users to select an answer by narrowing down their choice from a general category to a specific category. Date/Time Question The question type allows users to record the date and time with five types of configurations: Date/Time, Date Only, Time Only, Date/Month, and Month/Year. The default display format is Date/Time. Datasource Question The Datasource question is a text response question that connects to an external list. Checkbox Question The checkbox question type lets your users select more than one answer from a list of choices you provide. Text Response Question A Text Response question type accepts open-ended data either in a single line or multiline format. Single Column Question The Single Column Question type allows you to create a question with a combination of question types such as text response, dropdown, or checkboxes. Signature Question The Signature question type allows users to sign the form using their cursor or a touch screen. Section Heading Question The Section Heading question type lets you include text within a form without asking a question. It's used for introductions, explanatory text, or pictures in your form. Rating Scale Question The Rating Scale question type is, in essence, a Likert question. It is commonly used for reviewer ranking questions where you wish for your reviewers to rank submissions from 1-5 based on various criteria. Ranking Question A Ranking question allows the user to rank answers in an order of importance, or significance. The user simply drags-and-drops their answer choices from the left column to the right column in their chosen order. Multiple Choice Question The multiple choice question type lets a user select one answer per question. Multi-Column Question A Multi-Column question can have different question types within each column. JavaScript Question SurveyMonkey Apply provides the ability to include your own JavaScript code. The JavaScript question type allows for all such code to live under one location Hidden Field Question Hidden fields are questions that are only visible while editing the form as an Administrator. File Upload Question The File Upload question allows a user to upload a piece of information directly within the form they are editing. Dropdown Question The choices in this question will appear in a dropdown format. The user may select one answer from options that appear in a dropdown list. Drill Down Question Drill Down questions allow users to select an answer by narrowing down their choice from a general category to a specific category. Date/Time Question The question type allows users to record the date and time with five types of configurations: Date/Time, Date Only, Time Only, Date/Month, and Month/Year. The default display format is Date/Time. Datasource Question The Datasource question is a text response question that connects to an external list. Checkbox Question The checkbox question type lets your users select more than one answer from a list of choices you provide. Automations How to Set Up Time-based Automations Within SurveyMonkey Apply you can enable your automations to be activated based on a specific date. How to Send an Automated Email The purpose of this article is to provide an in-depth look at how to send emails from your site using automations. How to Automatically Submit an Application Once the Recommendation Task is Complete This article is a guide to automatically submitting an application once a recommendation request is received. Webhooks: Overview SurveyMonkey Apply has the ability to securely communicate with remote servers via Webhooks. Automations: Overview This article provides an overview of automations including how to build, manage, and troubleshoot automations within your site. Automations: Activations (“WHEN TO APPLY”) This article is an overview of the When statement and how to configure the first piece of your automations. Automations: Actions (“DO”) The DO statement is comprised of the actions that will occur when the automation is activated (WHEN statement) and the rules have been satisfied (Condition). Automations: “CONDITIONS” The second component of any automation within SM Apply is the Condition which is the set of rules that determine whether the automation will fire when the activation has occurred. Automation FAQ Common questions about Automations. Advanced Automation Settings Advanced settings can be enabled to alter the behaviour of your automations when an activation is met. This article explains the purpose of these settings and how to enable them for your new and existing automation. How to Send an Automated Email The purpose of this article is to provide an in-depth look at how to send emails from your site using automations. How to Automatically Submit an Application Once the Recommendation Task is Complete This article is a guide to automatically submitting an application once a recommendation request is received. Automations: Actions (“DO”) The DO statement is comprised of the actions that will occur when the automation is activated (WHEN statement) and the rules have been satisfied (Condition). Automations: “CONDITIONS” The second component of any automation within SM Apply is the Condition which is the set of rules that determine whether the automation will fire when the activation has occurred. This article explains the purpose of these settings and how to enable them for your new and existing automation. title: Analyzing Results
body: Analyzing Results Help Topics Analyzing Results Analyzing Results Understanding Your Results How to Analyze Results View your results from the Analyze Results section of a survey. You can see a summary view of your data; browse individual responses; create custom charts; use filters to focus on specific data views and segments; and easily download your results in multiple formats. Viewing Individual Responses To view how a particular respondent answered your survey, click the Individual Responses tab in your survey results. At the top of each response, you'll see some respondent metadata, which is outlined in this article. Survey Response Statuses A survey response is one respondent's submission of a survey, whether they completed the survey or only partially completed it. In the Individual Responses tab of your survey results, each response has one of the following statuses: Complete, Partial, Disqualified, or Over Quota. Missing Survey Responses Responses are recorded in the Analyze Results section of your survey. Read these tips if you think you're missing some responses. Response Quality Response Quality uses machine learning to scan your survey results and flag low-quality responses. Respondents Skipped Required Questions When you analyze your results, you may see that some respondents skipped required questions. The respondent may have exited the survey early, skip logic may have skipped the respondent past the question, or the respondent may have taken the survey before you added the required question. Thematic Analysis Apply themes to responses to review and filter text responses quickly. This feature uses AI to apply themes with ease. Analyze Multiple Surveys Together Analyze results from multiple surveys and track data over time. Combine multiple surveys, perform longitudinal analysis on recurring surveys, and visualize questions in multiple ways - all in one place. Get Quick Insights with Analyze with AI Analyze with AI, powered by OpenAI, helps you quickly uncover insights in your survey results. How to Analyze Results View your results from the Analyze Results section of a survey. You can see a summary view of your data; browse individual responses; create custom charts; use filters to focus on specific data views and segments; and easily download your results in multiple formats. Get Quick Insights with Analyze with AI Analyze with AI, powered by OpenAI, helps you quickly uncover insights in your survey results. Text Responses Analyzing Text Responses Find insights and trends in your text responses by tagging responses, creating a word cloud, or automatically detecting the sentiment behind each response. Sentiment Analysis Sentiment Analysis automatically categorizes your text responses to reveal the emotion behind what people are saying. Word Cloud Use the word cloud to see a visual representation of the most common words and phrases from your survey responses. Tagging Responses Create tags to categorize responses on questions with open-ended responses. Viewing a Specific Comment in the Analysis From the Individual Responses tab, view a respondent's specific comments. From the Question Summaries tab, click Responses to see a list of open-ended comments. Thematic Analysis Apply themes to responses to review and filter text responses quickly. This feature uses AI to apply themes with ease. Sentiment Analysis Sentiment Analysis automatically categorizes your text responses to reveal the emotion behind what people are saying. Word Cloud Use the word cloud to see a visual representation of the most common words and phrases from your survey responses. Tagging Responses Create tags to categorize responses on questions with open-ended responses. Viewing a Specific Comment in the Analysis From the Individual Responses tab, view a respondent's specific comments. From the Question Summaries tab, click Responses to see a list of open-ended comments. Thematic Analysis Apply themes to responses to review and filter text responses quickly. This feature uses AI to apply themes with ease. Charts & Data Tables Chart Types You can choose one of several chart types for each of your questions and customize the chart and data table for a question. The chart types available depend on the question type. Customizing Charts and Data Tables Charts, data tables, and basic statistics can be created for all closed-ended survey questions. Edit the display options to fine-tune the way your data displays—combine or hide answer choices or edit chart colors or labels. Combining or Hiding Answer Choices You can combine or hide answer choices in a chart for closed-ended question types with a single answer choice allowed. Basic Statistics Basic statistics show you the minimum, maximum, mean, median, and standard deviation for a closed-ended question. Basic statistics appear in a separate data table below the question chart Statistical Significance Turn on statistical significance while adding a Compare Rule to a question in your survey. Examine the data tables for the questions in your survey to see if there are statistically significant differences in how different groups answered the survey. Can I assign numerical values to answer choices? Display basic statistics to see the minimum, maximum, mean, median, and standard deviation for a question. You can also assign numerical values to answer choices for some question types. Insights and Data Trends Use Data Trends to assess how responses have changed over time. Send the same survey multiple times and see how responses compare. Crosstab Reports Crosstab reports let you choose questions and answer choices to display in a data table for easy comparison across multiple questions, and share them with other people. Chart Types You can choose one of several chart types for each of your questions and customize the chart and data table for a question. The chart types available depend on the question type. You can also assign numerical values to answer choices for some question types. Insights and Data Trends Use Data Trends to assess how responses have changed over time. Send the same survey multiple times and see how responses compare. Crosstab Reports Crosstab reports let you choose questions and answer choices to display in a data table for easy comparison across multiple questions, and share them with other people. Filters & Views Using Rules to Break Down Survey Results Filter, compare, and show rules allow you to break down your survey results and focus in on specific subsets of your data, so you can analyze your results in a way that's most meaningful to you. Filtering Survey Results Filter rules allow you to break down your survey results and focus on specific parts of your data. Comparing Survey Results Compare rules let you choose two or more answer options from a single question and view them as a side-by-side comparison. Creating Views A view is snapshot of your survey data made up of any rules that you apply to your survey results. You can create a Saved View to easily see sections of your data at any time, without having to recreate them. Show Rules Use show rules to focus on specific parts of your survey results. Filtering by Open-Ended Comments or Text You can Filter by Question and Answer to filter textboxes or comment boxes by specific words or phrases. Excluding Respondents who Skipped Questions Exclude respondents from survey results who skipped particular questions. Create a Filter by Question and Answer and select every answer choice—this removes respondents who didn't answer the question. Using Rules to Break Down Survey Results Filter, compare, and show rules allow you to break down your survey results and focus in on specific subsets of your data, so you can analyze your results in a way that's most meaningful to you. Filtering Survey Results Filter rules allow you to break down your survey results and focus on specific parts of your data. Comparing Survey Results Compare rules let you choose two or more answer options from a single question and view them as a side-by-side comparison. Creating Views A view is snapshot of your survey data made up of any rules that you apply to your survey results. You can create a Saved View to easily see sections of your data at any time, without having to recreate them. Show Rules Use show rules to focus on specific parts of your survey results. Filtering by Open-Ended Comments or Text You can Filter by Question and Answer to filter textboxes or comment boxes by specific words or phrases. Excluding Respondents who Skipped Questions Exclude respondents from survey results who skipped particular questions. Create a Filter by Question and Answer and select every answer choice—this removes respondents who didn't answer the question. Sharing Results Sharing Survey Results Learn how to share your survey results, depending on how much access you want to give to other people and how much you'd like to customize your presentation. Shared Data Pages Create shared data pages to share your survey results and charts online. You can control who can access your shared data page and what data you want to include. Results Dashboards Create a customizable dashboard to present your survey results and insights. Add charts and text, then share your dashboard with anyone. Getting Feedback on Surveys and Results You can invite others to give feedback on your survey design by sharing your survey preview link or sending an invite to comment. Once you collect survey responses, you can use a Shared Data Page to invite others to give feedback on your survey results. Sharing Survey Results Learn how to share your survey results, depending on how much access you want to give to other people and how much you'd like to customize your presentation. Shared Data Pages Create shared data pages to share your survey results and charts online. You can control who can access your shared data page and what data you want to include. Results Dashboards Create a customizable dashboard to present your survey results and insights. Add charts and text, then share your dashboard with anyone. Getting Feedback on Surveys and Results You can invite others to give feedback on your survey design by sharing your survey preview link or sending an invite to comment. Once you collect survey responses, you can use a Shared Data Page to invite others to give feedback on your survey results. Exporting Results Exporting Survey Results Export survey data to download an offline copy of your survey results. There are several export formats: PDF, PPT, XLS, CSV, and SPSS Export Examples We have several export examples available if you want to see how an export looks before downloading. At this time, examples are available in English only. XLS (Excel) Exports Export your survey results to an Excel spreadsheet. The Summary Data export includes data tables with response counts and percentages per question. The Responses Data export breaks down results by respondent. CSV Exports Export your survey results to a CSV spreadsheet. The All Summary Data export includes data tables with response counts and percentages per question. PDF Exports Export your survey results as a PDF with charts and data tables. PDF exports are ideal for printing and sharing since they require no additional analysis or editing. Export all results or the results of an individual question or respondent. PPT (PowerPoint) Exports Export your survey results as a PowerPoint presentation to share with your friends or colleagues. The export includes charts and data tables. Exporting Charts Create custom charts of your data and download them to your computer or share them online. SPSS Exports Export your survey results to an SAV file to use in SPSS, a popular computer program used for statistical analysis. Troubleshooting Exports Many formatting issues are resolved by using the Text Import Wizard to open a CSV. Format cells to change the date or number format. Exporting an Individual Question You can download the chart and data of an individual question. Click Save As from the top-right of the question in the Question Summary tab. Exporting Survey Results Export survey data to download an offline copy of your survey results. There are several export formats: PDF, PPT, XLS, CSV, and SPSS Export Examples We have several export examples available if you want to see how an export looks before downloading. Exporting an Individual Question You can download the chart and data of an individual question. Click Save As from the top-right of the question in the Question Summary tab. Benchmarks Viewing Benchmarks in Survey Results Benchmarks allow you to compare your survey results to others who used the same Question Bank questions as you. The Benchmarks menu appears if at least one Question Bank question used in your survey has an available benchmark. How to Buy Industry Benchmarks Benchmarks give context to your survey results by allowing you to compare your results to others who used the same Question Bank questions as you. You can buy Industry Benchmarks for specific comparison groups in our benchmarks store. Benchmark Data Benchmark data comes from SurveyMonkey customers who used Question Bank questions in their surveys. You can opt out or exclude your data from benchmarks. title: Question Types
body: Question Types Available Question Types Adding Questions to a Survey Viewing Question Type Examples Using Pre-Written Questions Question Types Question Types Available Question Types Adding Questions to a Survey Viewing Question Type Examples Using Pre-Written Questions SurveyMonkey offers a variety of question types so you can build a survey that collects the info you need. Available Question Types TIP! You can also add a New page, Page break, Intro page, or other survey elements to your survey from the Build section. Learn more: Adding and Managing Pages Adding Questions to a Survey From the Design Survey section, select Build to select from a list of our most-used question types and elements. To select from a full list, select View more . Learn more about adding and editing questions . After adding and saving a question, you can edit it at any time. Some editing limitations apply once the survey has already collected responses. Viewing Question Type Examples You can view an example of each question type by hovering over the question type in the Build section. If you don't want to see examples, hover over a question type and select Hide Builder tooltips . Using Pre-Written Questions The Question Bank contains hundreds of certified questions created by survey methodologists. Using the Question Bank's questions minimizes bias and gives you the most accurate responses to your survey questions. title: Learn about Enterprise Features
body: Learn about Enterprise Features Team management Integrations and API Data control Brand control Survey solutions Response collection Learn about Enterprise Features Learn about Enterprise Features Team management Integrations and API Data control Brand control Survey solutions Response collection ENTERPRISE FEATURES: If you're interested in these Enterprise-only features, get in touch with our sales team . Existing customers, please contact your customer success manager. Add-on features must be purchased separately. Team management In addition to collaboration features that come with team plans , Enterprise plans allow you to track account usage, organize users by department or project, and control team-wide settings. Integrations and API Only Enterprise plans can connect data to 100+ business-critical apps to automate workflows, streamline lead management, and sync data across reports. See app directory Data control If you're part of an Enterprise team, we regard the organization to be the owner of the team and all the accounts on that team. Learn more Brand control In addition to unlocking standard survey branding features , you can take branding to the next level with these custom branding features for your organization. Survey solutions Solutions built for decision makers in your organization—understand target markets, elevate your brand, ship better products, deliver world-class customer experiences, and build more engaged and diverse workplaces. Response collection Send surveys using all collector types , and even more advanced ways to send, track, and be notified of responses. title: Creating Great Surveys
body: Creating Great Surveys Create Survey Method Add Questions and Other Content Apply Logic Brand or Customize the Survey Preview and Collaborate Creating Great Surveys Creating Great Surveys Create Survey Method Add Questions and Other Content Apply Logic Brand or Customize the Survey Preview and Collaborate Creating a survey is the first thing to do in SurveyMonkey. We offer a variety of creation methods so that both new and experienced survey creators can build surveys, add questions and answers, apply logic, and make sure it looks branded. Tip! Once you create a survey, it's stored on the Home page where you can manage all your surveys. Choose a Survey Creation Method To create a new survey, click Create survey from the header menu and choose from the tiles. Start from scratch Get started with a blank survey page. You can add questions and other content from Build . Get started with a blank survey page. You can add questions and other content from Build . Copy an existing survey You can create a copy of any survey that's already in your account. This way you don't have to start from scratch or modify past surveys that have already collected responses. The survey questions, logic, theme, and other survey design settings are carried over to the copy, but you're responsible for sending your survey. You can create a copy of any survey that's already in your account. This way you don't have to start from scratch or modify past surveys that have already collected responses. The survey questions, logic, theme, and other survey design settings are carried over to the copy, but you're responsible for sending your survey. Build with AI Build with AI makes it easy and quick to create a survey. You just need to type a prompt that includes your survey goals but excludes sensitive information. With a click of a button, we'll generate a survey for you. You can choose to use it and edit it, re-generate a new survey with an edited prompt, or start over with another survey creation method. Build with AI makes it easy and quick to create a survey. You just need to type a prompt that includes your survey goals but excludes sensitive information. With a click of a button, we'll generate a survey for you. You can choose to use it and edit it, re-generate a new survey with an edited prompt, or start over with another survey creation method. Pick a popular template Get a head start by using a template designed by our team of survey experts. Use the search or filters dropdown to browse templates and find the right one for you. If you're on a team, you can also browse your team survey templates . Click on any template to learn more about it and preview its questions. Get a head start by using a template designed by our team of survey experts. Use the search or filters dropdown to browse templates and find the right one for you. If you're on a team, you can also browse your team survey templates . Click on any template to learn more about it and preview its questions. Paste your questions This is a good option if you have questions already written and want to copy and paste them to your survey. This is a good option if you have questions already written and want to copy and paste them to your survey. Build a target audience If you don’t have your own list of respondents to get the feedback you need, you can buy responses through SurveyMonkey Audience . If you don’t have your own list of respondents to get the feedback you need, you can buy responses through SurveyMonkey Audience . Use proven research methods Our Insights Solutions , like MaxDiff or Concept Testing, offer guided setup and analysis. Our Insights Solutions , like MaxDiff or Concept Testing, offer guided setup and analysis. Add Questions and Other Content When you're working on your survey, use the Build tab to add your own questions or choose pre-written questions from our Question Bank . You can apply question settings to further customize. If you have a long survey, break it up into multiple pages . Pages help you organize your survey into sections, which makes it easier for people to take. Plus, every time they go to the next page, their previous responses are saved. If you're using a template , review the survey to customize questions and answer choices so it's relevant to your survey goals. For example, you can add the specific product or company name you're looking for feedback on. You may also want to add new questions or delete questions that aren't useful to you. Apply Logic After your survey questions and pages are set up, it's a good time to apply logic to the survey. Logic can help you get better data by creating a more personalized survey experience for respondents. For example, you can use question skip logic to control which questions respondents will see next based on their answers to previous questions. Or, you can use question randomization to reduce potential bias in the order questions are presented. Brand or Customize the Survey After your questions and logic are in place, you can focus on fine-tuning the look and feel of your survey with our design and display options . For example, show or hide elements on the survey page, add a logo , or create a custom theme . Preview and Collaborate Always preview your survey before sending it to respondents so you can catch any mistakes or logic issues . If you want to work with others on your survey’s design, sending it out, or reviewing results you can share the survey . Or, if you’re looking for some feedback on your survey design, invite others to give feedback . Once you're survey is ready to send out to respondents, create a collector to get responses. title: Build a Form
body: Build a Form Help Topics Build a Form Build a Form Creating Forms Using the Rule Builder You can create rules to build a dynamic form that can show and hide fields, skip pages, and show custom confirmation messages based on what people select or type when filling out your form. Navigation Buttons Edit the Submit, Next, and Previous buttons on your form, change button styles using custom CSS, and learn what to do if the Submit button is missing on your embedded form. Importing Predefined Choices in Bulk Wufoo provides lots of pre-written sets of answer choices (available in English only) that you can add to Multiple Choice or Dropdown fields to save you time. You can also add your own predefined answer choices in bulk by copying and pasting a list of your choices, separated by line breaks. Getting Started with Wufoo Get the most out of Wufoo! Learn the basics and find links to related documentation for each section. Forms with Multiple Pages By default, Wufoo forms have one page, but you can add Page Breaks to your form to introduce pagination and break up your form into smaller steps or sections. Form Title, Name, and Description Form Names are the first impression people get of your form. They help you keep track of your forms on the Forms page, and they determine the URL ending of the Title Links to your form. Descriptions are a block of text that display under the Form Name. They're useful for giving an introduction to your form. Changing the Form Language When you change the language of your form, we automatically display translations for the default text in your form. You can change the form language under the Form Settings tab. Building a Form The Form Builder is where you can add fields to your form, adjust the settings for each field, and configure some form-wide settings. Watch our video on how to use the Form Builder, and get links to more documentation on how to use each section. Adding and Editing Fields How to add, delete, duplicate, or reorder fields on your form. You can add a maximum of approximately 100 fields to one form. Using the Rule Builder You can create rules to build a dynamic form that can show and hide fields, skip pages, and show custom confirmation messages based on what people select or type when filling out your form. Navigation Buttons Edit the Submit, Next, and Previous buttons on your form, change button styles using custom CSS, and learn what to do if the Submit button is missing on your embedded form. You can also add your own predefined answer choices in bulk by copying and pasting a list of your choices, separated by line breaks. Getting Started with Wufoo Get the most out of Wufoo! You can change the form language under the Form Settings tab. Watch our video on how to use the Form Builder, and get links to more documentation on how to use each section. Adding and Editing Fields How to add, delete, duplicate, or reorder fields on your form. You can add a maximum of approximately 100 fields to one form. Managing Forms Collecting Payments Through Your Form You can use one of our payment integrations to collect payments from people who fill out your form. Learn about the 3 steps you need to complete on the Payment Settings page to get your payment form up and running: Merchant Setup, Payment Options, and Assign Prices. File Manager The File Manager gives you a place to securely store files in your Wufoo account. You can upload files, like images and logos, to use when designing your form or manage files that people uploaded when they filled out your form. Welcome to the New Wufoo Experience Wufoo's getting a new look! Try out the latest features and designs and give feedback to help us create the best Wufoo experience for everyone. Viewing a Form You can view your form from the Forms page. When you view your form, you're actually opening up the real form, so any entries you submit are recorded and count toward the monthly entry limit for your plan. Using Wufoo on Mobile The Wufoo mobile site is great if you'd like to keep tabs on your forms on the go. Check out all your latest entries, send form notifications to someone's by email or text, or create a form super fast from one of our templates and share it out. The Forms Page The Form Manager is where you can view and manage all the forms in your account. To get there, click Forms in the header of your account. It's also the page you see when you first log in. Password Protecting a Form You can password-protect a form so that people must enter the password to gain access to the form. To add a password: Hover over the More menu next to your form in the Form Manager and click Add Password. Making a Form Public or Private Public forms can be viewed and filled out by anyone. Private forms can only be viewed and filled out by users logged in to your Wufoo account. Form Labels Labels help you categorize your forms in the Form Manager. You can add labels to forms then create a filter to quickly find the forms you’re looking for. Editing a Live Form Once you share your form link with people, embed it on your website, and start getting entries, it becomes a little bit trickier to make certain changes to your form. Keep these tips in mind before editing a live form. Deleting a Form Deleting a form from the Forms page immediately and permanently deletes all entries and uploaded files associated with that form. Copying a Form You can duplicate a form from the More menu from the Forms page. Collecting Payments Through Your Form You can use one of our payment integrations to collect payments from people who fill out your form. Learn about the 3 steps you need to complete on the Payment Settings page to get your payment form up and running: Merchant Setup, Payment Options, and Assign Prices. You can upload files, like images and logos, to use when designing your form or manage files that people uploaded when they filled out your form. Check out all your latest entries, send form notifications to someone's by email or text, or create a form super fast from one of our templates and share it out. It's also the page you see when you first log in. Password Protecting a Form You can password-protect a form so that people must enter the password to gain access to the form. To add a password: Hover over the More menu next to your form in the Form Manager and click Add Password. Making a Form Public or Private Public forms can be viewed and filled out by anyone. Private forms can only be viewed and filled out by users logged in to your Wufoo account. Form Labels Labels help you categorize your forms in the Form Manager. You can add labels to forms then create a filter to quickly find the forms you’re looking for. Editing a Live Form Once you share your form link with people, embed it on your website, and start getting entries, it becomes a little bit trickier to make certain changes to your form. Keep these tips in mind before editing a live form. Deleting a Form Deleting a form from the Forms page immediately and permanently deletes all entries and uploaded files associated with that form. Copying a Form You can duplicate a form from the More menu from the Forms page. Field Types Website Field The Website field is a single textbox that's validated to only accept a website URL. Time Field The Time field is a set of 3 textboxes (for hour, minutes, and seconds) with an AM/PM dropdown menu. Single Line Text Field The Single Line Text field is a single textbox that accepts any type of text up to 255 characters. Rating Field The Rating field lets people rate a statement out of 5 stars. Price Field The Price field is an open-ended field where people can enter a price of their choice. Phone Field The Phone field lets people enter a phone number in U.S. or international format, depending on the Phone Format setting you select. Paragraph Text Field The Paragraph Text field is a large textbox that accepts multiple lines of text—ideal for essay questions or open-ended comments. You can add a maximum of 10 Paragraph Text fields per form. Number Field The Number field is a single textbox that's validated to only accept numerical answers. Name Field The Name field is a set of text fields where people can enter their name. Multiple Choice Field Multiple Choice is a closed-ended field type where people can select only one answer from a list of choices. Likert Field The Likert field is displayed as a matrix, where people can evaluate a series of statements using the same scale. File Upload Field The File Upload field lets people attach a file to their entry. Learn about limits for this field, viewing and downloading entries, and managing your storage limit. Field Types Fields are the building blocks of forms—they let you collect data from the people who fill out your form. There are lots of field types you can add to your form so you collect the right kind of data, in the right format. Email Field The Email field is a single textbox that's validated to only accept email addresses. Dropdown Field Dropdown is a closed-ended field type where people can select only one answer from a menu of choices—ideal for presenting a long list of options without cluttering your form. Date Field The Date field lets people enter a date in the proper date format, or choose a date via a date picker calendar. Checkboxes Field Checkboxes is a closed-ended field type where people can select any number of answers from a list of choices. Address Field The Address field is a set of text fields where people can enter the address of a location. Adding Extra Text with Section Break Fields Section Break fields let you add large amounts of text into your form. Since HTML is supported, it's also really useful to use as a empty canvas for using HTML to add images, links, maps, and videos. DocuSign Field The DocuSign field lets you integrate with your DocuSign account so people can sign your form. It's a super useful field for when you need a more formal signature, like a consent form or when agreeing to terms of service. Time Field The Time field is a set of 3 textboxes (for hour, minutes, and seconds) with an AM/PM dropdown menu.
