Email Field The Email field is a single textbox that's validated to only accept email addresses. Dropdown Field Dropdown is a closed-ended field type where people can select only one answer from a menu of choices—ideal for presenting a long list of options without cluttering your form. Date Field The Date field lets people enter a date in the proper date format, or choose a date via a date picker calendar. Checkboxes Field Checkboxes is a closed-ended field type where people can select any number of answers from a list of choices. Address Field The Address field is a set of text fields where people can enter the address of a location. Adding Extra Text with Section Break Fields Section Break fields let you add large amounts of text into your form. Since HTML is supported, it's also really useful to use as a empty canvas for using HTML to add images, links, maps, and videos. DocuSign Field The DocuSign field lets you integrate with your DocuSign account so people can sign your form. It's a super useful field for when you need a more formal signature, like a consent form or when agreeing to terms of service. Field Settings Setting Max Quantities Per Answer Choice Use the Max Quantities field setting to limit how many times a specific answer choice can be selected. This is useful for order and registration forms where you have a limited inventory, and you want to prevent people from submitting an order for a answer choice that isn't available anymore. Required Field Select Required in the Field Settings of a field to require everyone to answer that field. Randomizing Answer Choices The Randomize setting lets you display the answer choices for a Multiple Choice field in a random order for each person that takes your form. You can only apply the Randomize setting to the Multiple Choice field type. Preventing Duplicate Answers on a Specific Field You can apply the No Duplicates setting to an individual field to prevent people from entering an answer that has already been submitted by someone else in a previous entry. Pre-Populating Fields You can prepopulate many field types so that an answer is pre-selected, or has a predefined value, when people go to your form. Placeholder Text The Placeholder Text field setting adds grey example text to your field that disappears when people start typing, and isn't recorded in your results. Limiting Answers to a Specific Range The Range setting lets you apply a range or limit on the answers a field will accept. For Single Line Text and Paragraph Text fields, set a minimum and maximum word count or character count. For Number fields, set a minimum and maximum range of values, or number of digits. Field Settings Field Settings are settings that you can apply to an individual field on your form—they control all sorts of things like validation, format, visibility, encryption, layout and requirements for filling out the field correctly. Encrypted Fields While all Wufoo forms are SSL-encrypted, you can encrypt up to 5 Single Line Text fields on your form to add an extra layer of security to those specific fields. Encrypted fields are stored with additional security on our servers, so they're ideal for fields that are collecting extra-sensitive data. Admin-Only Fields The Admin-Only field setting lets you hide a field from public view, so it's only editable through the Entry Manager to users in your Wufoo account with View and Edit permissions for that form. Adjusting Field Sizes The Field Size setting lets you change the size for some field types. Adding Instructional Text to a Field You can use the Instructions for User field setting to provide additional context or instructions for filling out a particular field in your form. When someone clicks into a field to fill it out, the instructions for that field will appear in a box to the right. Setting Max Quantities Per Answer Choice Use the Max Quantities field setting to limit how many times a specific answer choice can be selected. This is useful for order and registration forms where you have a limited inventory, and you want to prevent people from submitting an order for a answer choice that isn't available anymore. Required Field Select Required in the Field Settings of a field to require everyone to answer that field. Randomizing Answer Choices The Randomize setting lets you display the answer choices for a Multiple Choice field in a random order for each person that takes your form. You can only apply the Randomize setting to the Multiple Choice field type. Preventing Duplicate Answers on a Specific Field You can apply the No Duplicates setting to an individual field to prevent people from entering an answer that has already been submitted by someone else in a previous entry. Pre-Populating Fields You can prepopulate many field types so that an answer is pre-selected, or has a predefined value, when people go to your form. Placeholder Text The Placeholder Text field setting adds grey example text to your field that disappears when people start typing, and isn't recorded in your results. Encrypted Fields While all Wufoo forms are SSL-encrypted, you can encrypt up to 5 Single Line Text fields on your form to add an extra layer of security to those specific fields. Encrypted fields are stored with additional security on our servers, so they're ideal for fields that are collecting extra-sensitive data. Admin-Only Fields The Admin-Only field setting lets you hide a field from public view, so it's only editable through the Entry Manager to users in your Wufoo account with View and Edit permissions for that form. Adjusting Field Sizes The Field Size setting lets you change the size for some field types. Adding Instructional Text to a Field You can use the Instructions for User field setting to provide additional context or instructions for filling out a particular field in your form. When someone clicks into a field to fill it out, the instructions for that field will appear in a box to the right. Form Settings, Rules & Logic Form Settings The Form Settings tab is where you can edit properties that apply to your entire form, set up confirmation options to customize what happens when people complete your form, and set limits and restrictions on form activity. Using Templating to Customize Notifications & Confirmation Emails Templating lets you personalize notification and confirmation messages by adding bracketed templates that are dynamically replaced with data and metadata specific to that entry. You could also think of templating as merge tags. Send a Confirmation Email Upon Submission When someone successfully submits an entry, you can automatically send them a confirmation email to let them know. You can customize the email to include any follow-up info you'd like, and you can choose to include a copy of their entry in the email as well. Schedule an Open or Close Date for a Form You can apply the Schedule Form Activity form setting to open and close your form at a specific date and time. Page Rules Page Rules allow you to skip people to different pages in your form when certain conditions are met. This allows you to create custom paths for the different types of people filling out your form, making sure they only see pages relevant to them. Limiting the Total Number of Form Entries You can set a form-wide limit on the total number of entries the form will accept. In other words, you can turn the form off after it receives a certain amount of entries. When the limit is hit, the form becomes inactive. Form Rules Form Rules allow you to trigger an action after someone submits your form. You can redirect people to another site, create a customized confirmation message, or send an email—only when they meet your conditions. Field Rules Field Rules allow you to show or hide fields based on how someone has filled out other fields in the form. This allows you to customize the experience of people filling out your form, making sure they only see fields relevant to them. Confirmation Options & Form Closed Options Confirmation options control what happens when someone completes your form. By default, we show a standard message, but you can show custom text or redirect people to a website instead. You can also send a confirmation email to the person that filled out your form. Allowing Only One Entry Per IP Address You can apply the Allow Only One Entry Per IP form setting to prevent people from submitting multiple entries from the same computer. This helps restrict your form to only allow one entry per person. Adding Terms or a Consent Statement to a Form Set up your form so that people need to agree to your terms of service or a consent statement before filling out your form. You can even display your terms in a scrolling textbox so that they don't crowd your form. Adding Terms or a Consent Statement to a Form Set up your form so that people need to agree to your terms of service or a consent statement before filling out your form. You can even display your terms in a scrolling textbox so that they don't crowd your form. title: Payment Methods
body: Payment Methods Making a Payment Supported Currencies Purchase Orders SurveyMonkey Audience SurveyMonkey Billing Information Payment Methods Payment Methods Making a Payment Supported Currencies Purchase Orders SurveyMonkey Audience SurveyMonkey Billing Information The payment methods you can use depend on your billing country and what you're buying. Whenever you're making a purchase, you'll see available payment methods on the checkout page or on your invoice—just choose your billing country and take a look. We offer Direct Debit (SEPA) to existing customers for renewal payments only. Credit or Debit Card Using a credit or debit card is an easy way to pay for any plan in most countries. However, debit card payments aren't available in Brazil. We support several card types . Pay now : select Credit or Debit Card on the checkout page. Pay by invoice : select Invoice on the checkout page and confirm your billing details. Then go to your Transaction History and click Pay Invoice to pay it by card. Using a credit or debit card is an easy way to pay for any plan in most countries. However, debit card payments aren't available in Brazil. We support several card types . Pay now : select Credit or Debit Card on the checkout page. Pay by invoice : select Invoice on the checkout page and confirm your billing details. Then go to your Transaction History and click Pay Invoice to pay it by card. Wire Transfer or Direct Bank Deposit (ACH) If you’re buying an annual plan, you can pay by Wire Transfer or Direct Bank Deposit (ACH) in any country except Egypt or India. Pay now : you won’t be able to add your bank details on the checkout page. Instead, you'll need to pay by invoice. Pay by invoice : select Invoice on the checkout page and confirm your billing details. Then go to your Transaction History and click Pay Invoice . Our bank details and steps for making the payment are listed on the invoice. If you’re buying an annual plan, you can pay by Wire Transfer or Direct Bank Deposit (ACH) in any country except Egypt or India. Pay now : you won’t be able to add your bank details on the checkout page. Instead, you'll need to pay by invoice. Pay by invoice : select Invoice on the checkout page and confirm your billing details. Then go to your Transaction History and click Pay Invoice . Our bank details and steps for making the payment are listed on the invoice. Check If you’re in the United States, you can pay by Check for annual plans. Outside of the US, the option to pay an invoice by check is only available for some plans and countries. Pay now : not available, you'll need to pay by invoice. Pay by invoice : select Invoice on the checkout page and confirm your billing details. Then go to your Transaction History and click Pay Invoice . Our address and instructions for completing your payment are listed on the invoice. If you’re in the United States, you can pay by Check for annual plans. Outside of the US, the option to pay an invoice by check is only available for some plans and countries. Pay now : not available, you'll need to pay by invoice. Pay by invoice : select Invoice on the checkout page and confirm your billing details. Then go to your Transaction History and click Pay Invoice . Our address and instructions for completing your payment are listed on the invoice. PayPal You can pay using PayPal for all plans, in some countries. PayPal isn't available in the United States. Pay now : select PayPal on the checkout page and fill in your billing info. You'll be redirected to PayPal to complete your payment. Please read our PayPal Payments article for more details. Pay by invoice : Please don’t choose the Invoice option on the checkout page. You’ll need to select PayPal on the checkout page since you can’t pay an invoice by PayPal. You can pay using PayPal for all plans, in some countries. PayPal isn't available in the United States. Pay now : select PayPal on the checkout page and fill in your billing info. You'll be redirected to PayPal to complete your payment. Please read our PayPal Payments article for more details. Pay by invoice : Please don’t choose the Invoice option on the checkout page. You’ll need to select PayPal on the checkout page since you can’t pay an invoice by PayPal. Making a Payment Pay Now Find the payment method you want to use above and see if you can use it to pay now. You'll enter your payment info on the checkout page and submit your payment. Then your account is all set! Pay by Invoice See if the payment method you want to use has an option to pay by invoice. If so, choose invoice on the checkout page and fill out your payment info, then we’ll email you an invoice to pay. Click Make Payment in the email, or open the invoice from your Transaction History tab . Payment methods and instructions for making the payment are listed right there on the invoice. TIP! Each payment method has a different processing time that might affect when you get access to paid features in your account. Supported Currencies The currency you’re charged in depends on the billing country where your payment method is located. Before you complete a payment, we make sure to clearly display your billing currency right above the Confirm or Pay button. Purchase Orders You can add a purchase order number to your invoice. However, purchase orders aren’t valid forms of payment. In order to activate your account, you’ll need to pay using one of the accepted payment methods listed on the invoice. SurveyMonkey Audience You can pay for SurveyMonkey Audience responses by credit or debit card. Or you can pay using Audience Credits by paying an invoice upfront, then use credits to pay for individual projects. All the details on how to pay, payment methods available, and where to send payments is right there on the invoice. SurveyMonkey Billing Information Payment methods, instructions, and SurveyMonkey bank details are all located directly on your invoice. Please send payments according to the information listed on the invoice. If you need additional business information for accounting purposes, you can check out our Contact Information for Payments . title: How to Pay by Invoice
body: How to Pay by Invoice How Invoicing Works Choosing Invoice During Checkout Switching Your Account to Invoicing How to Pay by Invoice How to Pay by Invoice How Invoicing Works Choosing Invoice During Checkout Switching Your Account to Invoicing How Invoicing Works If you'd like to be emailed an invoice to pay manually rather than be auto-charged for your subscription, you can pay by invoice. Invoicing is available for annual plans only. Here's how it works: We’ll email you and your billing contact an invoice after you sign up. When it's time to renew , we'll email you the next invoice to pay 45 days before your renewal. The payment methods you can use and any special instructions will be right there on the invoice. If you’re paying the invoice by credit or debit card, make sure not to check the box to "make this the default payment method" or it’ll switch you to auto-pay! You need to keep auto-renew turned on to be emailed an invoice. This doesn’t mean we auto-charge you! It just means we can automatically create an invoice to email you. If you turn auto-renew off, we won’t create you an invoice and your account will downgrade at your renewal date. Just make your payment by the renewal date and you’ll be all set! If your payment arrives a little late, don’t worry—you won’t lose access to your account, surveys, or data right away (we have a short grace period). But you might not be able to download results until your payment arrives. After some time has passed and we don't get your payment, your account will downgrade to a free plan, but you can upgrade again whenever. Choosing Invoice During Checkout When you sign up for a paid plan, the payment methods you can choose from are all right there on the SurveyMonkey checkout page after you choose your billing country. Select Invoice on the checkout page, confirm your subscription, then go to your Transaction History and click Pay Invoice. You can use paid features as soon as your payment is processed . Switching Your Account to Invoicing If you've already got a paid account and you want to switch from having your card auto-charged to being emailed an invoice, no problem! As long as you have an annual plan, we can update your account. To switch to invoicing: Make sure the info in your Billing Details is up to date—your billing email address, postal address, billing contact name, phone number, purchase order number, anything and everything that relates to your payment method. Contact us and let us know you'd like to switch to invoicing. Make sure you understand how invoicing works by reading the info at the top of this article. That's it! We'll send you an invoice to pay for your next renewal. Remember, you need to keep auto-renew turned on in your account. This means you’ll get your invoice 45 days before your next renewal. Auto-renew doesn’t mean we auto-charge you! It just means we can automatically email you an invoice that you can pay manually when the time comes. title: How to Opt Out or Unsubscribe
body: How to Opt Out or Unsubscribe Emails and Newsletters Survey Invitations SurveyMonkey Contribute Cookies How to Opt Out or Unsubscribe How to Opt Out or Unsubscribe Emails and Newsletters Survey Invitations SurveyMonkey Contribute Cookies You can manage the types of marketing emails you receive, the SurveyMonkey accounts that can send you survey invitations, emails you receive from SurveyMonkey Contribute, and the cookies we use. These email communications may include monthly newsletters, best practices, data stories and quizzes, product updates, product research and feedback. Emails and Newsletters We like sharing how you can get the most out of SurveyMonkey by emailing you about cool new features, interesting customer stories, and advice from expert survey methodologists—and you can easily manage the types of emails we send. To manage your email and newsletter preferences: Click Unsubscribe at the bottom of an email. If you have an account, you can also sign in and go to My Account , then scroll down to Emails and Newsletters . Choose the types of emails you’d like to receive or unsubscribe from. Click Update Preferences to ensure the changes are applied. It may take up to 48 hours for the changes to go into effect. If you have a SurveyMonkey account, we’ll continue to send you account-related emails. While you can manage some emails like daily summary notifications , you will continue to receive other emails related to your account, like billing reminders, cancellation notices, and requests or invitations to access or comment on your surveys. These are service linked communications which you cannot opt out from if you wish to continue using our service. Survey Invitations SurveyMonkey account holders can create and send surveys to email addresses or phone numbers they add to an Email Invitation or Text Message . Each invitation includes the option to opt out or unsubscribe from receiving further invitations. Email Invitations Click the opt out link in the invitation to unsubscribe from future emails sent by that specific SurveyMonkey account. This doesn’t opt you out from all email invitations originating from SurveyMonkey services. If you have questions or concerns about being on a sender's email list, reply to your email invitation to reach out to the sender directly. If you want to start receiving email invitations from all users, opt back in . This is a global setting—it's not possible to opt in to a specific account. Text Messages Text messages include instructions to reply STOP to unsubscribe from text invitations from all SurveyMonkey users. If you want to start receiving text invitations, reply START to the text message you unsubscribed from to opt back in . This is a global setting—it's not possible to opt in to a specific account. TIP! If you're concerned a message you received through SurveyMonkey may be spam, please review our Acceptable Uses Policy to report a complaint. SurveyMonkey Contribute If you receive emails from SurveyMonkey Contribute asking you to take surveys, you can choose to unsubscribe. Once you unsubscribe, you won’t get email invitations to take surveys, but you can still log in to Contribute to take surveys. To unsubscribe from Contribute emails: Log in to your SurveyMonkey Contribute account . Click My Account in the upper right corner. Click Update notification settings . Click Unsubscribe from email invites . Complete the form and click Submit . Cookies Our Cookies Notice and Privacy Notice outline how we use cookies. Some cookies are used to make our site work. Others are used to help personalize content, tailor and measure our marketing, and improve your user experience. If you’re in North America, you’ll see a pop-up when you visit one of our webpages that asks you to agree to our use of certain cookies. To opt out of advertising cookies, click Cookies Preferences . You can update your preferences at any time by finding the “Do not sell my personal information" in the footer of our website, or by clearing your cookies in your browser settings, which will re-trigger the pop-up. If you’re in European Union (EU) or United Kingdom (UK), you’ll see a pop-up when you visit one of our webpages that asks you to agree to our use of certain cookies. You can consent to or reject functional or advertising cookies. It's not possible to opt out of required cookies because they perform essential functions to communicate our site and deliver our service. Update your preferences at any time by finding the “Cookie Preferences" link in the footer of our website, or by clearing your cookies in your browser settings, which will re-trigger the pop-up. If you’re outside of the EU, UK, or North America, you can clear and manage cookies in your browser settings at any time. If you clear all types of cookies, it might affect how certain features work. Enabling cookies ensures a smoother experience when you use our site, and SurveyMonkey won't function properly if all cookies are disabled. title: Team Seats, Roles, and Permissions
body: Team Seats, Roles, and Permissions Seat Types & Roles Permissions for Full Access Seats Permissions for Contributor Seats Changing Someone's Seat Type or Role Team Seats, Roles, and Permissions Team Seats, Roles, and Permissions Seat Types & Roles Permissions for Full Access Seats Permissions for Contributor Seats Changing Someone's Seat Type or Role TEAM ADVANTAGE AND TEAM PREMIER FEATURES: Read about roles within these specific team plans. If you have an Enterprise plan, go to Enterprise Team Seats, Roles, and Permissions. Your seat and role on a team control what permissions you have within your account and how you can work together with your team. Seats and Roles The Primary Admin invites people to fill a seat (an account) and assigns the seat a role. Someone's seat and role set the permissions within their account and what they can do on the team. Seats There are 2 seats available on Team Advantage or Team Premier Plans : Full access seats have full access survey permissions and can share surveys . Full access seats can be added one by one. Contributor seats have limited survey permissions and focus on one section of shared surveys, like just the Analyze section. Contributor seats can be added in bundles of 2 at a time. Roles The seat determines the role someone can have on the team. Contributor seat. They have limited survey permissions—full access to analyze the results of surveys shared with them , can view and comment on the survey design, and view the collectors used to send the survey. Viewing Seats and Roles Primary Admins can view the seat and role of everyone on the team from the Manage Users tab. To go to the Manage Users tab: Select My Team from the main navigation. Select Manage Users . Permissions for Full Access Seats Here's what people in each role can do on your team: Permissions for Contributor Seats Contributor seats focus on one area of a survey—the survey design, collecting responses, or analyzing results. Team members need to share surveys with Analysts so they have surveys to analyze. Here's what Analysts can do with the team's shared surveys: Exports, shared data pages, and dashboards Unlimited rules and filters on surveys shared with you * This table shows what an Analyst can do if given the default access levels . Survey owners can edit permissions to prevent Analysts from accessing the Collect Responses section. TIP! If you're an Analyst and need additional permissions, contact your Primary Admin. Changing Someone's Seat or Role If you need to change someone's seat or role, choose an option below to learn more. Change seat To change someone's seat: Select My Team from the main navigation. Select Manage Users . Locate the person whose seat you want to update and choose View User Details . Next to the seat, select Change . Select the seat you want to assign—you can see how many Seats Available you currently have. If the seat has 0 available , Select Add Seats to purchase the seat. Select Save . An email notification is sent to the team member to let them know their new seat and role. Since Contributor seats can't own surveys, you may have to ask a Full Access seat to transfer or delete their surveys before you can change their seat to a Contributor seat. To change someone's seat: Select My Team from the main navigation. Select Manage Users . Locate the person whose seat you want to update and choose View User Details . Next to the seat, select Change . Select the seat you want to assign—you can see how many Seats Available you currently have. If the seat has 0 available , Select Add Seats to purchase the seat. Select Save . An email notification is sent to the team member to let them know their new seat and role. Since Contributor seats can't own surveys, you may have to ask a Full Access seat to transfer or delete their surveys before you can change their seat to a Contributor seat. Change the Primary Admin If you can’t log into the Primary Admin account, contact support. The Primary Admin can edit their account details (name, email address, etc.) to the new person's. However, steps to complete this process depend on whether the new person is already on the team: Change to someone who isn't on the team yet To change the Primary Admin: Log into your Primary Admin account in SurveyMonkey. Change the email address on your account to the email address of the person you want to be the new Primary Admin. Change to someone who is on the team Changing the Primary Admin to someone else that's already part of your team is a multi-step process, so we'll start with an example. EXAMPLE In this example, Cindy and Deanna are already part of the same team. Cindy is the Primary Admin, and Deanna is a Full User. Cindy wants to make Deanna the new Primary Admin instead. Here's what needs to happen: 1. Deanna transfers all of her surveys to Cindy's Primary Admin account. 2. Cindy deletes Deanna's Full User account from the team. 3. Cindy changes the email address on her own account to Deanna's email address. 4. Deanna is now the Primary Admin and Cindy is no longer in the team. If you're the current Primary Admin, follow these steps to switch the Primary Admin to someone else that's already on your team: Before you do anything, ask the other person to log in to their account and transfer their surveys to the current Primary Admin account. Log in to the Primary Admin account in SurveyMonkey. Select My Team from the main navigation. Select Manage Users . Find the person who you want to be the new Primary Admin. If their email address is linked to multiple SurveyMonkey accounts, you will need to contact support or choose different email address for the Primary Admin account. Delete their account from the team . Change the email address on your account to the email address of the new person. If the original Primary Admin still needs to be in the team, the new Primary Admin can invite them to fill the open seat at no additional cost. If you change the email address on your account to someone else, you'll lose access to the account and all surveys and data within it. You won't be a part of the team anymore unless the new Primary Admin invites you to join the team. If you can’t log into the Primary Admin account, contact support. The Primary Admin can edit their account details (name, email address, etc.) to the new person's. However, steps to complete this process depend on whether the new person is already on the team: Change to someone who isn't on the team yet To change the Primary Admin: Log into your Primary Admin account in SurveyMonkey. Change the email address on your account to the email address of the person you want to be the new Primary Admin. Change to someone who is on the team Changing the Primary Admin to someone else that's already part of your team is a multi-step process, so we'll start with an example. EXAMPLE In this example, Cindy and Deanna are already part of the same team. Cindy is the Primary Admin, and Deanna is a Full User. Cindy wants to make Deanna the new Primary Admin instead. Here's what needs to happen: 1. Deanna transfers all of her surveys to Cindy's Primary Admin account. 2. Cindy deletes Deanna's Full User account from the team. 3. Cindy changes the email address on her own account to Deanna's email address. 4. Deanna is now the Primary Admin and Cindy is no longer in the team. If you're the current Primary Admin, follow these steps to switch the Primary Admin to someone else that's already on your team: Before you do anything, ask the other person to log in to their account and transfer their surveys to the current Primary Admin account. Log in to the Primary Admin account in SurveyMonkey. Select My Team from the main navigation. Select Manage Users . Find the person who you want to be the new Primary Admin. If their email address is linked to multiple SurveyMonkey accounts, you will need to contact support or choose different email address for the Primary Admin account. Delete their account from the team . Change the email address on your account to the email address of the new person. If the original Primary Admin still needs to be in the team, the new Primary Admin can invite them to fill the open seat at no additional cost. If you change the email address on your account to someone else, you'll lose access to the account and all surveys and data within it. You won't be a part of the team anymore unless the new Primary Admin invites you to join the team. title: Your Account
body: Your Account Help Topics Your Account Your Account Login & Password Single Sign-On (SSO) Single Sign-On (SSO) enables people on your team to use their corporate login credentials to log in to SurveyMonkey. Your organization can control who can access your SurveyMonkey team and create authentication policies for increased security. Logging in to Your Account Learn how to log in to SurveyMonkey, all about account verification, and how to troubleshoot login issues. Your Login Details Change your login details from My Account. Verify your email to make sure you can get account information from us. Forgot Login Details If you can't log in because you forgot your login details, try these troubleshooting steps to get back into your account. SurveyMonkey Mobile Apps Learn more about the three mobile apps SurveyMonkey has available for download. SurveyMonkey Login Updates We're updating the way you log in to SurveyMonkey to make it simpler and more secure. This article has details to help you prepare for the transition. Two-factor Authentication (2FA) Get added security to your SurveyMonkey account by confirming your identity via mobile device at login. Device Registration Single Sign-On (SSO) Single Sign-On (SSO) enables people on your team to use their corporate login credentials to log in to SurveyMonkey. Your organization can control who can access your SurveyMonkey team and create authentication policies for increased security. Two-factor Authentication (2FA) Get added security to your SurveyMonkey account by confirming your identity via mobile device at login. Device Registration Managing Your Account Changing the Language on Your Account You can easily switch the language you use when browsing SurveyMonkey in the footer. You can also save your language preference from the My Account page. Contacting Support About an Account If you need to contact support about an account, we're here to help! To keep your account and data secure, we may need to confirm account ownership or billing details before we send you account information. Account Response Limits Free plans have a response limit per survey. Monthly plans have an account-wide response limit per month, and you’ll be billed response overages or billable responses if you exceed the limit. For larger response limits, we recommend an annual plan. How to Opt Out or Unsubscribe You can manage the types of marketing emails you receive, the SurveyMonkey accounts that can send you survey invitations, emails you receive from SurveyMonkey Contribute, and the cookies we use. Allow List Information for SurveyMonkey If you're having trouble accessing SurveyMonkey or not receiving emails from us, we recommend adding our domains and IP addresses to your allow list (sometimes known as a whitelist). Canceling or Deleting Your SurveyMonkey Account To cancel a paid subscription, go to your Billing Details from My Account and cancel auto-renew. Or you can delete your account, if you don't want to keep it or your survey data any longer. Trying Paid Features When building your survey on the free plan, you have the chance to try some paid features before sending your survey. To keep the paid features, upgrade your account to send your survey or remove the features and send your survey on the free plan. Managing AI Feature Access Learn how to manage access to AI features on your Teams or Enterprise plan. Changing the Language on Your Account You can easily switch the language you use when browsing SurveyMonkey in the footer. You can also save your language preference from the My Account page. Contacting Support About an Account If you need to contact support about an account, we're here to help! To keep your account and data secure, we may need to confirm account ownership or billing details before we send you account information. Account Response Limits Free plans have a response limit per survey. Monthly plans have an account-wide response limit per month, and you’ll be billed response overages or billable responses if you exceed the limit. For larger response limits, we recommend an annual plan. How to Opt Out or Unsubscribe You can manage the types of marketing emails you receive, the SurveyMonkey accounts that can send you survey invitations, emails you receive from SurveyMonkey Contribute, and the cookies we use. Allow List Information for SurveyMonkey If you're having trouble accessing SurveyMonkey or not receiving emails from us, we recommend adding our domains and IP addresses to your allow list (sometimes known as a whitelist). Canceling or Deleting Your SurveyMonkey Account To cancel a paid subscription, go to your Billing Details from My Account and cancel auto-renew. Or you can delete your account, if you don't want to keep it or your survey data any longer. Trying Paid Features When building your survey on the free plan, you have the chance to try some paid features before sending your survey. To keep the paid features, upgrade your account to send your survey or remove the features and send your survey on the free plan. Managing AI Feature Access Learn how to manage access to AI features on your Teams or Enterprise plan. title: Sharing Survey Results
body: Sharing Survey Results Video Overview Sharing Survey Results Sharing Survey Results Video Overview There are a few ways to share your survey results, depending on how much access you want to give to other people and how much you'd like to customize your presentation. title: Sharing Surveys with Others
body: Sharing Surveys with Others How Sharing Works Ways to Share Surveys Viewing Shared Surveys and Permissions Managing Your Shared Surveys and Permissions Managing Team Sharing and Resharing Settings Requesting Survey Access Sharing Surveys with Others Sharing Surveys with Others How Sharing Works Ways to Share Surveys Viewing Shared Surveys and Permissions Managing Your Shared Surveys and Permissions Managing Team Sharing and Resharing Settings Requesting Survey Access TEAMS FEATURE: Sharing surveys is only available to some customers on some team plans . How Sharing Works You may be able to share surveys with people on or outside your team if you have an Enterprise account or a Full Access seat on a team. You can see which plan you have in My Account . Your plan type determines: The ways you can share and reshare surveys If you have the option to automatically share surveys with your entire team or workgroup Setting Survey Permissions When a survey is shared, people are granted permissions to each section of the survey. A team member's seat determines the default access level assigned to them. But survey owners may be able to edit someone's survey permissions or stop sharing at anytime. When a survey is shared with people outside your team, the most access they can have is View Only. Are My Surveys Private? Your surveys are private to your account unless: Your account or team-wide share settings have been set to share your surveys with your team You choose to share them with others At any time, you can check whether your surveys are shared along with who they're shared with. Ways to Share Surveys Depending on your plan, there are different ways survey owners and teammates can share surveys—expand the sections below to learn more. Share Your Survey for Review with Review Sessions You can share your survey with others to gather feedback using a review session. Review sessions allow you to invite individuals to comment on a survey preview. How to Share a Review Session Link From the Preview & Score page, select Share for Review to create a shareable survey link and open a review session. A review session link is active for 10 days. Reset or Extend Review Session Access You can reset the 10-day counter at any time. This will restart the 10-day period, not add days to the existing time. If you extend the duration, your share link will remain the same. If you close the current review session and open a new one, a brand new share link will be generated. This allows you to stop access to an old link (if it falls into the wrong hands) and easily restart your review session with a new link. Renew an Expired Review Session Link If a link expires, ask the person who originally shared the link with you to extend the share session. Review Session Permissions When a review session is opened, different user types will have varying levels of automatic permissions: Guest: Has view-only access and can comment on the survey. Paid User: Has view-only access, can comment on the survey, and the survey will be shared with them. Teams User: (on the same team): Has full access to the shared survey and can comment on the survey. Additionally, when a review session ends, different user types will retain varying levels of permissions: Guests: Lose access to the survey. Paid users: Keep the survey as it has been shared to their accounts. Team users : Keep the survey as it has been shared to their accounts. For more information on shared survey permissions, refer to: Survey Permissions to Shared Surveys You can share your survey with others to gather feedback using a review session. Review sessions allow you to invite individuals to comment on a survey preview. How to Share a Review Session Link From the Preview & Score page, select Share for Review to create a shareable survey link and open a review session. A review session link is active for 10 days. Reset or Extend Review Session Access You can reset the 10-day counter at any time. This will restart the 10-day period, not add days to the existing time. If you extend the duration, your share link will remain the same. If you close the current review session and open a new one, a brand new share link will be generated. This allows you to stop access to an old link (if it falls into the wrong hands) and easily restart your review session with a new link. Renew an Expired Review Session Link If a link expires, ask the person who originally shared the link with you to extend the share session. Review Session Permissions When a review session is opened, different user types will have varying levels of automatic permissions: Guest: Has view-only access and can comment on the survey. Paid User: Has view-only access, can comment on the survey, and the survey will be shared with them. Teams User: (on the same team): Has full access to the shared survey and can comment on the survey. Additionally, when a review session ends, different user types will retain varying levels of permissions: Guests: Lose access to the survey. Paid users: Keep the survey as it has been shared to their accounts. Team users : Keep the survey as it has been shared to their accounts. For more information on shared survey permissions, refer to: Survey Permissions to Shared Surveys Share a single survey To share a single survey from Home : Click … on the survey you want to share and select Share . Choose who you want to share the survey with. You can: Select Entire team or specific team members Enter email addresses of people outside of your team Select whether Team members can reshare this survey . Choose the access level to grant—Full access, Analyze access, or Custom access. If you choose Custom access, select the level of access granted to the Design survey, Collect responses, and Analyze results sections. 5. Click Apply . To share a single survey from Home : Click … on the survey you want to share and select Share . Choose who you want to share the survey with. You can: Select Entire team or specific team members Enter email addresses of people outside of your team Select Entire team or specific team members Enter email addresses of people outside of your team Select whether Team members can reshare this survey . Choose the access level to grant—Full access, Analyze access, or Custom access. If you choose Custom access, select the level of access granted to the Design survey, Collect responses, and Analyze results sections. If you choose Custom access, select the level of access granted to the Design survey, Collect responses, and Analyze results sections. 5. Click Apply . Share multiple surveys with people on your team Share multiple surveys with anyone on the same team as you. When you share with people outside of your team, you can only share surveys one at a time . To share multiple surveys with people on your team: Check the boxes for the surveys you want to share. You can select up to 50 surveys at a time. Select Share at the bottom of the page. Enter the names or email addresses you want to share surveys with. You can: Select Entire team or specific team members Select a workgroup Enter email addresses of people outside of your team Select whether Team members can reshare this survey . Choose the access level to grant—Full access, Analyze access, or Custom access. If you choose Custom access, select the level of access granted to the Design survey, Collect responses, and Analyze results sections. Select Apply . The permissions you select for multiple surveys will override any permissions you set for surveys previously shared. Share multiple surveys with anyone on the same team as you. When you share with people outside of your team, you can only share surveys one at a time . To share multiple surveys with people on your team: Check the boxes for the surveys you want to share. You can select up to 50 surveys at a time. Select Share at the bottom of the page. Enter the names or email addresses you want to share surveys with. You can: Select Entire team or specific team members Select a workgroup Enter email addresses of people outside of your team Select Entire team or specific team members Select a workgroup Enter email addresses of people outside of your team Select whether Team members can reshare this survey . Choose the access level to grant—Full access, Analyze access, or Custom access. If you choose Custom access, select the level of access granted to the Design survey, Collect responses, and Analyze results sections. If you choose Custom access, select the level of access granted to the Design survey, Collect responses, and Analyze results sections. Select Apply . The permissions you select for multiple surveys will override any permissions you set for surveys previously shared. Share surveys with your entire team TEAMS FEATURE: Sharing with your entire team is available to Full Access seats on Team Advantage and Team Premier plans. The checkbox to Share this survey with my team lets you share a survey with your entire team, including new people who join your team in the future. This option is available when you select the Share icon from or create a survey from scratch. Depending on how your Primary Admin set up sharing for your team, you may not be able to edit this setting. TEAMS FEATURE: Sharing with your entire team is available to Full Access seats on Team Advantage and Team Premier plans. The checkbox to Share this survey with my team lets you share a survey with your entire team, including new people who join your team in the future. This option is available when you select the Share icon from or create a survey from scratch. Depending on how your Primary Admin set up sharing for your team, you may not be able to edit this setting. Resharing surveys If a survey owner allows resharing, any Enterprise user or Team Full Access seat can share a survey that was previously shared with them. Analyst seats and people outside the team can't reshare. Resharing stays active when a survey is transferred, but not when a survey is copied. Resharing for survey owners To allow resharing, select Allow people on your team to reshare with other people when you're sharing a single survey. Some people on Enterprise plans won’t see this option if their Primary Admin has it turned off. The resharing option is specific to each survey, so you can choose which surveys you want to allow others to reshare. When turned on, surveys can be reshared with anyone. If you uncheck the Resharing option, it restricts future resharing of that survey. Any surveys reshared before you turned off resharing remain shared. Resharing a survey you don't own When a survey with resharing turned on is shared with you, you can give someone new the same permissions you were granted, or the highest level of access based on their seat permissions . Learn more about managing your team's resharing setting . If a survey owner allows resharing, any Enterprise user or Team Full Access seat can share a survey that was previously shared with them. Analyst seats and people outside the team can't reshare. Resharing stays active when a survey is transferred, but not when a survey is copied. Resharing for survey owners To allow resharing, select Allow people on your team to reshare with other people when you're sharing a single survey. Some people on Enterprise plans won’t see this option if their Primary Admin has it turned off. The resharing option is specific to each survey, so you can choose which surveys you want to allow others to reshare. When turned on, surveys can be reshared with anyone. If you uncheck the Resharing option, it restricts future resharing of that survey. Any surveys reshared before you turned off resharing remain shared. Resharing a survey you don't own When a survey with resharing turned on is shared with you, you can give someone new the same permissions you were granted, or the highest level of access based on their seat permissions . Learn more about managing your team's resharing setting . We send an email notification to anyone you share a survey with. To access the survey, they can select Open Survey to log in or sign up for an account. The account email address needs to match the one the survey was shared with. A shared survey remains available in your account until you remove it , it's deleted by the survey owner, or the survey owner either removes you from accessing the survey or transfers the survey to someone outside of the team . Viewing Shared Surveys and Permissions You can see all surveys in your account from Home . If you have shared surveys, you can select Shared by you or Shared with you to see who else the survey is shared with and what permissions each person has. If the person you're sharing the survey with is logging in with the new login process, and has multiple accounts, they'll choose the account that the survey is shared with. People outside of the team don't have visibility into who else a survey is shared with. Managing Your Shared Surveys and Permissions When a survey is shared, survey owners may be able to edit permissions to change the level of access a person has to each section of the survey or stop sharing the survey completely. Depending on how your Primary Admin set up sharing for your team, you may not be able to edit these settings. Edit permissions To edit permissions from Home: Check the box for your survey, then select Share . In the Manage Access section, select the person you want to edit permissions for. Adjust the permissions for the survey. Select Apply . Close the panel, or continue sharing your survey. To edit permissions from Home: Check the box for your survey, then select Share . In the Manage Access section, select the person you want to edit permissions for. Adjust the permissions for the survey. Select Apply . Close the panel, or continue sharing your survey. Remove permissions To remove permissions from Home: Check the box for your survey, then select Share . In the Manage Access section, select the person or workgroup you want to remove access from. Select Remove access . Select Apply . Close the panel, or continue sharing your survey. To remove permissions from Home: Check the box for your survey, then select Share . In the Manage Access section, select the person or workgroup you want to remove access from. Select Remove access . Select Apply . Close the panel, or continue sharing your survey. Managing Team Sharing and Resharing Settings Depending on your plan, you may be able to adjust how people share or reshare surveys. Team Advantage and Team Premier Settings If you're part of a Team Advantage or Team Premier plan, when you create a new survey or copy an existing survey, Share this survey with my team may be automatically selected depending on your account and team-wide settings. Keep the option checked to give view-only or full access, depending on the settings. Some survey owners are able to uncheck this option and not share with their team. Applying team-wide share settings (for Primary Admins) When you set up a Team Advantage or Team Premier account, the team-wide share setting is Full Access (required) and will be applied to all future surveys unless edited. See all share options and steps for adjusting, below. Team Sharing Options Team-wide share setting What to expect Full Access (required) All surveys are shared with the entire team. Team members can see and edit everyone's surveys. Survey owners can't limit the level of access to their surveys or stop sharing their surveys. Full Access All surveys are shared with the entire team. Team members can see and edit everyone's surveys. Survey owners can Edit their account-wide team sharing setting to change the level of access teammates get to their surveys. View Only All surveys are shared with the entire team. Team members can see everyone's surveys, but can't edit. Survey owners can Edit their account-wide team sharing setting to change the level of access teammates get to their surveys. Individual user preferences All surveys are shared with the entire team. Team members can see and edit everyone's surveys. Survey owners can Edit their account-wide team sharing setting to change the level of access teammates get to their surveys or stop automatically sharing all surveys with their team. To edit the team-wide sharing setting: Go to the Team Summary tab under My Team . Select Edit in the Team Sharing section. Select Full Access (required) , Full Access , View Only , or Individual user preferences . Select Save . These changes only affect newly created surveys—they don’t override the sharing settings on existing surveys. A team member's seat may also limit their level of access to a specific section of a survey. When you set up a Team Advantage or Team Premier account, the team-wide share setting is Full Access (required) and will be applied to all future surveys unless edited. See all share options and steps for adjusting, below. Team Sharing Options To edit the team-wide sharing setting: Go to the Team Summary tab under My Team . Select Edit in the Team Sharing section. Select Full Access (required) , Full Access , View Only , or Individual user preferences . Select Save . These changes only affect newly created surveys—they don’t override the sharing settings on existing surveys. A team member's seat may also limit their level of access to a specific section of a survey. Applying account-wide share settings (for survey owners) Your ability to change the Team Sharing setting for your surveys depends on what the Primary Admin chose as the team-wide setting. To edit how your surveys are shared with the team: Go to My Account from your username dropdown in the upper-right corner. Scroll to General Preferences . Next to Team Sharing , select Edit . If you don't see the option to edit, you can’t override your Primary Admin's team sharing setting. Choose: Full Access to share all your surveys and with Full Access permissions. View Only to share all your surveys and with View Only permissions. No Access if you don’t want your surveys shared with your team. You can still share a single or multiple surveys at a time. If you don't see the No Access option, you can’t override your Primary Admin's team sharing setting. Select Save . These changes only affect newly created surveys—they don’t override the sharing settings on existing surveys. A team member's seat may also limit their level of access to a specific section of a survey. What Survey Owners Can Do If your Primary Admin selected What to expect Full Access (required) By default, your account-wide setting is Full Access (required) . Your surveys are shared with Full Access permissions. You can't change this. Full Access By default, your account-wide setting is Full Access . Your surveys are shared with Full Access permissions. You can edit this setting to change the level of access people have to your surveys. View Only By default, your account-wide setting is View Only . Your surveys are shared with View Only permissions. You can edit this setting to change the level of access people have to your surveys. Individual user preferences By default, your account-wide setting is Full Access . Your surveys are shared with Full Access permissions. You can edit this setting to change the level of access people have to your surveys. If you don't want to share your surveys with your team, select No Access . Your ability to change the Team Sharing setting for your surveys depends on what the Primary Admin chose as the team-wide setting. To edit how your surveys are shared with the team: Go to My Account from your username dropdown in the upper-right corner. Scroll to General Preferences . Next to Team Sharing , select Edit . If you don't see the option to edit, you can’t override your Primary Admin's team sharing setting. Choose: Full Access to share all your surveys and with Full Access permissions. View Only to share all your surveys and with View Only permissions. No Access if you don’t want your surveys shared with your team. You can still share a single or multiple surveys at a time. If you don't see the No Access option, you can’t override your Primary Admin's team sharing setting. Full Access to share all your surveys and with Full Access permissions. View Only to share all your surveys and with View Only permissions. No Access if you don’t want your surveys shared with your team. You can still share a single or multiple surveys at a time. If you don't see the No Access option, you can’t override your Primary Admin's team sharing setting. Select Save . These changes only affect newly created surveys—they don’t override the sharing settings on existing surveys. A team member's seat may also limit their level of access to a specific section of a survey. What Survey Owners Can Do Enterprise Plan Settings If you’re part of an Enterprise plan , team surveys are not shared with anyone unless the survey owner chooses to. Choosing team-wide resharing setting (for Primary Admin) Primary Admins can choose a team-wide setting that determines whether survey owners have the option to enable resharing. Resharing is turned off by default and can be adjusted by following these steps. Go to My Team > Settings . Select Manage sharing . Select On to allow survey owners to give others permission to reshare their survey with more people, or Off so that only survey owners can share. Requesting Survey Access Need permission to view a survey? If you are trying to access a survey you don’t have permission for, you can send a message directly to the survey owner by selecting Request Access . The survey owner will then review your request. TIP! Once you receive permission, click on Open survey in the email to open up the Survey preview. You'll then be able to see the survey in Home . Looking for team surveys? After you join a team , you may already have shared surveys in your account . If you don't, ask the Primary Admin and teammates to share surveys so you can access your team's existing surveys. Want more access to a shared survey? People on the same team can request more access to a specific section of a survey that's shared with them. To request more access: Go to Home and open the survey you want a higher level of access to. From the Design Survey, Collect Responses, or Analyze Results section select the dropdown that shows your current access level in the upper-right corner (for example, No Access or View Only ). You'll see a list of each section of the survey and your current level of access. Next to the section you want more access to, select Request Access . The survey owner will get an email about the request and can choose to change your access levels. There's no way to request a specific level of access—it's up to the survey owner to decide what level of access they give you. Your seat may also limit the level of access you can have to a specific section of a survey. title: SurveyMonkey Contribute
body: SurveyMonkey Contribute Creating Your Contribute Account Taking Surveys Editing Your Account Settings Nominating Charities Reporting an Issue SurveyMonkey Contribute SurveyMonkey Contribute Creating Your Contribute Account Taking Surveys Editing Your Account Settings Nominating Charities Reporting an Issue Only available in the United States: Learn more about Contribute eligibility below. SurveyMonkey Contribute lets you complete surveys to play our sweepstakes instant win game and donate to participating charities. You’ll take surveys from SurveyMonkey Audience customers who need feedback from people like you. Try SurveyMonkey Rewards : Download the new app , earn credits for completing surveys, and redeem them for rewards or donations to participating charities. Creating Your Contribute Account Signing Up for Contribute If you’re eligible , you can sign up for a free Contribute account and start taking surveys today . When you sign up for Contribute, you also get a SurveyMonkey account (our free plan) you can use to create your own surveys. The email or username and password are the same for both accounts. Your Profile As part of the sign-up process, you'll fill out a profile with general questions about you and your lifestyle. This profile info helps ensure you’ll take surveys relevant to you, your background, and other criteria that SurveyMonkey Audience customers are looking for. To update or edit your profile: Log in to your Contribute account. In the upper-right corner, click My Account . Click Edit my profile . Select Edit your answer to update any existing profile info or Tell us more about you to complete more profile questions. We share basic demographic info in survey results. To maintain your privacy, we never share your name, username, email address, or home address. For more information, please read our Privacy Notice . Taking Surveys Finding Surveys To take a survey, log in to your Contribute account and click Take a survey from your dashboard- Check out an example of this in the image at the top of this article. We sometimes send you an email or text inviting you to take surveys, if you’re subscribed for these notifications. You can update your Notification Settings at any time. There may not always be surveys available that match your profile, but don’t worry—we’ll have more surveys for you to take soon. Completing Surveys When you complete a survey, we’ll automatically donate to your default charity, as long as your results aren’t flagged for poor-response quality . You’ll also gain a chance to spin the wheel to the win the sweepstake prize. You can go to your dashboard and Play to Win to see if you have any spins. In order to donate to your default charity and Play to Win you must complete the survey. Completing the survey means that you answer all required questions and click Done on the last page of the survey. Some surveys may have screening questions at the start of the survey to ensure survey creators are getting the respondent data they need. You may not complete the survey and collect a reward if you are disqualified by the screening questions. If you exit a survey before completing it, you won't receive credit, and you won't be able to access the same survey again. Where do surveys come from? You’re taking surveys created by SurveyMonkey customers who purchased responses from SurveyMonkey Audience . Customers can target the types of people they want to hear from—from all over the world. You may notice a wide variety of survey subjects and tone, but all surveys should still adhere to our Acceptable Uses Policy and design guidelines and recommendations . If you have concerns about a survey you’re taking, please report the survey . Editing Your Account Settings To get to your account settings, click My Account in the upper-right corner of your dashboard. Click on the setting you wish to update. My Donations displays at the bottom of your My Account page. It summarizes your total amount donated and the charities you donated to. Contribute Plug-in We retired the Contribute Plug-in. This means if you have the plug-in installed, we're not collecting data about the use of your device and there's no increase in the donations made to participating charities. Removing the Contribute Plug-in To remove the Contribute Plug-in and VPN profile on an iOS device : Go to Settings in your device. Select General and then Profiles . Select Contribute and then Delete Profile . To remove the Contribute Plug-in on an Android device , delete the plug-in app from your device. To remove the Contribute Plug-in and VPN profile on an iOS device : Go to Settings in your device. Select General and then Profiles . Select Contribute and then Delete Profile . To remove the Contribute Plug-in on an Android device , delete the plug-in app from your device. Nominating Charities If you know of or work for a charity that may be interested in being considered for SurveyMonkey Together's Contribute partnership, please complete our charity partner application . Our charity manager will reach out to qualified charities with the next steps. If you have any questions, please contact surveymonkeytogether@surveymonkey.com . Reporting an Issue If you have concerns about a survey you’re taking, please click Report a problem with this survey at the bottom of any survey page to alert us. We’ll review the survey and can work with the survey owner to improve their survey or discontinue it. If you’re curious, learn more about how to detect and avoid scams . If you encounter a technical issue with the sweepstakes instant win game, please contact us with your username, browser version, and any error message you may have seen. title: Survey Builder
body: Survey Builder Help Topics Survey Builder Survey Builder Links Your Survey Link Get a survey link that works with any email solution. Custom Survey Links and Domains You can change the domain of your survey link or create a Custom URL Ending to make your link more relevant to your survey and respondents. You'll need to contact support to set up a custom domain. Using the Link Builder to Add Merge Fields Add merge fields to your link to collect identifying information from your respondents. Build a link to share through email, Salesforce, or other channels. Your Survey Link Get a survey link that works with any email solution. Custom Survey Links and Domains You can change the domain of your survey link or create a Custom URL Ending to make your link more relevant to your survey and respondents. You'll need to contact support to set up a custom domain. Using the Link Builder to Add Merge Fields Add merge fields to your link to collect identifying information from your respondents. Build a link to share through email, Salesforce, or other channels. Logic Custom Forms Show custom feedback forms to specific people, such as employees or logged-in users. Custom Variables Custom Variables help you track respondent information in GetFeedback for Web and Apps. Conditional Logic Show respondents different questions based on the type of feedback they want to leave. You can display a different set of questions when someone reports a bug or leaves a compliment. Skip Logic Customize the question sequence with skip logic. Send respondents to different landing pages based on their answers. Using Merge Fields in Survey Logic Use merge fields to create conditional logic. Question and Answer Piping Personalize question content based on previous responses. You can bring someone's answer into a later question to ask more targeted questions and get specific feedback. Preventing Duplicate Responses Prevent respondents from taking a survey more than once. Add a merge field to your survey to track who has already taken your survey. Smart Forms Pre-populate form fields with a respondent's information using merge fields. Hide form fields from a respondent if you already have their information. Resuming Incomplete Surveys Let respondents resume a survey if they close it without submitting it. Respondents can pick up where they left off in the survey. Showing or Hiding Fields Show or hide fields in your web and app campaigns based on previous responses. If someone chooses a specific answer, show or hide another question. Custom Forms Show custom feedback forms to specific people, such as employees or logged-in users. Custom Variables Custom Variables help you track respondent information in GetFeedback for Web and Apps. Conditional Logic Show respondents different questions based on the type of feedback they want to leave. You can display a different set of questions when someone reports a bug or leaves a compliment. Skip Logic Customize the question sequence with skip logic. Send respondents to different landing pages based on their answers. Using Merge Fields in Survey Logic Use merge fields to create conditional logic. Question and Answer Piping Personalize question content based on previous responses. You can bring someone's answer into a later question to ask more targeted questions and get specific feedback. Preventing Duplicate Responses Prevent respondents from taking a survey more than once. Add a merge field to your survey to track who has already taken your survey. Smart Forms Pre-populate form fields with a respondent's information using merge fields. Hide form fields from a respondent if you already have their information. Resuming Incomplete Surveys Let respondents resume a survey if they close it without submitting it. Respondents can pick up where they left off in the survey. Showing or Hiding Fields Show or hide fields in your web and app campaigns based on previous responses. If someone chooses a specific answer, show or hide another question. Managing Surveys Survey Builder GetFeedback's web-based survey builder makes it easy for anyone to build surveys in minutes. Breaking Changes in Live Surveys Some changes may prevent your web and app forms from syncing to Insights. Learn how to make changes without breaking your forms. Turning a Survey On or Off After sending a survey link, you can turn off the link to stop collecting responses. To stop collecting responses after using our Salesforce Automation, Zendesk Automation, or List email feature, contact help@getfeedback.com. Preview and Draft Mode Create a draft version of your survey for editing and testing before publishing your changes. Test question logic, preview your survey on other devices, and test any automations and merge fields. Responses sent to your draft survey won't count toward your response limit. Multilingual Surveys Create multiple versions of one survey in the languages of your choice. Respondents are greeted with surveys in their preferred language. Saving Surveys as Templates Save a web campaign as a template to use it for future campaigns. Using Folders to Organize Surveys Folders help you organize and group your surveys. Create your own folders and move your surveys between folders as needed. Survey Languages Learn which languages are supported in GetFeedback surveys. Encrypting Merge Fields Encrypt merge fields to hide personal information and prevent respondents from editing or removing them. Sharing and Transferring Surveys Share your survey with a team member, or transfer it to a new owner. Survey Builder GetFeedback's web-based survey builder makes it easy for anyone to build surveys in minutes. Turning a Survey On or Off After sending a survey link, you can turn off the link to stop collecting responses. To stop collecting responses after using our Salesforce Automation, Zendesk Automation, or List email feature, contact help@getfeedback.com. Test question logic, preview your survey on other devices, and test any automations and merge fields. Responses sent to your draft survey won't count toward your response limit. Create your own folders and move your surveys between folders as needed. Survey Languages Learn which languages are supported in GetFeedback surveys. Encrypting Merge Fields Encrypt merge fields to hide personal information and prevent respondents from editing or removing them. Sharing and Transferring Surveys Share your survey with a team member, or transfer it to a new owner. Questions and Pages Question Types Choose from several open and close-ended question types for traditional surveys and CX use cases. Make sure you pick the question type that's going to report the data you want. Adding Multiple Pages Use multiple pages in your campaign to split up questions and use jump rules based on responses to other questions. Answer Options and Answer Values When you add close-ended questions to web campaigns, you'll need to define the values for each answer option. Answer values display next to your results on the Feedback page. Adding Comment Fields to Multiple Choice Questions Let respondents provide additional information about their answers by adding a comment field to a multiple choice question. Customizable Survey Templates Choose from a variety of survey templates designed for common use cases. Customize and style them to fit your needs. Thank You Pages, Exit Pages, and Redirects Customize the exit page on your survey. Redirect respondents to your website or thank them for taking your survey. Question Types Choose from several open and close-ended question types for traditional surveys and CX use cases. Make sure you pick the question type that's going to report the data you want. Adding Multiple Pages Use multiple pages in your campaign to split up questions and use jump rules based on responses to other questions. Answer values display next to your results on the Feedback page. Adding Comment Fields to Multiple Choice Questions Let respondents provide additional information about their answers by adding a comment field to a multiple choice question. Customizable Survey Templates Choose from a variety of survey templates designed for common use cases. Customize and style them to fit your needs. Thank You Pages, Exit Pages, and Redirects Customize the exit page on your survey. Redirect respondents to your website or thank them for taking your survey. Themes and images Adding and Editing Images Add images to your survey questions. Resize and crop your image, add a frame, or change the position of your image. Enabling HTML in the Survey Editor Add links, include images, or add an iframe to your web forms by enabling HTML. Survey Theme: Mobile app Customize your app forms to match the color and style of your app or brand. Survey Theme: Email Change the background, colors, and font in your survey to match your brand. Survey Theme: Website Customize your web buttons, forms, and campaigns using a custom theme. Contact support to request a custom theme. Then, appy your theme to your button or form. JavaScript API Perform additional actions on your web buttons and forms. If you want to use our API in your own application, use our Public API instead. Whitelabeling & Branding Your Surveys Replace GetFeedback branding and URLs with your own logo and URL. Feedback Buttons on Apps Share a survey using a feedback button in your mobile app. Let app users provide passive feedback at any time. Ask for their mood and get feedback about your app as a whole. Adding and Editing Images Add images to your survey questions. Resize and crop your image, add a frame, or change the position of your image. Enabling HTML in the Survey Editor Add links, include images, or add an iframe to your web forms by enabling HTML. Survey Theme: Mobile app Customize your app forms to match the color and style of your app or brand. Survey Theme: Email Change the background, colors, and font in your survey to match your brand. Survey Theme: Website Customize your web buttons, forms, and campaigns using a custom theme. Contact support to request a custom theme. Then, appy your theme to your button or form. JavaScript API Perform additional actions on your web buttons and forms. If you want to use our API in your own application, use our Public API instead. Whitelabeling & Branding Your Surveys Replace GetFeedback branding and URLs with your own logo and URL. Feedback Buttons on Apps Share a survey using a feedback button in your mobile app. Let app users provide passive feedback at any time. Ask for their mood and get feedback about your app as a whole.
