title: Customizing Survey Links
body: Customizing Survey Links Custom URL Ending Changing the Domain Changing the Subdomain Customizing Survey Links Customizing Survey Links Custom URL Ending Changing the Domain Changing the Subdomain When sending out your survey, you can customize your survey link by using a Custom URL Ending , as well as changing the Domain , and changing the Subdomain . Custom URL Ending Custom URL Ending You can create a Custom URL Ending to make your link more relevant to your survey and respondents. The URL ending is the part of the URL that comes after the /r/ in a survey link. By default, SurveyMonkey randomly generates a string of numbers and letters. www.surveymonkey.com/r/ your_custom_ending You can use a Custom URL Ending for any Web link collector or Social media collector . It's not available for other collector types. You can't customize your URL ending for Web Links with the Recurrence collector option turned on. If you create a Custom URL Ending, the Recurrence is automatically disabled—and vice versa. To create a Custom URL Ending: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the Web Link or Social Media Collector you want to edit. Click Customize of Link settings to the right of the survey link. Enter a Custom URL Ending (100 characters or less). Click Save . Supported Characters Alphanumeric characters (A to Z, a to z, and 0 to 9) Hyphens (-) Underscores (_) Spaces or special characters are not accepted. Alphanumeric characters (A to Z, a to z, and 0 to 9) Hyphens (-) Underscores (_) Spaces or special characters are not accepted. Transferring a Custom URL Ending You can transfer a Custom URL Ending to another one of your Web Link or Social Media Collectors. However, the same URL cannot be used on two collectors at once. To transfer a Custom URL Ending: Go to the Web Link or Social Media Collector you wish to transfer the URL to. Click Customize . Type in the Custom URL Ending. Click Save. Click Transfer URL . The URLs for both collectors will update. It isn't possible to transfer a SurveyMonkey generated URL ending. You can transfer a Custom URL Ending to another one of your Web Link or Social Media Collectors. However, the same URL cannot be used on two collectors at once. To transfer a Custom URL Ending: Go to the Web Link or Social Media Collector you wish to transfer the URL to. Click Customize . Type in the Custom URL Ending. Click Save. Click Transfer URL . The URLs for both collectors will update. It isn't possible to transfer a SurveyMonkey generated URL ending. Deleting a Collector with a Custom URL Ending If you delete a collector with a Custom URL Ending, you may not be able to use it on a future collector. If you'd like to re-use a Custom URL Ending, we recommend not deleting the collector until you transfer the Custom URL Ending to a new collector. If you delete a collector with a Custom URL Ending, you may not be able to use it on a future collector. If you'd like to re-use a Custom URL Ending, we recommend not deleting the collector until you transfer the Custom URL Ending to a new collector. TIP! If you customize the URL after you send the survey out, both the original link and the customized link will work. Changing the Domain White Label URL You can also change the domain of your survey link to use the White Label URL. You can choose the domain research.net to create a White Label URL for your survey. www. research.net /r/your_custom_ending Your Default Domain When you change your default domain preference, new collectors you create will use the domain you select. Existing collectors aren't affected. To change your default domain preference: Click your username in the upper-right corner of your account. Click My Account from the drop-down menu. Scroll to General Preferences . Next to Survey Domain , click Edit to change your preference. This change applies to future collectors you create. You'll need to manually update the domain for existing collectors. Changing the Subdomain ENTERPRISE ADD-ON: Requesting a custom subdomain is only available to customers on Enterprise. If you're interested, contact sales . If you already have an Enterprise account, contact your Customer Success Manager (CSM). You can also change the subdomain of your survey link to make your organization more recognizable to respondents, if your data is stored in the US or EU data centers. https:// customsubdomain .surveymonkey.com/r/your_custom_ending https:// customsubdomain .research.net/r/your_custom_ending You can then choose this to be your default domain preference by following the steps above in Your Default Domain. If your data is stored in the CA data center, your URLs display the country prefix instead of the subdomain (e.g. ca.research.net). Your Collector's Domain Web Link To change the domain of your survey link: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of the collector. Click Customize to the right of the survey link. Click the down arrow to choose your preferred domain. Click Save . To change the domain of your survey link: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of the collector. Click Customize to the right of the survey link. Click the down arrow to choose your preferred domain. Click Save . Email Invitation When you use the White Label URL in an Email Invitation Collector, both the survey link and the URL respondents see in the From field of the email invitation use research.net. To change the domain of your survey link: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of the collector. Go to the collector options . If you've already sent an invitation, go to the Options tab. When sending your first invitation message in the collector, you'll choose collector options after composing your message. Click Custom URL and change your preference. This will affect any new messages you send. It's not possible to change the survey link of messages that were already sent. When you use the White Label URL in an Email Invitation Collector, both the survey link and the URL respondents see in the From field of the email invitation use research.net. To change the domain of your survey link: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of the collector. Go to the collector options . If you've already sent an invitation, go to the Options tab. When sending your first invitation message in the collector, you'll choose collector options after composing your message. Click Custom URL and change your preference. This will affect any new messages you send. It's not possible to change the survey link of messages that were already sent. Social Media To change the domain of your survey link: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of the collector. Click Customize to the right of the survey link. Click the down arrow to choose your preferred domain. Click Save . This will affect any new posts you create using that collector. It's not possible to change the survey link of posts that you already shared on social media. You can't change the domain of a Classic Facebook Wall Collector . To change the domain of your survey link: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of the collector. Click Customize to the right of the survey link. Click the down arrow to choose your preferred domain. Click Save . This will affect any new posts you create using that collector. It's not possible to change the survey link of posts that you already shared on social media. You can't change the domain of a Classic Facebook Wall Collector . Text Message If you're a Primary Admin or Admin of an Enterprise team , you can enable your team's custom domain when using the Text Message collector. To add your team's custom domain , click on Custom URL under Options and select On, show a custom URL for survey . If you're a Primary Admin or Admin of an Enterprise team , you can enable your team's custom domain when using the Text Message collector. To add your team's custom domain , click on Custom URL under Options and select On, show a custom URL for survey . Other Collector Types It's not possible to directly edit the domain of an existing survey link in other collector types. Please edit your default domain and create a new collector to ensure the White Label URL is being used. It's not possible to directly edit the domain of an existing survey link in other collector types. Please edit your default domain and create a new collector to ensure the White Label URL is being used. title: Email Invitation and Contact Limits
body: Email Invitation and Contact Limits Sending Limits Import Limits Character Limits Email Invitation and Contact Limits Email Invitation and Contact Limits Sending Limits Import Limits Character Limits When sending messages through an Email Invitation collector or storing respondent information in Contacts , please be aware of the following sending, importing, contacts, and character limits. Sending Limits Your plan type determines the number of messages you can send in a rolling 24 hour period. The daily sending limit includes invitation, reminder, and thank you messages sent from Email Invitation collectors. Once you reach the daily sending limit you won’t be able to send messages for 24 hours. You can still schedule messages for a later date and time. TIP! If you want to send even more messages within 24 hours, send your survey through Mailchimp . Import Limits You can import contacts to Contacts by adding them as contacts to an Email Invitation or Text Message , or by importing them to Contacts . 1,000 at a time in the Send To field 10,000 at a time per import TIP! You can create multiple Email Invitation collectors to send your survey to more contacts. Character Limits Forbidden Characters in Email Address Field Email addresses used in Email Invitation and Contacts can't contain the following characters: Symbol Description # Pound or hashtag & Ampersand * Asterisk $ € £ (etc.) Monetary symbols “ ” " " Double quotes < > Angle brackets Email addresses used in Email Invitation and Contacts can't contain the following characters: Character Limits in Custom Data The number of characters per custom data field need to be under the following: Field # of Characters Email Address 255 First Name 50 Last Name 50 Custom 1 1,000 Custom 2–50 100 Filtering in Analyze may be limited if a plus symbol (+) is included in your custom data. The number of characters per custom data field need to be under the following: Filtering in Analyze may be limited if a plus symbol (+) is included in your custom data. HTML Template HTML templates have the following limits per message: Field # of Characters Email Message 16,000 Subject Line 255 Header 255 Button 255 HTML templates have the following limits per message: Custom HTML & Plain Text Templates Custom HTML and Plain Text templates can have 2MB of information per message. Custom HTML and Plain Text templates can have 2MB of information per message. Top Level Domains Top level domains can have up to 6 characters where the .com bit usually is. Top level domains can have up to 6 characters where the .com bit usually is. title: IP Tracking
body: IP Tracking IP Tracking IP Tracking When someone takes your survey, their IP address is recorded as metadata with your survey results by default. It’s possible to update your collector options to control IP tracking. You can choose to: Restrict or allow survey access based on IP address Make survey results anonymous IP addresses can be traced to a single device, proxy server, or group of devices on the same network, but can’t be traced to an individual person. For example, people who share a computer also share an IP address. If you notice your survey was taken multiple times from the same IP address, it means either: An individual is responding to your survey multiple times Multiple people are taking your survey but they share an IP address TIP! Depending on how you send your survey, there are other, more definite ways to track who’s taken your survey. title: Manually Entering Survey Responses
body: Manually Entering Survey Responses Manually Entering Survey Responses Manually Entering Survey Responses Manual Data Entry Collector You can manually input responses you collected offline or on behalf of someone without an internet connection. The Manual Data Entry collector essentially lets you fill out your survey the same way a survey taker would. There isn't a way to upload or import a spreadsheet of responses in bulk—you have to enter each response manually, one at a time. Also, you need to create the survey in SurveyMonkey before you can create a collector and input responses. The Manual Data Entry collector is labeled as a Web Link collector in the Analyze Responses section. Manual Data Entry Collectors Choose Manual Data Entry for your survey to keep responses collected offline separate from other collectors. To create a Manual Data Entry collector: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Choose Add Data Manually and click Next . If you already have a collector for your survey, click Manual Data Entry from the bottom-right corner of the collector list. Click Add New Response and fill out the survey. Make sure to click Done on the last page to record the survey response. To add responses to an existing Manual Data Entry collector, follow the steps below for Web Links. Web Link & Social Media Collectors To manually add responses to an existing Web Link or Social Media collector: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of the collector. In the top-right corner of the collector, click Manual Data Entry . Click Add New Response and fill out the survey. Make sure to click Done on the last page to record the survey response. TIP! Enter multiple survey responses in a row by looping the survey back to the beginning upon completion. Then use the survey link found on the collector options page to take the survey rather than clicking + New Response. Email Invitation Collectors It's not possible to manually add a survey response for a contact when using Email Invitation . Contacts must click the link from their email invitation and submit the survey. Or you can create a Web Link to record the response on their behalf. title: Offline Mode
body: Offline Mode How it Works Creating a Survey Turning on Offline Mode Using SurveyMonkey Anywhere Turning Off Offline Mode Device Management Offline Mode Offline Mode How it Works Creating a Survey Turning on Offline Mode Using SurveyMonkey Anywhere Turning Off Offline Mode Device Management ENTERPRISE FEATURE: If you're interested, contact sales . If you already have an Enterprise account, contact your Customer Success Manager. Use offline mode and the SurveyMonkey Anywhere app to collect responses without an internet connection, then upload them back to SurveyMonkey once you have internet access. Offline mode is not available with Market Research solutions surveys or if you have data stored in our European Data Center. You can check where your data is stored by checking your Account Details . How It Works Offline mode lets you collect survey responses in the SurveyMonkey Anywhere app when you don't have an internet connection. ✅ Create your survey in SurveyMonkey and share it with your team ✅ Create a Kiosk Survey Collector in SurveyMonkey ✅ Collect responses in the SurveyMonkey Anywhere app* ✅ Upload your responses from the app to SurveyMonkey ✅ Access your survey, collector, or analyze your results in SurveyMonkey * Some offline mode functionality is only available to Power seats—learn about Enterprise Team Seats, Roles and Permissions Creating a Survey To collect responses using offline mode, first you'll need to create a new survey . If your survey uses any incompatible features, you’ll be prompted to remove them before moving forward. To share the survey , you must be logged into an Enterprise account with offline mode turned on. You can then register your device slots with any Power seat who will be collecting responses. This lets them download the survey in the SurveyMonkey Anywhere app. TIP ! You can also share surveys with Casual seats or anyone outside of your team—they can only conduct the survey online . Incompatible Features Incompatible Question Types Incompatible Survey Options File Upload A/B Test Payments (Stripe) Click Map Block Randomization Quotas One Question at a Time Question & Answer Piping Advanced Piping Turning on Offline Mode To turn on offline mode, first you need to create a Kiosk Survey Collector and validate your survey to make sure it will work offline. To create a Kiosk Survey collector: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Create a Kiosk Survey collector. Click Validate the survey to turn on offline mode. If your survey uses any incompatible features , you’ll be prompted to remove them before moving forward. Click Text a download link to send the SurveyMonkey Anywhere app download link to anyone on your team via a one-time text message, or copy and share the link. Once offline mode is turned on, your survey is locked and you won’t be able to make edits to it. If you need to edit your survey, make a copy of the survey, edit the copy, and then create a new offline collector. Using SurveyMonkey Anywhere Once you're logged in to the SurveyMonkey Anywhere app , you can download a survey to use offline and collect responses without an internet connection, manage responses, then upload them back to SurveyMonkey once you have internet access. Collecting Responses You need to be the survey owner, or the survey owner needs to share the survey with you, and your device needs to be connected to the internet to download the survey. To download a survey: Go to the My Surveys screen. Select a survey and tap the down arrow to download it. Once your survey is downloaded, you can disconnect from the internet and start collecting responses by tapping the title of the survey. You need to be the survey owner, or the survey owner needs to share the survey with you, and your device needs to be connected to the internet to download the survey. To download a survey: Go to the My Surveys screen. Select a survey and tap the down arrow to download it. Once your survey is downloaded, you can disconnect from the internet and start collecting responses by tapping the title of the survey. Managing Responses You can view the Completion Status, Collector Name, Last Entry Date/Time and Time Spent for any collected responses, and edit or delete survey responses while disconnected from the internet. To edit or delete a survey response: Go to the My Surveys screen. Tap the cloud icon with an arrow to see a list of survey responses. Tap each response in the list to see the response details. In the upper-right corner of the screen, tap the three vertical dots. Tap Edit to reopen the survey and edit responses, or tap Delete to remove the response from your device. You can view the Completion Status, Collector Name, Last Entry Date/Time and Time Spent for any collected responses, and edit or delete survey responses while disconnected from the internet. To edit or delete a survey response: Go to the My Surveys screen. Tap the cloud icon with an arrow to see a list of survey responses. Tap each response in the list to see the response details. In the upper-right corner of the screen, tap the three vertical dots. Tap Edit to reopen the survey and edit responses, or tap Delete to remove the response from your device. Uploading Responses Your device needs to be connected to the internet to upload the survey responses you collected in offline mode. To upload responses to SurveyMonkey: Go to the My Surveys screen. Tap the speech bubble with a check mark next to the survey you want to upload responses from. In the bottom-right corner, tap the cloud icon with an arrow and choose to upload All responses or Complete responses only . Tap Upload . When you upload responses, they're permanently deleted from the device and moved into the Analyze section of your survey in SurveyMonkey. You can continue to collect more responses, or tap X to remove the survey from your device. Your device needs to be connected to the internet to upload the survey responses you collected in offline mode. To upload responses to SurveyMonkey: Go to the My Surveys screen. Tap the speech bubble with a check mark next to the survey you want to upload responses from. In the bottom-right corner, tap the cloud icon with an arrow and choose to upload All responses or Complete responses only . Tap Upload . When you upload responses, they're permanently deleted from the device and moved into the Analyze section of your survey in SurveyMonkey. You can continue to collect more responses, or tap X to remove the survey from your device. Turning Off Offline Mode To turn off offline mode, you’ll need to close any open Kiosk Survey collectors. To close a collector: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the three dots ( ... ) next to an open Kiosk Survey collector and select Close collector . Choose Flag to Close or Close Now . Click Confirm . When you select Flag to Close , everyone who downloaded the survey to the SurveyMonkey Anywhere app is prompted to upload their responses to SurveyMonkey. Once all responses are uploaded, the collector closes automatically. When you select Close Now , your collector will be closed immediately and anyone answering the survey in the app may be interrupted and unable to complete their response. Any responses that haven’t already been uploaded to SurveyMonkey are permanently deleted. Device Management Connected Devices Once offline mode is turned on , you can see the number of devices that have downloaded the survey for offline collection on the collector page. Clicking View All next to the number of devices will show you: The device name The account holder's email address The date the survey was downloaded to the device Removing Devices From the Offline Devices page in the My Teams dropdown, Primary Admins and Admins can see all available device slots and a list of enabled devices across all surveys. To remove an offline-enabled device and free up a device slot, click - next to the device. title: Can a survey be saved and finished later?
body: Can a survey be saved and finished later? Can a survey be saved and finished later? Can a survey be saved and finished later? The survey creator needs to edit the Collector settings to allow respondents to edit their responses. Then respondents can complete a portion of a survey and return later to finish the rest. title: Required Data in Email Invitations
body: Required Data in Email Invitations Required Data in Email Invitations Required Data in Email Invitations When using the Plain Text or Custom HTML message formats , you may see an alert that you need to include required data tags before you can send your message. Required data tags are placeholders that are automatically replaced with the following content when the message is sent. When the Embed first question option is selected, [FirstQuestion] inserts the first question of your survey in your email invitation message. [FirstQuestion] is only required if Embed first question is selected and replaces the requirement to include [SurveyLink]. Inserting Required Data Tags We include all required data tags in the draft messages provided for Plain Text or Custom HTML messages, but if you copy and paste your own custom text, you'll see an alert if you're missing a required data tag. To insert a required data tag: Open the message editor. Place your cursor in the message where you'd like to insert the tag. At the top of the message field, click Insert Required Data . Select the tag to insert. TIP! The HTML Template message format automatically includes required tags for you as part of the template design, so you don't need to manually insert them. Editing Links with Custom HTML If you're using the Custom HTML message format, use [SurveyLink] and [OptOutLink] as the URL within the anchor tag. The survey link and opt out will automatically replace the bracketed values once you send the message. For example: Take the survey! Please remove me from your mailing list. While you can edit the text surrounding the opt out link to better customize your invitation message, per our Acceptable Uses Policy you must clearly explain what the opt out link does, and you should not attempt to hide the link in the message. title: Troubleshooting Issues with an Email Invitation
body: Troubleshooting Issues with an Email Invitation What's the status of my message? How long does it take to send my message? Why can’t I send my message? Why didn’t people get my email invitation? Troubleshooting Issues with an Email Invitation Troubleshooting Issues with an Email Invitation What's the status of my message? How long does it take to send my message? Why can’t I send my message? Why didn’t people get my email invitation? What's the status of my message? You can view the message statuses of your email invitations, reminders, and thank you messages. To view your message statuses: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the email invitation collector name. On the Overview tab, scroll down to the Message History section. Your message was sent. Your message wasn't sent. Follow these tips if people say they didn't get your message. Your message is ready to send and is currently being monitored and released from our servers. The status should update to Sent soon. The message is scheduled to be sent at a specific date and time. Click the three dots ( ... ) to unschedule the message and change it to a Draft that you can edit Your message has not been scheduled or sent. Click Resume to finish composing your message, choosing your collector options, and scheduling or sending your message. How long does it take to send my message? Usually, it takes 5 - 15 minutes for your message to send. During this time, your status will say Sending . In rare situations, the status may remain as Sending for up to 1 hour. This can happen when there's an unusually high volume of outgoing messages that are being monitored for spam and abuse . If it has been more than 1 hour and you’ve already added SurveyMonkey’s info to your allow list , feel free to contact us . Why can’t I send my message? If the Send now button is greyed out, or you get an error saying “something went wrong” when you try to send or schedule an email invitation message, it means you may have: Added duplicate email addresses Included recipients that are opted out or bounced Imported a contact list that wasn’t formatted correctly Follow these tips to send your message. Need to send your survey right away? Create a Web Link collector to send your survey with your own email. However, web links aren't able to track recipients and survey responses in the same way as an email invitation. Why didn’t people get my email invitation? If your message status says Not Sent and you followed our guidelines to avoid spam filters , it's likely people aren't getting your email for one of these reasons. title: Suspended Mailing Privileges
body: Suspended Mailing Privileges Suspended Mailing Privileges Suspended Mailing Privileges We monitor outgoing messages from Email Invitations to ensure we meet industry standards for bounce rates and spam or abuse rates. To help keep your bounce and abuse rates low, read our Acceptable Uses Policy so you understand what is and is not permitted. Messages Pending Approval Occasionally, a message you try to send may be flagged for review and marked as Pending Approval . After reviewing, we'll release messages that comply with our Acceptable Uses Policy , or we'll contact you to notify you of any issues. Messages may be marked for review for a few reasons: The message was auto-flagged as spam by our system. Most people don't realize that emails they send can be considered as spam by email clients or by recipients, so we created some great guidelines for avoiding spam filters . The opt out link was not clearly labeled or was hidden in the message. Cleaning Your Email List If you exceed bounce rates or abuse rates, we may suspend your mailing privileges within SurveyMonkey. You will need to clean your email lists in order to reactivate your mailing privileges. It's your responsibility to clean your email lists outside of SurveyMonkey before using them on the site. It's not permitted to use SurveyMonkey as a method of cleaning your email lists. Bounced Emails : We monitor hard bounces. A hard bounce is an email message that was returned to the sender and is permanently undeliverable. This may be due to an invalid email address or a mail server blocking the SurveyMonkey domain. You can view bounced recipients at any time within an Email Invitation. Abuse Complaints : Email providers send us the number of recipients who manually mark your email invitations sent via SurveyMonkey as spam. The percentage of your messages that were marked as spam contribute to your abuse rate. This percentage does not include bounces or people who opt-out via the remove link inside the message. You cannot track abuse rates within SurveyMonkey. TIP! If you need to send a survey right away, create a Web Link and distribute the survey through your own email client. title: Share Your Survey on Social Media
body: Share Your Survey on Social Media Sharing Your Survey on Social Media Managing Your Collector Share Your Survey on Social Media Share Your Survey on Social Media Sharing Your Survey on Social Media Managing Your Collector You can post a link to your survey on Facebook, X, LinkedIn, Microsoft Teams, or WhatsApp using the icons within the Web link collector . You can also copy the web link to share the survey wherever you want. Tip! Use the Thumbnail Image & Text collector option to customize how your survey title, description, or image displays on social media or messaging apps. Sharing Your Survey on Social Media Expand a section below for the social media site you want to post your survey to. Facebook To post your survey link to Facebook: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Create a Web link collector . Choose your collector options . Click the Facebook icon. Facebook opens in a new window and you may need to log in. Add a note to the post or leave it blank. You can edit your post at any time in Facebook, but it isn’t possible to change the default image associated with the Facebook post. Select whether to post your survey to your News Feed or Your Story , and edit the audience dropdown to choose who can see your post. Learn more about privacy settings in Facebook's Help Center . Click Share . To view or edit your post, open Facebook in a new tab. To post your survey link to Facebook: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Create a Web link collector . Choose your collector options . Click the Facebook icon. Facebook opens in a new window and you may need to log in. Add a note to the post or leave it blank. You can edit your post at any time in Facebook, but it isn’t possible to change the default image associated with the Facebook post. Select whether to post your survey to your News Feed or Your Story , and edit the audience dropdown to choose who can see your post. Learn more about privacy settings in Facebook's Help Center . Click Share . To view or edit your post, open Facebook in a new tab. X To post your survey link to X: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Create a Web link collector . Choose your collector options . Click the X icon. Edit your post. You won’t be able to edit your post once it’s shared. Click Post . The X window closes automatically. To view your post, open X in a new tab. To post your survey link to X: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Create a Web link collector . Choose your collector options . Click the X icon. Edit your post. You won’t be able to edit your post once it’s shared. Click Post . The X window closes automatically. To view your post, open X in a new tab. LinkedIn To post your survey link to LinkedIn: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Create a Web link collector . Choose your collector options . Click the LinkedIn icon. Choose your Post settings (who can see your post). Customize your post or message. Click Post . The LinkedIn window closes automatically. To view your post or message, open LinkedIn a new tab. To post your survey link to LinkedIn: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Create a Web link collector . Choose your collector options . Click the LinkedIn icon. Choose your Post settings (who can see your post). Customize your post or message. Click Post . The LinkedIn window closes automatically. To view your post or message, open LinkedIn a new tab. WhatsApp To send your survey in WhatsApp: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Create a Web link collector . Choose your collector options . Click the WhatsApp icon. Choose the contact you want to send the survey to. Add a custom message to go with your survey link. Click Send . To send your survey in WhatsApp: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Create a Web link collector . Choose your collector options . Click the WhatsApp icon. Choose the contact you want to send the survey to. Add a custom message to go with your survey link. Click Send . Microsoft Teams Click the Teams icon to open Microsoft Teams and Share the survey with a person, group, or channel. You can add a personalized message to the survey link and click Share . If it’s your first time connecting SurveyMonkey to Teams, you may need to select My Surveys from the SurveyMonkey Chat and click Continue to Authorize the app connection. Once connected, you’re able to utilize all the functionality of the Microsoft Teams integration . Click the Teams icon to open Microsoft Teams and Share the survey with a person, group, or channel. You can add a personalized message to the survey link and click Share . If it’s your first time connecting SurveyMonkey to Teams, you may need to select My Surveys from the SurveyMonkey Chat and click Continue to Authorize the app connection. Once connected, you’re able to utilize all the functionality of the Microsoft Teams integration . Beta feature : Only some customers will see the collector to Post to Social Media and they can copy and paste the link onto any site. Anyone can create a Web Link collector and click the social icons to post to social media directly. Managing Your Collector You can manage your collector options or customize your survey link to create a custom URL ending or change the survey domain . If you customize the survey link after you post to social media, the link on your posts won't change but the collector options are updated. Facebook Sharing The Facebook Sharing collector option controls whether your Facebook friends can post your survey on their Timeline or share it with their network. When Facebook Sharing is On , your friends will be able to edit the Facebook message associated with the post and share it, but the SurveyMonkey headline and message can’t be edited. When Facebook Sharing is Off , friends won’t see the Share option, but they may still be able to copy and paste the survey link from their browser to share on their own. Re-Posting You can use the same collector to re-post or share your survey on another social media site—or wherever you like. title: Can respondents print their responses?
body: Can respondents print their responses? Printing Proof of Completion Can respondents print their responses? Can respondents print their responses? Printing Proof of Completion Exports No, respondents can't print a record of their answers after they complete a survey. However, if you allow respondents to edit responses , they can go back to review or change their responses. As the survey creator, you can export and print a PDF of an individual response in the Analyze Results section. Depending on your situation, you might consider creating a form instead of a survey to collect the data you need. Forms are useful for collecting information and keeping a record for both the form creator and the respondent themselves—whereas a survey is best for collecting feedback and making decisions based on aggregated results. For example, think of an order form—customers want to keep a record of what they ordered, and the company needs to keep a record of the response to follow through with the delivery. With Wufoo , an online form builder, you can set up confirmation emails so that respondents automatically receive an email with all their answers, and any custom message you'd like to include along with that. Printing Proof of Completion There's no way to automatically generate a certificate of completion for respondents, but there are two alternatives: Send your survey via Email Invitation to track respondents and their response status, so you can know who completed your survey. Host a certificate of completion on your own website (or an image-hosting site), and edit the Survey End Page option to redirect respondents to that URL after they complete your survey. title: Sending Confirmation Emails
body: Sending Confirmation Emails Email Invitation Confirmation Emails Web Link Confirmation Emails Sending Confirmation Emails Sending Confirmation Emails Email Invitation Confirmation Emails Web Link Confirmation Emails PAID FEATURE: Confirmation emails are only available on paid plans—see what's on your plan . When someone completes a survey sent by an Email invitation or Web link collector, you can send them a confirmation email that lets them know you received their results and includes a link to see their answers. Confirmation Emails aren't sent to people who only partially complete a survey, are disqualified , or over the survey's quota . SurveyMonkey Branding If you used a Custom URL or removed the SurveyMonkey footer , we apply the same options to your confirmation email. Email Invitation Confirmation Emails Turn on Email Invite Confirmation Emails To turn on Confirmation emails for Email invitations: Go to the Collect Responses section and choose to send an Email invitation. Compose your invitation message and click Next . From the Collector options page, click Confirmation Email . Select On, send a confirmation email to each respondent with a copy of their answers . The confirmation email is automatically sent to the recipient's email address after they complete the survey. It isn't possible to manually send confirmation emails. What Respondents See The confirmation email is sent a few minutes after the respondent clicks Done to complete the survey. The email includes the survey title and a link to View answers . Respondents can view all the questions they saw when they took the survey along with their answers, including open-ended text and piped text . They can view their answers for 90 days after taking the survey. Web Link Confirmation Emails Turn on Web link Confirmation Emails To turn on Confirmation emails for Web links: Go to the Collect Responses section and choose the Web link option. From the list of Collector options, find Send copy of responses and select On, let respondents request a copy of their answers via email. The checkbox for a respondent to opt-in to the confirmation email displays on the last page of your survey. If your survey includes skip logic , make sure all respondents can access the last page of your survey so respondents can choose whether to receive a confirmation email. SurveyMonkey can send one confirmation email to a recipient within a 5 minute period. So, if you take and request confirmation emails from multiple surveys within 5 minutes, you will only receive one email confirming the first survey you submitted. Unsupported Themes It isn’t possible to send a confirmation email if the survey uses a Classic theme . Update your theme to send a copy of responses to respondents—you have 3 ways to do this: Edit your theme and choose from any Standard or Premium themes Create a new survey from scratch and choose from any offered Standard or Premium themes Create a copy of your survey with an updated, compatible theme What Respondents See When respondents take your survey, they can check a box to Send me a copy of my responses via email and enter an email address to receive a copy of their answers, after they complete the survey. The email they receive includes the survey title and a link to View answers . Respondents can view all the questions they saw when they took the survey along with their answers, including open-ended text and piped text . They can view their answers for 90 days after taking the survey. If a respondent enters an email address to send a copy of their responses to but then clicks Previous to return to an earlier page in the survey, their email input gets cleared and the respondent would need to opt-in and re-enter their email address to trigger an email confirmation. title: Using Custom Data to Store Contact Info
body: Using Custom Data to Store Contact Info Overview Adding & Editing Contacts with Custom Data Using Custom Data in Email Invitations Custom Data in Analyze Using Custom Data to Store Contact Info Using Custom Data to Store Contact Info Overview Adding & Editing Contacts with Custom Data Using Custom Data in Email Invitations Custom Data in Analyze Custom Data lets you store extra info in Contacts about the people you invite to take your survey. When someone takes your survey via an Email Invitation or Text Message , the contact's custom data is shown along with their responses to help you analyze your results. You can also use custom data to personalize your Email Invitation messages—a proven way to get better response rates. Overview Custom data lets you store first name, last name, and up to fifty custom fields in Contacts . Since custom data isn't specific to one survey or collector, we don't recommend regularly updating custom data for specific surveys or collectors. To view your contact's custom data: Log in to SurveyMonkey. Click your username in the upper-right corner. Select Contacts . Use the scroll bar at the bottom of the contact list to view all contact fields. Custom data fields are labeled by default as Custom 1, Custom 2, etc. Click Edit Columns to edit these labels. Adding and Editing Contacts with Custom Data Anyone can store up to 6 custom fields in Contacts . If you’re on a Team or Enterprise plan , you can to store up to 50 custom fields. New Contacts You can add an individual or multiple contacts directly to Contacts. Or, add contacts directly to an Email Invitation or Text Message collector, and they’ll be automatically added to Contacts. Add a Single Contact To add a new contact with custom data: From Contacts , click Add Contacts . Select Add a single contact . Input First Name, Last Name, Email Address, and Phone Number (phone number only displays if Text Message is enabled for your team). Check the box to Add custom data . Add up to 50 fields of custom data. (Optional): Check the box to Add to a Group . Select an existing group, or click New Group , name it, and click Add Group . Click Add Contacts . To add a new contact with custom data: From Contacts , click Add Contacts . Select Add a single contact . Input First Name, Last Name, Email Address, and Phone Number (phone number only displays if Text Message is enabled for your team). Check the box to Add custom data . Add up to 50 fields of custom data. (Optional): Check the box to Add to a Group . Select an existing group, or click New Group , name it, and click Add Group . Click Add Contacts . Import Multiple Contacts To add new contacts with custom data: From Contacts , click Add Contacts . Select Import Multiple Contacts . Select an import method—you can import your existing contacts directly from Gmail, Outlook.com, Yahoo! Mail, Apple Mail, Outlook, or LinkedIn, or import a CSV file. You can also manually add multiple contacts by typing or copy and pasting in contact info. Create a spreadsheet with your contacts' email, phone number, name, and custom data in an application like Excel, Numbers, or Google Sheets, then save it as a CSV file. (Phone number only displays if Text Message is enabled for your team.) (Optional): Check the box to Add to a Group . Select an existing group, or click New Group , name it, and click Add Group . To add new contacts with custom data: From Contacts , click Add Contacts . Select Import Multiple Contacts . Select an import method—you can import your existing contacts directly from Gmail, Outlook.com, Yahoo! Mail, Apple Mail, Outlook, or LinkedIn, or import a CSV file. You can also manually add multiple contacts by typing or copy and pasting in contact info. Create a spreadsheet with your contacts' email, phone number, name, and custom data in an application like Excel, Numbers, or Google Sheets, then save it as a CSV file. (Phone number only displays if Text Message is enabled for your team.) Create a spreadsheet with your contacts' email, phone number, name, and custom data in an application like Excel, Numbers, or Google Sheets, then save it as a CSV file. (Phone number only displays if Text Message is enabled for your team.) (Optional): Check the box to Add to a Group . Select an existing group, or click New Group , name it, and click Add Group . Existing Contacts To add or edit custom data for a single existing contact, click the contact's row in Contacts and click Edit custom data . To update multiple contacts at a time: Export your contacts as a CSV file. Add the custom data to the CSV file. Make sure the CSV is properly formatted . Import the CSV to Contacts and make sure to select update contact information in the dropdown. TIP! Check out the custom data character limits . Using Custom Data in Email Invitations Composing an Invite To personalize your email invitation messages, you can Insert Custom Data 1-6 tags in any message format . These tags are placeholders that are automatically replaced with your contact’s custom data when your message is sent. To add custom data to your message: Create an Email Invitation collector. While editing the Body of your message, click where you want to insert custom data. Click the Insert Custom Data button and select a tag to insert. If you want to personalize your subject line, type or copy and paste a custom data tag from the list below. Just make sure you don't edit these tags, including the brackets. If a contact doesn’t have custom data, they’ll see a blank space in their message where that tag was. Custom Data Tags Add any of the following custom data tags to your message: [Email] [FirstName] [LastName] [CustomData1] [CustomData2] [CustomData3] [CustomData4] [CustomData5] [CustomData6] You can only add custom data tags for custom data fields 1-6. Add any of the following custom data tags to your message: [Email] [FirstName] [LastName] [CustomData1] [CustomData2] [CustomData3] [CustomData4] [CustomData5] [CustomData6] You can only add custom data tags for custom data fields 1-6. Example Message with Custom Data Here’s an example of a message using custom data tags ( bolded ): Hi [FirstName] , We're planning a picnic for the [CustomData1] department and would love to get your feedback. Please do not forward this message since it's associated with your email address: [Email] Thanks for your participation! - Annie Each contact gets the message with their own custom data in place of the custom data tags. Here’s an example of what a contact sees (custom data is bolded ): Hi Danny , We're planning a picnic for the customer service department and would love to get your feedback. Please do not forward this message since it's associated with your email address: danny@surveymonkey.com Thanks for your participation! - Annie Here’s an example of a message using custom data tags ( bolded ): Hi [FirstName] , We're planning a picnic for the [CustomData1] department and would love to get your feedback. Please do not forward this message since it's associated with your email address: [Email] Thanks for your participation! - Annie Each contact gets the message with their own custom data in place of the custom data tags. Here’s an example of what a contact sees (custom data is bolded ): Hi Danny , We're planning a picnic for the customer service department and would love to get your feedback. Please do not forward this message since it's associated with your email address: danny@surveymonkey.com Thanks for your participation! - Annie TIP! When you send a test email , custom data is pulled from a random contact in your collector. Tracking Recipient Custom Data Once your Email invitation is sent, your recipient's custom data is viewable in your collector's Recipients tab. The metadata that displays is reflective of the current custom data stored in Contacts, which may be different from the custom data that was set at the time you sent your email invitation. Custom Data in Analyze When you view Individual Responses or Responses Data exports , you can see the following custom data: Email address First name Last name Custom 1 To view all Custom Data fields, you can export your results as an XLS spreadsheet . You can apply analyze rules to filter survey data based on custom data to help you better understand why people answered the way they did. If you don't see custom data in your results, it's likely because: The survey wasn't sent via Email Invitation or Text Message collector Custom data was added to Contacts after the survey taker completed your survey Anonymous Responses was set to exclude all respondent information Custom data fields 7-50 will show in columns after your responses Related Articles Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice

title: Opted Out or Bounced Contacts
body: Opted Out or Bounced Contacts What are Opted Out or Bounced Contacts? Viewing Opted Out or Bounced Contacts Opted Out or Bounced Contacts Opted Out or Bounced Contacts What are Opted Out or Bounced Contacts? Viewing Opted Out or Bounced Contacts Some of your contacts (recipients) may be labeled as opted out or bounced in Contacts , Email Invitation collectors, or Text Message collectors. What are Opted Out or Bounced Contacts? Opted Out All messages sent through SurveyMonkey are required to include info on how recipients can opt out and unsubscribe from future survey invitations. To comply with our Acceptable Uses Policy , please remove opted out contacts from SurveyMonkey Contacts within ten days. Email Invitations Any recipient who clicks an opt out link is labeled as opted out in your Email Invitation collector and Contacts. After someone opts out, you can’t send them messages via the Email Invitation collector. To change an opted out status, the email address owner can opt back in to start receiving future email invitations from all users. This is a global setting—it's not possible to opt in to a specific account. Any recipient who clicks an opt out link is labeled as opted out in your Email Invitation collector and Contacts. After someone opts out, you can’t send them messages via the Email Invitation collector. To change an opted out status, the email address owner can opt back in to start receiving future email invitations from all users. This is a global setting—it's not possible to opt in to a specific account. Text Messages Any recipient who replies STOP to your text invitation is labeled as opted out in your Text Message collector and Contacts. After someone opts out, you can’t send them messages via the Text Message collector. To change the opted out status, the phone number owner needs to reply START to the original text invitation. Any recipient who replies STOP to your text invitation is labeled as opted out in your Text Message collector and Contacts. After someone opts out, you can’t send them messages via the Text Message collector. To change the opted out status, the phone number owner needs to reply START to the original text invitation. Bounced A hard bounce means there's a permanent reason an email or text can't be delivered. A hard bounce most likely occurs if the contact info is invalid (for example, it doesn't exist or contains a typo) or the receiving mail server is blocking our IP addresses or domains . Any recipient whose email address or phone number hard bounced a message is labeled as bounced in your Email Invitation collector or Text Message collector, and Contacts. If an email address or phone number bounced a message sent from any SurveyMonkey account, no one else with a SurveyMonkey account can send them messages. We monitor outgoing messages sent through Email Invitation collectors to ensure we meet industry standards regarding bounce rates. If you have a very high bounce rate, we may suspend your mailing privileges within SurveyMonkey. Viewing Opted Out or Bounced Contacts Email Invitations or Text Messages While you can add opted out or bounced contacts in the Send To field, we review the recipient list before an invitation is sent and remove recipients that previously opted out or bounced. As a result, your invitation may send to fewer recipients than you added. To view the specific contacts who opted out or bounced: Go to your collector’s Overview tab. Click the Recipients tab. Click All recipients and select the status from the drop-down menu. If you're looking at an Email Invitation, make sure All messages is selected. You can't remove recipients who opted out or bounced from existing collectors, but you can remove them from Contacts so you don't add them to future collectors. Contacts When adding or importing contacts, you can add email addresses that opted out or bounced to Contacts . But, the contacts are automatically labeled as opted out or bounced. To view and delete opted out or bounced contacts: Click your username in the upper-right corner. Select Contacts . In the left sidebar of Contacts, click Opted Out or Bounced . In your contact list, check the box next to the contacts you want to delete. Click Delete Permanently at the top of the list. Deleting contacts within Contacts doesn’t remove them from your existing collectors, but it will prevent you from adding them to future collectors. title: Adding Contacts to Email Invitations
body: Adding Contacts to Email Invitations Adding Contacts Import Methods Invalid Email Errors Editing Contacts Adding Contacts to Email Invitations Adding Contacts to Email Invitations Adding Contacts Import Methods Invalid Email Errors Editing Contacts Learn how to add contacts (recipients) to an Email Invitation so you can email people your survey. Adding Contacts Add Contacts To add contacts using an import method: Click the Add Contacts button in the upper-right corner of the message. Choose an import method (described in more detail below). Name the group (the email addresses will be stored in your Contacts ). Decide what you'd like to do if someone already exists in your Contacts . You can either update contact information associated with the email address with the info in your current import, or ignore import information so the info you already have for that contact stays as is. Click Add . Read the section below if you see any errors . Please be sure to use individual email addresses and not a Listserv, distribution list, or email alias (since only one person from the list would be able to take the survey). Copy & Paste Email Addresses You can type in or copy and paste a list of email addresses directly in the Send To field. Just pop them in and hit enter. Recipient & Message Limits There is a limit to how many people you can send to, as well as how many messages you can send in one day: Sending, Import & Character Limits Import Methods Manual List (Simple Copy and Paste) You can copy and paste a simple list of email addresses using the Manual import option. Guidelines : Each email address should be on its own line. Example : bob@email.com jane@email.com marge@email.com pat@email.com You can copy and paste a simple list of email addresses using the Manual import option. Guidelines : Each email address should be on its own line. Example : bob@email.com jane@email.com marge@email.com pat@email.com Manual List (Advanced Copy and Paste) You can copy and paste a list of email addresses, names, and custom data using the Manual import option. If you're using a city and state (like Portland, Oregon) this will create two fields: one for Portland, one for Oregon. If the commas are too confusing, you can simply copy and paste the rows of your spreadsheet into the box! Guidelines : Each email address needs to be on its own line with custom data fields separated by commas. If you don't have info for a given field, leave a blank space. You must put the email address first: Email, First Name, Last Name, Custom 1, Custom 2, etc. Example : Here's an example list with email, first name, last name, 3 custom fields (age, gender, and favorite ice cream flavor). We don't have Jane's age, we don't have Pat's age or gender, and we don't know Marge's favorite ice cream flavor, so we'll leave those blank: bob@email.com, Bob, Thompson, 39, male, chocolate jane@email.com, Jane, Smith, , female, strawberry marge@email.com, Marge, Simpson, 33, female, pat@email.com, Pat, Lyon, , , pistachio You can copy and paste a list of email addresses, names, and custom data using the Manual import option. If you're using a city and state (like Portland, Oregon) this will create two fields: one for Portland, one for Oregon. If the commas are too confusing, you can simply copy and paste the rows of your spreadsheet into the box! Guidelines : Each email address needs to be on its own line with custom data fields separated by commas. If you don't have info for a given field, leave a blank space. You must put the email address first: Email, First Name, Last Name, Custom 1, Custom 2, etc. Example : Here's an example list with email, first name, last name, 3 custom fields (age, gender, and favorite ice cream flavor). We don't have Jane's age, we don't have Pat's age or gender, and we don't know Marge's favorite ice cream flavor, so we'll leave those blank: bob@email.com, Bob, Thompson, 39, male, chocolate jane@email.com, Jane, Smith, , female, strawberry marge@email.com, Marge, Simpson, 33, female, pat@email.com, Pat, Lyon, , , pistachio CSV Spreadsheet You can create a spreadsheet with people's email, name, and c u stom data in an application like Excel, Numbers, or Google Sheets, then download it as a CSV to upload into SurveyMonkey. Guidelines : Each contact needs to be on its own row in the spreadsheet. If you don't have data for a particular contact, just leave the cell blank. Remove the header row from the spreadsheet before you import it. Put the columns in this order with the email address in the first column: Email, First Name, Last Name, Custom 1, Custom 2, etc. Example : View a screenshot of a properly formatted CSV file . You can create a spreadsheet with people's email, name, and c u stom data in an application like Excel, Numbers, or Google Sheets, then download it as a CSV to upload into SurveyMonkey. Guidelines : Each contact needs to be on its own row in the spreadsheet. If you don't have data for a particular contact, just leave the cell blank. Remove the header row from the spreadsheet before you import it. Put the columns in this order with the email address in the first column: Email, First Name, Last Name, Custom 1, Custom 2, etc. Example : View a screenshot of a properly formatted CSV file . Email Import You can use Gmail, Yahoo! Mail, LinkedIn, Microsoft 365, or Outlook.com to import all your contacts. If you make changes to contacts in your email account, they're not reflected in SurveyMonkey (your SurveyMonkey account is not synced to those applications). To add only some contacts or to import contacts from another email provider or site, go to your email account and export the contacts you want as a CSV file, then import the file to SurveyMonkey. For instructions on how to export your contacts to a CSV, please search your email provider's help center. Outlook.com, the free web-based email service formerly known as Hotmail.com, differs from the Microsoft Office Outlook mail application. To import contacts from Microsoft Office Outlook, first export your contacts into a CSV file, and then import the file. Or ask your IT department if your Outlook application is powered by Microsoft 365. You can use Gmail, Yahoo! Mail, LinkedIn, Microsoft 365, or Outlook.com to import all your contacts. If you make changes to contacts in your email account, they're not reflected in SurveyMonkey (your SurveyMonkey account is not synced to those applications). To add only some contacts or to import contacts from another email provider or site, go to your email account and export the contacts you want as a CSV file, then import the file to SurveyMonkey. For instructions on how to export your contacts to a CSV, please search your email provider's help center. Outlook.com, the free web-based email service formerly known as Hotmail.com, differs from the Microsoft Office Outlook mail application. To import contacts from Microsoft Office Outlook, first export your contacts into a CSV file, and then import the file. Or ask your IT department if your Outlook application is powered by Microsoft 365. Invalid Email Errors If you see an error about invalid emails or that “something went wrong” when you try to send or schedule a message, it means you may have: Added duplicate email addresses Included contacts that are opted out or bounced Imported a contact list that wasn’t formatted correctly Duplicate Emails You can send one invitation email per email address per collector, by default. When you Invite More and add a contact that was already sent an invitation from the collector, we automatically remove them from your contact list before sending your new message. Enterprise customers may be able to Allow duplicate invites when they choose to Invite More. Anyone can create a new Email Invitation collector for the survey if you want someone to take a survey more than once. If you want to send someone your invitation message again, you can send them a one-off reminder. Opted Out or Bounced Emails You can’t send messages to people who have opted out or bounced. Ask them to opt back in if they want to take your survey. Then, create a new email invitation collector to send them the survey (the old collector will continue to list them as opted out or bounced). You can check for opted out or bounced emails in the Recipients tab under the Sent column. Spreadsheet and Contact Errors If you imported or added a contact list that wasn’t formatted correctly, you won’t be able to send your message. Here are some tips to fix the errors, then try to add contacts again. While there's a hard limit of 10,000 rows per spreadsheet, it may be helpful to break large lists down into multiple CSV files. We suggest files with fewer than 2,500 rows each and import them one at a time. Or copy and paste the rows of the spreadsheet using the Manual import option. Delete the header row from your spreadsheet. Any formatting of the header row can cause errors. Make sure you're using an accepted delimiter for the spreadsheet (colon, semicolon, pipe, comma, or tab), and that your character encoding is in Unicode ( UTF-8 or UTF-16). If your spreadsheet includes Asian characters, make sure your character encoding is set to UTF-8 format. If you're using a Mac, try saving your file as MS-DOS Comma Separated (.csv). Go to File > Save As > Format. Review our import, sending, and character limits for more info on special characters and vanity domains. If you're copying and pasting a list of emails using the Manual import option, make sure the email address is listed first, then you can add other info. Check out the example above. Editing Contacts Draft or Scheduled Emails You can remove contacts from draft or scheduled emails. From the Overview tab, click Resume and expand your contact group in your email invitation. Reminders & Thank Yous When you're sending a Reminder or Thank You message, you don't upload contacts from scratch. Instead, you can choose from the people you've already invited. Click Edit Recipients in any Reminder or Thank You message to remove recipients. You can remove up to 1,000 recipients. Update Email Address or Custom Data To update someone's data in the Recipients tab: Click your username in the upper-right corner to go to your Contacts . Find the email address, click the contact to make edits, and save. Go back to your Email Invitation collector. In the Recipients tab, you should see the new info. Any new messages you send will use the up-to-date info you saved in your Contacts. Export the data from the Recipients tab to use when analyzing your results. Contact details are pulled into survey results when a recipient submits their response, so they aren't updated when you make edits in Contacts. Sent Messages You can delete a recipient from a sent Email Invitation. One reason you may need to do this is if a recipient requests their Right to Erasure . In this case, the account holder needs to delete all the recipient's personal and response data. To delete a recipient from the collector: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Open the Email Invitation collector used to send your survey. Click on the Recipients tab. Click recipient's email address. Click Remove recipient record . This removes the recipient from the Email Invitation collector. When you receive a Right to Erasure request, we also recommend that you: Delete the individual's response Delete the recipient's contact You can delete a recipient from a sent Email Invitation. One reason you may need to do this is if a recipient requests their Right to Erasure . In this case, the account holder needs to delete all the recipient's personal and response data. To delete a recipient from the collector: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Open the Email Invitation collector used to send your survey. Click on the Recipients tab. Click recipient's email address. Click Remove recipient record . This removes the recipient from the Email Invitation collector. When you receive a Right to Erasure request, we also recommend that you: Delete the individual's response Delete the recipient's contact Related Articles Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice

title: Embedding Questions in Email Invitations
body: Embedding Questions in Email Invitations How to Embed In-email Response Capture Collector Option Survey Behavior Supported Question Types Survey Design Requirements Troubleshooting Issues Embedding Questions in Email Invitations Embedding Questions in Email Invitations How to Embed In-email Response Capture Collector Option Survey Behavior Supported Question Types Survey Design Requirements Troubleshooting Issues You can embed the first question of your survey in your Email Invitation , as long as the first question is a supported question type. When a survey taker chooses an answer option in the email, they're sent to the first page of your survey to continue taking the survey. TIP! If you don't see the Embed first question toggle when you're composing your message then you're not using a supported question type or your survey doesn't meet the design requirements . How to Embed To embed a question in an email: Go to the Design Survey section of your survey. Add a supported question type to the very beginning of page 1. Make sure your survey meets the design requirements . Don't enable any option that would disqualify the question or you won't see the option to embed the first question. Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Create an Email Invitation . Compose your message and make sure the Embed first question toggle is on. (Optional) Customize your message . Click Next . Select the In-email Response Capture collector optio n and other collector options. In-email Response Capture Collector Option You can choose whether to save the first response from the email instantly or to wait to save the response until the respondent clicks the Next or Done button. By default, the collector option is set to Off and saves the first response upon clicking Next or Done. If the embedded question has an Other Textbox or Comment field , recipient’s responses won’t be recorded from the email instantly—the response is only submitted when clicking the Next or Done button in the browser. Password Protection isn't available when In-email Response Capture is On. To use Password protection, turn off In-email Response Capture. When In-email response capture is On, email scanner bots could click the links within your email invitation, as a security measure. These bot clicks record responses to the embedded question before your respondent sees the email. This means bots can cause misleading responses for the embedded question (including, a sole bot response, multiple responses, or varying NPS responses). When an actual respondent takes the survey, the responses recorded by email scanner bots are replaced by the respondent’s true answer. If you’re concerned about poor response quality due to email scanner bots, don’t enable In-email response capture. If you’ve already collected data with this option on, you can clean up your responses in Analyze by identifying and deleting incomplete responses related to the collector that were recorded shortly after sending the invitation. Bot answers will only have recorded responses to the embedded, first question. Survey Behavior How the first answer choice is saved is dependent on the In-email Response Capture collector option selection and whether the embedded question has an Other Textbox or Comment field. Regardless of whether the first answer is saved immediately or not, the survey taker is sent to the first page of the survey so they can continue answering the rest of the questions. They'll see their response to the first question pre-selected in SurveyMonkey. Survey takers need to click Next on the first page to save their other responses and trigger any logic in your survey. If you're sending a test email to preview the survey, we don't pre-populate the response in the survey preview since we don't actually collect any responses in survey previews . When the first question is embedded, the email invitation doesn't have a Begin Survey button. Survey takers need to answer the embedded question to open the survey in a browser tab to take remaining survey questions. Supported Question Types To embed a question in an email invitation, use a supported question type as the first question on page 1 of your survey: Multiple Choice Net Promoter® Score (NPS) Star Rating Survey Design Requirements To embed a question in an email invitation, your survey needs to meet these survey design requirements: Use a supported question type as the first question on page 1 of your survey—don't add anything in front of the question, like an Intro Page or Text. Don't use Page Randomization or Block Randomization on page 1 of your survey. Don't enable a Quota on your survey. Setting and Option Requirements The settings and options applied to the question you want to embed may disqualify it or cause it to render differently in the email than what you see in your survey design. Multiple Choice Questions Don't insert an image or video in answer choices. If you enable the Randomize, Flip, or Sort Choices option on the question, don't randomize or flip answer choices, but you can alphabetize them. Don't enable the Adjust Question Layout option. Don't enable the Question Text A/B Test option. We don't recommend adding an “Other” answer option or comment field on the question you want to embed—the question will render differently in the email. While the full Other answer option or comment field will display once the survey opens in a browser, survey-takers may not notice the additional answer option. If you changed the layout of the question to 2 columns, 3 columns, or horizontal, it'll be displayed as 1 column in the email. Don't insert an image or video in answer choices. If you enable the Randomize, Flip, or Sort Choices option on the question, don't randomize or flip answer choices, but you can alphabetize them. Don't enable the Adjust Question Layout option. Don't enable the Question Text A/B Test option. We don't recommend adding an “Other” answer option or comment field on the question you want to embed—the question will render differently in the email. While the full Other answer option or comment field will display once the survey opens in a browser, survey-takers may not notice the additional answer option. If you changed the layout of the question to 2 columns, 3 columns, or horizontal, it'll be displayed as 1 column in the email. Star Rating Questions You can use the Star, Smiley, or Heart icons on the question you want to embed, but, due to email client compatibility, you can't use the Thumb icon. Don't add Other as an answer option for comments. Don't enable the Question Text A/B Test option. Don't use image or video rating labels . You can choose a scale from 2 to 10, however, questions with larger scales aren't mobile responsive—they'll be static in the email, so people will have to scroll to see the full scale. You can use the Star, Smiley, or Heart icons on the question you want to embed, but, due to email client compatibility, you can't use the Thumb icon. Don't add Other as an answer option for comments. Don't enable the Question Text A/B Test option. Don't use image or video rating labels . You can choose a scale from 2 to 10, however, questions with larger scales aren't mobile responsive—they'll be static in the email, so people will have to scroll to see the full scale. Troubleshooting Issues Why does the email look different than what I see in SurveyMonkey? If you update your survey design after scheduling your message and it no longer meets the requirements, we'll send the default email template without the embedded question. Email clients can render HTML messages differently , which can cause HTML Template or Custom HTML messages to display differently than what you expect. title: Showing Respondents Instant Results
body: Showing Respondents Instant Results Turning On Instant Results Previewing Instant Results Who Sees Instant Results What Respondents See Removing SurveyMonkey Branding Display Limitations Showing Respondents Instant Results Showing Respondents Instant Results Turning On Instant Results Previewing Instant Results Who Sees Instant Results What Respondents See Removing SurveyMonkey Branding Display Limitations Turning On Instant Results Instant Results allows you to show your respondents a real-time summary of results when they complete the survey. This collector option is turned off, by default. You can turn on Instant Results from your collector options. To turn on Instant Results: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of the collector and access the collector options . You may need to click Show advanced options . Turn on Instant Results . Your changes are saved automatically. TIP! Collectors are ways to send your survey. Each collector type works a little differently, so they all have different sets of options to choose from when you set them up. If you don't see this particular option in the collector type you're using, review the info on this page, and be sure to check out the help article about that collector type . Previewing Instant Results You can preview Instant Results by taking the survey through a test collector . When you preview your survey, you won't see Instant Results. Who Sees Instant Results Instant Results shows to respondents taking the survey through any collector where you turned on Instant Results. If you're using more than one collector to distribute your survey, you need to turn on Instant Results for each collector. When Instant Results are turned on, any respondent who completes your survey by clicking the Done button at the end of the survey are directed to the Instant Results page. If you added Skip Logic , Disqualification Logic , or Quotas to your survey, respondents who skip over questions in your survey may see Instant Results, depending on your logic settings. To ensure they don't see Instant Results, choose to close the survey window or to redirect respondents to a custom webpage. Respondents can bookmark or copy and paste your Instant Results link and share it. To share a protected version of your survey results, create a password protected shared data page or results dashboard . What Respondents See Instant Results highlights the results of all the closed-ended questions collected at the time the respondent completed the survey or refreshed the page. See example » If you added a Custom Thank You to your collector, your custom message appears at the top of the Instant Results page as long as the survey taker is logged into their SurveyMonkey account. If the survey taker isn’t logged in, the custom message doesn’t display on the Instant Results. After clicking the secondary Done button at the bottom of the Instant Results page, respondents see the Survey End Page . Survey responses are submitted when a respondent clicks the Done button on the last page of your survey—respondents don't need to click the Done button on the Instant Results page to submit their responses. Removing SurveyMonkey Branding White Label URL You can remove SurveyMonkey branding that appears on the Instant Results page if you're using the White Label URL (research.net) on your collector. Display Limitations Instant Results is intended to be a quick snapshot of your survey results, so there are some display limitations to consider: Instant Results doesn't display individual responses or open-ended responses, including Slider question responses. Instant Results doesn't display if you add an image to an answer choice field . Instant Results doesn't display for surveys with more than 15 closed-ended questions. Instant Results doesn't display for surveys with more than 10,000 responses. When you hit your account's response limit , Instant Results won't show any new responses. Instant Results doesn’t display when using a Website Collector . Instant Results doesn't display when using Kiosk Mode . After you collect 100 responses, Instant Results may take up to 15 minutes to refresh and include new responses. Edits you make to your survey design or collector options may take up to 15 minutes to display on the Instant Results page. The chart types and display options used for Instant Results cannot be customized. All variables included in any A/B tests you used may display on Instant Results. TIP! To share more than 15 questions, customize charts, share open-ended responses, choose the questions you share, and more, you can create a shared data page to share your survey results.
