title: Downgrading Your Plan
body: Downgrading Your Plan Downgrading to a lower tier paid plan Downgrading a Team or Enterprise account Downgrading to a free plan (Auto-renew off or non-payment) Special Downgrade Cases Downgrading Your Plan Downgrading Your Plan Downgrading to a lower tier paid plan Downgrading a Team or Enterprise account Downgrading to a free plan (Auto-renew off or non-payment) Special Downgrade Cases There are situations where you may find the need to downgrade your SurveyMonkey plan. In these cases, you can either downgrade to a lower tier paid plan, or our Basic (free) plan, with limited creation and analysis capabilities, 10 questions per survey or form, and fewer responses . In this article, we detail limitations you may run into after downgrading to a free or different paid plan . Downgrading to a lower tier paid (or free) plan What happens to my account when I downgrade? Survey and forms created before downgrading your plan, may include paid features no longer available on your current plan. Additionally, responses over a survey’s response limit may not be viewable. When you create new surveys, you can only send them with features available on the plan you currently have. If you add paid features not available in your current plan, we let you know that you need to upgrade to a different plan to send your survey. Check out the Plans & Pricing page to see which features are available on the plan you’ve selected and compare them with your previous plan. What happens if I upgrade my account again? You can upgrade your account again from the Plans & Pricing page any time. If you upgrade to a different plan than you had before, you might be limited on what features you can use. When this happens, we'll show you what features are no longer on your plan when you try to send a survey. To keep those paid features, re-upgrade your account to send your survey or form. If you don't want to upgrade, you will need to remove the paid features before sending your survey or form. Learn more . For example, if you have a feature on your survey that is only available on the Premier plan. You won’t be able to send that survey again unless you remove the feature, or upgrade to the Premier plan again. Downgrading a Teams or Enterprise account What happens to my team when I downgrade? If a Primary Admin does not renew, your account is put on hold for 30 days, in case your payment is late. After the grace period, users are removed from the team, and all accounts are downgraded to Basic (free) plans. Surveys are only accessible within the original survey creator’s individual account and survey sharing is turned off. Responses that exceed your Basic plan’s response limit will be deleted in accordance with our data retention period — 365 days from the date the response was collected. Individual account owners can delete responses over the account limit at any time. What happens if I upgrade my account again? If the Primary Admin re-upgrades their account, it doesn't automatically re-create the team. Each user will need a new invite to join the team again. Downgrading to a free plan (Auto-renew off or non-payment) After cancelling auto-renew , in most cases, your account will downgrade to a free plan at your next billing date. Similarly, if you have an invoice that remains unpaid a few weeks after the billing date, your account will be downgraded to a free plan. To keep your paid plan active, you’ll need make a payment before your next billing date or choose a different paid plan . What happens to my survey data? When your account downgrades, responses over a survey’s response limit aren’t viewable and may be deleted after a 30 day grace period. To view and keep access to all of your responses, you will need to upgrade to a paid plan again before they're deleted. You can go to My Surveys or the new Homepage (beta) to see which surveys have responses over your plan's limit. After the grace period ends, over-limit responses collected more than 365 days from the date they were collected will be automatically deleted — in accordance with our data retention policy. Deleted responses can’t be restored. However, if for legal compliance reasons, such as data subject requests, you need to access specific over-limit responses that have not been yet deleted, contact our support team. As long as your account remains downgraded, responses collected more than 365 days prior that are over your response limit will continue to be deleted. You can also delete all responses over your account limit at any time. Will my surveys continue to work? Yes, but keep in mind the free plan (and lower paid plans) may have a different set of features than what you had before. When you create new surveys, you can only send them with features available on the plan you currently have. If you add additional paid features, we let you know that you need to upgrade to a different plan to send your survey. Survey restrictions while on the free plan When your account downgrades, some paid features in live surveys continue to work, but with restrictions. Design Restrictions There's a limit of 10 questions per survey, which includes text and images . If you have live surveys with more than 10 questions, we don't delete any questions, but you may run into editing restrictions. You can only copy surveys with 10 questions or less. You may not be able to edit questions on survey templates with more than 10 questions. You can't add logic to your surveys. If existing surveys use logic, they continue to work as long as the collector was open at the time the account downgraded. You may have previously had a plan that allowed you to hide the SurveyMonkey footer. You won't be able to send your survey unless you change the footer back to the default SurveyMonkey one , or upgrade to a plan that includes that feature again. There's a limit of 10 questions per survey, which includes text and images . If you have live surveys with more than 10 questions, we don't delete any questions, but you may run into editing restrictions. You can only copy surveys with 10 questions or less. You may not be able to edit questions on survey templates with more than 10 questions. You can't add logic to your surveys. If existing surveys use logic, they continue to work as long as the collector was open at the time the account downgraded. You may have previously had a plan that allowed you to hide the SurveyMonkey footer. You won't be able to send your survey unless you change the footer back to the default SurveyMonkey one , or upgrade to a plan that includes that feature again. Collect Restrictions There's a limit of 3 collectors per survey. You can't re-open collectors for existing surveys that include paid features. Collectors that were open when the account downgraded continue to record responses and the collector options remain the same, except the Survey End Page may change to the standard end page. You can only delete 50 viewable responses across the entire account. Responses over the survey’s limit aren’t viewable, but you can delete all of these responses at any time. However, if you need access to specific over-limit responses to comply with legal obligations, such as to fulfill a data subject request, then please contact customer support . There's a limit of 3 collectors per survey. You can't re-open collectors for existing surveys that include paid features. Collectors that were open when the account downgraded continue to record responses and the collector options remain the same, except the Survey End Page may change to the standard end page. You can only delete 50 viewable responses across the entire account. Responses over the survey’s limit aren’t viewable, but you can delete all of these responses at any time. However, if you need access to specific over-limit responses to comply with legal obligations, such as to fulfill a data subject request, then please contact customer support . Analyze Restrictions Any shared data pages you created on a paid plan continue to be accessible, but you can't create saved views to share. View-only access per your response limit , and extra responses exceeding your response limit are automatically deleted in accordance with our data retention period. You can't export your data. You can't preview or download files uploaded to your survey. You can only create 1 rule per survey. Your existing rules are deleted when you downgrade. Any shared data pages you created on a paid plan continue to be accessible, but you can't create saved views to share. View-only access per your response limit , and extra responses exceeding your response limit are automatically deleted in accordance with our data retention period. You can't export your data. You can't preview or download files uploaded to your survey. You can only create 1 rule per survey. Your existing rules are deleted when you downgrade. Security Restrictions You don't get login alerts when there are login attempts from a new device or browser You don't get login alerts when there are login attempts from a new device or browser Special Downgrade Cases To comply with data privacy laws, it's not possible to downgrade HIPAA-enabled accounts or an account stored in the European Union (EU) data center to a Basic plan. Learn what other options are available to you in these scenarios. Downgrading HIPAA-enabled accounts Once you enable HIPAA-compliant features for your Enterprise team, it cannot be reverted back to a regular, non-HIPAA-enabled account. To downgrade, you must open a new, non-HIPAA enabled account and transfer over your surveys and data. Surveys that contain PHI can’t be transferred. Regular accounts cannot be covered by a BAA and storing data that contains PHI in a regular account violates our terms of service. HIPAA accounts downgrading due to auto-renew off or non-payment Non-renewing HIPAA-enabled accounts will be placed into a suspended state for a period of time to provide you with an opportunity to renew. While suspended, SurveyMonkey will continue to treat the account, and all data it contains, in accordance with the BAA. During the suspension period, you won’t be able to access your survey data or account directly, except for limited billing and account administration functions. At the end of the suspension period, SurveyMonkey will close your account and delete all data in it. If your account is suspended and you need access to your data or want to close your account, please contact us . Downgrading EU data center accounts The European Union Data Center is only available for SurveyMonkey Enterprise Customers. If you downgrade from an Enterprise plan with accounts and survey data located in our EU data center, you’ll need to open a new self-serve account on our US Data Center and your data cannot be migrated . title: Account Response Limits
body: Account Response Limits Per-Survey Limits Self-Serve Monthly and Annual Limits Enterprise Annual Limits SurveyMonkey Audience Responses Account Response Limits Account Response Limits Per-Survey Limits Self-Serve Monthly and Annual Limits Enterprise Annual Limits SurveyMonkey Audience Responses Each SurveyMonkey plan comes with a set number of responses a user, or team of users, can view. These limits work differently depending on your plan and billing cycle. To compare offerings, see plans and pricing . TIP! A response is one survey takers’ submission to a survey. A response may have any status , including incomplete or deleted. Per-Survey Limits With per-survey response limits, you can view a set number of responses per survey according to your plan. To see a survey’s response count, go to Home . Responses over the survey’s limit aren’t viewable and will be deleted. However, if you need access to specific over-limit responses to comply with legal obligations, such as to fulfill a data subject request, then please contact customer support . You can immediately delete these responses over your account limit or we will automatically delete them 1 year after they were collected. TIP! To view and keep access to all of your responses, upgrade to a paid plan . Self-Serve Monthly and Annual Limits If your plan has an account response limit, responses across all surveys are combined and counted each billing cycle. Unused responses do not roll over. If you exceed survey responses in a billing cycle, there will be an additional $0.15 USD charge per response : All responses, including ones you delete, count towards your overage. You’ll receive a separate invoice for Billable Responses at your next billing date. You’re billed automatically to the payment method on file on the start date of the next billing cycle. Your next subscription and your overages are billed at the same time but as two separate charges. The response count is set back to 0 at the start of the next billing cycle or when your renewal invoice is paid. TIP! You can check your response count from My Account . The charge per billable response depends on the currency in which you pay for your plan. Enterprise Annual Limits Enterprise plans have annual response limits. Contact sales or your CSM to learn more about this option. SurveyMonkey Audience Responses SurveyMonkey Audience responses are not included in SurveyMonkey plans—this is a separate service you can use to buy respondents to take your survey. Learn more: Buying Survey Responses Related Articles Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice

title: Teams
body: Teams Video Overview How Teams Work Signing Up for a Team Joining a Team Managing a Team Teams Teams Video Overview How Teams Work Signing Up for a Team Joining a Team Managing a Team SurveyMonkey Teams are perfect for organizations where multiple people need to work on surveys. Teams offer collaboration features that make working with other people to create, send, and analyze surveys easier than ever. Video Overview How Teams Work Here are some important facts to know about teams: A team is made up of multiple SurveyMonkey accounts. Every account has its own username and password. The Primary Admin creates the team, manages all the team’s accounts (which we call seats), and takes care of the billing for the entire team. Common Questions Can you see each other's surveys? Your surveys are private to your account unless you choose to share them with others or your Team Sharing settings automatically share all new surveys with your team. While Primary Admins manage the accounts on their team, they aren't able to see the surveys within accounts, unless they take over that seat . But they may be able to control how surveys are shared among the team. Your surveys are private to your account unless you choose to share them with others or your Team Sharing settings automatically share all new surveys with your team. While Primary Admins manage the accounts on their team, they aren't able to see the surveys within accounts, unless they take over that seat . But they may be able to control how surveys are shared among the team. How much does it cost to add a seat? I’m a Primary Admin Go to My Team and refer to the number of Seats Available (Empty seats). If you still have seats available, it doesn’t cost anything to add someone to your team. If you don’t have any seats available, you can either reassign a seat at no cost or add a seat for an additional cost. To see how much adding a seat costs, go to Add Users and select Add Seats . Before paying, you can see the cost per seat per year, along with your overage total. We prorate the cost based on the number of days left in your billing cycle. For example, if your next renewal date is in about 6 months, your cost is only about one half of the annual price. I’m not a Primary Admin Go to our Plans and Pricing and review our team plan options. Team plans start at 3 users, and you can add more users during checkout. The cost per user is clearly broken down on the checkout page before you submit payment. I’m a Primary Admin Go to My Team and refer to the number of Seats Available (Empty seats). If you still have seats available, it doesn’t cost anything to add someone to your team. If you don’t have any seats available, you can either reassign a seat at no cost or add a seat for an additional cost. To see how much adding a seat costs, go to Add Users and select Add Seats . Before paying, you can see the cost per seat per year, along with your overage total. We prorate the cost based on the number of days left in your billing cycle. For example, if your next renewal date is in about 6 months, your cost is only about one half of the annual price. I’m not a Primary Admin Go to our Plans and Pricing and review our team plan options. Team plans start at 3 users, and you can add more users during checkout. The cost per user is clearly broken down on the checkout page before you submit payment. Can my account belong to more than one team? If you need to work with another team, you can create another account, or try collaboration features like commenting or shared data pages . If you need to work with another team, you can create another account, or try collaboration features like commenting or shared data pages . Signing Up for a Team Paid Feature: Contributor seats are currently only available on some teams. Team plans require a minimum of 3 Full Access seats. (Full Access seats were previously called Users.) The person who creates the team is the Primary Admin. They're responsible for making payments for the team and managing seats. To sign up for a team: Log in and go to our Plans & Pricing page. Review our team plans under the Team Plans tab and Select a plan. Enter your Billing Details and Payment Method . Or, move to the next step if you're upgrading your current subscription. Under Review Order , choose the number of Full Access and Contributor seats your team needs. Once your payment is processed, you can set up your team, invite people to join, and manage seats on your team . What are Full Access and Contributor seats? We offer different seat types to help you customize your team to support the way you work. Joining a Team Getting Invited If you want to join a team, you may be able to browse for teams that share your company domain or you can ask the Primary Admin to invite you. You may need to ask around at your organization who is in charge of SurveyMonkey. Learn more: Inviting and Managing Users You'll get an email when someone invites you to join their team. Pay attention to the seat type you have. Full Access Seat If you’re invited to a Full Access seat , you can choose to: Create a new account and start with no surveys. Convert an existing SurveyMonkey account to move the surveys into the team. Learn more below. Converting Your Existing Account When you convert an existing account to a team: - If the plan level of the team you're joining is different than your existing account, your account will be converted to the new plan type (and whatever features are available on that plan). - All of your surveys will remain in your account. - If you’re on an existing paid plan, you won’t receive a refund for any time remaining on the plan. However, the Primary Admin of the team will take care of future billing for your team. - Your seat and role on a team control what permissions you have within your account. - Who we regard as the owner of the account and data may change. Learn more: Your SurveyMonkey Data When you convert an existing account to a team: - If the plan level of the team you're joining is different than your existing account, your account will be converted to the new plan type (and whatever features are available on that plan). - All of your surveys will remain in your account. - If you’re on an existing paid plan, you won’t receive a refund for any time remaining on the plan. However, the Primary Admin of the team will take care of future billing for your team. - Your seat and role on a team control what permissions you have within your account. - Who we regard as the owner of the account and data may change. Learn more: Your SurveyMonkey Data Joining a HIPAA-Enabled Team A HIPAA-enabled team is a team that’s been enabled with HIPAA-compliant features. If you’re invited to join an Enterprise HIPAA Team and join it by converting your existing SurveyMonkey account, your account will be HIPAA-enabled and become subject to the terms of the business associate agreement (BAA) that cover that team. This means that control of your account will be subject to your organization, and you won't be able to convert your HIPAA-enabled account back into a non-HIPAA account or leave the team. If you prefer to keep your existing account separate, you can join the HIPAA Team by creating a new SurveyMonkey account. Learn more: HIPAA Compliance & SurveyMonkey A HIPAA-enabled team is a team that’s been enabled with HIPAA-compliant features. If you’re invited to join an Enterprise HIPAA Team and join it by converting your existing SurveyMonkey account, your account will be HIPAA-enabled and become subject to the terms of the business associate agreement (BAA) that cover that team. This means that control of your account will be subject to your organization, and you won't be able to convert your HIPAA-enabled account back into a non-HIPAA account or leave the team. If you prefer to keep your existing account separate, you can join the HIPAA Team by creating a new SurveyMonkey account. Learn more: HIPAA Compliance & SurveyMonkey Managing a Team If you're a Primary Admin or Admin, learn more about managing your team in these articles. title: Welcome to SurveyMonkey Enterprise
body: Welcome to SurveyMonkey Enterprise Welcome to SurveyMonkey Enterprise Welcome to SurveyMonkey Enterprise I'm an admin I'm a survey creator Manage your enterprise team's users and permissions As the admin of your enterprise team, you're able to add users, change and set permissions and assign user roles. You can also can control access to your SurveyMonkey team by using your organization’s corporate login credentials with SSO. Learn more about how to manage your team using the resources below: Manage seats on Enterprise To manage your Enterprise Team seats, you must be a Primary Admin or Admin. Depending on your plan and whether you are an Admin or Primary Admin, there are several permissions you may be able to view, change or customize. Primary Admin Admin Add items to the team library ✅ ✅ View team summary ✅ ✅ View and manage users ✅ ✅ Invite users to join the team ✅ ✅ Ongoing support from Customer Success Manager ✅ ✅ View team activity ✅ ✅ Manage billing details ✅ View only Manage logins and signups with account control ✅ Manage users and invite users Set default permissions for the entire team ✅ Depends on global setting Manage global team wide settings ✅ View only, select settings To manage your Enterprise Team seats, you must be a Primary Admin or Admin. Depending on your plan and whether you are an Admin or Primary Admin, there are several permissions you may be able to view, change or customize. Seats, Roles, and Permissions https://help.surveymonkey.com/en/surveymonkey/teams/enterprise-seats/ https://help.surveymonkey.com/en/surveymonkey/teams/enterprise-seats/ Enterprise Settings (including user permissions) /surveymonkey/teams/enterprise-settings/ /surveymonkey/teams/enterprise-settings/ Single Sign-On With SurveyMonkey’s SSO add-on, your organization can control access to your SurveyMonkey team and create authentication policies for increased security. SurveyMonkey SSO follows the S​AML 2.0 specification and is Service Provider (SP) initiated. With SSO enabled, you can also use the Account Control feature to ensure individual SurveyMonkey accounts using your company's email domain belong to your Enterprise team. With SurveyMonkey’s SSO add-on, your organization can control access to your SurveyMonkey team and create authentication policies for increased security. SurveyMonkey SSO follows the S​AML 2.0 specification and is Service Provider (SP) initiated. With SSO enabled, you can also use the Account Control feature to ensure individual SurveyMonkey accounts using your company's email domain belong to your Enterprise team. HIPAA If your company is a “covered entity” (as defined by HIPAA), SurveyMonkey offers a “ HIPAA-enabled account ” that enables covered entities to collect and manage PHI through surveys in a manner compliant with HIPAA. As part of offering this service, SurveyMonkey ensures that it operates in a way that is consistent and compatible with those laws and SurveyMonkey's role as a business associate to a covered entity user. If your company is a “covered entity” (as defined by HIPAA), SurveyMonkey offers a “ HIPAA-enabled account ” that enables covered entities to collect and manage PHI through surveys in a manner compliant with HIPAA. As part of offering this service, SurveyMonkey ensures that it operates in a way that is consistent and compatible with those laws and SurveyMonkey's role as a business associate to a covered entity user. Managing collaboration features for your enterprise team Divisions Divisions are sub-groups within an Enterprise team, with their own admins, users, and division library . Primary Admins and Admins can add divisions for different departments, offices, clients, cost centers, or any other groups you want to manage separately or give unique branding assets. Divisions help with administrative management of large teams while Workgroups help organize team members collaborating on survey projects. Divisions are sub-groups within an Enterprise team, with their own admins, users, and division library . Primary Admins and Admins can add divisions for different departments, offices, clients, cost centers, or any other groups you want to manage separately or give unique branding assets. Divisions help with administrative management of large teams while Workgroups help organize team members collaborating on survey projects. Workgroups Workgroups help organize team members with a shared purpose to work together on survey projects. Primary Admins and Admins can create workgroups to quickly and easily share surveys with a group of people on your team. Plus, you can manage members, assign roles, and change owner status so each team member has the right level of access to surveys. To allow Power Users to create, own, and manage workgroups, you can contact your CSM. Workgroups help organize team members with a shared purpose to work together on survey projects. Primary Admins and Admins can create workgroups to quickly and easily share surveys with a group of people on your team. Plus, you can manage members, assign roles, and change owner status so each team member has the right level of access to surveys. To allow Power Users to create, own, and manage workgroups, you can contact your CSM. Connect SurveyMonkey to your team's apps To help your team analyze and share survey data when and where they need it, SurveyMonkey Enterprise integrates with many of the most popular business tools. Read on to learn more about the integrations we offer and how to set them up for your team. Setting up Integrations Enterprise plans can connect data to 100+ business-critical apps to automate workflows, streamline lead management, and sync data across reports. Visit our app directory to see the full list of integrations. Enterprise plans can connect data to 100+ business-critical apps to automate workflows, streamline lead management, and sync data across reports. Visit our app directory to see the full list of integrations. Salesforce Integration The SurveyMonkey for Salesforce integration is available as an Enterprise add-on. Contact Sales or your Customer Success Manager (CSM) to get access to this feature. To set up the integration: In SurveyMonkey, select the Products icon and select Integrations & Plug-ins . Select Salesforce . Select Connect or Connect Sandbox to connect your Salesforce account. If you’ve signed in to Salesforce, we’ll automatically connect to your signed-in account. When you're ready to create your mappings, SurveyMonkey for Salesforce guide . To avoid permission issues, it’s best to use a Salesforce account with a “system admin” profile. Only users with Enterprise Power seats in SurveyMonkey can access the integration. The SurveyMonkey for Salesforce integration is available as an Enterprise add-on. Contact Sales or your Customer Success Manager (CSM) to get access to this feature. To set up the integration: In SurveyMonkey, select the Products icon and select Integrations & Plug-ins . Select Salesforce . Select Connect or Connect Sandbox to connect your Salesforce account. If you’ve signed in to Salesforce, we’ll automatically connect to your signed-in account. When you're ready to create your mappings, SurveyMonkey for Salesforce guide . To avoid permission issues, it’s best to use a Salesforce account with a “system admin” profile. Only users with Enterprise Power seats in SurveyMonkey can access the integration. Customize your team's surveys Custom Sender Name A Custom Sender Name & Email lets you specify the display name and email address survey-takers see in the From field when your team sends surveys with the Email Invitation . It replaces the SurveyMonkey sender name and email . Using a Custom Sender Name & Email makes it more likely for your emails to be delivered and for survey-takers to open the survey and respond when they recognize your familiar and trusted brand. Primary Admins can choose to set a custom sender name for the entire team or for specific members only. When Custom Sender Name & Email is turned on, team members can choose to update the display name and local name when selecting their email's collector options. A Custom Sender Name & Email lets you specify the display name and email address survey-takers see in the From field when your team sends surveys with the Email Invitation . It replaces the SurveyMonkey sender name and email . Using a Custom Sender Name & Email makes it more likely for your emails to be delivered and for survey-takers to open the survey and respond when they recognize your familiar and trusted brand. Primary Admins can choose to set a custom sender name for the entire team or for specific members only. When Custom Sender Name & Email is turned on, team members can choose to update the display name and local name when selecting their email's collector options. Custom Question Bank The Custom Question Bank feature lets Primary Admins and Admins add custom questions to their team’s Library. When you add questions to the Library, they become available in the Question Bank. You can also add tags to your custom questions to make them easy for team members to find. Full Access seats on your team can search and browse company questions in the Question Bank and add them to their surveys. The Custom Question Bank feature lets Primary Admins and Admins add custom questions to their team’s Library. When you add questions to the Library, they become available in the Question Bank. You can also add tags to your custom questions to make them easy for team members to find. Full Access seats on your team can search and browse company questions in the Question Bank and add them to their surveys. Manage your team's Brand Library The library is where team members can find and use shared assets to create surveys. These shared assets include images, documents, templates, themes, and questions. Primary Admins and Admins can add or manage items in the team library and set default assets to be automatically added to new surveys that teammates create. The library is where team members can find and use shared assets to create surveys. These shared assets include images, documents, templates, themes, and questions. Primary Admins and Admins can add or manage items in the team library and set default assets to be automatically added to new surveys that teammates create. Viewing your enterprise team's activity Team activity The Activity tab lets Primary Admins and Admins of teams with SSO enabled know what's been happening in their Enterprise Team. In the Activity tab, you'll find options to view, filter and export activity data for your enterprise team's users. The Activity tab lets Primary Admins and Admins of teams with SSO enabled know what's been happening in their Enterprise Team. In the Activity tab, you'll find options to view, filter and export activity data for your enterprise team's users. While many admins don't actively create surveys, we've found it's helpful for admins to understand the survey building process, too. Continue to the next section to explore resources about creating and sharing surveys, collecting survey responses and analyzing data in SurveyMonkey. Create your survey Options for creating your survey SurveyMonkey makes it easy to create a survey from scratch or from a template. Get a head start by using a template designed by our team of survey experts. Use the dropdown menu to browse templates by type to find the right survey for you. If you're on a team, you can also browse your team survey templates . Or try our Build it for me option which helps you create a survey designed to meet your goals. To get started, answer a few simple questions about you and your survey goals. Check out our How to Create a Survey article to learn more ways you can build your survey. SurveyMonkey makes it easy to create a survey from scratch or from a template. Get a head start by using a template designed by our team of survey experts. Use the dropdown menu to browse templates by type to find the right survey for you. If you're on a team, you can also browse your team survey templates . Or try our Build it for me option which helps you create a survey designed to meet your goals. To get started, answer a few simple questions about you and your survey goals. Check out our How to Create a Survey article to learn more ways you can build your survey. Using the Question Bank The Question Bank is a library containing hundreds of questions you can add to your survey in seconds. These questions are written and certified by our very own survey methodologists. Your team's Admins can also add custom questions to the team’s Library. If they add questions to the Library, those questions will be found in the Question Bank. Anyone with a Full Access seat on your team can search and browse company questions in the Question Bank and add them to their surveys. The Question Bank is a library containing hundreds of questions you can add to your survey in seconds. These questions are written and certified by our very own survey methodologists. Your team's Admins can also add custom questions to the team’s Library. If they add questions to the Library, those questions will be found in the Question Bank. Anyone with a Full Access seat on your team can search and browse company questions in the Question Bank and add them to their surveys. Using your team's Brand Library The library is where team members can find and use shared assets to create surveys. These shared assets include images, documents, templates, themes, and questions. Primary Admins and Admins can add or manage items in the team library and set default assets to be automatically added to new surveys that you and your teammates create. If your Enterprise team has Divisions , you may also have access to division libraries with additional survey controls . The library is where team members can find and use shared assets to create surveys. These shared assets include images, documents, templates, themes, and questions. Primary Admins and Admins can add or manage items in the team library and set default assets to be automatically added to new surveys that you and your teammates create. If your Enterprise team has Divisions , you may also have access to division libraries with additional survey controls . Collaborate and share with teammates Working with others on surveys We have some great ways you can work with other people on surveys, allowing you and everyone in your team to build advanced surveys and use all our collaboration features to seamlessly share surveys or manage access to different sections of a survey. For example, if you want others to be notified about results of a survey you've created - whether they're on your team or outside of it, you can share daily summary notifications . You can also share surveys with others to get feedback on your survey design or results. Explore the sections below for more details on how to share your survey. We have some great ways you can work with other people on surveys, allowing you and everyone in your team to build advanced surveys and use all our collaboration features to seamlessly share surveys or manage access to different sections of a survey. For example, if you want others to be notified about results of a survey you've created - whether they're on your team or outside of it, you can share daily summary notifications . You can also share surveys with others to get feedback on your survey design or results. Explore the sections below for more details on how to share your survey. Sharing surveys with others You can share surveys with people on or outside your team if you have an Enterprise account. When a survey is shared, people are granted permissions to each section of the survey. Each team member's seat type determines the default access level assigned to them. But survey owners may be able to edit someone's survey permissions or stop sharing at anytime, depending on your team's settings. When a survey is shared with people outside your team, the most access they can have is View Only. Your surveys are private to your account unless: Your team-wide or account level share settings are set to share your surveys with your team or You choose to share them with others At any time, you can check whether your surveys are shared along with who they're shared with. You can share surveys with people on or outside your team if you have an Enterprise account. When a survey is shared, people are granted permissions to each section of the survey. Each team member's seat type determines the default access level assigned to them. But survey owners may be able to edit someone's survey permissions or stop sharing at anytime, depending on your team's settings. When a survey is shared with people outside your team, the most access they can have is View Only. Your surveys are private to your account unless: Your team-wide or account level share settings are set to share your surveys with your team or You choose to share them with others At any time, you can check whether your surveys are shared along with who they're shared with. Getting Feedback on Surveys and Results You can invite others to give feedback on your survey design by sharing your survey preview link or sending an invite to comment. Anyone can test your survey and those signed into a SurveyMonkey account may be able to post comments but only the survey owner can invite people to the preview by email or turn commenting on to gather feedback. Once you have survey responses, you can create a shared data page so others can view your data and give feedback on survey results. You can invite others to give feedback on your survey design by sharing your survey preview link or sending an invite to comment. Anyone can test your survey and those signed into a SurveyMonkey account may be able to post comments but only the survey owner can invite people to the preview by email or turn commenting on to gather feedback. Once you have survey responses, you can create a shared data page so others can view your data and give feedback on survey results. Collect survey responses Ways to Send Your Survey Once your survey design is ready to go, click Collect Responses to create a collector and send your survey. Any collectors you create can be managed from your collector list. There are various ways to send your survey and collect responses: Collector Type Description Web Link Create a URL or QR code linking to your survey so you can send or post your survey anywhere you want. Email Invitation Send customized email invitations to your contacts through SurveyMonkey to track who responds and send follow-up emails. Social Media Post your survey on Facebook, Twitter, or LinkedIn. Facebook Messenger Let people take your survey directly in Facebook Messenger. People chat with the SurveyMonkey bot to answer the survey and the responses are recorded in SurveyMonkey. Target Audience If you don’t have your own list of survey takers to get the feedback you need, you can buy responses through SurveyMonkey Audience. Website Embed your survey or show a pop-up invitation to your survey on your website. Manual Data Entry Input responses collected offline or add responses for someone without an internet connection. Mobile SDK Get a survey hash used by app developers to add surveys to iOS or Android apps. Field Survey Collect responses without an internet connection through the SurveyMonkey Anywhere app. Text Message Text your contacts a link to your survey. Survey takers can tap the link to take your survey in their mobile browser. The first time you set up a collector for a survey, you may be prompted with suggestions for specific collector types or asked to narrow down how you want to send your survey. To view all collector types, click See more ways to collect responses or Send surveys your way . As part of an Enterprise team, you may also have access to advanced collector options like sending a survey via text message . Once your survey design is ready to go, click Collect Responses to create a collector and send your survey. Any collectors you create can be managed from your collector list. There are various ways to send your survey and collect responses: The first time you set up a collector for a survey, you may be prompted with suggestions for specific collector types or asked to narrow down how you want to send your survey. To view all collector types, click See more ways to collect responses or Send surveys your way . As part of an Enterprise team, you may also have access to advanced collector options like sending a survey via text message . Analyze your survey data Analyzing your data in SurveyMonkey Using our Analyze view, you can see a summary view of your data; browse individual responses; create and export dynamic charts; use filter, compare, and show rules to analyze specific data views and segments; view and categorize open-ended responses, and easily download your results in multiple formats. In addition to our built-in visualization tools, as part of an Enterprise team, you have access to features like Response Quality which uses machine learning to scan your survey results and flag poor-quality responses. Using our Analyze view, you can see a summary view of your data; browse individual responses; create and export dynamic charts; use filter, compare, and show rules to analyze specific data views and segments; view and categorize open-ended responses, and easily download your results in multiple formats. In addition to our built-in visualization tools, as part of an Enterprise team, you have access to features like Response Quality which uses machine learning to scan your survey results and flag poor-quality responses. Exporting your survey data If your team already has established data analysis workflows or tools you prefer, SurveyMonkey gives you options to export your data in several formats such as: XLS (Excel) Exports CSV Exports PDF Exports PPT (PowerPoint) Exports SPSS Exports You can also use our export tools to create custom charts of your data and download them to your computer or share them online. If your team already has established data analysis workflows or tools you prefer, SurveyMonkey gives you options to export your data in several formats such as: XLS (Excel) Exports CSV Exports PDF Exports PPT (PowerPoint) Exports SPSS Exports You can also use our export tools to create custom charts of your data and download them to your computer or share them online. Want to learn more? Visit the Teams and Enterprise section of our Help Center for more helpful articles about features available to your team. For more information on creating, sending or analyzing surveys, choose from any of the links below: Survey Design & Character Limits Adding & Editing Questions Managing Survey Collector Options Allowing Multiple Responses Integrate surveys to increase engagement Survey Response Statuses Using Rules to Break Down Survey Results Visit the Teams and Enterprise section of our Help Center for more helpful articles about features available to your team. title: Device Registration
body: Device Registration What is Device Registration? What are Saved Devices? Teams and Account Verification Troubleshooting Account Verification Device Registration Device Registration What is Device Registration? What are Saved Devices? Teams and Account Verification Troubleshooting Account Verification Device registration adds an extra layer of security and convenience to your log in. The first time you log in to SurveyMonkey with a new device, we'll ask you to save that device in your account. TIP! Use two-factor authentication (2FA) for even more login security. What is Device Registration? Register a new device To register a device, log in from your preferred device or browser, you'll see a prompt asking you to save your device. If you use a different device or browser later, you'll be asked to register ans save that device to your device, as well. Is device registration required? Yes. We require device registration to help protect your account and data. It's not possible to turn off or opt out of device registration . You can click Do this later to skip verification up to 3 times. Once you run out of skips, you'll be required to verify each time you log in from a device or browser that's not saved . Not getting the code? Check that your email address is up-to-date in My Account . Check your spam folders and add us to your allow list to make sure you receive the device code email.Make sure you can receive emails from SurveyMonkey. a What if other people use my account? Each account is meant for one person — the owner of the account email address . Please don’t share your login details or let others use your account Sharing accounts is against our Terms of Use .and mya put your data at risk, since it’s not secure. We have some great ways you can work with others on surveys while everyone uses their own secure account, username, and password. What are Saved Devices? Managing your saved devices You can have up to 2 devices saved at a time per account. If you reach the device removal limit, on your nexyyou'll get a security email with a verification code able to log in from the 2 most recent saved devices . When you remove a saved device and add a new one, that counts towards your monthly removal limit. To see your saved devices, edit a device nickname, or remove a device, go to the Login Details section of My Account. How does SurveyMonkey remember my saved devices? We use cookies to remember your 2 most recent saved devices . These cookles save information about the device and the browser you use to log in so we can identify you. If you complete the device registration steps on a device using your preferred browser, that device and browser will be saved. If you log in on a different browser on that same device (or clear your preferred browser's cookies), you’ll need to verify again. If you clear your browser's cookies, we'll prompt you to complete device registration the next time you log in. How many devices can I save to my account? You can save up to two devices in your account at a time. To add another device, you’ll first have to remove one of your saved devices. Can I get more than 2 devices saved at a time? It’s not possible to have more than 2 saved devices saved per account at a time. If you haven't met your removal limit, you can still log in to SurveyMonkey with a different device or browser. To do that, you need to complete device registration again and remove an active saved device. TIP! If you have multiple people who need access to SurveyMonkey, check out our Team plans . After joining a team, you can share surveys and collaborate securely. Teams and Device Registration Every person on a team gets their own username and password and needs to complete device registration for their own account. Emails with a verification code are sent to the account holder's account email address , not to the Primary Admin . How many saved devices can my team use? A team is made up of multiple SurveyMonkey accounts. Every person (user or seat) on the team has their own account and can have 2 devices saved at a time. Saved devices aren't the same as users on a team . The account holder, identified by the account email address , should be the only person verifying their device and logging in to the account. Can I add more saved devices to my team? Each account on the team can have 2 devices saved at a time. If more people need to access SurveyMonkey, you can invite them to join your team . Troubleshooting Device Registration Why isn’t SurveyMonkey remembering my saved devices? Since we use cookies to remember your saved devices , check that your browser isn’t clearing cookies automatically and preventing us from remembering your device. Enabling cookies ensures we can remember your saved devices for a smoother login experience. Since we use cookies to remember your saved devices , check that your browser isn’t clearing cookies automatically and preventing us from remembering your device. Enabling cookies ensures we can remember your saved devices for a smoother login experience. The verification code doesn't work Verification codes expire after 24 hours or if a new code is requested. Make sure to use the most recent code and enter it correctly—copy and paste the code directly from your email to make sure it's accurate. If your code expired, you can Request a new code from the verification screen and try again. Verification codes expire after 24 hours or if a new code is requested. Make sure to use the most recent code and enter it correctly—copy and paste the code directly from your email to make sure it's accurate. If your code expired, you can Request a new code from the verification screen and try again. I didn't get the login alert email Check your spam, junk, or clutter folder for the subject line "New login alert." You might need to add SurveyMonkey to your safe senders list by allowing our info before you can receive emails from us. If you're not sure how to add to your allow list, just pass that info along to your IT department. Check your spam, junk, or clutter folder for the subject line "New login alert." You might need to add SurveyMonkey to your safe senders list by allowing our info before you can receive emails from us. If you're not sure how to add to your allow list, just pass that info along to your IT department. title: Logging in to Your Account
body: Logging in to Your Account Logging In Account Verification Login Issues Other Ways to Log In Logging in to Your Account Logging in to Your Account Logging In Account Verification Login Issues Other Ways to Log In Logging In To log in to your SurveyMonkey account: Go to the login page . Enter your email and click Next . Enter your password and click Log in . If you're logging in from a device or browser we don't recognize complete account verification . Account Verification Any time you log in from a new device or browser, you're required to complete account verification. To complete account verification: After entering your email and password, click Send code . Go to your account email inbox and open the verification email with the subject, "New Login Alert," sent from SurveyMonkey. Copy and paste your Verification code in SurveyMonkey. Create a unique Device nickname to describe your device or browser. If you already have two verified devices, Remove one to continue. The removed device is automatically logged out—the next time you want to use it, you’ll need to complete account verification again. Why do I need to complete account verification? Account verification adds an extra layer of security to your account by alerting you when a new device or browser tries to log in and access your data. Review these common questions about account verification for more info. If you need multiple accounts with enhanced security and compliance features for your organization, contact our sales team . Login Issues I forgot my email or password Reset your password if you forgot your email or password. Reset your password if you forgot your email or password. I have multiple accounts and don't know how to login If you have already changed over to the new way of logging in with your email address , you can enter your email address and password. You can select your username at the top right of the screen, and select Switch accounts . Then choose which account you want to go to next. If you haven’t switched over to the new way of logging in with your email address, you can enter your email address into the password reset page . A list of your login usernames will be emailed to you. If you don't know your password, you can return to the password reset page and enter your username (not your email). You will then receive an email with a link to reset your password. If you have already changed over to the new way of logging in with your email address , you can enter your email address and password. You can select your username at the top right of the screen, and select Switch accounts . Then choose which account you want to go to next. If you haven’t switched over to the new way of logging in with your email address, you can enter your email address into the password reset page . A list of your login usernames will be emailed to you. If you don't know your password, you can return to the password reset page and enter your username (not your email). You will then receive an email with a link to reset your password. I don't have access to the account email address The account holder (owner of the account email address) should be the only person accessing the SurveyMonkey account. If you're sharing an account, reach out to the account holder and talk about secure ways to work with others on surveys . If the email address is a no-reply or an internal email address that can't receive emails from other domains, or the account holder is no longer with the company, you can work with your IT department to forward you the email, then update your account email address to a supported email address that only you can access. The account holder (owner of the account email address) should be the only person accessing the SurveyMonkey account. If you're sharing an account, reach out to the account holder and talk about secure ways to work with others on surveys . If the email address is a no-reply or an internal email address that can't receive emails from other domains, or the account holder is no longer with the company, you can work with your IT department to forward you the email, then update your account email address to a supported email address that only you can access. I have questions about account verification If you have questions about account verification, verified devices, or login alert emails, check out our article on account verification . If you have questions about account verification, verified devices, or login alert emails, check out our article on account verification . For issues with logging in using two factor authentication (2FA) see troubleshooting 2FA . Other Ways to Log In Single Sign-On (SSO) If your organization has SS O enabled, you can log in with SSO . If you receive an error that your email address isn't enabled for SSO, make sure you're entering the email address you use for SSO at your organization. If you haven't yet joined your organization's team or you're still encountering log in issues, reach out to your IT department. Google, Facebook, LinkedIn, Microsoft, or Apple You can link your SurveyMonkey account to Google, Facebook, LinkedIn, Microsoft, or Apple and use those credentials to log in . You'll still need to complete account verification if a new device or browser is detected. Any changes to your email address or password need to be managed from your Google, Facebook, LinkedIn, Microsoft or Apple account. If you forget your password, you can reset it through the platform you’re using to log in. You cannot reset your password through SurveyMonkey. title: Managing Seats on Your Team
body: Managing Seats on Your Team My Team Adding More Seats Inviting People to Join Managing Pending Invitations Reassigning or Deleting Accounts User Statuses Managing Seats on Your Team Managing Seats on Your Team My Team Adding More Seats Inviting People to Join Managing Pending Invitations Reassigning or Deleting Accounts User Statuses TEAMS FEATURE: This article is for Team Advantage or Team Premier only. If you have an Enterprise team, see Managing seats on your Enterprise Team . My Team If you're a Primary Admin, you can invite people to join your team and manage existing seats from the My Team section of your account. My Team is the central place to find team information. You can find it in the main navigation. Team Summary Under the Team Summary tab, Primary Admins and Admins get an overview of the team. On the Team Summary page you can: Find an overview of your Team Details. Manage Team Sharing permissions . Connect to your team's Billing details. View a breakdown of your current team and available seats. View a summary of Team Overages . Manage AI and machine learning (ML) feature access Adding More Seats Full Access seats and Contributor seats are currently only available to some teams. Under the Add Users tab, you can select Add Seats to select the number of additional Full Access seats and Contributor seats you want to add to your team. Once you've paid for additional seats, select your receipt # in your confirmation to go directly to your invoice or select OK to invite people to join your team. Inviting People to Join Ways to Invite People Under the Add Users tab, you can send an email to invite people to fill available seats. You're billed team overages for each invitation sent that exceeds the number of seats available on the team. You're billed at the time the invitation is sent. Learn more: Charges for Adding More Seats (Team Overages) Full Access seats and Contributor seats are currently only available to some teams. To invite people to your team via email: To invite people to your team via email: Go to My Team . Select Add Users . Select Invite people . Enter email addresses separated by commas. Select Next . Duplicate email addresses are removed for you, as well as emails with pending invitations. Review the number of seats and seat types you’re inviting. If you've invited more people than you have seats available for a seat type, you'll be charged overages when you send the invites. Select Send Invites . It isn't possible to customize the email message. Allowing Team Members to Invite Users The Primary Admin can choose who on the team can invite others to join when there are open seats. Only the Primary Admin can add more seats. To allow team members to invite others to join: Go to My Team . Under Team Sharing , find Manage team invitations permissions and select Edit . Select from the following options: Allow all Full Users to invite team members. Allow some Full Users to invite team members: Search and add team members. Don't allow anyone to invite team members. Allow all Full Users to invite team members. Allow some Full Users to invite team members: Search and add team members. Don't allow anyone to invite team members. Select Save . How to invite people to the team when you're not the Primary Admin Once your Primary Admin has given you permission to invite others to the team via Manage team invitation permissions , you can help fill any open seats. To invite new team members: From the top navigation, select Add users Choose which seats you'd like to fill: Full Access seats have permissions to create, send, analyze, and share surveys. Contributor seats only have permissions to analyze results of shared surveys. Enter email addresses separated by commas. Select Next . Review your selection. Select Send invite . If there are no open seats, then you may be able to request more which allows you to send a message to your Primary Admin, or you may need to directly ask your Primary Admin. Only the Primary Admin can purchase and add more open seats to the team. Once your Primary Admin has given you permission to invite others to the team via Manage team invitation permissions , you can help fill any open seats. To invite new team members: From the top navigation, select Add users Choose which seats you'd like to fill: Full Access seats have permissions to create, send, analyze, and share surveys. Contributor seats only have permissions to analyze results of shared surveys. Full Access seats have permissions to create, send, analyze, and share surveys. Contributor seats only have permissions to analyze results of shared surveys. Enter email addresses separated by commas. Select Next . Review your selection. Select Send invite . If there are no open seats, then you may be able to request more which allows you to send a message to your Primary Admin, or you may need to directly ask your Primary Admin. Only the Primary Admin can purchase and add more open seats to the team. Why can't I invite more people? If you can't send an invite, you probably have an outstanding invoice you need to pay. Once you pay any unpaid invoices, you'll be able to invite more people to your team. You can find invoices in your Transaction History. Can team members see existing surveys? Your surveys are private to your account unless you choose to share them with others or your Team Sharing settings automatically share all new surveys with your team. Primary Admins aren't able to see what surveys are in each team member's account. But they may be able to control how surveys are shared among the team. TIP! Need more insight into your team's surveys? Find out how you can manage your team's surveys with Enterprise . Managing Pending Invitations Email Invitations You can manage pending team invitations sent via email from the Manage Users tab of My Team. If someone has a pending invitation but you invite them to a different seat type , the most recent invitation will override the original pending request. Resending an Invitation You can resend an invitation to anyone with the Invited or Invitation Expired status. You're not charged team overages for resending invitations. To resend an invitation: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the person you want to send another invitation to. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that person and select Resend Invitation . Choose from the following options: Resend Invitation : Sends another email invitation inviting the person to join your team. Copy invitation link : Gives you a link you can share with the person. This link is uniquely tied to the person you're resending the invitation to, so you should only give the link to that person directly. You can resend an invitation to anyone with the Invited or Invitation Expired status. You're not charged team overages for resending invitations. To resend an invitation: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the person you want to send another invitation to. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that person and select Resend Invitation . Choose from the following options: Resend Invitation : Sends another email invitation inviting the person to join your team. Copy invitation link : Gives you a link you can share with the person. This link is uniquely tied to the person you're resending the invitation to, so you should only give the link to that person directly. Resend Invitation : Sends another email invitation inviting the person to join your team. Copy invitation link : Gives you a link you can share with the person. This link is uniquely tied to the person you're resending the invitation to, so you should only give the link to that person directly. Canceling an Invitation You can cancel any invitation in the Invited status. Canceling an invitation will disable the invitation link that was already sent out. If you cancel an invite, you can send someone else an invite at no additional cost since you were already charged team overages for the first invite. To cancel an invitation: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the person whose invitation you'd like to cancel. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that person. Select Cancel Invitation . Select Yes to confirm. You can cancel any invitation in the Invited status. Canceling an invitation will disable the invitation link that was already sent out. If you cancel an invite, you can send someone else an invite at no additional cost since you were already charged team overages for the first invite. To cancel an invitation: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the person whose invitation you'd like to cancel. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that person. Select Cancel Invitation . Select Yes to confirm. Reassigning or Deleting Accounts As the people you need to work with change, you can reassign or delete accounts from the Manage Users tab of My Team. Reassigning an Account You can reassign any Full User or Admin account in your team to another person, along with all of the surveys and data contained within it. You're not charged team overages for reassigning accounts since you were already charged for the seat. To reassign an account: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the account you'd like to reassign. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that account and choose Reassign Account . Enter the email address of the person you want to reassign the account to. Select Send email . Until the new person accepts their invitation, the status of the account will be Reassignment pending . If the account has any shared surveys , they will remain shared with the account—even after it's reassigned to a different person. You can reassign any Full User or Admin account in your team to another person, along with all of the surveys and data contained within it. You're not charged team overages for reassigning accounts since you were already charged for the seat. To reassign an account: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the account you'd like to reassign. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that account and choose Reassign Account . Enter the email address of the person you want to reassign the account to. Select Send email . Until the new person accepts their invitation, the status of the account will be Reassignment pending . If the account has any shared surveys , they will remain shared with the account—even after it's reassigned to a different person. Deleting an Account Before deleting an account, we highly recommend contacting the current owner to ensure that there is no survey data within the account that needs to be kept or transferred to another account in the team. Also, please consider the following precautions and reminders before deletion: - This is a permanent action and cannot be undone. - All survey data within the account will be permanently deleted. - The username will no longer be associated with the account. - Any surveys owned by this account and shared by others will be permanently deleted, and anyone with access to their surveys will lose access. - If the account owner created any collectors on a survey shared with them , the survey owner will get View only access to that collector. It's not possible to modify or close an open collector created by an account that's been deleted. - Their seat is not deleted from your team. Instead, the seat becomes available, so you can invite another person to your team at no additional cost. To delete an account in your team: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the account you'd like to delete. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that account and choose Delete Account . Select Delete to permanently delete the account. You can't delete the Primary Admin. If you want to change the Primary Admin, see Changing Someone's Role . Before deleting an account, we highly recommend contacting the current owner to ensure that there is no survey data within the account that needs to be kept or transferred to another account in the team. Also, please consider the following precautions and reminders before deletion: - This is a permanent action and cannot be undone. - All survey data within the account will be permanently deleted. - The username will no longer be associated with the account. - Any surveys owned by this account and shared by others will be permanently deleted, and anyone with access to their surveys will lose access. - If the account owner created any collectors on a survey shared with them , the survey owner will get View only access to that collector. It's not possible to modify or close an open collector created by an account that's been deleted. - Their seat is not deleted from your team. Instead, the seat becomes available, so you can invite another person to your team at no additional cost. To delete an account in your team: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the account you'd like to delete. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that account and choose Delete Account . Select Delete to permanently delete the account. You can't delete the Primary Admin. If you want to change the Primary Admin, see Changing Someone's Role . TIP! You can also change someone's seat type or role . User Statuses You can check the status of every account in your team from the Manage Users tab. Here's what each status means: TIP! To read about the different roles in a team, like Primary Admin and Full User, see Team Seat Types, Roles, and Permissions .
