title: Enterprise Settings
body: Enterprise Settings Manage Collectors and Collector Settings Roles and permissions Response Manager Permissions to Buy Responses Personally Identifiable Information AI and Machine Learning (ML) Feature Access Enterprise Settings Enterprise Settings Manage Collectors and Collector Settings Roles and permissions Response Manager Permissions to Buy Responses Personally Identifiable Information AI and Machine Learning (ML) Feature Access ENTERPRISE FEATURE: If you're interested in an Enterprise plan, contact sales . Default Respondent Authentication and Anonymous Responses settings are available to all Enterprise customers. The other features in this article are Enterprise add-ons —contact your Customer Success Manager to add it to your team. If you’re the Primary Admin of an Enterprise team, you can access the Settings section in My Team to set default settings and permissions for your entire team. Manage Collectors and Collector Settings You can set default collector types and collector options for your entire Enterprise team, control whether people can change these default selections, and allow or restrict the types of collectors your team can use to send surveys. The default settings are applied to all future collectors your team creates. Existing collectors—including recurring surveys —don't change, but can be edited to match the default settings. Collector Types Restrict collector types This Restrict Collector Types setting lets you choose the collector types your team can use to send surveys. If a collector type is disabled, your team will see it greyed out in the Collect Responses section. Any existing and open collectors created before the default settings were made can be used until they're closed . To restrict the collector types your team can use: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Settings . Click Collectors . Scroll to the Restrict Collector Types section. Uncheck the collector types you don't want your team to use. Select the collector types you do want your team to use. At least one collector type must be selected. You can’t disable the Target Audience collector . This Restrict Collector Types setting lets you choose the collector types your team can use to send surveys. If a collector type is disabled, your team will see it greyed out in the Collect Responses section. Any existing and open collectors created before the default settings were made can be used until they're closed . To restrict the collector types your team can use: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Settings . Click Collectors . Scroll to the Restrict Collector Types section. Uncheck the collector types you don't want your team to use. Select the collector types you do want your team to use. At least one collector type must be selected. You can’t disable the Target Audience collector . Allow people to send surveys by text message The Primary Admin controls whether people on your team can send surveys by text message. By default, no one on the team has access to send surveys by text message. To let people send surveys by text message: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Settings . Click the Collector tile. Under Text Message Collector , click the toggle to Allow people to send surveys by text message . Select whether your Entire team or Specific people can send surveys by text message. If you select Specific people , the Primary Admin or an Admin can turn on this setting for individuals in Manage Users . Team members you give access to can create Text Message collectors . If you disable access later, team members won't be able to send or create new Text Message collectors, but they can see their existing collectors. The Primary Admin controls whether people on your team can send surveys by text message. By default, no one on the team has access to send surveys by text message. To let people send surveys by text message: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Settings . Click the Collector tile. Under Text Message Collector , click the toggle to Allow people to send surveys by text message . Select whether your Entire team or Specific people can send surveys by text message. If you select Specific people , the Primary Admin or an Admin can turn on this setting for individuals in Manage Users . If you select Specific people , the Primary Admin or an Admin can turn on this setting for individuals in Manage Users . Team members you give access to can create Text Message collectors . If you disable access later, team members won't be able to send or create new Text Message collectors, but they can see their existing collectors. Collector Settings Whether or not team members can change these settings in individual collectors depends on whether the default settings were locked in Settings or conflict within a web link collector . Respondent Authentication The Respondent Authentication setting on the web link collector is available to teams with SSO enabled. When Respondent Authentication is enabled, survey takers are required to log in through SSO to access the survey, and their responses are tracked with this SSO metadata. You can set the default Respondent Authentication collector option for all new web link collectors. Once you select a default setting, you can choose to lock it so no one on your team can change it. To set the team default: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Settings . Click Collectors . Under Respondent Authentication (Web Link Collector Only) , toggle Set a team default . Toggle Turn Respondent Authentication on or off by default . (Optional) Check Lock default setting so no one on your team can change your preferred setting. If the default settings for Respondent Authentication and Anonymous Responses are both On, the default options on web link collectors will update . The Respondent Authentication setting on the web link collector is available to teams with SSO enabled. When Respondent Authentication is enabled, survey takers are required to log in through SSO to access the survey, and their responses are tracked with this SSO metadata. You can set the default Respondent Authentication collector option for all new web link collectors. Once you select a default setting, you can choose to lock it so no one on your team can change it. To set the team default: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Settings . Click Collectors . Under Respondent Authentication (Web Link Collector Only) , toggle Set a team default . Toggle Turn Respondent Authentication on or off by default . (Optional) Check Lock default setting so no one on your team can change your preferred setting. If the default settings for Respondent Authentication and Anonymous Responses are both On, the default options on web link collectors will update . Anonymous Responses The Anonymous Responses setting lets you control the level of anonymity for any collector type. Enabling this default setting helps enforce company policies or prevent users on the team from capturing info like Personally Identifiable Information (PII). You can set the Anonymous Responses team default to one of the following: Not anonymous —all available respondent info is included in results. Partially anonymous —applies to Email Invitations only. Custom data is passed through to results, but all other respondent info is excluded. Any other collector types default to fully anonymous. Fully anonymous —no respondent info is included in results. Once you select a default setting, you can choose to lock it so no one on your team can change it. To set a team default: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Settings . Click Collectors . Under the Anonymous Responses section, toggle Set a team default . Select a default anonymity setting— Not anonymous , Partially anonymous , or Fully anonymous . (Optional) Check Lock default setting so no one on your team can change your preferred setting. If the default settings for Respondent Authentication and Anonymous Responses are both On, the default options on web link collectors will update . The Anonymous Responses setting lets you control the level of anonymity for any collector type. Enabling this default setting helps enforce company policies or prevent users on the team from capturing info like Personally Identifiable Information (PII). You can set the Anonymous Responses team default to one of the following: Not anonymous —all available respondent info is included in results. Partially anonymous —applies to Email Invitations only. Custom data is passed through to results, but all other respondent info is excluded. Any other collector types default to fully anonymous. Fully anonymous —no respondent info is included in results. Once you select a default setting, you can choose to lock it so no one on your team can change it. To set a team default: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Settings . Click Collectors . Under the Anonymous Responses section, toggle Set a team default . Select a default anonymity setting— Not anonymous , Partially anonymous , or Fully anonymous . (Optional) Check Lock default setting so no one on your team can change your preferred setting. If the default settings for Respondent Authentication and Anonymous Responses are both On, the default options on web link collectors will update . How Respondent Authentication and Anonymous Responses work together Because the Respondent Authentication feature always records the SSO profile information for everyone that takes the survey, responses can't be anonymous when Respondent Authentication is turned on. So, while you're able to turn on both Respondent Authentication and Anonymous Responses by default in Settings, both of these settings won't actually be reflected in new Web Link collectors your team creates. Instead, Respondent Authentication will remain turned on, and responses won't be anonymous. If Respondent Authentication is unlocked and Anonymous Responses is locked, people in your team can turn off Respondent Authentication, and the Anonymous Responses setting will automatically update to match the locked default setting. Because the Respondent Authentication feature always records the SSO profile information for everyone that takes the survey, responses can't be anonymous when Respondent Authentication is turned on. So, while you're able to turn on both Respondent Authentication and Anonymous Responses by default in Settings, both of these settings won't actually be reflected in new Web Link collectors your team creates. Instead, Respondent Authentication will remain turned on, and responses won't be anonymous. If Respondent Authentication is unlocked and Anonymous Responses is locked, people in your team can turn off Respondent Authentication, and the Anonymous Responses setting will automatically update to match the locked default setting. What Your Team Will See Collector Options The team's default settings are automatically applied to new collectors. If the default setting is locked, team members can't change the setting. If unlocked, team members can change it, but we recommend keeping the default selected by your Admin. Anyone on the team can update existing collectors to match the team’s default preference, but if the default setting is locked, team members won't be able to change it back. If the default settings for Respondent Authentication and Anonymous Responses are both On, the default options on web link collectors will update . The team's default settings are automatically applied to new collectors. If the default setting is locked, team members can't change the setting. If unlocked, team members can change it, but we recommend keeping the default selected by your Admin. Anyone on the team can update existing collectors to match the team’s default preference, but if the default setting is locked, team members won't be able to change it back. If the default settings for Respondent Authentication and Anonymous Responses are both On, the default options on web link collectors will update . Available collectors Team members can see all collector types in the Collect Responses section. If a collector type is greyed out, it can't be used to send your survey because the Primary Admin disabled it. Team members can see all collector types in the Collect Responses section. If a collector type is greyed out, it can't be used to send your survey because the Primary Admin disabled it. Roles and permissions You can create custom roles that will give team members more or less access, depending on how they use SurveyMonkey. Give seats on your team access to certain features, and administrative functions in the following permission areas: Manage users , team-wide settings , manage team credits , team library , Division management , and advanced access and permissions. Response Manager If a respondent asks you or someone on your team to erase their response data, you can search across your team and filter by Email Invitation and Text Message collector metadata to find and delete applicable responses. Depending on where you and your respondents are located, you may be required to respond to requests from people who ask to exercise their data privacy rights . To find and delete survey responses: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Settings . Click Survey response management. Click Search responses . In the new tab Response Manager , filter your team's responses by at least one of these criteria: Email , First name , Last name , or Custom field . (Optional) Filter your team’s responses by Date . Click Apply Filters . Click Delete Responses . Confirm you want to delete responses. Filters let you search for respondent metadata—results won't include responses where name or email was collected as survey data. Permissions to Buy Responses Your Enterprise Team may use Budgets instead to manage credits. You can restrict users in your team from buying SurveyMonkey Audience responses unless they get your approval. To set permissions to buy responses: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Settings . Click SurveyMonkey Audience . Toggle Users can buy responses without Admin approval on or off Personally Identifiable Information You can restrict users in your team from collecting personally identifiable information (PII) in the following open-ended question types: Single Textbox , Multiple Textbox , Comment Box , Contact Information , or Text A/B Testing . Restricted PII When this setting is enabled, open-ended questions are flagged if they include any of the following PII terms: email e-mail phone phone number user name first name last name full name login credit card password address When this setting is enabled, open-ended questions are flagged if they include any of the following PII terms: email e-mail phone phone number user name first name last name full name login credit card password address AI and Machine Learning (ML) Feature Access TIP! Check out the Managing AI Feature Access article for more info. You can give users in your team access to the following AI/ML features: Build with AI Sentiment Analysis Response Quality Related Articles Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice

title: Managing Seats on Your Enterprise Team
body: Managing Seats on Your Enterprise Team My Team Inviting People to Join Importing Users by CSV Managing Pending Invitations Reassigning or Deleting Accounts User Statuses Managing Seats on Your Enterprise Team Managing Seats on Your Enterprise Team My Team Inviting People to Join Importing Users by CSV Managing Pending Invitations Reassigning or Deleting Accounts User Statuses ENTERPRISE TEAMS: This article is for Enterprise teams. If you have Team Advantage or Team Premier, see Managing seats on your Team . My Team If you're a Primary Admin or Admin, you can invite people to join your team and manage existing seats from the My Team section of your account. My Team is the central place to find your Enterprise team information. You can find it in the main navigation. Team Summary Under the Team Summary tab, Primary Admins and Admins get an overview of the team. Inviting People to Join Under the Add Users tab, you can send an email to invite people to fill available seats. Enterprise teams can also see an option to create a team sign-up page where people in your organization can send invites to themselves to join. Teams with SSO enabled won't see either of these options and can send your team’s invite link to people . Send an email invitation To invite people to your team via email: Go to My Team . Select Add Users . Choose Send an email. Enter the email addresses of the people you want to invite. Enter multiple addresses separated by commas, or put each email address on its own line. Customize the email message. Select Send Invitations . Team Sign-Up Page ENTERPRISE FEATURE: Team sign-up pages are only available to Enterprise customers. You can activate a sign-up page and share the URL to allow people to join your team on their own. Anyone with the link can enter their email address to send themselves an invitation. To create a sign-up page: Go to My Team . Select Add Users . Choose Use a sign-up page . In the Maximum signups field, enter a limit for how many people can sign up. Select Activate page . Copy the link and share it however you'd like. Teams with SSO enabled won't see these options. Instead, admins can send your team’s invite link to people . You can manage your team sign-up page from the Add Users tab of My Team. Monitoring Sign-Ups You can see the number of signups started through your sign-up page at any time. This number indicates how many people have requested an invitation through the sign-up page—not how many people have signed up for an account from the invitation. To see the number of signups started through your team sign-up page: Go to My Team . Select Add Users . Choose Activate a sign-up page . Under the link, you'll see the number of signups initiated out of the maximum number of signups you chose when you created the page. You can see the number of signups started through your sign-up page at any time. This number indicates how many people have requested an invitation through the sign-up page—not how many people have signed up for an account from the invitation. To see the number of signups started through your team sign-up page: Go to My Team . Select Add Users . Choose Activate a sign-up page . Under the link, you'll see the number of signups initiated out of the maximum number of signups you chose when you created the page. Deactivating Your Sign-Up Page You can deactivate a sign-up page at any time to prevent any new people from joining your team through the link. Anyone that already started the sign-up process through the link will still be able to complete it, unless you cancel the invitation. To deactivate a sign-up page: Go to My Team . Select Add Users . Under the URL for the sign-up page, select Deactivate Page . Select Deactivate . If someone tries going to a deactivated sign-up page, they'll see a message that the page was deactivated. You can deactivate a sign-up page at any time to prevent any new people from joining your team through the link. Anyone that already started the sign-up process through the link will still be able to complete it, unless you cancel the invitation. To deactivate a sign-up page: Go to My Team . Select Add Users . Under the URL for the sign-up page, select Deactivate Page . Select Deactivate . If someone tries going to a deactivated sign-up page, they'll see a message that the page was deactivated. Importing Users by CSV Primary Admins and Admins can add or update their team's division , and custom role assignments by importing a CSV file. If your team has SSO enabled, you can't add users via CSV import. Spreadsheet Setup View our example screenshot to see how to properly format your CSV file. Create a spreadsheet in an application like Excel, Numbers, or Google Sheets. Make sure you set up your spreadsheet's first row with the following header fields: Username , Email , Role , Division (user), Division (admin) . Follow these guidelines when adding data to your spreadsheet: Each User is on their own row Username is required and matches what's in SurveyMonkey The file can have up to 10,000 rows and is less than 5MB Use commas to separate the division names if adding a User as a Division Admin of multiple divisions For the Role column*, find the right role in this list and, in the cell, use the term next to it: *For CSV Terms for customized roles, see Custom Roles . Saving your CSV file You may be able to save your CSV file in various .csv formats and not all formats will save and import successfully. Try saving your file as either: CSV UTF-8 (Comma delimited) | MS-DOS Comma Separated How to Import To import a CSV file: Go to the Manage Users tab. (Optional) Select Export CSV to download a complete list of users in your team and their account status. Select Import CSV . (Optional) Select Download example template to download a properly formatted CSV file that you can edit and re-import. Drag and drop or browse your computer to attach your CSV file. Select Next . Preview the first 5 rows of your CSV to confirm your data is in the right order and select Next . Once your import is finished select Download report to view the import status per user and any import errors. Once you dismiss the Import finished message, you won't be able to download the report. Import Errors Once your import is finished, you’ll be able to Download a report to view the import status for each row. If there are errors, you can fix them and re-import the file to try again. If there's an Import Error it could be: The data isn't formatted properly. The columns aren't in the right order. There's extra data in your spreadsheet. There are more than 10,000 rows or your spreadsheet is over 5 MB. The file needs to be saved in a different CSV format. The spreadsheet includes more users than there are seats in your team. You're changing a Power User to a Casual User more than one time within a 90 day time frame. Why can't I invite more people? If you can't send an invite or people can't invite themselves from the team sign-up page, you may have an outstanding invoice you need to pay. Once you pay any unpaid invoices, you'll be able to invite more people to your team. Contact your Customer Success Manager (CSM) for more information. If you can't send an invite or people can't invite themselves from the team sign-up page, you may have an outstanding invoice you need to pay. Once you pay any unpaid invoices, you'll be able to invite more people to your team. Contact your Customer Success Manager (CSM) for more information. Can team members see existing surveys? Your surveys are private to your account account unless you choose to share them with others or your Team Sharing settings automatically share all new surveys with your team. Primary Admins are able to see what surveys are in each team member's account and can manage them. Your surveys are private to your account account unless you choose to share them with others or your Team Sharing settings automatically share all new surveys with your team. Primary Admins are able to see what surveys are in each team member's account and can manage them. Managing Pending Invitations Email Invitations You can manage pending team invitations sent via email from the Manage Users tab of My Team. If someone has a pending invitation but you invite them to a different seat type , the most recent invitation will override the previous request. Resending an Invitation You can resend an invitation to anyone with the Invited or Invitation Expired status. You're not charged team overages for resending invitations. To resend an invitation: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the person you want to send another invitation to. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that person and select Resend Invitation . Choose from the following options: Resend Invitation : Sends another email invitation inviting the person to join your team. Copy invitation link : Gives you a link you can share with the person. This link is uniquely tied to the person you're resending the invitation to, so you should only give the link to that person directly. You can resend an invitation to anyone with the Invited or Invitation Expired status. You're not charged team overages for resending invitations. To resend an invitation: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the person you want to send another invitation to. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that person and select Resend Invitation . Choose from the following options: Resend Invitation : Sends another email invitation inviting the person to join your team. Copy invitation link : Gives you a link you can share with the person. This link is uniquely tied to the person you're resending the invitation to, so you should only give the link to that person directly. Resend Invitation : Sends another email invitation inviting the person to join your team. Copy invitation link : Gives you a link you can share with the person. This link is uniquely tied to the person you're resending the invitation to, so you should only give the link to that person directly. Canceling an Invitation You can cancel any invitation in the Invited status. Canceling an invitation will disable the invitation link that was already sent out. If you cancel an invite, you can send someone else an invite at no additional cost as long as you have seats available. To cancel an invitation: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the person whose invitation you'd like to cancel. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that person. Select Cancel Invitation . Select Yes to confirm. You can cancel any invitation in the Invited status. Canceling an invitation will disable the invitation link that was already sent out. If you cancel an invite, you can send someone else an invite at no additional cost as long as you have seats available. To cancel an invitation: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the person whose invitation you'd like to cancel. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that person. Select Cancel Invitation . Select Yes to confirm. Reassigning or Deleting Accounts As the people you need to work with change, you can reassign or delete accounts from the Manage Users tab of My Team. Reassigning an Account You can reassign any seat or Admin account in your team to another person who isn’t already on your team, along with all of the surveys and data contained within it. You're not charged team overages for reassigning accounts since you were already charged for the seat. To reassign an account: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the account you'd like to reassign. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that account and choose Reassign Account . Enter the email address of the person you want to reassign the account to. Select Send email . Until the new person accepts their invitation, the status of the account will be Reassignment pending . If the account has any shared surveys , they will remain shared with the account— even after it's reassigned to a different person. TIP! Primary Admins can transfer surveys over to an existing team member. You can reassign any seat or Admin account in your team to another person who isn’t already on your team, along with all of the surveys and data contained within it. You're not charged team overages for reassigning accounts since you were already charged for the seat. To reassign an account: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the account you'd like to reassign. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that account and choose Reassign Account . Enter the email address of the person you want to reassign the account to. Select Send email . Until the new person accepts their invitation, the status of the account will be Reassignment pending . If the account has any shared surveys , they will remain shared with the account— even after it's reassigned to a different person. TIP! Primary Admins can transfer surveys over to an existing team member. Deleting an Account Before deleting an account, we highly recommend contacting the current owner to ensure that there is no survey data within the account that needs to be kept or transferred to another account in the team. Also, please consider the following precautions and reminders before deletion: - This is a permanent action and cannot be undone. - All survey data within the account will be permanently deleted. - The username will no longer be associated with the account. - Any surveys owned by this account and shared by others will be permanently deleted, and anyone with access to their surveys will lose access. - If the account owner created any collectors on a survey shared with them , the survey owner will get View only access to that collector. It's not possible to modify or close an open collector created by an account that's been deleted. - Their seat is not deleted from your team. Instead, the seat becomes available, so you can invite another person to your team at no additional cost. To delete an account in your team: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the account you'd like to delete. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that account and choose Delete Account . Select Delete to permanently delete the account. You can't delete the Primary Admin, but you are able to reassign the Primary Admin account. Before deleting an account, we highly recommend contacting the current owner to ensure that there is no survey data within the account that needs to be kept or transferred to another account in the team. Also, please consider the following precautions and reminders before deletion: - This is a permanent action and cannot be undone. - All survey data within the account will be permanently deleted. - The username will no longer be associated with the account. - Any surveys owned by this account and shared by others will be permanently deleted, and anyone with access to their surveys will lose access. - If the account owner created any collectors on a survey shared with them , the survey owner will get View only access to that collector. It's not possible to modify or close an open collector created by an account that's been deleted. - Their seat is not deleted from your team. Instead, the seat becomes available, so you can invite another person to your team at no additional cost. To delete an account in your team: Go to My Team . Select Manage Users . Find the account you'd like to delete. Select the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that account and choose Delete Account . Select Delete to permanently delete the account. You can't delete the Primary Admin, but you are able to reassign the Primary Admin account. Changing the Primary Admin If you can’t log into the Primary Admin account, contact support. The Primary Admin can edit their account details (name, email address, etc.) to the new person's details. However, steps to complete this process depend on whether the new person is already on the team: Change to someone who isn't on the team yet To change the Primary Admin: Log into your Primary Admin account in SurveyMonkey. Change the email address on your account to the email address of the person you want to be the new Primary Admin. Change to someone who is on the team Changing the Primary Admin to someone else that's already part of your team is a multi-step process. If you're the current Primary Admin, follow these steps to switch the Primary Admin to someone else that's already on your team: Before you do anything, ask the other person to log in to their account and transfer their surveys to the current Primary Admin account. Log in to the Primary Admin account in SurveyMonkey. Select My Team from the main navigation. Select Manage Users . Find the person who you want to be the new Primary Admin. If their email address is linked to multiple SurveyMonkey accounts, you will need to contact support or choose different email address for the Primary Admin account. Delete their account from the team . Change the email address on your account to the email address of the new person. If the original Primary Admin still needs to be in the team, the new Primary Admin can invite them to fill the open seat at no additional cost. If you change the email address on your account to someone else, you'll lose access to the account and all surveys and data within it. You won't be a part of the team anymore unless the new Primary Admin invites you to join the team. If you can’t log into the Primary Admin account, contact support. The Primary Admin can edit their account details (name, email address, etc.) to the new person's details. However, steps to complete this process depend on whether the new person is already on the team: Change to someone who isn't on the team yet To change the Primary Admin: Log into your Primary Admin account in SurveyMonkey. Change the email address on your account to the email address of the person you want to be the new Primary Admin. Change to someone who is on the team Changing the Primary Admin to someone else that's already part of your team is a multi-step process. If you're the current Primary Admin, follow these steps to switch the Primary Admin to someone else that's already on your team: Before you do anything, ask the other person to log in to their account and transfer their surveys to the current Primary Admin account. Log in to the Primary Admin account in SurveyMonkey. Select My Team from the main navigation. Select Manage Users . Find the person who you want to be the new Primary Admin. If their email address is linked to multiple SurveyMonkey accounts, you will need to contact support or choose different email address for the Primary Admin account. Delete their account from the team . Change the email address on your account to the email address of the new person. If the original Primary Admin still needs to be in the team, the new Primary Admin can invite them to fill the open seat at no additional cost. If you change the email address on your account to someone else, you'll lose access to the account and all surveys and data within it. You won't be a part of the team anymore unless the new Primary Admin invites you to join the team. To enable Single Sign-On (SSO) when reassigning an Account TIP! The new user must have SSO credentials already configured by your IT department. To link an SSO log-in to a reassigned account: Reassign the Account . The new person needs to accept the email invitation to join the team and set up a new password. Send your team’s invite link to the new user. When selecting the invite link they will be given the option to create or convert an account to log in with SSO. To complete the seat reassignment: Select convert an account . After that initial set up, your new team member will log into SurveyMonkey or the SurveyMonkey app with SSO. TIP! The new user must have SSO credentials already configured by your IT department. To link an SSO log-in to a reassigned account: Reassign the Account . The new person needs to accept the email invitation to join the team and set up a new password. Send your team’s invite link to the new user. When selecting the invite link they will be given the option to create or convert an account to log in with SSO. To complete the seat reassignment: Select convert an account . After that initial set up, your new team member will log into SurveyMonkey or the SurveyMonkey app with SSO. TIP! You can also change someone's seat type or role . User Statuses You can check the status of every account in your team from the Manage Users tab. Here's what each status means: TIP! Use custom roles to provide more Admin support, give users access to certain features or to limit permissions on the team. title: Account Control
body: Account Control Account Capture Account Migrate Account Control Account Control Account Capture Account Migrate ENTERPRISE FEATURE: If you're interested in Account Control, contact sales . If you already have a SurveyMonkey Enterprise account, contact your Customer Success Manager. Account Control lets you lock down your organization's email domain so that every SurveyMonkey account using your company's email domain becomes part of your Enterprise team. You must have Single Sign-On (SSO) enabled on your Enterprise team in order to get this feature. Once someone joins your Enterprise team through Account Control, they need to use SSO to access that account moving forward. If you have data stored in our European or Canadian Data Center, this feature isn't available. You can see if this applies to you by checking your Account Details . There are two parts of Account Control: Account Capture Account Migrate Account Capture Account Capture intercepts new sign-ups that use a company email address. When someone tries to sign up for a new account using your company's email domain, they're blocked from creating an account. Instead, they're prompted to sign up as part of your Enterprise team. If they click to join the Enterprise plan, they're given two options: Convert an existing account to the Enterprise team Create a new account as part of the Enterprise team Account Migrate Account Migrate will only apply to individual accounts using your company’s email domain. If you are on a Team plan , you won’t be affected. Account Migrate helps you migrate existing company accounts into your Enterprise team. When someone logs into an existing account that uses your company's email domain, they're given two options: Convert their account to the Enterprise team Change their email address to a personal one, and keep their account separate Decide Later If they don't want to make a choice immediately, they can choose to decide later. They'll have 30 days from their original log in to make the decision. Every time they log in during that 30-day period, they'll be prompted again to make a decision or decide later. If they still haven't taken any action at 30 days, they'll be locked out of their account. To access their account again, they need to either convert their account or change their email address to a personal one. title: Working with Others on Surveys
body: Working with Others on Surveys Collaboration Features Working with Others on Surveys Working with Others on Surveys Collaboration Features We have some great ways you can work with other people on surveys, no matter what kind of SurveyMonkey account you have. To see our plan options or sign up for an account, check out our Plans and Pricing page. Basic (free) plan : you can make your own surveys, comment on other people’s surveys and results, and share data pages with anyone. Individual paid plans : you get access to more powerful features, like using survey logic in your design or exporting your results, plus, you’ll get additional shared data page options. Team plans : you and everyone in your team can build advanced surveys and use all our collaboration features to seamlessly share surveys and manage access to different sections of a survey. It's important that everyone you're working with has their own account to protect your account and data . Collaboration Features * Some shared data page settings may only be available with a paid plan. Our team can partner with you to maximize your programs and deliver value at any stage. The table below provides a brief overview of the services we offer. title: Discover Teams at Your Company
body: Discover Teams at Your Company How It Works Turning Discovery On or Off Browsing Teams Reviewing Requests to Join Your Team Eligibility Discover Teams at Your Company Discover Teams at Your Company How It Works Turning Discovery On or Off Browsing Teams Reviewing Requests to Join Your Team Eligibility Team Discovery is only available to some customers on Team Premier or Team Advantage plans —check eligibility for more info. Team Discovery helps people find existing SurveyMonkey teams from their company and makes it easier for Primary Admins to invite people to join their team. How It Works Eligible Primary Admins control whether their team is discoverable or not Eligible colleagues with an individual account can browse SurveyMonkey teams that already exist within their organization and request to join The Primary Admin is notified of their colleagues' request and can choose to invite them to the team Approved colleagues get an invitation to join the team, otherwise they can browse and request to join another team or start a new team Turning Discovery On or Off From the Team Summary , Primary Admins can control whether their eligible team can be discovered by colleagues with their same email domain. If you don't see Discovery in your Team Details, your team isn't eligible . To turn Discovery On or Off: Go to My Team . Under Team Details, click Edit next to Discovery . Choose On to allow others with the same email domain to find your team and request to join, or select Off to keep your team hidden. Click Save . If you turn Discovery Off while there are pending requests, you can still invite the people who made those requests, but they won't be able to send you a reminder. Update Your Team Name or Description Your team name and description can help colleagues identify your team as the right one to request to join. You can update Name and Description anytime from the Team Summary . Browsing Teams To discover teams at your organization that are already using SurveyMonkey, you can Browse teams from My Account . You’ll see eligible teams, with Discovery On, that share your work email domain. The team name, description, and Primary Admin's email address can help you identify the team that's right for you. Request to Join a Team To browse available teams and request to join: Log in and go to My Account . Go to the Account Details section. Click Browse teams . You may be prompted to verify your account email address before you can proceed. If you don't see Browse teams , your email domain or account isn't eligible to browse teams. Identify the team you want to join and click Request to join team . If you consent to share your name and email address with the team's Primary Admin, click Send request . An email is sent to the Primary Admin to Invite or Delete your request. Your Account Details will update to show the requested team name and the status Pending . You can only request to join 1 team and your request never expires. If you click Browse teams again, you can either: Cancel request to continue browsing and request to join another team. Send a reminder to the Primary Admin . You can only send one reminder. Request approved If your request to join the team is approved, you'll get an email with the option to Join team . If you choose to convert your account rather than create a new account for the team, be aware of what to expect if you convert your existing account . If your request to join the team is approved, you'll get an email with the option to Join team . If you choose to convert your account rather than create a new account for the team, be aware of what to expect if you convert your existing account . Request denied If your request to join a team is denied, you can return to Browse teams and request to join a different team. If your request to join a team is denied, you can return to Browse teams and request to join a different team. Reviewing Requests to Join Your Team When someone requests to join your team, the Primary Admin is notified by email. You can Review requests from the Manage Users tab and choose to Invite the requestor to your team or Delete the request. To review requests to join your team: Go to My Team . Click Manage Users . Click Review requests to view the requestor's name and email address. Click Invite or Delete . If you choose Invite , you're prompted to invite them to your team. The requestor's email address is auto-populated in the Full Access seat field. You can choose to update their seat type assignment or invite others to the team. You may be charged overages depending on whether you have seats available on your team. If you choose to Delete the request, the requestor is sent an email notification that their request wasn't approved. If you choose Invite , you're prompted to invite them to your team. The requestor's email address is auto-populated in the Full Access seat field. You can choose to update their seat type assignment or invite others to the team. You may be charged overages depending on whether you have seats available on your team. If you choose to Delete the request, the requestor is sent an email notification that their request wasn't approved. The Primary Admin can always manually invite people to the team, including people who were previously denied a pending request. TIP! Admins can head to the Notification Center to check out requests to join your team from the last 30 days. Why don't I see a pending request? If you got an email notification that there's a request to join your team, but there are no pending requests in Manage users , then: The requestor canceled their request, joined another team, or deleted their account, or You already invited the requestor to your team If you got an email notification that there's a request to join your team, but there are no pending requests in Manage users , then: The requestor canceled their request, joined another team, or deleted their account, or You already invited the requestor to your team Eligibility The Primary Admin and people browsing for a team need a verified account email address associated with their company or work. Also, the team must be in good financial standing with a credit card on file to be eligible. We maintain a block list of email addresses, including publicly used domains, like gmail.com, yahoo.com, etc., which aren’t eligible for team Discovery. However, SurveyMonkey’s system may not include all possible publicly used domains. Why am I not eligible? Below are common reasons why you or your team or people browsing may not be eligible for Discovery: The Primary Admin or person browsing needs a verified account email address Your email address domain is a publicly used domain or is on our block list The email of the Primary Admin or person browsing has been flagged for spam or is locked out The team's subscription renewal is overdue or your payment hasn't processed yet The team doesn't have an updated credit card on file The team made payments via our mobile app or through the app store The team has unpaid overages There's no assigned Primary Admin of the team The team stores its data in a regional data center The team doesn't have a Team Premier or Team Advantage plan Below are common reasons why you or your team or people browsing may not be eligible for Discovery: The Primary Admin or person browsing needs a verified account email address Your email address domain is a publicly used domain or is on our block list The email of the Primary Admin or person browsing has been flagged for spam or is locked out The team's subscription renewal is overdue or your payment hasn't processed yet The team doesn't have an updated credit card on file The team made payments via our mobile app or through the app store The team has unpaid overages There's no assigned Primary Admin of the team The team stores its data in a regional data center The team doesn't have a Team Premier or Team Advantage plan Related Articles Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice

title: Team Seats, Roles, and Permissions
body: Team Seats, Roles, and Permissions Seat Types & Roles Permissions for Full Access Seats Permissions for Contributor Seats Changing Someone's Seat Type or Role Team Seats, Roles, and Permissions Team Seats, Roles, and Permissions Seat Types & Roles Permissions for Full Access Seats Permissions for Contributor Seats Changing Someone's Seat Type or Role TEAM ADVANTAGE AND TEAM PREMIER FEATURES: Read about roles within these specific team plans. If you have an Enterprise plan, go to Enterprise Team Seats, Roles, and Permissions. Your seat and role on a team control what permissions you have within your account and how you can work together with your team. Seats and Roles The Primary Admin invites people to fill a seat (an account) and assigns the seat a role. Someone's seat and role set the permissions within their account and what they can do on the team. Seats There are 2 seats available on Team Advantage or Team Premier Plans : Full access seats have full access survey permissions and can share surveys . Full access seats can be added one by one. Contributor seats have limited survey permissions and focus on one section of shared surveys, like just the Analyze section. Contributor seats can be added in bundles of 2 at a time. Roles The seat determines the role someone can have on the team. Contributor seat. They have limited survey permissions—full access to analyze the results of surveys shared with them , can view and comment on the survey design, and view the collectors used to send the survey. Viewing Seats and Roles Primary Admins can view the seat and role of everyone on the team from the Manage Users tab. To go to the Manage Users tab: Select My Team from the main navigation. Select Manage Users . Permissions for Full Access Seats Here's what people in each role can do on your team: Permissions for Contributor Seats Contributor seats focus on one area of a survey—the survey design, collecting responses, or analyzing results. Team members need to share surveys with Analysts so they have surveys to analyze. Here's what Analysts can do with the team's shared surveys: Exports, shared data pages, and dashboards Unlimited rules and filters on surveys shared with you * This table shows what an Analyst can do if given the default access levels . Survey owners can edit permissions to prevent Analysts from accessing the Collect Responses section. TIP! If you're an Analyst and need additional permissions, contact your Primary Admin. Changing Someone's Seat or Role If you need to change someone's seat or role, choose an option below to learn more. Change seat To change someone's seat: Select My Team from the main navigation. Select Manage Users . Locate the person whose seat you want to update and choose View User Details . Next to the seat, select Change . Select the seat you want to assign—you can see how many Seats Available you currently have. If the seat has 0 available , Select Add Seats to purchase the seat. Select Save . An email notification is sent to the team member to let them know their new seat and role. Since Contributor seats can't own surveys, you may have to ask a Full Access seat to transfer or delete their surveys before you can change their seat to a Contributor seat. To change someone's seat: Select My Team from the main navigation. Select Manage Users . Locate the person whose seat you want to update and choose View User Details . Next to the seat, select Change . Select the seat you want to assign—you can see how many Seats Available you currently have. If the seat has 0 available , Select Add Seats to purchase the seat. Select Save . An email notification is sent to the team member to let them know their new seat and role. Since Contributor seats can't own surveys, you may have to ask a Full Access seat to transfer or delete their surveys before you can change their seat to a Contributor seat. Change the Primary Admin If you can’t log into the Primary Admin account, contact support. The Primary Admin can edit their account details (name, email address, etc.) to the new person's. However, steps to complete this process depend on whether the new person is already on the team: Change to someone who isn't on the team yet To change the Primary Admin: Log into your Primary Admin account in SurveyMonkey. Change the email address on your account to the email address of the person you want to be the new Primary Admin. Change to someone who is on the team Changing the Primary Admin to someone else that's already part of your team is a multi-step process, so we'll start with an example. EXAMPLE In this example, Cindy and Deanna are already part of the same team. Cindy is the Primary Admin, and Deanna is a Full User. Cindy wants to make Deanna the new Primary Admin instead. Here's what needs to happen: 1. Deanna transfers all of her surveys to Cindy's Primary Admin account. 2. Cindy deletes Deanna's Full User account from the team. 3. Cindy changes the email address on her own account to Deanna's email address. 4. Deanna is now the Primary Admin and Cindy is no longer in the team. If you're the current Primary Admin, follow these steps to switch the Primary Admin to someone else that's already on your team: Before you do anything, ask the other person to log in to their account and transfer their surveys to the current Primary Admin account. Log in to the Primary Admin account in SurveyMonkey. Select My Team from the main navigation. Select Manage Users . Find the person who you want to be the new Primary Admin. If their email address is linked to multiple SurveyMonkey accounts, you will need to contact support or choose different email address for the Primary Admin account. Delete their account from the team . Change the email address on your account to the email address of the new person. If the original Primary Admin still needs to be in the team, the new Primary Admin can invite them to fill the open seat at no additional cost. If you change the email address on your account to someone else, you'll lose access to the account and all surveys and data within it. You won't be a part of the team anymore unless the new Primary Admin invites you to join the team. If you can’t log into the Primary Admin account, contact support. The Primary Admin can edit their account details (name, email address, etc.) to the new person's. However, steps to complete this process depend on whether the new person is already on the team: Change to someone who isn't on the team yet To change the Primary Admin: Log into your Primary Admin account in SurveyMonkey. Change the email address on your account to the email address of the person you want to be the new Primary Admin. Change to someone who is on the team Changing the Primary Admin to someone else that's already part of your team is a multi-step process, so we'll start with an example. EXAMPLE In this example, Cindy and Deanna are already part of the same team. Cindy is the Primary Admin, and Deanna is a Full User. Cindy wants to make Deanna the new Primary Admin instead. Here's what needs to happen: 1. Deanna transfers all of her surveys to Cindy's Primary Admin account. 2. Cindy deletes Deanna's Full User account from the team. 3. Cindy changes the email address on her own account to Deanna's email address. 4. Deanna is now the Primary Admin and Cindy is no longer in the team. If you're the current Primary Admin, follow these steps to switch the Primary Admin to someone else that's already on your team: Before you do anything, ask the other person to log in to their account and transfer their surveys to the current Primary Admin account. Log in to the Primary Admin account in SurveyMonkey. Select My Team from the main navigation. Select Manage Users . Find the person who you want to be the new Primary Admin. If their email address is linked to multiple SurveyMonkey accounts, you will need to contact support or choose different email address for the Primary Admin account. Delete their account from the team . Change the email address on your account to the email address of the new person. If the original Primary Admin still needs to be in the team, the new Primary Admin can invite them to fill the open seat at no additional cost. If you change the email address on your account to someone else, you'll lose access to the account and all surveys and data within it. You won't be a part of the team anymore unless the new Primary Admin invites you to join the team. title: Custom Sender Name and Email Domain
body: Custom Sender Name and Email Domain How It Works Setting up a Custom Sender Name and Email Domain Editing the Custom Sender Name and Email Domain What Survey-Takers See Common Questions Custom Sender Name and Email Domain Custom Sender Name and Email Domain How It Works Setting up a Custom Sender Name and Email Domain Editing the Custom Sender Name and Email Domain What Survey-Takers See Common Questions ENTERPRISE FEATURE: If you're interested, contact sales . If you already have an Enterprise account, contact your Customer Success Manager (CSM). How it Works A Custom Sender Name and Email Domain lets you specify the display name and email address when you send surveys with the Email Invitation . It's what survey-takers see in the From field of the email asking them to take your survey. It replaces the SurveyMonkey sender name and email . Using a Custom Sender Name and Email Domain makes it more likely for your emails to be delivered and for survey-takers to open the survey and respond when they recognize your familiar and trusted brand. Team members can then choose to update the display name and local name when selecting their email's collector options. Replies to Email Invitations Your Primary Admin can also choose a reply-to email address for any bounced emails or replies to email invitations sent using the Custom Sender Name and Email Domain. The reply-to email can either be the survey sender's account email address or a listserv email. To know what to expect if you use a Custom Sender Name and Email Domain, reach out to your Primary Admin. Setting up a Custom Sender Name and Email Domain Your team's Primary Admin should reach out to their CSM to set up a Custom Sender Name and Email Domain. Here's a high-level breakdown of what to expect during setup. Send us your chosen Custom Sender Name and Email Domain We need these details: Display name Local name Custom email domain. We recommend using a subdomain of your company’s domain. (Optional) Reply-to email address Update your DNS Your CSM will send you DKIM/CNAME and MX/SPF records that your IT department needs to add to your DNS. Let us know once this is complete so your CSM can confirm everything looks good from our side. Otherwise, they can help you troubleshoot. Start sending branded Email Invitations The Primary Admin should let team members with Custom Sender Name and Email Domain turned on know what to expect, including where replies to emails will go. Once set up, surveys sent via Email Invitation will use the team’s Custom Sender Name and Email Domain. Any emails sent or scheduled before the Custom Sender Name and Email was set up will send from the SurveyMonkey sender email address. Editing the Custom Sender Name and Email Domain When Custom Sender Name and Email Domain is turned on, team members can choose to personalize it when choosing collector options for an email invitation. To update the Custom Sender Name and Email Domain: Compose your invitation message and click Next . Click Custom Sender Name and Email . Click Change . Edit the display Name . Edit the local name section of the Email Address . The domain is set by your Primary Admin and can't be changed. Click Save . What Survey-Takers See From Field When people see an email invitation in their inbox, the From field will look like this: [ Name ] < Email Address @example.domain.com > To Field Each person gets a unique email invitation and can only see their own email address in the To field. Common Questions Can we set up more than one Custom Sender Name and Email Domain? Nope—your team can only have one Custom Sender Name and Email Domain. Nope—your team can only have one Custom Sender Name and Email Domain. Is this feature available if my data is stored in the European Union (EU) or Canada? Yes—Custom Sender Name and Email Domain is available no matter where your data is stored . Yes—Custom Sender Name and Email Domain is available no matter where your data is stored . Why do you recommend using a subdomain? While you can choose to use a top level domain, it isn’t industry best practice. We recommend choosing a subdomain to get better email deliverability and reduce the risk of your emails ending up in a spam folder. While you can choose to use a top level domain, it isn’t industry best practice. We recommend choosing a subdomain to get better email deliverability and reduce the risk of your emails ending up in a spam folder.
