title: Custom Roles
body: Custom Roles Roles Permissions Managing Roles and Permissions Assigning roles Filtering by role Custom Roles Custom Roles Roles Permissions Managing Roles and Permissions Assigning roles Filtering by role ENTERPRISE FEATURE : If you're interested, contact sales . If you already have an Enterprise account, contact your Customer Success Manager (CSM). The seat and role on a team controls what account permissions you have and how you work together with your team. Admins can create custom roles that will give team members a more customized experience and will cater to specific types of seats on your Team. Custom roles can be used to provide more Admin support, give Users access to certain features or to limit permissions on the team. Roles and Permissions Roles Here's a basic overview of the default roles that can be assigned to seats on your Team. The Primary Admin role can't be assigned to others on the team, if you need to change your Primary Admin, see Manage Seats on your Enterprise Team . Permissions The Primary Admin can pick and choose permissions from the areas below to create a custom role. Each area will have several permissions or administrative functions that can be selected, and the created custom role may have a variety of permissions spread across all areas. Admin Role When selecting Admin to start your custom role from, you can see both general and, team and account management permissions to assign. * Only available for Enterprise plans that have Divisions as an add-on User Role If you select User to start from, you can only see and choose from general permissions. Managing Roles and Permissions The Primary Admin will be able to create new roles and assign them to seats on the team. Once an Admin custom role is set up to allow management of roles and permissions, they will also be able to create and assign roles. Creating a New Role You can create as many custom roles as you need with a range of permissions. Go to My Team Click Settings Select Roles and permissions Click + Create role Choose a role to start from: Admin User Admin User Enter the Role name and Description (optional) Click Create Duplicating a role If there is a Custom Role that you have already customized and want to build from, you can duplicate it. All options configured in the permissions areas will carry over to the copied version. Once duplicated, you can then edit the name and permissions. From the Roles and permissions page, find the role you want to duplicate and click the 3 dots ( ... ) Choose Duplicate Edit the Role name , Description , and permissions . Click Save . If there is a Custom Role that you have already customized and want to build from, you can duplicate it. All options configured in the permissions areas will carry over to the copied version. Once duplicated, you can then edit the name and permissions. From the Roles and permissions page, find the role you want to duplicate and click the 3 dots ( ... ) Choose Duplicate Edit the Role name , Description , and permissions . Click Save . Editing a Custom Role Once a custom role has been created, you are able to change the role and its permissions. All changes will automatically be updated to those within that custom role. Find the role you want to change and click the 3 dots ( ... ) Choose Edit permissions . Review the Role name , Description , and permissions and make changes. Click Save . TIP! Default roles can only be viewed or duplicated . Deleting a Custom Role To better manage your custom roles, you can delete them when they aren't needed anymore. Deleting a custom role is permanent, it can't be restored. From the Roles and permissions page , find the role you want to remove and click the 3 dots ( ... ) Choose Delete. When you are sure you want to proceed, select Delete role . When you delete a custom role, any users with that custom role will be reassigned to the starter default role. Assigning Roles Now that custom roles are set up, you can start allocating seats on your teams to those roles. There are two ways in which you can assign a role, by selecting each seat individually or by CSV imports for multiples team members at a time. Individually Assigning a Custom Role Go to My Team . Click Manage Users Select the user Click on Change next to role Choose a new user role from the dropdown. Click Save . Assigning Multiple Custom Roles To adjust multiple roles and seats at once, follow the guidance for Importing Users by CSV . For the Role column, find the right role in the list below. Then, in your CSV file, use the CSV term listed: Filtering by role Admins can filter the team to easily see who on the team has default and custom roles. Go to My Team . Click Manage Users . Under Filters, select the Roles dropdown. Select Role Click Apply filters When a filter is applied, the default roles are first listed at the top, followed by custom roles. Related Articles Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice

title: Managing Brand Assets in the Library
body: Managing Brand Assets in the Library Video Overview Items in the Library Adding Items to the Library Managing Existing Items in the Library Setting Default Assets Using Items from the Library in Surveys Division Libraries and Survey Controls Managing Brand Assets in the Library Managing Brand Assets in the Library Video Overview Items in the Library Adding Items to the Library Managing Existing Items in the Library Setting Default Assets Using Items from the Library in Surveys Division Libraries and Survey Controls Library The library is where team members can find and use shared assets to create surveys. These shared assets include images, documents, templates, themes, and questions. Primary Admins and Admins can add or manage items in the team library and set default assets to be automatically added to new surveys that teammates create. To review access levels for other roles, see Team Roles or Enterprise Team Roles . If your Enterprise team has Divisions , you can also access division libraries that have additional survey controls . Video Overview Items in the Library The library is a collection of shared resources that some team members, depending on their roles, can use when they creating surveys. Images: Add approved visual assets to use in surveys—like your company's logo. Themes: Choose a survey theme that best reflects your organization. CSS theme ( Enterprise only): Add CSS for a custom survey theme that matches your visual assets, fonts, colors, and style preferences. Templates: Turn a custom survey into a standard template so your team can reapply the format in new surveys. Documents: Provide team members with guidelines and resources for creating surveys for your organization. Questions ( Enterprise only) : Add company questions to a Custom Question Bank so team members will add them to surveys in a consistent format. Presentation template ( Enterprise only) : Apply a custom template to your team’s PPT presentation exports for survey results. Adding Items to the Library Primary Admins and Admins can add new items to the library. To add a new item to the library: Select My Team from the main navigation and select Library . Select + New Item (Add item). Choose the item you want to add: Image and document: Browse for the image or document on your computer, or import it via URL. Theme: Select an existing custom theme from the list. If you don't have any custom themes, create a new one . CSS theme ( Enterprise only): Select Copy code and paste in your preferred CSS editing tool. Make customizations to the code and then see a preview by adding it to the box under Customize theme and selecting Generate preview . Once you’re happy with the theme, select Save . Template: Select an existing survey from the list. If you don't have any surveys, create a new one . Every aspect of the survey design will be included in the template—all questions, the theme, logic, options, and images. If the survey you choose uses a custom theme that's not yet in your library, that theme will also be added to the library. Question ( Enterprise only): Add a new question in the Design Survey section. Once the question is saved, hover over it and click Library to save it to the library. Presentation template ( Enterprise only): Upload a PPTX file containing the template you want applied to the presentation exports. To create a custom template for your PPT exports, download and make changes to this sample PPTX file . Open the file, navigate to View , and click Slide Master . Modify the first slide (parent slide) of the Slide Master to reflect your desired font size, font color, footer, header, background color or image, and other options. Any changes made to other slides will not be reflected in PPT exports. For additional help creating a custom template, you can review Microsoft's resource on creating a PowerPoint template . Image and document: Browse for the image or document on your computer, or import it via URL. Theme: Select an existing custom theme from the list. If you don't have any custom themes, create a new one . CSS theme ( Enterprise only): Select Copy code and paste in your preferred CSS editing tool. Make customizations to the code and then see a preview by adding it to the box under Customize theme and selecting Generate preview . Once you’re happy with the theme, select Save . Template: Select an existing survey from the list. If you don't have any surveys, create a new one . Every aspect of the survey design will be included in the template—all questions, the theme, logic, options, and images. If the survey you choose uses a custom theme that's not yet in your library, that theme will also be added to the library. Question ( Enterprise only): Add a new question in the Design Survey section. Once the question is saved, hover over it and click Library to save it to the library. Presentation template ( Enterprise only): Upload a PPTX file containing the template you want applied to the presentation exports. To create a custom template for your PPT exports, download and make changes to this sample PPTX file . Open the file, navigate to View , and click Slide Master . Modify the first slide (parent slide) of the Slide Master to reflect your desired font size, font color, footer, header, background color or image, and other options. Any changes made to other slides will not be reflected in PPT exports. For additional help creating a custom template, you can review Microsoft's resource on creating a PowerPoint template . Add a Title (Name) and Description that will help team members understand how and when to use the item in their own surveys. For some items, choose if you’d like to make the item a team default. Learn more about setting default assets . Upload Requirements Managing Existing Items in the Library In the Library, Primary Admins and Admins can manage existing items by clicking the three dots to the right of the item and choosing an action from the menu. The actions available depend on the item type. Setting Default Assets Primary Admins and Admins can set defaults to be used in all new surveys the team creates. TIP! First add items to the Library , to then use them as the team default setting. To manage default assets: Select My Team from the main navigation and select Library . Select Set defaults Choose the asset you want as default for the Team: Logo Theme Template* Text* End page* Presentation* Logo Theme Template* Text* End page* Presentation* (Optional) Set Restrictions for the team. (Optional) Click the toggle to turn Division Admins Permissions on and off. Select Apply . *Enterprise only. If you're interested in these Enterprise-only features, get in touch with our sales team . Existing customers, please contact your Customer Success Manager (CSM). When adding a new image, theme, CSS theme, or presentation template, select the default option to have it applied to all new surveys in your team. To set an existing asset as a default, click the three dots to the right of the item and select the default option. Creating Surveys with Default Items When a default is set for the team and someone creates a new survey, the default item is automatically applied. Existing surveys aren't changed. If your Enterprise team has access to Divisions, your Admins may have restricted access to remove or edit default items. Using Items from the Library in Surveys To use items from the library in surveys, select My Team from the main navigation and then Library to browse, preview, or download library items. For instructions on how to use each type of item in the library, see the relevant section below. Themes and CSS themes To apply a team theme to a survey: In the Design Survey section, click THEMES in the left sidebar. Select Teams . Select the theme you want to apply. To apply a team theme to a survey: In the Design Survey section, click THEMES in the left sidebar. Select Teams . Select the theme you want to apply. Images To add an image from the library to a survey: In the Design Survey section, add a Logo , Image , or Image A/B Test to your survey. Select Upload File . Under the From Library tab, select the image you want to use. If adding an image to question text or answer choice field, you'll need the library image's source image URL. From the Library, right-click the image to open the image source URL in a new tab and copy the URL from the address bar. Add the image to your survey using the formatting toolbar. To add an image from the library to a survey: In the Design Survey section, add a Logo , Image , or Image A/B Test to your survey. Select Upload File . Under the From Library tab, select the image you want to use. If adding an image to question text or answer choice field, you'll need the library image's source image URL. From the Library, right-click the image to open the image source URL in a new tab and copy the URL from the address bar. Add the image to your survey using the formatting toolbar. Templates To create a new survey from a team template: Select My Team from the main navigation and select Library . Select the three dots next to the template you want to use. Select Create survey . In the Design Survey section, you can make any edits or additions you'd like before sending out your survey. Any edits you make are unique to your survey and won't affect the template in the library. Similarly, if an Admin makes edits to the template in the library after you created your survey, it won't affect your existing survey. To create a new survey from a team template: Select My Team from the main navigation and select Library . Select the three dots next to the template you want to use. Select Create survey . In the Design Survey section, you can make any edits or additions you'd like before sending out your survey. Any edits you make are unique to your survey and won't affect the template in the library. Similarly, if an Admin makes edits to the template in the library after you created your survey, it won't affect your existing survey. Documents Documents can't be added to surveys, but you can download them to your computer. To download a document to your computer: Select My Team from the main navigation and select Library . Select the three dots next to the document you want to download. Select Download . You can't preview documents within SurveyMonkey. If you need to attach a document to a survey, host it on a third-party site and add a hyperlink to your survey. Documents can't be added to surveys, but you can download them to your computer. To download a document to your computer: Select My Team from the main navigation and select Library . Select the three dots next to the document you want to download. Select Download . You can't preview documents within SurveyMonkey. If you need to attach a document to a survey, host it on a third-party site and add a hyperlink to your survey. Questions Everyone in your Enterprise team can search and browse company questions in the Custom Question Bank and add them to their surveys. Everyone in your Enterprise team can search and browse company questions in the Custom Question Bank and add them to their surveys. Presentation Follow the steps to export your survey results as a PPT . Follow the steps to export your survey results as a PPT . Division Libraries and Survey Controls ENTERPRISE FEATURE: Only available on some Enterprise plans. If you're interested, contact sales . If you already have an Enterprise account, contact your Customer Success Manager. How It Works When your team has Divisions —sub-groups within your team that can be managed independently of one another—each division can have its own division library with its own set of assets. A division library allows each division to have unique assets that are different from the assets in the team library and other divisions. Division members can use the assets from the team library or their division library, which ensures all surveys meet either the team's or division’s unique branding needs. The assets that team members can see, manage, and use depend on their role , if they belong to a division, and whether those assets have additional default settings or restrictions. Only the Primary Admin and Admin have full access to view, add, and manage the team library and all division libraries. Division Libraries vs. Team Library The team library is for everyone on the team. A division library is only available to the people assigned to that division. If someone is not assigned to a division, they only have access to the team library. If an asset is Set as default for a Division, that setting overrides the team default. The team library is for everyone on the team. A division library is only available to the people assigned to that division. If someone is not assigned to a division, they only have access to the team library. If an asset is Set as default for a Division, that setting overrides the team default. Navigating the Library On the Library page, there's a Library dropdown to navigate between the team and division libraries. The Filter button lets anyone narrow down their library by item type. Primary Admins, Admins, and Division Admins can also Filter to display items from specific libraries. On the Library page, there's a Library dropdown to navigate between the team and division libraries. The Filter button lets anyone narrow down their library by item type. Primary Admins, Admins, and Division Admins can also Filter to display items from specific libraries. Setting Default Division Assets From the Library page, Primary Admins and Admins can click Set team defaults to set a default logo, theme, template, or intro text for all new surveys the team creates. Primary Admins, Admins, and Division Admins can Set division defaults . If an asset is Set as default for a Division, that setting overrides the team default. After adding a default team or division asset, Primary Admins and Admins can set further restrictions. Assets can have: No restrictions—team members can remove or replace the default asset Restrictions to logos or themes in the library—team members can choose to replace the default asset with another asset in their library Restriction to only the default asset—team members can only create surveys with the default asset There's also a toggle to Allow Division Admins to override the asset settings for their division . If the Division Admin is given permission, they can add and manage assets for their division libraries. If they aren’t allowed, they can only view their division libraries. When division defaults differ from the Team default, Primary Admins, Admins, or Division Admins can click Reset to Team Defaults to revert the asset and its restrictions back. TIP! You can select the size and position of a default logo and choose to restrict whether users can edit your selections. From the Library page, Primary Admins and Admins can click Set team defaults to set a default logo, theme, template, or intro text for all new surveys the team creates. Primary Admins, Admins, and Division Admins can Set division defaults . If an asset is Set as default for a Division, that setting overrides the team default. After adding a default team or division asset, Primary Admins and Admins can set further restrictions. Assets can have: No restrictions—team members can remove or replace the default asset Restrictions to logos or themes in the library—team members can choose to replace the default asset with another asset in their library Restriction to only the default asset—team members can only create surveys with the default asset There's also a toggle to Allow Division Admins to override the asset settings for their division . If the Division Admin is given permission, they can add and manage assets for their division libraries. If they aren’t allowed, they can only view their division libraries. When division defaults differ from the Team default, Primary Admins, Admins, or Division Admins can click Reset to Team Defaults to revert the asset and its restrictions back. TIP! You can select the size and position of a default logo and choose to restrict whether users can edit your selections. Creating Surveys The assets that team members can use for creating new surveys depend on their role, if they belong to a division, and whether those assets have default settings or restrictions on them. When creating surveys, Division Admins and Users can only see the assets they have permission to view and use. Primary Admins and Admins don’t have any restrictions as they create surveys so they can add new assets to libraries as they need. If an asset is set as a default, it's automatically added when a new survey is created. Depending on the restrictions set, the team member may or may not have the ability to remove or update the asset. The assets that team members can use for creating new surveys depend on their role, if they belong to a division, and whether those assets have default settings or restrictions on them. When creating surveys, Division Admins and Users can only see the assets they have permission to view and use. Primary Admins and Admins don’t have any restrictions as they create surveys so they can add new assets to libraries as they need. If an asset is set as a default, it's automatically added when a new survey is created. Depending on the restrictions set, the team member may or may not have the ability to remove or update the asset. title: Get Set Up to Send Text Messages
body: Get Set Up to Send Text Messages Get Set Up to Send Text Messages Get Set Up to Send Text Messages Enterprise feature : The Text Message collector is an Enterprise add-on—contact your Customer Success Manager to add it to your team. If you're interested in an Enterprise plan, contact sales . Does your organization want to send surveys via the Text Message collector ? If you’re interested, start the process to set your organization up with their unique, pre-verified phone number to distribute text message surveys. You’ll need a phone number for each region you’re planning to send text messages to. Some benefits of having your own unique phone line are: Increased security ensuring that only the customer’s organization can send SMS surveys using the unique line Improved deliverability as an individual toll free number is subjected to less scrutiny from cellular carriers Higher response rates as respondents will be more likely to know who they’re receiving the survey from, as it’s your organization's unique number. It isn’t permitted to use the Text message collector for political, financial, or gambling-related use cases. For additional info, please see Twilio’s Forbidden message categories and unsupported use cases . To set up your unique phone number to send text message surveys: Contact your Customer success manager (CSM) and let them know you’re interested. If you’re not an Enterprise customer yet, contact sales . They’ll respond with a survey where you can supply information about your text messaging use case, including proof of your opt-in process. SurveyMonkey works with our SMS vendor, Twilio, to authorize your usage. This can take up to 2-3 weeks. SurveyMonkey provides you with a dedicated phone number for your region to start sending text message surveys. Opt-in Process In our setup form, we ask for details on your text message opt-in process. In order to gain approval from our SMS provider, we’ll need to verify where and how you get buy-in from your respondents to receive messages from your organization. This is required in order to send text messages via SurveyMonkey. Check out our SMS provider’s tips on appropriate Opt-in methods . title: Single Sign-On (SSO)
body: Single Sign-On (SSO) How SSO Works Setting Up SSO Logging In and Managing Login Credentials Troubleshooting Login Errors Enabling Respondent Authentication Single Sign-On (SSO) Single Sign-On (SSO) How SSO Works Setting Up SSO Logging In and Managing Login Credentials Troubleshooting Login Errors Enabling Respondent Authentication How SSO Works ENTERPRISE FEATURE: Single Sign On (SSO) Single Sign-On (SSO) lets everyone on your Enterprise team log in to SurveyMonkey using your organization’s corporate login credentials. SSO removes the need to maintain a separate SurveyMonkey username and password. Your organization can control who can access your SurveyMonkey team and create authentication policies for increased security. SurveyMonkey’s SSO solution follows the S​AML 2.0 specification and is Service Provider (SP) initiated. SSO glossary Term Description Service Provider (SP) A vendor that provides services to your organization. In relation to SSO, the SP is SurveyMonkey. Identity Provider (IdP) A company that provides user authentication services. IdPs manage whether an employee can access a SP, like SurveyMonkey or other applications. Okta and ADFS are common IdPs. Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) The language the IdP and SP communicate in. SurveyMonkey follows the SAML 2.0 technical specifications to exchange info with your organization's IdP. Attributes Pieces of info about an employee that an IdP uses for authentication. SurveyMonkey requires 4 attributes—FirstName, LastName, Email, and NameID. Claim Types Pieces of info about a user on a team that SurveyMonkey accepts. Attributes from your IdP need to be mapped to SurveyMonkey claims so SSO works correctly. Assertion An assertion is made up of one or more statements. SurveyMonkey requires certain attribute statements in our assertions. Setting Up SSO After your organization upgrades to an Enterprise plan, you'll be given the option to set up SSO for your team's account—only 1 IdP per Enterprise team. We'll then contact your team’s Primary Admin to start the setup process and connect with your IT department. We recommend waiting to invite people to your Enterprise team until SurveyMonkey confirms that SSO is set up properly. TIP! If you already have an Enterprise plan, reach out to your CSM to get set up with SSO. Here's a high-level breakdown of what to expect when setting up SSO: Input and map metadata Your unique SurveyMonkey metadata (Entity ID and ACS URL) is provided to you by your Technical Solutions Manager. Mapping guide Example IdP attributes Claim types SurveyMonkey accepts Mapping Unique, non-changing identifier (e.g. UPN or employee ID) NameID Required Email, emailaddress Email Required FirstName, first.name, givenname, Given-Name FirstName Required Surname LastName Required Department, DepartmentID, department name Department Optional* CostCenter, cost center number CostCenterCode Optional* * Optional attributes can help you track and monitor team activity in the User Report . * Optional attributes can help you track and monitor team activity in the User Report . Send us your metadata Send SurveyMonkey your organization's metadata URL. If you’re unable to send the metadata URL, provide the XML file. We'll set up SSO in our system and send you steps to validate that it's working correctly. We need the following from you: Entity ID HTTP Redirect Endpoint X.509 Certificate (specifically the Signing KeyType) SurveyMonkey will set up SSO in our system and send you steps to validate that it's working correctly. Invite employees to access SurveyMonkey If you want to restrict some employees from accessing your team, you can use a security group to permit or deny claims on the IdP side. Primary Admins and Admins can always see how many Empty seats are available on their team from the Team Summary . When you’re ready, click Add Users from the top navigation bar and then Copy link to share with people you want to invite. Users will be able to create or convert an account to log in with SSO. Check if a user has SSO enabled After your organization sets up SSO, Admins can see whether or not a user has SSO enabled on their Survey Monkey account. Go to My Team and select Manage Users . Search for the person by entering their email. The SSO column will show a key icon next to the user’s email if SSO is enabled. If they don’t have SSO enabled, it could be for a few different reasons. Connect with your Customer Success Manager to learn more. Logging In and Managing Login Credentials Create or convert an account The first time you log in to an SSO enabled SurveyMonkey account, choose to Create a new account or Convert an account . Create a new account : Start fresh with no surveys. Convert an account : Make sure to review what to expect . You'll need to log in with your current SurveyMonkey username and password to authorize that you want to convert and move your surveys to your team. TIP! You can find your username in the Login Details section of My Account . After that initial login, you're all set up to log in to SurveyMonkey or the SurveyMonkey app with SSO. Logging in to SurveyMonkey To log in using SSO: From SurveyMonkey , click Log in with SSO . Enter your work email and click Continue . Enter your corporate login credentials. If you don't first authorize converting your existing account , you'll see an error message when you try to sign in. Logging in to the mobile app Logging in with the iPhone app To log in to the SurveyMonkey iPhone app with SSO: On the sign-in page, tap Log in with SSO Enter the email address you use for SSO. Tap Continue . We'll confirm your email address is associated with an SSO enabled account. Log in with your corporate login credentials. To log in to the SurveyMonkey iPhone app with SSO: On the sign-in page, tap Log in with SSO Enter the email address you use for SSO. Tap Continue . We'll confirm your email address is associated with an SSO enabled account. Log in with your corporate login credentials. Logging in with the Android app To log in to the SurveyMonkey Android app with SSO:On the sign-in page, tap Trouble signing in? below the sign-in button. Tap Log in with SSO . Enter the email address you use for SSO. Tap Continue . We'll confirm your email address is associated with an SSO enabled account. Log in with your corporate login credentials. To log in to the SurveyMonkey Android app with SSO:On the sign-in page, tap Trouble signing in? below the sign-in button. Tap Log in with SSO . Enter the email address you use for SSO. Tap Continue . We'll confirm your email address is associated with an SSO enabled account. Log in with your corporate login credentials. Managing login credentials After SSO is set up , everyone who has an SSO account will have their login credentials are managed by your organization's network. Please contact your IT department or network admin to: Reset your password Change your username Change your email address Troubleshooting Login Errors Below are common errors with potential solutions to help resolve them. We’re unable to authenticate your info at this time. It's likely that there's been a server clock drift. Your IdP’s clock isn't aligned with the SAML assertion’s active window. Reach out to your CSM to investigate and get you logged in. It's likely that there's been a server clock drift. Your IdP’s clock isn't aligned with the SAML assertion’s active window. Reach out to your CSM to investigate and get you logged in. The account you’re trying to log in to may be pending deletion. If an account is pending deletion, please contact us for assistance permanently deleting the account. If an account is pending deletion, please contact us for assistance permanently deleting the account. The account you’re trying to log in to was reassigned by your Admin. When an account is reassigned, an email is sent to the new account owner which needs to be accepted before the account can be accessed. Check your inbox for an invitation. If you still need assistance, contact your Primary Admin or CSM for assistance. When an account is reassigned, an email is sent to the new account owner which needs to be accepted before the account can be accessed. Check your inbox for an invitation. If you still need assistance, contact your Primary Admin or CSM for assistance. We’re not able to find your account ID in our system. Likely there's been a change to an employee’s unique identifier (such as an email address change). Contact your Primary Admin or reach out your CSM for assistance. Likely there's been a change to an employee’s unique identifier (such as an email address change). Contact your Primary Admin or reach out your CSM for assistance. We’re not able to identify your group information. SurveyMonkey may have incorrect metadata for your IdP. Contact your Primary Admin or reach out your CSM for assistance. SurveyMonkey may have incorrect metadata for your IdP. Contact your Primary Admin or reach out your CSM for assistance. We’re not able to identify your group information due to an incorrect certificate. SurveyMonkey may have an incorrect certificate configured. Contact your CSM for assistance. SurveyMonkey may have an incorrect certificate configured. Contact your CSM for assistance. TIP! If you need to contact us for support, please copy the error page’s URL and include it in your email. Enabling Respondent Authentication SSO-enabled accounts can use Respondent Authentication to send more secure internal surveys and track the people taking your survey with SSO metadata. Respondents don't need a SurveyMonkey account to take the survey. TIP! Primary Admins can set a default Respondent Authentication setting for their entire Enterprise team. Require survey takers to log in with SSO Respondent Authentication on the Web Link collector only requires survey takers to log in through SSO to access your survey, without needing a SurveyMonkey account. Responses are tracked with their SSO metadata—first name, last name, and email address. It isn't possible to make responses anonymous when Respondent Authentication is turned on. Respondent Authentication is for surveys taken on personal devices—don't enable Respondent Authentication on a public or shared device. To turn on Respondent Authentication: Log in to SurveyMonkey using your organization’s corporate login credentials ( SSO ). Go to the Collect Response section of your survey. Add a Web Link collector. Or, click the name of an existing Web Link. Click Respondent Authentication . Select On, your respondents need to authenticate to take your survey . title: User Report
body: User Report User Table Viewing Surveys in an Account User Report User Report User Table Viewing Surveys in an Account If you're a Primary Admin or Admin of an Enterprise team , the User Report gives you more visibility into your team's activity. View account details like the number of surveys each user has in their account, and the date they were last active. Preview the surveys in each account to better understand how people on your team are using SurveyMonkey. To get to the User Report: Select My Team from the main navigation. Select User Report. User Table The User Table lists all the users on your team, and the following usage metrics about each account: *Only available on Enterprise teams with SSO enabled. Filtering the Report You can use filters to narrow down your user list based on some of the data in the table. The following filters are available: Filter Description Role Filter by the user's role on the team. Seat type Filter by Power or Casual. Division Filter by the user's division (Only available on teams with Divisions enabled). Department Filter by the user's department (only available on teams with SSO enabled). Shared surveys Enter a numerical range to filter by number of surveys shared with or by this user. Responses received Enter a numerical range to filter by how many responses the user has received in their account. Active surveys Enter a numerical range to filter by how many modified surveys the user has in their account. This includes shared surveys. Select the funnel icon for filtering. You can use filters to narrow down your user list based on some of the data in the table. The following filters are available: Select the funnel icon for filtering. Searching the Report You can use the search bar in the upper-right corner of the table to quickly find a specific person. The search bar will search the following fields: Email Username First name Last name You can use the search bar in the upper-right corner of the table to quickly find a specific person. The search bar will search the following fields: Email Username First name Last name Exporting Account Reports TIP! You can export the table with a date range and filter applied to the report. To export the report as a CSV, click Export in the upper-right corner of the table. At this time there's no way to export an individual user's survey list. Timestamp Format Timestamps are shown in ISO 8601 format, which looks like this: 2016-02-17T21:37:40.643Z The first portion is the date in YYYY-MM-DD format. The second portion (introduced by the letter T) is the time in 24-hour notation (HH:mm:ss.sss). The letter Z at the end of the timestamp stands for the "Zulu" time zone, which is the same as UTC. TIP! You can export the table with a date range and filter applied to the report. To export the report as a CSV, click Export in the upper-right corner of the table. At this time there's no way to export an individual user's survey list. Timestamp Format Timestamps are shown in ISO 8601 format, which looks like this: 2016-02-17T21:37:40.643Z The first portion is the date in YYYY-MM-DD format. The second portion (introduced by the letter T) is the time in 24-hour notation (HH:mm:ss.sss). The letter Z at the end of the timestamp stands for the "Zulu" time zone, which is the same as UTC. Setting up Display Columns You can choose which columns to display by using Table setup in the upper-right corner of the table. Email is the first column in the User Report, with a dropdown list of all other columns to select and view, or unselect to hide. You can choose which columns to display by using Table setup in the upper-right corner of the table. Email is the first column in the User Report, with a dropdown list of all other columns to select and view, or unselect to hide. Setting the Date Range By default, the report shows your current billing cycle. You can narrow down the time period by using the date dropdown menu above the table. Date filters affect the Active surveys, Response and Shared surveys columns only. The following date ranges are available: Current billing cycle (default) Today This week This month This quarter This year Last 365 days TIP! All date ranges end with the current date . If you can’t select a date, no data is available for that time period. You can’t select dates before June 2023, as this was when the User Report feature was first introduced. By default, the report shows your current billing cycle. You can narrow down the time period by using the date dropdown menu above the table. Date filters affect the Active surveys, Response and Shared surveys columns only. The following date ranges are available: Current billing cycle (default) Today This week This month This quarter This year Last 365 days TIP! All date ranges end with the current date . If you can’t select a date, no data is available for that time period. You can’t select dates before June 2023, as this was when the User Report feature was first introduced. Viewing Surveys in an Account In the User Report, you can see the surveys created by people on your team and help manage those surveys. You can easily transfer a survey from one account to another , share surveys on behalf of others, or delete surveys . For more information on survey management, see Manage your Team's Surveys. Deleting a survey is a permanent action that can't be reversed. To keep a survey and its responses available for the Team, make sure to transfer the survey to another before deleting. To view a list of surveys in a specific account: Go to the User Report page. Click on the Email address of the user whose surveys you'd like to see. When you view someone’s surveys, you can see how many surveys the user has created, shared, and has open collectors for. TIP! To preview a survey, click any survey title to preview the entire survey—responses won't be recorded. Searching for a survey When you're viewing an individual user's survey list, you can use the search bar in the upper-right corner of the table to quickly find a specific survey in their account. The search bar will search the Survey Title only—not the contents of the survey. When you're viewing an individual user's survey list, you can use the search bar in the upper-right corner of the table to quickly find a specific survey in their account. The search bar will search the Survey Title only—not the contents of the survey. title: Workgroups
body: Workgroups Create a Workgroup Workgroup Surveys & Roles Manage Workgroups Find a Workgroup Workgroups Workgroups Create a Workgroup Workgroup Surveys & Roles Manage Workgroups Find a Workgroup ENTERPRISE FEATURE: If you're interested, contact sales . If you already have an Enterprise account, contact your Customer Success Manager. Workgroups help organize team members with a shared purpose to work together on survey projects. Primary Admins and Admins can create workgroups to quickly and easily share surveys with a group of people on your team. Plus, you can manage members, assign roles, and change owner status so each team member has the right level of access to surveys. You can contact your CSM to let Power Users create, own, and manage workgroups, too. What's the difference between Workgroups and Divisions? Workgroups help organize team members collaborating on survey projects while Divisions help with administrative management of large teams. Create a Workgroup To create a new workgroup: Select My Team from the main navigation. Select Workgroups . Click New Workgroup . Type the Workgroup name and Purpose. Click Create Workgroup . From the Members tab, search or click to add members to the workgroup. You can search for members of your team by name, email, or role. From the Surveys tab, add the surveys you want to share with all members of the workgroup. From the Settings tab, select whether the workgroup is Public or Private . Public workgroups are visible to your entire team, while private workgroups are only visible to its members. When a team member is added to a workgroup, they're assigned the default role. Manage Members to update the default role and individual member roles. Workgroup Surveys and Roles Surveys Add surveys to a workgroup to share it with all team members. You can add surveys when creating a workgroup or share surveys directly from Home . Workgroup Roles A user’s role in a workgroup determines if they can view, access, and edit the workgroup's shared surveys. These roles only apply within the workgroup and a user’s Enterprise seat determines what role they can have. Full permissions to the Analyze section. Limited permissions to view the survey design and collector list. People you're working with will see any rules, custom charts, shared data pages, exports, or text analysis features created by the survey owner or any others with Full Access or Analyzer permissions. You need to refresh the Analyze Results page to see others' changes. Manage Workgroups Managing Members The Members tab displays every workgroup member's name, email, and role. This is also where you can add members to a workgroup, re-assign roles, remove members, or review team requests to join a public workgroup. TIP! Check out the Notification Center to see Workgroup messages from the last 30 days. Re-assign a member's role To re-assign an individual member's role: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Workgroups . From the Members tab, click on . to the right of the member's name you want to re-assign. Click Assign Role . Select the role from the dropdown. Click Assign . To re-assign an individual member's role: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Workgroups . From the Members tab, click on . to the right of the member's name you want to re-assign. Click Assign Role . Select the role from the dropdown. Click Assign . Remove a member To remove a member from a workgroup: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Workgroups . From the Members tab, click on . to the right of the member's name you want to remove. Click Remove member . Click Remove . The removed member loses access to the workgroup's shared surveys unless they are the survey owner or the survey is shared with them independently of the workgroup. To remove a member from a workgroup: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Workgroups . From the Members tab, click on . to the right of the member's name you want to remove. Click Remove member . Click Remove . The removed member loses access to the workgroup's shared surveys unless they are the survey owner or the survey is shared with them independently of the workgroup. Re-assign the default role To re-assign the default role for a workgroup: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Workgroups . From the Settings tab, click the Default Role dropdown and select the new default role. Click Save Changes . To re-assign the default role for a workgroup: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Workgroups . From the Settings tab, click the Default Role dropdown and select the new default role. Click Save Changes . Review a request to join a workgroup To review a member request to join a workgroup: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Workgroups . From the Members tab, Accept or Deny a member request to join the workgroup. To review a member request to join a workgroup: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Workgroups . From the Members tab, Accept or Deny a member request to join the workgroup. Update Owner A workgroup owner, Primary Admin, or Admin can make any member an owner of the workgroup or remove owner status from an existing owner. Owners can’t remove their own owner status. To update owner status: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Workgroups . From the Members tab, click on the three dots ( ... ) to the right of the member you want to update. Select Make this person an owner or Remove owner status . Delete a Workgroup If a workgroup is no longer needed, delete the workgroup. When a workgroup is deleted, the shared surveys will no longer be available to members, unless they are owned by the member or the survey is shared independently of the workgroup. To delete a workgroup: Select My Team from the top navigation. Select Workgroups . Find the workgroup you want to delete and click the three dots ( ... ) to the right of that workgroup. Select Delete . Find a Workgroup Anyone on the team can see the workgroups they're a part of in the My Workgroups tab or view the entire team's public workgroups in the All Workgroups tab—just click My Team on the main navigation and select Workgroups . If you'd like to join a public workgroup, you can Ask to join . This sends an email notification to the workgroup owner to review. title: Custom Question Bank
body: Custom Question Bank Adding Questions to the Library Managing Questions in the Library Adding Company Questions to Surveys Custom Question Bank Custom Question Bank Adding Questions to the Library Managing Questions in the Library Adding Company Questions to Surveys ENTERPRISE FEATURE: If you're interested, contact sales . If you already have an Enterprise account, contact your Customer Success Manager. Custom Question Bank lets Primary Admins and Admins add custom questions to their team’s Library . Full Access seats on the team can add the questions to their survey from the Question Bank . Adding Questions to the Library Primary Admins and Admins can add survey questions to the Library. To add a company question to the Library: Go to the Design Survey tab, create a question , and click Save . Hover over the question and click Library . (Optional) Add tags. To create a new tag, click the Add tags field, type in the tag you'd like, and click Create tag . Or, choose an existing tag from the list. Click Add to Library . Tags Tags categorize your company questions so they're easier to find. People looking for questions on your team’s Question Bank can filter by tag. Tags are case sensitive. Managing Questions in the Library Primary Admins and Admins can update and delete company questions. Update Company Questions When you update a company question in your team’s Library, the new version of the question becomes available to your team to add to new surveys moving forward. It doesn't update any existing surveys using older versions of the question. To update a company question: In the Design Survey tab, add the company question you want to update. Edit the question and options and click Save . Hover over the question and click Library . Review the question and update the tags. Click Update Question to save the new version to the Library. If the question you're trying to update already matches the version in your Library, you'll see Matches Library . When you update a company question in your team’s Library, the new version of the question becomes available to your team to add to new surveys moving forward. It doesn't update any existing surveys using older versions of the question. To update a company question: In the Design Survey tab, add the company question you want to update. Edit the question and options and click Save . Hover over the question and click Library . Review the question and update the tags. Click Update Question to save the new version to the Library. If the question you're trying to update already matches the version in your Library, you'll see Matches Library . Deleting Company Questions To delete a question from the Library: Select My Team from the main navigation and select Library . Find the question you want to delete, click the three dots ( ... ), and select Delete . Click Delete . When you delete a question from the Library, it doesn’t delete the question from existing surveys using the question. To delete a question from the Library: Select My Team from the main navigation and select Library . Find the question you want to delete, click the three dots ( ... ), and select Delete . Click Delete . When you delete a question from the Library, it doesn’t delete the question from existing surveys using the question. Adding Company Questions to Surveys When you add questions to the Library, they become available in the Question Bank. Full Access seats on your team can search and browse company questions in the Question Bank and add them to their surveys. To add a company question to your survey: In the Design Survey tab, click QUESTION BANK in the left sidebar. Click [YourTeamName] Question Bank to view all your company questions. (Optional) Filter by tag. Click Filter . Select one or more tags. Click Apply . Click Filter . Select one or more tags. Click Apply . Select the questions to add to your survey design—they'll display in the preview on the right. Click + Add Question . title: Consolidating Accounts for Enterprise
body: Consolidating Accounts for Enterprise Before You Start My Team Inviting People To Join Your Enterprise account Joining Enterprise Enterprise Consolidation FAQs Consolidating Accounts for Enterprise Consolidating Accounts for Enterprise Before You Start My Team Inviting People To Join Your Enterprise account Joining Enterprise Enterprise Consolidation FAQs Enterprise feature: Account consolidation is available for US Data Center accounts only. Your Enterprise plan allows you to collaborate, organize users by department or project, track account usage, and give the team access to custom branding features. Learn more about Enterprise settings . To get started, first you'll need to consolidate accounts under your Enterprise team. Consolidating accounts glossary Term Description Consolidation The process of combining multiple SurveyMonkey accounts under a larger group account. Primary Admin The main administrator in a SurveyMonkey account who controls account settings and user permissions. Individual Account A SurveyMonkey account that allows a single user to manage surveys, collect responses, and analyze data independently. Billing is managed by the owner of the account. Team Account A SurveyMonkey account that enables multiple users to collaborate on surveys with varying roles and permissions. Everyone in a team has their own account, but team billing is managed by a Primary Admin. Data Center Where your data is stored . We have data centers in the United States, Canada, and Ireland. Enterprise teams may have the option to store survey and response data in a regional data center. Before You Start The Primary Admin will need to invite users into the Enterprise account, this includes both new users and users with an existing SurveyMonkey account. We recommend informing your team of what to expect during the consolidation process. Here is an email template to help explain the steps: Template letter Email Subject: Our SurveyMonkey Enterprise account is now live! Hello, Our SurveyMonkey Enterprise account is now available for your use. You should have received an email with the subject line “Invitation to join SurveyMonkey.” If you have not received an invitation, please let me know and I will be sure to add you. Once you accept the invitation, SurveyMonkey will open in your browser and prompt you to create or convert a SurveyMonkey account. If you are a new SurveyMonkey user , select the link in the top right corner, “ Create an account .” Follow the steps to create your account, including setting up a username, password, and your preferences. If you have an existing SurveyMonkey Account , please choose the option to “ Convert Existing Account .” Enter your username and password to sign into your account. Your account is now rolled up into our SurveyMonkey Enterprise account. Once you’ve successfully created or converted your account, you’ll be directed to your Home page. If you have any questions about setting up your account, please don’t hesitate to reach out. Thanks, [Your Name] Email Subject: Our SurveyMonkey Enterprise account is now live! Hello, Our SurveyMonkey Enterprise account is now available for your use. You should have received an email with the subject line “Invitation to join SurveyMonkey.” If you have not received an invitation, please let me know and I will be sure to add you. Once you accept the invitation, SurveyMonkey will open in your browser and prompt you to create or convert a SurveyMonkey account. If you are a new SurveyMonkey user , select the link in the top right corner, “ Create an account .” Follow the steps to create your account, including setting up a username, password, and your preferences. If you have an existing SurveyMonkey Account , please choose the option to “ Convert Existing Account .” Enter your username and password to sign into your account. Your account is now rolled up into our SurveyMonkey Enterprise account. Once you’ve successfully created or converted your account, you’ll be directed to your Home page. If you have any questions about setting up your account, please don’t hesitate to reach out. Thanks, [Your Name] My Team If you're a Primary Admin or Admin, you can invite people to join your team and manage existing seats from the My Team section of your account. My Team is the central place to find team information. Log in with the account information provided to you by your onboarding specialist. Select Home to view your surveys. Select on My Team . Inviting People To Join Your Enterprise account TIP! Instructions on how to invite users to your Enterprise account can also be found in your Onboarding E-Guide. Send an Email Invitation To invite people to your team via email: Go to My Team . Select Add Users . Choose Send an email invitation . Enter the email addresses of the people you want to invite. Enter multiple addresses separated by commas, or put each email address on its own line. Customize the email message. Select Send Invitations . Creating a Team Sign-Up Page You can activate a sign-up page and share the URL to allow people to join your team on their own. Anyone with the link can enter their email address to send themselves an invitation. To create a sign-up page: Go to My Team . Select Add Users . Choose Set up sign-up page . In the Maximum signups field , enter a limit for how many people can sign up. Select Save and Activate . Copy the link and share it however you'd like. TIP! View and manage different members in your team, including their roles and status in Manage Users . Joining Enterprise To join the Enterprise team, your invitees must accept the invitation. SurveyMonkey will open in their browser and prompt them to create or convert a SurveyMonkey account. TIP! No data is lost when joining the Enterprise team, and live surveys will not be interrupted. New Account Select on Create an account . Follow the steps to create your account, including setting up a username, password, and your preferences. Existing Individual plan Select on Convert Account . Enter your username and password to sign into your account. Your account is now rolled up into our SurveyMonkey Enterprise account. Existing Team plans The Enterprise Primary Admin will need to provide their Onboarding Specialist with the Team account details. The Onboarding Specialist will then need the approval from the Primary Admin of the Team account before moving their team into the Enterprise account. You will now be able to login to your Enterprise team account. Learn more about Enterprise features . Enterprise Consolidation FAQs Below are common questions with potential solutions to help resolve them. What happens to my surveys and data? No survey or response data will be lost in the consolidation process However, previously shared surveys will become unshared. You can log in to your account and re-share those surveys. TIP! Use share this survey with my entire team to allow your whole team to access your surveys. If you want to be more selective about who your surveys are shared with, then make sure to not select : share this survey with my entire team. Primary Admins can also edit the team-wide share settings . No survey or response data will be lost in the consolidation process However, previously shared surveys will become unshared. You can log in to your account and re-share those surveys. TIP! Use share this survey with my entire team to allow your whole team to access your surveys. If you want to be more selective about who your surveys are shared with, then make sure to not select : share this survey with my entire team. Primary Admins can also edit the team-wide share settings . Can I consolidate my account if I am moving to another data center? For example: I would like to move my individual account (in the US Data Center) to the EU Data Center. We cannot move data from one data center to another. However, we can create a new account for you within the data center of your choosing at which point you could export your data for safekeeping. Find out more about where your data is stored. We cannot move data from one data center to another. However, we can create a new account for you within the data center of your choosing at which point you could export your data for safekeeping. Find out more about where your data is stored. How long does it take for consolidation of accounts? Once the invitation to join the Enterprise team is sent and accepted, the process is instant. Once the invitation to join the Enterprise team is sent and accepted, the process is instant. Will I lose any data during a consolidation? You will not lose any survey or response data during consolidation. Assets uploaded to the library and administrative managements groups such as workgroups or divisions , are not transferred into the new consolidated account. You will not lose any survey or response data during consolidation. Assets uploaded to the library and administrative managements groups such as workgroups or divisions , are not transferred into the new consolidated account. What happens to live surveys during a consolidation? Your live surveys are uninterrupted during the consolidation process. Your live surveys are uninterrupted during the consolidation process. Still have questions? If you have any questions or need further assistance throughout the consolidation process, please reach out to your onboarding specialist or our support team . title: Manage Your Team’s Surveys
body: Manage Your Team’s Surveys Viewing a User’s Surveys Transferring Surveys from One Account to Another Sharing a User’s Surveys Deleting a User’s Surveys Manage Your Team’s Surveys Manage Your Team’s Surveys Viewing a User’s Surveys Transferring Surveys from One Account to Another Sharing a User’s Surveys Deleting a User’s Surveys ENTERPRISE TEAMS : This article is for Enterprise teams. If you're interested in an Enterprise plan, contact sales . If you’re a Primary Admin , you can view and manage surveys created by people on your team, including transferring surveys from one account to another, sharing surveys on behalf of others, and deleting outdated surveys. Viewing a User’s Surveys Take a look at the surveys created by each person on your team and decide if you need to take action. Select Team Surveys from the admin dashboard navigation. Find the survey you’d like to review by scrolling the list of surveys or by searching the survey’s title in the search bar To view the survey design, select the Preview Survey button. Transferring Surveys from One Account to Another If you need to transfer a survey from one account to another - for example, when an employee leaves and a teammate needs to take over their surveys - you can manage this in Team Surveys. Most surveys, except those that accept payments or use a Kiosk collector in offline mode , can be transferred. To transfer a survey: From Team Surveys , search for or select from the surveys list the survey you want to transfer. Select Transfer in the Actions column on the Team Surveys page or Click the Manage survey dropdown in a viewed survey and select Transfer survey . Enter the name, email, or address of the person you’d like to transfer to. (If your account has Power and Casual seats, the user must have a Power seat to become the new survey owner.) Select Transfer . The new survey owner will be notified and see the survey in their account. Sharing a User’s Surveys Sharing surveys on behalf of someone on your team will allow you to choose additional people who can view and comment on their survey. If you share surveys with a workgroup, users may also be able to edit depending on their workgroup role. To share a survey: From the Team Surveys menu, choose a survey to share. Select Share in the Actions column. In the modal that appears, type in the names or workgroups of those you’d like to share with. You can share with anyone on your plan, however, you may only add workgroups the survey owner is part of. Review the people and workgroups you’ve selected and click Share to confirm. People will be notified by email that you’ve shared with them. You can share up to 40 surveys at a time. Deleting a User’s Surveys In Team Surveys , locate the surveys you’d like to delete. You can’t undo the action, so make sure everyone is comfortable with you deleting the survey(s) you’ve selected. To delete a survey: Select one or multiple surveys to delete. Once you’ve selected the surveys to delete, click Delete in the Actions column. Review the number of surveys you’ve selected and choose Delete to confirm. title: Managing AI Feature Access
body: Managing AI Feature Access How AI Feature Access Works Managing AI Feature Access How Your Data is Processed Managing AI Feature Access Managing AI Feature Access How AI Feature Access Works Managing AI Feature Access How Your Data is Processed SurveyMonkey provides AI and machine learning features to help you create better surveys, gather higher quality data, and spot insights quicker. Team and Enterprise admins can control what features their teams have access to at any time. Here are the features that Teams and Enterprise admins can manage access to: AI features to create a survey, which includes: Build with AI Importing surveys with AI Build with AI Importing surveys with AI Response Quality Sentiment Analysis Analyze with AI Thematic Analysis Data security and privacy are built into the design of our AI and machine learning features. Team and Enterprise Primary Admins can manage their teams' access to AI and machine learning features as needed. You can learn more about how our features process your data to decide if these features are right for you. How AI Feature Access Works Your AI feature access depends on your plan type: For Basic and Individual accounts , access to AI and machine learning features will be on , simplifying the process to access our features. Your data is only processed by the feature if you choose to use it. If you don’t want to use these features, you can still use SurveyMonkey to create, send, and analyze your surveys as you always have without AI and machine learning. For Teams and Enterprise accounts , Primary Admins will manage access to individual AI and machine learning features for their teams. Access may be on or off by default, depending on your plan. Learn how to adjust these settings . Some AI features may only be available on certain plan types, depending on where your data is stored . Managing AI Feature Access Feature availability depends on your plan type and where your data is stored. You’ll only see settings for the features you have access to. Expand the dropdowns below to learn how to manage feature access for your account. Team plans - Primary Admins Primary admins can manage the AI features their team has access to. To manage AI feature access for your team: Select My Team , then select Team Summary . Find AI and machine learning (ML) feature access , then select Edit . Use the toggle and checkboxes to manage access to AI and machine learning features. Primary admins can manage the AI features their team has access to. To manage AI feature access for your team: Select My Team , then select Team Summary . Find AI and machine learning (ML) feature access , then select Edit . Use the toggle and checkboxes to manage access to AI and machine learning features. Enterprise plans - Primary Admins Primary admins can manage the AI features their team has access to. To manage AI feature access for your Enterprise team: Select My Team , then select Settings . Select AI and machine learning (ML) feature access . Use the toggle and checkboxes to manage access to AI and machine learning features. Primary admins can manage the AI features their team has access to. To manage AI feature access for your Enterprise team: Select My Team , then select Settings . Select AI and machine learning (ML) feature access . Use the toggle and checkboxes to manage access to AI and machine learning features. Teams and Enterprise plans - Non-Admins Reach out to your team’s Primary Admin to request access to a feature. Your Primary Admin controls access to AI features for your entire team. Reach out to your team’s Primary Admin to request access to a feature. Your Primary Admin controls access to AI features for your entire team. Basic and Individual plans Access to AI features is always on so you can use them with ease. Your data is only processed by the feature if you choose to use it. If you don't want to use these features, you can create, send, and analyze your surveys as you always have. Access to AI features is always on so you can use them with ease. Your data is only processed by the feature if you choose to use it. If you don't want to use these features, you can create, send, and analyze your surveys as you always have. Accessing New Features As we develop advanced AI features, we will add these capabilities to your available permissions. When new AI feature permissions become available, we’ll notify admins on Teams and Enterprise accounts before we make the feature available. Access to new features may be on or off by default, depending on your plan type and existing settings: For Basic and Individual accounts , any features you have access to will be ON by default so you can use them with ease. Your data is only processed by the feature if you choose to use it. For Teams and Enterprise accounts : If an admin previously allowed access to all AI features, access to new features will be ON by default. If an admin previously turned off access to one or more AI features, access to new features will be OFF by default. If an admin previously allowed access to all AI features, access to new features will be ON by default. If an admin previously turned off access to one or more AI features, access to new features will be OFF by default. Teams and Enterprise admins can manage access to these features during and after the notice period. How Your Data is Processed Transparency is one of our guiding AI principles. We’ve outlined below how our AI and machine learning features process your data when you use them. title: Your Login Details
body: Your Login Details Account Email Address Email Verification Issues Username Password Transferring the Account Your Login Details Your Login Details Account Email Address Email Verification Issues Username Password Transferring the Account Account Email Address Changing Your Email An account holder is identified by the account’s email address. Make sure your email address is always up to date so we can reach you with important info and so our support team is authorized to help you. When you change your account email address, the previous email address will get an email about the change. You'll soon need to use your email address to log in to your account instead of a username. Choose the option below that best applies to you. To change your account email address if you’re using the new way to log in : Log in and go to My Account . Find the Profile section. Select Change account email and password to open the Login Details page. Select Edit next to your email address. Update your email address and confirm your current password. Select Next . Check your email inbox to verify your email address. Once you verify your email your email address will update. From the confirmation page, choose Log in to log in with your new address. To change your account email address if you’re still using your username to log in: Log in and go to My Account . Go to the Login Details section. Click Edit next to the email address. Update your email address and confirm your current password. Click Change Email . Verify your email address. Use an email address that only you have access to. Role-based, list-serv email addresses like info@, admin@, or sales@yourcompany.com can't be used for your SurveyMonkey account. Verifying Your Email It’s important to verify your account email address to make sure you can receive account-related emails from us. You may be required to verify your email address before collecting responses to your surveys, including any new sender email address you’re using for the first time. We're currently updating the way you log in to your account . Choose the option below that best applies to you. To verify your account email address using the new way to log in : Log in and go to My Account . Go to the Profile section. Go to the Login Details page from the Email and Password section. If your email says Not Verified , click Verify . Check your email inbox to verify your email address. Once you verify your email your email address will update. From the confirmation page, choose Log in to log in with your new address. To verify your account email address using your username to log in: Log in and go to My Account . Go to the Login Details section. If your email says Not Verified , click Resend Email . Go to your inbox and look for an email from SurveyMonkey. Click the verification link. Email Verification Issues Your email address is incorrect There may be a typo in the email address or the email might belong to someone else. Also, if your trouble is specific to verifying your account email address , you may be using an unsupported email address, like a generic, role-based, or list-serv email address. You didn't get the email If you have access to the email account but you're not getting the verification email, it's likely either in your spam, junk, or clutter folder. The email subject is "Verify Your Email Address" and is sent from surveymonkey@t.outbound.surveymonkey.com. You can add us to your safe sender's list by allowing our sender domains and IP addresses . If you're not sure how to add to your allow list, just pass that info along to your IT department. You don't have access to the email account If you don't have access to the email account (you're using someone else's email address, a no-reply email address, or an internal email address that can't receive emails from other domains, etc.), you can: Reach out to your IT department and ask them to allow the internal email address to receive emails from SurveyMonkey by allow listing our info . Then they'll need to forward you the verification email so you can click the verification link. Change the email address—use an email account that you do have access to. Your link isn't working You (the SurveyMonkey account holder) must be logged in to your SurveyMonkey account when you click the the verification link. If you're not logged in, you'll see an error message or be asked to log in when you click the verification link. You have multiple SurveyMonkey accounts If you have multiple SurveyMonkey accounts with the same email address, and you’re not using the new login process , please make sure you're logged in to the correct account when you click the verification link. If you're not logged in to the correct account, you'll see an error message. Username If you’re using the new login process , and don’t log in with SSO, you can edit your username in the Profile section of My Account. If you’re still logging in with your username, and have not switched to the new login process, you can edit your username in the Login Details section of My Account. If you’re having trouble logging in, you might have multiple SurveyMonkey accounts, which means you might have more than one username. You can get a list of all usernames tied to an email address, enter your email on the Forgot Password page. Password If you’re using the new login process , you can edit your password by visiting the Login Details page in the Profile section of My Account. Sharing login info goes against our Terms of Use and opens your account to risk of a potential breach. To protect access to your account and data, create a strong, hard-to-guess password that only you know. Check out other password tips to help keep your account secure. TIP! If you forgot your password or don't have one, log out of your account and follow these steps to reset your password . Transferring the Account If you use SurveyMonkey for work and you're changing jobs, update the point of contact to the new person responsible for surveys at your organization. All you have to do is change the account email to update the account holder. If you don't want to transfer your entire account, you can transfer surveys to any paid account. The username for the account you’re transferring to can be found in their My Account section. If multiple people need to collaborate on surveys, upgrade to a team to unlock all collaboration features. Account and data ownership depends on your plan type which is listed in the Account Details section of the My Account page.
