title: Enterprise Admin Central
body: Enterprise Admin Central Setting Up Your Account Building Your Team Managing AI Feature Access Create, Collect, and Analyze Team Collaboration Branding Your Surveys Integrations and Advanced Features Training and Support Resources Enterprise Admin Central Enterprise Admin Central Setting Up Your Account Building Your Team Managing AI Feature Access Create, Collect, and Analyze Team Collaboration Branding Your Surveys Integrations and Advanced Features Training and Support Resources Join Our Weekly Onboarding Office Hours Got questions about setup, surveys, or reporting? We’ve got answers—Thursdays at 1pm ET / 11am PT! SurveyMonkey Enterprise empowers you to gather valuable insights and make data-driven decisions quickly and efficiently. Whether you're creating surveys for customer feedback, market research, academic studies, and more. By leveraging these resources, you’ll have the tools and support you need to create impactful surveys, gather valuable insights, and achieve your goals with SurveyMonkey. Use our Onboarding Checklist to track your progress, and make sure you complete all the steps needed to successfully set up your Enterprise team. Onboarding Checklist ✅ Log into your account and configure settings ✅ Add users to your account OR Setup Single Sign-On ✅ Schedule and take the SurveyMonkey Essentials training course ✅ Create branded templates and resources ✅Build a survey, collect responses, and review results ✅ Integrate with other systems of record ✅ Create reports and dashboards ✅ Log into your account and configure settings ✅ Add users to your account OR Setup Single Sign-On ✅ Schedule and take the SurveyMonkey Essentials training course ✅ Create branded templates and resources ✅Build a survey, collect responses, and review results ✅ Integrate with other systems of record ✅ Create reports and dashboards Setting Up Your Account TIP! Don’t know who your Onboarding Specialist is? Reach out to our team to get connected. Log In : Use the credentials sent to your email from your Onboarding Specialist to log into your account. Update Your Profile : Navigate to your email address in the top right corner and click on the dropdown. Select My Account and review the information in this section. Make edits to your name, contact information, and organization details. Choose Your Preferences : In the same My Account section configure data feature permissions, language, time zone, and notification settings for a personalized experience. Configure Security Settings: Connect with your SurveyMonkey technical contact to enable Single Sign-On (SSO) or setup Two-factor Authentication. If you're not sure who your Technical Contact is, reach out to your Onboarding Specialist . If you’ve purchased HIPAA compliance , please enable this feature by following the steps below: Click on My Team in the top-left corner while logged in. Select Settings from the menu. On this page, find the HIPAA BAA section and click Enter into a BAA . Complete Admin Training: Watch the following series of videos to understand how to use the Admin portal and learn about the settings available to you. This will help you move forward to the next step in the process which is to build your team. User Management Learn how to manage seats on your Enterprise team. Including reassignment and seat deletion. Adding Users Learn how to add users and build your team. This video is also for admins with SSO-enabled accounts. Team Settings Learn about individual and global account settings . Including HIPAA, PII and AI/ML options. Building Your Team As an Admin on your Enterprise team, you can add users, change and set permissions, and assign user roles. Prep Your Users: Let your team know that you’re working on building a SurveyMonkey Enterprise team and explain how they can gain access once they receive their invite. Use this email template to help explain the steps. Email template Email Subject: Our SurveyMonkey Enterprise account is now live! Hello, Our SurveyMonkey Enterprise account is now available for your use. You should have received an email with the subject line “Invitation to join SurveyMonkey.” If you have not received an invitation, please let me know and I will be sure to add you. Once you accept the invitation, SurveyMonkey will open in your browser and prompt you to create or convert a SurveyMonkey account. If you are a new SurveyMonkey user , click the link in the top right corner, “ Create an account .” Follow the steps to create your account, including setting up a username, password, and your preferences. If you have an existing SurveyMonkey Account , please choose the option to “ Convert Existing Account .” Enter your username and password to sign into your account. Your account is now rolled up into our SurveyMonkey Enterprise account. Once you’ve successfully created or converted your account, you’ll be directed to your Home page. If you have any questions about setting up your account, please don’t hesitate to reach out. Thanks, [Your Name] Email Subject: Our SurveyMonkey Enterprise account is now live! Hello, Our SurveyMonkey Enterprise account is now available for your use. You should have received an email with the subject line “Invitation to join SurveyMonkey.” If you have not received an invitation, please let me know and I will be sure to add you. Once you accept the invitation, SurveyMonkey will open in your browser and prompt you to create or convert a SurveyMonkey account. If you are a new SurveyMonkey user , click the link in the top right corner, “ Create an account .” Follow the steps to create your account, including setting up a username, password, and your preferences. If you have an existing SurveyMonkey Account , please choose the option to “ Convert Existing Account .” Enter your username and password to sign into your account. Your account is now rolled up into our SurveyMonkey Enterprise account. Once you’ve successfully created or converted your account, you’ll be directed to your Home page. If you have any questions about setting up your account, please don’t hesitate to reach out. Thanks, [Your Name] Invite Team Members : Find the My Team tab in the top left menu bar section of your account, click on the down arrow, and select Add Users . Send invitations to your team members via email or create a team sign-up page where people in your organization can send invites to themselves to join. Teams with SSO enabled won't see either of these options and instead can send a team’s invite link. Assign Roles and Permissions : Understand and define user roles and permissions to control access and responsibilities. Learn more about roles and how to make adjustments . Managing AI Feature Access SurveyMonkey provides AI and machine learning features to help you create better surveys, gather higher quality data, and spot insights quicker. Enterprise admins can control what features their teams have access to at any time. Here are the features Enterprise admins can manage access to: Build with AI Response Quality Sentiment Analysis Data security and privacy are built into the design of our AI and machine learning features. Enterprise Primary Admins can manage their teams' access to AI and machine learning features as needed. TIP! You can learn more about how our features process your data to decide if these features are right for you. To manage AI feature access for your Enterprise team: Primary admins can manage the AI features their team has access to. To manage AI feature access for your Enterprise team: Select My Team , then select Settings . Select AI and machine learning (ML) features Use the toggle and checkboxes to manage access to AI and machine learning features. Create, Collect, and Analyze Creating A Survey TIP! Check out the How to Create a Survey article (which includes video resources) to learn more ways to build a survey. You can create a survey from scratch or from a template . Get a head start by using a template designed by our team of survey experts. Use the dropdown menu to browse templates by type to find the right survey for you. If you're on a team, you can also browse your team survey templates . Try our Build with AI option which helps you create a survey designed to meet your goals. To get started, answer a few simple questions about you and your survey goals. Collecting Survey Responses Once your survey design is ready to go, click Collect Responses to create a collector and send your survey. Any collectors you create can be managed from your collector list. There are various ways to send your survey and collect responses: Analyzing Your Survey Data Using our Analyze view, you can see a summary view of your data; browse individual responses; create and export dynamic charts; use filter, compare, and show rules to analyze specific data views and segments; view and categorize open-ended responses, and easily download your results in multiple formats. In addition to our built-in visualization tools, as part of an Enterprise team, you have access to features like Response Quality which uses machine learning to scan your survey results and flag poor-quality responses. Exporting Your Survey Data If your team already has established data analysis workflows or tools you prefer, SurveyMonkey gives you options to export your data in several formats such as: XLS (Excel) Exports CSV Exports PDF Exports PPT (PowerPoint) Exports SPSS Exports You can also use our export tools to create custom charts of your data and download them to your computer or share them online. Want to learn more? Visit the Teams and Enterprise section of our Help Center for more helpful articles about features available to your team. For more information on creating, sending or analyzing surveys, choose from any of the links below: Survey Design & Character Limits Adding & Editing Questions Managing Survey Collector Options Allowing Multiple Responses Integrate surveys to increase engagement Survey Response Statuses Using Rules to Break Down Survey Results Visit the Teams and Enterprise section of our Help Center for more helpful articles about features available to your team. For more information on creating, sending or analyzing surveys, choose from any of the links below: Survey Design & Character Limits Adding & Editing Questions Managing Survey Collector Options Allowing Multiple Responses Integrate surveys to increase engagement Survey Response Statuses Using Rules to Break Down Survey Results Team Collaboration Collaboration is at the heart of successful teams, and SurveyMonkey Enterprise offers a suite of tools designed to make teamwork seamless and efficient. Whether you're co-creating surveys, sharing insights, or managing feedback, these tools empower teams to work together effectively in real-time, no matter where they are. Start with the training video below for an overview on some of our favorite Enterprise collaboration tools. We recommend learning about the following collaboration features first: TIP! Check out the full list of collaboration options in our Working with others article. Branding Your Surveys SurveyMonkey Enterprise offers powerful tools to help your organization create branded surveys that reflect your identity and build trust with respondents. Consistent branding ensures a professional appearance, aligns with your organization's standards, and enhances respondent engagement. Explore the branding options available and learn how to customize your surveys effectively. Setting Up a Survey Theme What is a Survey Theme? TIP! Add your custom theme to the library and save commonly used themes as templates to create consistency across all team surveys. A survey theme determines the overall look and feel of your survey, including the font, colors, and logo placement. Custom themes are a great way to reinforce your brand identity across all surveys. To add a custom theme: Navigate to the Design Survey section of your project. Click on Themes in the left-hand menu. Select an existing theme or click Create New Theme to start customizing. Customize the following elements: Font Style and Size : Choose from available fonts or upload a custom one. Color Palette : Set primary and secondary colors for backgrounds, text, and buttons. Logo : Upload your organization’s logo and place it in the header or footer. Font Style and Size : Choose from available fonts or upload a custom one. Color Palette : Set primary and secondary colors for backgrounds, text, and buttons. Logo : Upload your organization’s logo and place it in the header or footer. Save the theme and apply it to your survey. Adding Your Logo Adding a logo to your survey is an easy way to make it instantly recognizable. To add a logo: Go to the Design Survey section. In the Builder tab, click Header or Footer to edit these sections. Click the Logo option to upload an image. Adjust the size and alignment as needed. Preview your survey to ensure the logo appears as intended. Supported image formats include JPG, PNG, and GIF, with a maximum file size of 2MB. Customizing Colors SurveyMonkey allows you to customize the color palette to match your brand’s identity. You can adjust background, text, and button colors. To customize brand colors: In the Themes menu, select a theme to edit. Choose your preferred colors for the following elements: Background Text Buttons Hyperlinks Background Text Buttons Hyperlinks Save your changes and apply the theme. You can your organization’s HEX color codes for precise alignment with your brand standards. TIP! Use CSS to style your survey so that it matches your visual assets, fonts, colors, and style preferences. Adding a Custom URL A custom URL (e.g., surveys.yourcompany.com) adds another layer of professionalism to your surveys. To set up a custom URL: Connect with your SurveyMonkey Technical Contact to get started. Don’t know who your contact is? Reach out to your Onboarding Specialist ! Work with your IT team to configure the domain settings. Once set up, share the branded URL with your team for use in surveys. You can also change the subdomain of your survey link to make you organization more recognizable to respondents. ENTERPRISE ADD-ON: Requesting a custom subdomain is only available on some Enterprise packages, please contact your Onboarding Specialist to get set up. Customizing the Survey Footer The footer is another opportunity to include branding elements such as a logo, copyright notice, or links to privacy policies. First hide the SurveyMonkey footer: Go to the Design Survey section of your survey. Click Style . In the Settings tab, click Footer . Select None to hide the footer. Then add your own footer: You'll need to add additional text into your survey, at the very end of each page. You can add extra spacing to the top of the text so it appears lower down the page. Branding Best Practices TIP! Set a default logo or theme, or presentation template for your Enterprise team. Keep it simple Avoid overwhelming your survey with too many design elements. Consistency is key Use the same logo, fonts, and colors across all surveys. Test before sending Make sure your branding displays correctly on different devices and browsers. Align with company policies Follow your organization's branding and privacy guidelines. Integrations and Advanced Features Our platform offers seamless integrations with popular tools like Salesforce , Marketo , Power BI , and Tableau to help you unlock the full potential of your survey data. These integrations enable you to connect your survey results directly to your existing workflows, making it easier to analyze, automate, and act on your insights. Getting Started with Paid Integrations Using Our API For more advanced integrations, our API allows you to connect your surveys with other platforms or build custom workflows tailored to your needs. Whether you're syncing data with proprietary systems or automating responses, our API documentation provides detailed guidance. TIP! Explore API documentation. App Directory In addition to these paid integrations, we offer a variety of apps and tools to extend the functionality of our platform. Browse the App Directory to discover even more ways to connect and enhance your survey experience. TIP! Visit the App Directory . Integrating your surveys with these tools allows you to streamline your processes, save time, and make more data-driven decisions. If you have questions or need assistance, our support team is here to help! Training and Support Resources We’re committed to helping you succeed with SurveyMonkey by providing comprehensive training and support resources tailored to your needs. Below are the key ways you can access help, learn more about the platform, and even partner with us for customized services. Customer Support SurveyMonkey’s customer support team is available to assist with any questions or issues. English email support for all customers 24/7 English Phone Support for Enterprise Customers: Mon-Fri from 3am-8pm Eastern Time Our Help Center also includes an extensive library of articles, guides, and troubleshooting resources. Attend Live Training and Events We host a variety of live webinars, workshops, and virtual events to help you maximize the value of SurveyMonkey. These sessions are designed for all experience levels and cover topics such as: Getting started with SurveyMonkey. Advanced survey creation and analysis techniques. New features and best practices. Visit our Upcoming Events page to register for sessions. Many events are free, making it easy to level up your skills on a schedule that works for you. Professional Services for Tailored Support If you’re looking for hands-on assistance or specialized expertise, consider our Professional Services . Our team of experts can help with: Custom survey design and methodology. Survey insights through dashboards and custom reports. Consultation on effectively using the platform to achieve feedback goals. Professional Services are available for purchase and are ideal for organizations with unique or complex needs. Learn more about what we offer on our Professional Services page . Reach out to your Onboarding Specialist for more info on how to get started with our Professional Services team! Expert Consultation Receive customized training specific to your needs. With best practice guidance on feedback programs, using custom data to personalize surveys, analysis strategy and more. Survey Design and Programming Let SurveyMonkey experts design, program and test your survey for you. Tailored specifically with best practices in mind to satisfy your own objectives and receive actionable results. Custom Reporting Our experts help you turn insights into action. With custom dashboards, data tables, and comprehensive executive reports highlighting key themes to showcase findings. Have feedback about this guide? Please fill out this survey. Related Articles Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice

title: Your SurveyMonkey Data
body: Your SurveyMonkey Data Data Retention and Restoration of Deleted Data Data Privacy, Security, and Confidentiality Where Your Data Is Stored Your SurveyMonkey Data Your SurveyMonkey Data Data Retention and Restoration of Deleted Data Data Privacy, Security, and Confidentiality Where Your Data Is Stored Data Retention and Restoration of Deleted Data Account Data While you have a SurveyMonkey account, we retain data associated with your account. If your account is inactive, we may delete your SurveyMonkey Basic (free) account and survey data in accordance with our data retention policy. In the case of either a SurveyMonkey paid account or SurveyMonkey Basic (free) account, we may retain the data associated with your account longer as required by applicable law. Response data With per-survey response limits, you can view a set number of responses per survey according to your plan. Responses over the survey’s limit aren’t viewable and will be deleted. However, if you need access to specific over-limit responses to comply with legal obligations, such as to fulfill a data subject request, then please contact customer support . You may also choose to immediately delete all survey responses over your account limi t. Alternatively, we will automatically delete them 1 year after they were collected—in accordance with our retention period. To view and keep access to those responses, upgrade to a paid plan before they're deleted. You can go to Home to see which surveys have responses over your plan's limit if you want to upgrade to a paid plan. The following sections describe who can delete data, how long it's retained, and whether it can be restored. Deleting survey data from within your account You can delete surveys and data from within your account. Once deleted from your account, the survey or data won’t be accessible and you may not be able to restore it. The deleted data is permanently removed from our system within 60 days. Type of Data How to Delete It Can It be Restored? Questions Deleting a Question Yes. See Restoring Deleted Questions Responses Deleting Responses Responses can't be restored. Surveys Deleting a Survey Surveys can't be restored. TIP! If you're on a free (Basic) plan, you can immediately delete all responses over your account limit . You can delete surveys and data from within your account. Once deleted from your account, the survey or data won’t be accessible and you may not be able to restore it. The deleted data is permanently removed from our system within 60 days. TIP! If you're on a free (Basic) plan, you can immediately delete all responses over your account limit . Deleting your account You can delete your account or survey data associated with it at any time. After deletion, the account is disabled immediately. The deleted account and data will be permanently removed from our system within 60 days. You can delete your account or survey data associated with it at any time. After deletion, the account is disabled immediately. The deleted account and data will be permanently removed from our system within 60 days. Deleting an account on a team The Primary Admin or Admin of a team can delete an account from their team at any time. The account, including all surveys and data within it, is disabled immediately. The deleted account and data will be permanently removed from our system within 60 days. The Primary Admin or Admin of a team can delete an account from their team at any time. The account, including all surveys and data within it, is disabled immediately. The deleted account and data will be permanently removed from our system within 60 days. Deleting responses over your (Basic) account limit If you're on a SurveyMonkey Basic (free) account, responses over your account limit aren’t viewable and will be automatically deleted in accordance with our retention period. However, you can choose to delete these responses immediately. If you need to access specific over-limit responses to comply with legal obligations, such as to fulfill a data subject request, then please contact customer support . To delete over-limit responses: Log in and go to My Account . Go to the Data Features section. Under the Delete responses over the account limit section click Delete Read this before deleting: All responses in your account over the limit will be permanently deleted. Deleted responses can’t be recovered and will not be in your account if you upgrade. Responses over the limit will continue to be deleted 1 year after they are collected. Acknowledge that responses over the limit will be deleted immediately and will not be recoverable . Click Delete responses . You’ll then receive an email to confirm the deletion of responses over your account limit. The last time you manually deleted your over-limit responses is shown under the Last manual deletion date . This date does not include automatic deletions of over-limit responses that were removed in accordance with our retention period. TIP! Close your survey collectors to prevent any more responses from being collected. If you're on a SurveyMonkey Basic (free) account, responses over your account limit aren’t viewable and will be automatically deleted in accordance with our retention period. However, you can choose to delete these responses immediately. If you need to access specific over-limit responses to comply with legal obligations, such as to fulfill a data subject request, then please contact customer support . To delete over-limit responses: Log in and go to My Account . Go to the Data Features section. Under the Delete responses over the account limit section click Delete Read this before deleting: All responses in your account over the limit will be permanently deleted. Deleted responses can’t be recovered and will not be in your account if you upgrade. Responses over the limit will continue to be deleted 1 year after they are collected. All responses in your account over the limit will be permanently deleted. Deleted responses can’t be recovered and will not be in your account if you upgrade. Responses over the limit will continue to be deleted 1 year after they are collected. Acknowledge that responses over the limit will be deleted immediately and will not be recoverable . Click Delete responses . You’ll then receive an email to confirm the deletion of responses over your account limit. The last time you manually deleted your over-limit responses is shown under the Last manual deletion date . This date does not include automatic deletions of over-limit responses that were removed in accordance with our retention period. TIP! Close your survey collectors to prevent any more responses from being collected. Some residual copies of deleted data may remain on backup media up to 90 days after the deletion has occurred, at which point it will be overwritten. We generally don't use deleted survey data for any purpose, however in limited circumstances, we may retain other data about your account and historical usage for the following reasons: To comply with our legal obligations To enforce our agreements To resolve disputes To perform analytics In these cases, we ensure that access to the data is blocked except for the purposes for which we have been required to retain the information. The data is deleted as soon as that purpose no longer exists. We also retain aggregate anonymous usage and meta data which doesn’t identify you or any of your respondents. Data Privacy, Security, and Confidentiality We understand that survey responses can capture a wide range of information, some of which may be sensitive, confidential, or proprietary—both to the account owner and survey takers. SurveyMonkey values the trust that our customers, whether they be individuals or large organizations, place in us by letting us be the custodians of their survey data. Our Privacy Notice details how we handle your survey data. We aim to be transparent with our privacy practices so there aren't any surprises. We won't use your surveys or information collected from your surveys in any way other than as described in our Privacy Notice. Our Security Statement and white paper describe the security measures we use to keep your data secure. We make every effort to ensure that your data is handled and stored securely. We also require you, as a survey creator, to be responsible for good privacy practices for those taking your survey. This can help improve response rates and the survey-taking experience. Learn more about data collection and privacy best practices and adding a consent statement or privacy notice to your survey. Where Your Data Is Stored As an international company, we have data centers in the United States, Canada, and Ireland. Depending on your plan type and region, you may have the option to store your survey and response data in a regional data center. Regardless of the data center you use, we may access our other data centers to implement, maintain, repair, or upgrade our services for our customers. If your data is stored in a regional data center, you can see the location listed in the Account Details on your My Account page. If you don't see anything listed, your data is stored on servers located in the United States. Regional Data Centers If your data is stored in a regional data center, expand the section on your region to learn more. Canada ENTERPRISE FEATURE: The Canadian data center is currently available to new Enterprise customers only. If you're interested, contact sales . Visit our policy center to read more about our International Data Centers . Customer Support Options Our global customer support team, located in Australia, Canada, Ireland, and the United States, may need to look at your account to best help you. Accepting support means our global customer service representatives can access your account and data for the purposes of helping you with your questions. If you’d prefer not to accept customer service outside of Canada, you can let us know in your account. To accept or deny global support: Go to your My Account page . Under General Preferences , choose whether or not to accept customer support outside of Canada. TIP! You can turn this setting on and off if you'd only like to accept global support for a short period of time. Limitations The following features are only available when you use them within your own team, whose data is also stored in the Canadian data center: Transferring surveys TIP! You can send a copy of your Survey template instead. The features below aren't available with Canadian data storage at this time, but we're working to make them available soon: Category Feature Analyze Sentiment Analysis , Word Cloud Collecting Responses Text Message collector Integrations Most existing apps or plug-ins aren't available - including, Microsoft Teams , Zoom and Zendesk , as well as Accepting Payments Solutions Feature Importance (MaxDiff) , Price Optimization (Van Westendorp) , Usage & Attitudes , Idea Screening , Creative and Concept Testing Solutions (Ad Testing, Concept Testing, Video Testing, Package Testing, Logo Design Testing, Name Testing, Message & Claims Testing) ENTERPRISE FEATURE: The Canadian data center is currently available to new Enterprise customers only. If you're interested, contact sales . Visit our policy center to read more about our International Data Centers . Customer Support Options Our global customer support team, located in Australia, Canada, Ireland, and the United States, may need to look at your account to best help you. Accepting support means our global customer service representatives can access your account and data for the purposes of helping you with your questions. If you’d prefer not to accept customer service outside of Canada, you can let us know in your account. To accept or deny global support: Go to your My Account page . Under General Preferences , choose whether or not to accept customer support outside of Canada. TIP! You can turn this setting on and off if you'd only like to accept global support for a short period of time. Limitations The following features are only available when you use them within your own team, whose data is also stored in the Canadian data center: Transferring surveys TIP! You can send a copy of your Survey template instead. The features below aren't available with Canadian data storage at this time, but we're working to make them available soon: European Union (EU) ENTERPRISE FEATURE: The EU data center is currently available to new Enterprise customers only. If you're interested, contact sales . We offer customers EU and UK Standard Contractual Clauses to validate transfers of data outside of the EU. However, we understand that some customers prefer EU data storage. Also, closer data storage is likely to improve site speed for survey creation and survey-taking. We offer some Enterprise customers the ability to store survey and response data in the EU Data Center in Ireland, using our public cloud infrastructure. Other data, such as login information, billing details, and account metadata may be stored in the United States. When creating the account, the Primary Admin can request that we store the team's survey and response data in the EU. This setting applies to all users added to the team. At this time, existing customers aren’t able to choose to migrate their data to the EU data center. Logging in to SurveyMonkey on the EU Data Center To log in to your SurveyMonkey account, go to eu.sur v eymonkey.com . It’s a good idea to bookmark the home page since it’s unique for customers storing data in the EU. On the SurveyMonkey Mobile App, use the Europe region link to log in to the European Data Center. If you visit surveymonkey.com pages while logged in, you may see an error saying something went wrong. If this happens, return to eu.surveymonkey.com to continue using your account. Limitations The following features are only available when you use them within your own team, whose data is also stored in the EU data center: Commenting on surveys and results Commenting on Shared data pages Sharing surveys Transferring surveys Copying surveys The features below aren't available with EU data storage at this time, but we're working to make them available soon: Category Feature Survey Design Survey gallery Collecting Responses Text Message collector, Mobile SDK collector, Offline mode Solutions SurveyMonkey Audience , Audience credits , Benchmarks , Feature Importance (MaxDiff) , Price Optimization (Van Westendorp) , Usage & Attitudes , Idea Screening , Creative and Concept Testing Solutions (Ad Testing, Concept Testing, Video Testing, Package Testing, Logo Design Testing, Name Testing, Message & Claims Testing) Enterprise Account Control , SCIM Integrations Most existing apps or plug-ins aren't available. But SurveyMonkey for Salesforce , Tableau , Microsoft Power BI , Zapier , and Marketo are available, or you can build new apps to add to the App Directory . Products Wufoo , Techvalidate , SurveyMonkey Apply , SurveyMonkey Engage Downgrading Downgrade to another plan type ENTERPRISE FEATURE: The EU data center is currently available to new Enterprise customers only. If you're interested, contact sales . We offer customers EU and UK Standard Contractual Clauses to validate transfers of data outside of the EU. However, we understand that some customers prefer EU data storage. Also, closer data storage is likely to improve site speed for survey creation and survey-taking. We offer some Enterprise customers the ability to store survey and response data in the EU Data Center in Ireland, using our public cloud infrastructure. Other data, such as login information, billing details, and account metadata may be stored in the United States. When creating the account, the Primary Admin can request that we store the team's survey and response data in the EU. This setting applies to all users added to the team. At this time, existing customers aren’t able to choose to migrate their data to the EU data center. Logging in to SurveyMonkey on the EU Data Center To log in to your SurveyMonkey account, go to eu.sur v eymonkey.com . It’s a good idea to bookmark the home page since it’s unique for customers storing data in the EU. On the SurveyMonkey Mobile App, use the Europe region link to log in to the European Data Center. If you visit surveymonkey.com pages while logged in, you may see an error saying something went wrong. If this happens, return to eu.surveymonkey.com to continue using your account. Limitations The following features are only available when you use them within your own team, whose data is also stored in the EU data center: Commenting on surveys and results Commenting on Shared data pages Sharing surveys Transferring surveys Copying surveys The features below aren't available with EU data storage at this time, but we're working to make them available soon: Related Articles Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice

title: Customizing Survey Links
body: Customizing Survey Links Custom URL Ending Changing the Domain Changing the Subdomain Customizing Survey Links Customizing Survey Links Custom URL Ending Changing the Domain Changing the Subdomain When sending out your survey, you can customize your survey link by using a Custom URL Ending , as well as changing the Domain , and changing the Subdomain . Custom URL Ending Custom URL Ending You can create a Custom URL Ending to make your link more relevant to your survey and respondents. The URL ending is the part of the URL that comes after the /r/ in a survey link. By default, SurveyMonkey randomly generates a string of numbers and letters. www.surveymonkey.com/r/ your_custom_ending You can use a Custom URL Ending for any Web link collector or Social media collector . It's not available for other collector types. You can't customize your URL ending for Web Links with the Recurrence collector option turned on. If you create a Custom URL Ending, the Recurrence is automatically disabled—and vice versa. To create a Custom URL Ending: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the Web Link or Social Media Collector you want to edit. Click Customize of Link settings to the right of the survey link. Enter a Custom URL Ending (100 characters or less). Click Save . Supported Characters Alphanumeric characters (A to Z, a to z, and 0 to 9) Hyphens (-) Underscores (_) Spaces or special characters are not accepted. Alphanumeric characters (A to Z, a to z, and 0 to 9) Hyphens (-) Underscores (_) Spaces or special characters are not accepted. Transferring a Custom URL Ending You can transfer a Custom URL Ending to another one of your Web Link or Social Media Collectors. However, the same URL cannot be used on two collectors at once. To transfer a Custom URL Ending: Go to the Web Link or Social Media Collector you wish to transfer the URL to. Click Customize . Type in the Custom URL Ending. Click Save. Click Transfer URL . The URLs for both collectors will update. It isn't possible to transfer a SurveyMonkey generated URL ending. You can transfer a Custom URL Ending to another one of your Web Link or Social Media Collectors. However, the same URL cannot be used on two collectors at once. To transfer a Custom URL Ending: Go to the Web Link or Social Media Collector you wish to transfer the URL to. Click Customize . Type in the Custom URL Ending. Click Save. Click Transfer URL . The URLs for both collectors will update. It isn't possible to transfer a SurveyMonkey generated URL ending. Deleting a Collector with a Custom URL Ending If you delete a collector with a Custom URL Ending, you may not be able to use it on a future collector. If you'd like to re-use a Custom URL Ending, we recommend not deleting the collector until you transfer the Custom URL Ending to a new collector. If you delete a collector with a Custom URL Ending, you may not be able to use it on a future collector. If you'd like to re-use a Custom URL Ending, we recommend not deleting the collector until you transfer the Custom URL Ending to a new collector. TIP! If you customize the URL after you send the survey out, both the original link and the customized link will work. Changing the Domain White Label URL You can also change the domain of your survey link to use the White Label URL. You can choose the domain research.net to create a White Label URL for your survey. www. research.net /r/your_custom_ending Your Default Domain When you change your default domain preference, new collectors you create will use the domain you select. Existing collectors aren't affected. To change your default domain preference: Click your username in the upper-right corner of your account. Click My Account from the drop-down menu. Scroll to General Preferences . Next to Survey Domain , click Edit to change your preference. This change applies to future collectors you create. You'll need to manually update the domain for existing collectors. Changing the Subdomain ENTERPRISE ADD-ON: Requesting a custom subdomain is only available to customers on Enterprise. If you're interested, contact sales . If you already have an Enterprise account, contact your Customer Success Manager (CSM). You can also change the subdomain of your survey link to make your organization more recognizable to respondents, if your data is stored in the US or EU data centers. https:// customsubdomain .surveymonkey.com/r/your_custom_ending https:// customsubdomain .research.net/r/your_custom_ending You can then choose this to be your default domain preference by following the steps above in Your Default Domain. If your data is stored in the CA data center, your URLs display the country prefix instead of the subdomain (e.g. ca.research.net). Your Collector's Domain Web Link To change the domain of your survey link: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of the collector. Click Customize to the right of the survey link. Click the down arrow to choose your preferred domain. Click Save . To change the domain of your survey link: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of the collector. Click Customize to the right of the survey link. Click the down arrow to choose your preferred domain. Click Save . Email Invitation When you use the White Label URL in an Email Invitation Collector, both the survey link and the URL respondents see in the From field of the email invitation use research.net. To change the domain of your survey link: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of the collector. Go to the collector options . If you've already sent an invitation, go to the Options tab. When sending your first invitation message in the collector, you'll choose collector options after composing your message. Click Custom URL and change your preference. This will affect any new messages you send. It's not possible to change the survey link of messages that were already sent. When you use the White Label URL in an Email Invitation Collector, both the survey link and the URL respondents see in the From field of the email invitation use research.net. To change the domain of your survey link: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of the collector. Go to the collector options . Click Custom URL and change your preference. This will affect any new messages you send. It's not possible to change the survey link of messages that were already sent. Social Media To change the domain of your survey link: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of the collector. Click Customize to the right of the survey link. Click the down arrow to choose your preferred domain. Click Save . This will affect any new posts you create using that collector. It's not possible to change the survey link of posts that you already shared on social media. You can't change the domain of a Classic Facebook Wall Collector . To change the domain of your survey link: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of the collector. Click Customize to the right of the survey link. Click the down arrow to choose your preferred domain. Click Save . This will affect any new posts you create using that collector. It's not possible to change the survey link of posts that you already shared on social media. You can't change the domain of a Classic Facebook Wall Collector . Text Message If you're a Primary Admin or Admin of an Enterprise team , you can enable your team's custom domain when using the Text Message collector. To add your team's custom domain , click on Custom URL under Options and select On, show a custom URL for survey . If you're a Primary Admin or Admin of an Enterprise team , you can enable your team's custom domain when using the Text Message collector. To add your team's custom domain , click on Custom URL under Options and select On, show a custom URL for survey . Other Collector Types It's not possible to directly edit the domain of an existing survey link in other collector types. Please edit your default domain and create a new collector to ensure the White Label URL is being used. It's not possible to directly edit the domain of an existing survey link in other collector types. Please edit your default domain and create a new collector to ensure the White Label URL is being used. title: Pre-Populating Fields
body: Pre-Populating Fields Pre-Populating Fields Pre-Populating Fields You can pre-populate many field types so that an answer is pre-selected, or has a predefined text or numerical value, when people go to your form. If someone submits your form without changing the pre-populated answers, the pre-populated answer will be included in their final entry. If you want to add example text to your field that disappears when people start typing (and never gets recorded in your results), use the Placeholder Text field setting instead. To pre-populate a field on your form: Log in and go to Forms . Click the form you want to edit. Click a field to open its Field Settings. For Open-Ended Fields: In the Predefined Value textbox, type in the value you want to be pre-populated. For Closed-Ended Fields: In the Choices section, select the radio button or checkbox you want to be preselected. For Open-Ended Fields: In the Predefined Value textbox, type in the value you want to be pre-populated. For Closed-Ended Fields: In the Choices section, select the radio button or checkbox you want to be preselected. Click Save Form . Supported Field Types Prepopulate Country in Address Field You can also pre-select an answer to the Country dropdown when you're setting up an Address field type. Fancier Ways to Pre-Populate Fields Check out our blogs and guides for more tricks for prefilling data into your forms: Pre-Populating Data Fields Using URL Modifications - Add parameters to your form URL to pre-populate answers. Multiple Form Submissions with Prefilled Fields - For forms that encourage multiple submissions, learn how to pre-populate the repeated data so people don't have to type the same stuff over and over again. Use Wufood to Automatically Generate URLs to Prefilled Forms - Wufood is a third-party web app that lets you automatically generate complex URLs to your Wufoo forms based on the fields you want to pre-populate, so you don't have to worry about getting the formatting right. title: Account, Users and Login
body: Account, Users and Login Help Topics Account, Users and Login Account, Users and Login Logging In Your Subdomain Your subdomain is the username for your account. It's used in URLs associated with your account, in links to your forms, and in your report links. Logging in to Your Account If you're an Admin or a User in a Wufoo account, you need to log in using the Account Login Link, which includes your subdomain. Your Subdomain Your subdomain is the username for your account. It's used in URLs associated with your account, in links to your forms, and in your report links. Logging in to Your Account If you're an Admin or a User in a Wufoo account, you need to log in using the Account Login Link, which includes your subdomain. User Management Managing Users & Permissions On any paid plan, you can add users to a Wufoo account and work with a team to build forms and reports. To get to the User Management page, log in and go to Users. Managing Your Account The Account Manager page is the hub for your account settings—it's where you can access your subdomain, activity log, account usage, billing information, and plan details. Your Account How to Contact Wufoo We offer email support for all customers. Editing Your Name, Email & Password To edit your user information, like the name, email, or password for your account, log in and go to Users. Canceling Your Account To ensure your access to paid features is never interrupted, paid subscriptions are set to auto-renew by default. You can cancel your subscription at any time. Your Account Activity Log The Activity Log shows you what's been happening in your Wufoo account. This is really useful if you have multiple users in your account and need to track down when something occurred. How to Contact Wufoo We offer email support for all customers. This is really useful if you have multiple users in your account and need to track down when something occurred. Billing How to Sign Up or Upgrade To sign up free, go to our Plans & Pricing and choose a plan. To upgrade your account, log in and go to Account. Then click Upgrade Plan. Your New Wufoo Plan Read this article if you have questions about a recent email you got about updates to your plan. It can help answer questions about what this means for your account, how much your new plan costs, and how much you were paying before. Your Billing Information To get to your billing info, log in and go to Account. Then scroll to the bottom of the page to browse your bills or change your billing information. Your Account’s Monthly Entry Limit Your plan type determines the number of entries you can collect in the account per month. If you exceed your monthly entry limit on a paid plan, you'll be charged $0.05 per additional entry. Wufoo W-9 Form Download our W-9 form. Wufoo Plans Your plan determines the features you have. We have one free plan with limited features and several paid plans with more advanced features. Here's an outline of some of the main differences between them. Taxes on Wufoo Purchases Depending on your billing location, taxes may be included in the price of subscriptions, renewals, or fees. Wufoo Non-Profit Discount To support non-profits, we provide a 50% discount on all paid plans to non-educational organizations that are tax-exempt under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. Privacy and Legal Keeping Your Account Secure As a Wufoo user it is recommended to understand your data, and use best practices when viewing and accessing it. How to Opt Out or Unsubscribe You can choose to unsubscribe from our marketing emails and newsletters, and manage the cookies we use. How do I clear or enable cookies? If you're experiencing issues using Wufoo, a good way to troubleshoot is to clear your cookies and then visit the site again. Clearing your cookies helps to refresh your browser and can improve its speed and performance. European Union Subscription Cancellation Policy If you are a consumer who has signed up for a new, paid Wufoo subscription and are located certain EU countries, you have a right to cancel your subscription within 14 calendar days. Customer Complaints & Dispute Resolution If you have a complaint with respect to your quality of service, billing or invoicing, or you have any concerns about our terms of use or policies, we urge you to contact us so we can try to resolve your complaint or concern as quickly as possible. About the Cookies Wufoo Uses Cookies are small bits of data stored on devices (computer, mobile phone, tablet) that recognize repeat users. Each cookie expires after a certain period of time depending on what it's used for. We use cookies for several reasons, as explained in this article. Your Wufoo Data Learn about account ownership, data privacy and security, and how long we retain your forms and data. Wufoo IP Addresses and Sender Domain Information Certain filters and firewalls may prevent emails from reaching your inbox. You or your IT department can add our sender domains and mail IP addresses to your email allow list (sometimes known as a whitelist). Wufoo Data Transfers and EU Laws For European customers, learn more about the EU-US Privacy Shield and Swiss-US Privacy Shield, and where SurveyMonkey stores customer data. Supported Browsers We recommend downloading the newest version of your preferred browser for the best experience. SSL Encryption All Wufoo forms and reports (basically anything you share from Wufoo) are SSL-encrypted by default, on all plans—free and paid. Protecting Your Wufoo Account & Data Learn tips and best practices that you should follow—in Wufoo, and anywhere on the web—to keep your account and data safe and secure. title: Importing Predefined Choices in Bulk
body: Importing Predefined Choices in Bulk Importing Predefined Choices in Bulk Importing Predefined Choices in Bulk There are lots of multiple choice fields that you always see on forms—things like Gender, Age, Employment, Income, Education, Days of the Week, and U.S. States. Likewise, it's really common to ask people to evaluate how often they do something, how satisfied they are with an experience, or how important something is to them. Even though these questions are super common, sometimes it's tricky to figure out the best way to word these field labels and answer choices. And for things like a dropdown of U.S. States, it would be time-consuming to add every choice one by one. Wufoo provides lots of pre-written sets of answer choices (available in English only) that you can add to certain field types to save you time. You can also copy and paste your own predefined answer choices in bulk. To import predefined choices: Log in and go to Forms . Click the form you want to edit. Go to the Field Settings tab of a Multiple Choice or Dropdown field on your form. In the Choices section, click Import Predefined Choices . Select a category. Review the answer choices, and edit them however you'd like. Just make sure that every answer choice is separated by a line break. Click Add Choices to Field . Click Save Form . TIP! Copy & Paste Your Own Pre-Written Choices To add your own answer choices in bulk, replace any list of predefined choices with a set of your own, with each choice on its own line. Supported Field Types You can import predefined choices into the following field types: Multiple Choice Dropdown Likert Checkboxes * * You won't see the Import Predefined Choices button on a Checkboxes field, but here's a workaround: Import predefined choices into a Multiple Choice field, and then change the field type to Checkboxes from the Field Type dropdown. The answer choices will be retained. title: Navigation Buttons
body: Navigation Buttons Changing Button Styles with CSS Missing Submit Button Navigation Buttons Navigation Buttons Changing Button Styles with CSS Missing Submit Button You can change the text or image of the Submit button from the Theme Designer, and you can edit the Next and Previous buttons in the Field Settings for a Page Break. Submit Button To edit the Submit button: Click Themes in the header of your account. From the Theme dropdown menu all the way to the left, select an existing theme or create a new one. Select Button from the list of properties. Under Button Type, select Text or Link (image). Text - Type in the button text you want. This field is UTF-8 compatible so you should be able to use most foreign characters. Link (image) - Enter an image URL—the Submit button will become a hyperlinked image. Click Apply . Click Save Theme to save your theme. If it's a new theme you'll also have to name your theme. Apply the theme to any of your forms or reports. To edit the Submit button: Click Themes in the header of your account. From the Theme dropdown menu all the way to the left, select an existing theme or create a new one. Select Button from the list of properties. Under Button Type, select Text or Link (image). Text - Type in the button text you want. This field is UTF-8 compatible so you should be able to use most foreign characters. Link (image) - Enter an image URL—the Submit button will become a hyperlinked image. Text - Type in the button text you want. This field is UTF-8 compatible so you should be able to use most foreign characters. Link (image) - Enter an image URL—the Submit button will become a hyperlinked image. Click Apply . Click Save Theme to save your theme. If it's a new theme you'll also have to name your theme. Apply the theme to any of your forms or reports. Next and Previous Buttons If you have a multi-page form , you can also customize the Next and Previous buttons. To edit the Next or Previous button: Log in and go to Forms . Click the form you want to edit. Click a Page Break in your form to open its Field Settings. Choose from: Use Text Button - Type in the button text you want. This field is UTF-8 compatible so you should be able to use most foreign characters. Use Image for Button (Next Buttons Only) - Enter an image URL—the Next button will become a hyperlinked image. Click Save Form . TIP! Hide the Previous Button If you want to hide the Previous button to prevent people from going back to previous pages in the form, type hideSecondary into the CSS Layout Keywords textbox in the Field Settings for that Page Break. Learn more: CSS Keywords If you have a multi-page form , you can also customize the Next and Previous buttons. To edit the Next or Previous button: Log in and go to Forms . Click the form you want to edit. Click a Page Break in your form to open its Field Settings. Choose from: Use Text Button - Type in the button text you want. This field is UTF-8 compatible so you should be able to use most foreign characters. Use Image for Button (Next Buttons Only) - Enter an image URL—the Next button will become a hyperlinked image. Use Text Button - Type in the button text you want. This field is UTF-8 compatible so you should be able to use most foreign characters. Use Image for Button (Next Buttons Only) - Enter an image URL—the Next button will become a hyperlinked image. Click Save Form . TIP! Hide the Previous Button If you want to hide the Previous button to prevent people from going back to previous pages in the form, type hideSecondary into the CSS Layout Keywords textbox in the Field Settings for that Page Break. Learn more: CSS Keywords Changing Button Styles with CSS You can add Custom CSS to a theme to fully customize the look of your form's navigation buttons. If you have a multi-page form, you'll also need to account for the Next and Previous buttons. Here are the CSS selectors for all the navigation buttons that can appear on Wufoo forms: Missing Submit Button When you use an iFrame code to embed your form on your website, the code includes a height that we estimate. Unfortunately, there's room for error due to different browser resolutions or font sizes, so sometimes the Submit button will get cut off at the bottom of the form. To fix this, you'll need to increase the height attribute in your embed code. Locate the code snippet on your site, and find the height attribute. It will say something like height="746" . Increase that number and continue testing until you can see everything on your form. You should also make sure to leave some extra wiggle room because error messages take up extra space if someone fills out a field on your form incorrectly. title: Viewing a Form
body: Viewing a Form Viewing a Form Viewing a Form You can view or preview your form at any time. To view your form: Log in and go to Forms . Click the form you want to edit. Click View form . Submitting Test Entries When you view your form from the Forms page, you're actually opening up the real form, so any entries you submit are recorded and count toward the monthly entry limit for your plan. You should also delete your test entries so they don't get mixed up with your real data. title: SurveyMonkey Apply Data & Privacy
body: SurveyMonkey Apply Data & Privacy SurveyMonkey Apply Data & Privacy SurveyMonkey Apply Data & Privacy Overview SurveyMonkey takes the privacy and security of your data very seriously. As part of our ongoing commitment to ensuring your information is secure within SurveyMonkey Apply, we have updated our policies and capabilities to meet the requirements of applicable privacy regulations the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) . Depending on your location, as a SurveyMonkey Apply site administrator, you may be required to respond to requests from data subjects who ask to exercise their privacy rights. Organizations using our services the controller/business owner of the data they collect through their site and have the ability to access , modify, and delete data on behalf of their users when requested. For more information, see Administrator Responsibilities . SurveyMonkey Apply also collects information on users as part of daily business activities - for instance, when we receive a support request, sign a contract, or send newsletters and other marketing information. We are the controller/business owner of this data and any requests that are made we will handle and fulfill. Data Rights & Roles Data Rights Depending on your location and/or the location of your users, your users may be entitled to exercise the following rights: Data Roles Organizations using our services may be data controllers under GDPR or businesses under CCPA for the data they collect, while SurveyMonkey, as a service provider just processes that data for you. SurveyMonkey controls/is the business owner of very limited data about users—we may use personal data like cookie data and IP address for specific purposes as described in our Privacy Policy. For individuals like applicants, reviewers, recommenders, and site visitors , SurveyMonkey is the data controller/business owner of personal data like name, email address, and digital identifiers like a cookie data or IP address, among other things. We describe in detail the data we collect and how we use it in our Privacy Policy . For further information on identifying your data controller see our Privacy Policy under the section “Who is my data controller”?. Administrator Responsibilities Site administrators are responsible for the data they collect through their site and have the ability to access, modify, and delete data on behalf of their users when requested. Depending on your location and the location of your users, you may receive and need to fulfill the requests below. Below are ways that site administrators can fulfill these types of requests made by their users: 1. "Right of Access" requests Site users have the ability to request to see all the information available on them within the site. Users may contact the administrator directly or may submit a request through SurveyMonkey Apply’s form . In either scenario, Site administrators can export a user’s data from the User Profile: Go to the User Profile Click on Data Access Export This file will contain all information submitted by the user on the site in JSON format. We would recommend that after providing the JSON file for the user, the administrator delete the file from their records. This will only contain personal information that has been submitted directly to SurveyMonkey Apply by the user. Any additional information stored on systems outside of SurveyMonkey Apply will need to be sent to the user as well. NOTE: When a request is submitted through SurveyMonkey Apply, SurveyMonkey Apply will review our records for any data we are the controller of and send this separately to the subject within 30 days. 2. "Right of Rectification" requests Administrators have full control over the information they collect from their administrator portal (for example user data, applications, reviews, recommendations.) and can modify the information on behalf of the user who requested the change. Edit Tasks and Form Responses on Behalf of Users Edit Account Information on Behalf of Users 3. "Right to Data Portability" requests As discussed in "Right of Access" , when requested, administrators can provide users with a JSON file of all collected data within the site so the user can provide the data to another data controller. 4. "Right to Restrict Use" requests Users may not want their data to be deleted but can object to anything being used in the processing of their data (for example they believe something to be inaccurate). Administrators may be contacted to prevent their data from being used for decision making. 5. "Right to Object" requests This will vary depending on the nature of the objection and the information that is being objected to. Administrators have full control over the information stored on their sites and will have the ability to make modifications or delete data to address the request. 6. "Right to Erasure" / Data Deletion requests Users may contact a site administrator directly to ask to be deleted from their site. Administrators can find the user through the Manage Users area of the administrator portal and can remove the user from their site which will permanently delete any information associated with that user on that site. Please see, How to Delete a User from a Site . This will remove the user from the specific site. What SurveyMonkey Apply will do: When such a request is made, SurveyMonkey Apply will automatically redact any identifiable information from the user after 14 days . The User will appear on the site as a "Removed User." An email notification will be sent to the organization of the site as the data controller and to SurveyMonkey Apply to review and delete any additional information stored on the user outside of the SurveyMonkey Apply Platform. What a Site Administrator should do: Review the site and ensure that if any additional data not provided by the user was added and contains personal data, for example, data entered by co-applicants/administrators, metadata fields, reviewer comments that you capture this in the request - SurveyMonkey Apply is not responsible for this. NOTE: If you wish for us to suspend deletion while you communicate with this user regarding their request, please contact our support team within 14 days of the date of the request and you can then take over communications with this user directly. If you do not contact our support team within 14 days we will initiate the deletion process and this user’s data will be deleted thereafter. WARNING! Once SurveyMonkey Apply begins the process of deleting a user’s account, this cannot be undone. What happens in SurveyMonkey Apply when an Erasure /Data Deletion request is fulfilled: Administrators as Data Subjects Site Administrators are data subjects for any personal data they submit to SurveyMonkey Apply, including Account Information and any requests sent to the Support & Services team for assistance. Depending on the location of the Site Administrator, you may have certain rights to make the privacy requests below. 1. Making a "Right of Access" request Administrators can make a request for their data from SurveyMonkey Apply by submitting this form . SurveyMonkey Apply will review our records and any personal data we have stored will be forwarded to the administrator within 30 days. The primary administrator of the site, if different than the one making the request, will be notified in the event they have data stored outside of the system. The primary administrator will be responsible for forwarding this information over to the administrator requesting access. 2. Making a "Right of Rectification" request For any of the data that SurveyMonkey Apply provides to the administrator, the administrator can contact our SurveyMonkey Apply Support team directly for us to modify their data. 3. Making a "Right to Data Portability" request When an administrator makes a request for their data, if SurveyMonkey has anything on the administrator, we will forward it to them in a format that will be portable. See “Making a Right of Access” request above. 4. Making a "Right to Restrict Use" request In order to make a request to restrict the use of your data, please contact our SurveyMonkey Apply Support team . 5. Making a "Right to Object" request In order to make a request to object the use of your data, please contact our SurveyMonkey Apply Support team . 6. Making a "Right to Erasure" / Data Deletion request If you are a primary administrator on a SurveyMonkey Apply site, please contact our support team if you’d like to delete your account and data. If you are not a primary administrator, you will need to complete the following form. Applicants, Reviewers, and Recommenders as Data Subjects If you are an Applicant, Reviewer, or Recommender on the site, and depending on your location, you may be able to exercise the rights as listed below: 1. Making a "Right of Access" request In order to make a "Right of Access" request, you will need to fill out the following form . Upon filling out this form, the administrators for the sites you have been a member of will be contacted. We will recommend that they review their records and forward any personal identifiable data they have stored on you, but SurveyMonkey is not responsible for requiring that the sites deliver any data for which they are the controller. The SurveyMonkey Apply team will also receive a request and will review our records and any personal information for which we are your data controller, will be sent to you. Requests sent by email will be directed to filling out this form as we need to ensure the person making the request is a valid user in our system. 2. Making a "Right of Rectification" request If you would like to make a "Right of Rectification" request, you will need to contact the specific data controller with the change you would like to make. Any change related to your application, review, or recommendation within the SurveyMonkey Apply site, you will need to contact the administrator . For any data SurveyMonkey is the controller of, for example, help requests sent to support , you can contact our SurveyMonkey Apply Support team. 3. Making a "Right to Data Portability" request Similar to making a "Right of Access" request, you can complete the form to request your data. The site administrators and SurveyMonkey Apply will compile any data stored on you and provide it in a format that will be portable. 4. Making a "Right to Restrict Use" request If you would like to make a "Right to Restrict Use" request, you will need to contact the specific data controller. For example, any request related to your application, review, or recommendation within the SurveyMonkey Apply site, you will need to contact the administrator. For any data SurveyMonkey is the controller of, for example, help requests sent to our support team, you can contact our SurveyMonkey Apply Support team . 5. Making a "Right to Object" request If you would like to make a "Right to Object" request, you will need to contact the specific data controller. Any request related to your application, review, or recommendation within the SurveyMonkey Apply site, you will need to contact the administrator. For any data SurveyMonkey is the controller of, for example, help requests sent to support , you can contact our SurveyMonkey Apply Support team. 6. Making a "Right to Erasure"/ Data Deletion request If you wish to remove yourself and permanently delete your data from a specific site you will need to contact the site administrator. They will be able to remove all data stored on you within the site they own. If you are a member of multiple SurveyMonkey sites and wish to delete your SurveyMonkey Apply account and all of your data, you will need to complete the following form. title: Deleting a Survey
body: Deleting a Survey Deleting a Survey Deleting a Survey When you delete a survey, the entire survey and all its responses are permanently deleted. Deleting a survey is permanent. Once a survey is deleted, it can't be restored. To delete a survey: Go to Home . Click the three dots ( ... ) to the right of the survey. Click Delete . Review the details. Click Delete . Deleting Shared Surveys You can only delete surveys that you own. When you delete a survey that is shared with others, it's also deletes the survey from their accounts.
