title: Using Themes to Style Surveys
body: Using Themes to Style Surveys Applying a Theme Types of Themes in the Theme Library Creating Your Own Themes Customizing your Themes Editing Details and Limitations Classic Themes Accessible Surveys Using Themes to Style Surveys Using Themes to Style Surveys Applying a Theme Types of Themes in the Theme Library Creating Your Own Themes Customizing your Themes Editing Details and Limitations Classic Themes Accessible Surveys You can change the appearance of your survey by changing the colors or fonts, applying a theme, or customizing options like adding a logo or removing the footer. Applying a Theme To apply a theme to your survey: Go to the Design Survey tab in any survey. Select Style . Select the Themes tab. Select any theme to apply it to your survey. As you build your survey, you can always use the rich text editor to make formatting changes to specific text to override the theme settings. Theme colors apply to Email Invitations ! When you use the HTML Template with an email invitation, the header and Begin Survey button match the Survey Title Background color of your theme. Types of Themes in the Theme Library You can choose from themes in a few categories: Creating Your Own Themes There are a few ways to build your own theme: Generate a theme from an image : Use our theme generator to build a custom theme based on an image, like your company’s logo. Create a custom theme : Manually create your own custom theme. Anyone can create a custom theme and preview it on a survey. Depending on your plan and the features you use, you may be prompted to upgrade your plan or remove the paid features before you can send your survey. Generating a Theme from an Image Device limitation: Generating a theme using an image is only available to customers on desktop devices. Generate a theme to quickly customize your survey theme to match your brand’s style. All you need to do is upload an image, like your company logo, and we'll use machine learning to pull colors from the image to generate a theme. File requirements: Upload a PNG, JPG, or GIF. File size can be 2 MB or less. To generate a theme: Go to the Design Survey tab of your survey. In the Style menu, select Generate theme . If your survey already has a logo, your theme is generated based on that image. If you haven’t uploaded a logo yet, continue with the instructions below: Select Upload image . Choose whether to Use image as my logo . Select Generate theme . SurveyMonkey generates and saves your theme. Select Upload image . Choose whether to Use image as my logo . Select Generate theme . SurveyMonkey generates and saves your theme. Choose from the suggested font, color, and layout options to customize your theme. If you want to add a color, click + under Select theme color . You can use more detailed customization tools later. (Optional) Use the thumbs up and down buttons to tell us whether the generated theme works well for you. Select Done . To find your generated theme, go to the My Themes section of the Themes tab. Theme generation isn't available if your survey uses a classic theme. Create a copy of your survey to use this feature. For Teams and Enterprise plans, this feature may not be available if an admin has set a default logo in your library . Manually Creating a Custom Theme Custom Themes To create a custom theme: Go to the Design Survey section in any survey. In the left sidebar, click Style . Select the Themes tab. Under My themes , select Create custom theme . Your theme is saved in the Style menu under My themes. In the Settings tab, customize your theme. Customizing your Themes To edit custom and generated themes: Open the Style menu. Go to the Themes tab. Scroll to My themes . Find your theme, then select the three dots menu. Select Edit . Theme Settings These are the sections you'll find in the Settings tab as you're customizing your theme. Logo and footer settings aren't carried over when you apply your custom theme to a different survey. Nickname Enter a name for your theme to stay organized. Respondents won't see this. Enter a name for your theme to stay organized. Respondents won't see this. Logo When you add a logo you can choose to position your logo Left , Center , or Right . When you add a logo you can choose to position your logo Left , Center , or Right . Footer You can hide SurveyMonkey branding from the bottom of your survey design. You can hide SurveyMonkey branding from the bottom of your survey design. Fonts You can change the font type, style and size for the survey title, survey questions, and answer choices. The font formatting used for your thank you message , disqualification message , over-quota message , or password required message is inherited by the Answer Choices font settings. You can change the font type, style and size for the survey title, survey questions, and answer choices. The font formatting used for your thank you message , disqualification message , over-quota message , or password required message is inherited by the Answer Choices font settings. Layout You can use layouts to choose how and where your background color or image is displayed. You can use layouts to choose how and where your background color or image is displayed. Background Image You can upload your own background image or select one from thousands in our gallery. How your background image displays and what size your image should be depends on the type of device and screen size. We recommend uploading your background image, then previewing your survey to see what it will look like on multiple device types. To change the background image: Click Replace . Choose From Computer or From Image Gallery . Click Done . Backgrounds on Mobile Devices How background images display on mobile or tablet devices depends on which layout you choose: Full background surveys don't display the image. Instead, the survey background color will show. Partial background surveys will display the image by shrinking it to fit the device. Images larger than 600px may be cut off. TIP! When you select a background image, it's automatically used as your Thumbnail Image . You can further customize your Thumbnail Image & Text in the collector options. You can upload your own background image or select one from thousands in our gallery. How your background image displays and what size your image should be depends on the type of device and screen size. We recommend uploading your background image, then previewing your survey to see what it will look like on multiple device types. To change the background image: Click Replace . Choose From Computer or From Image Gallery . Click Done . Backgrounds on Mobile Devices How background images display on mobile or tablet devices depends on which layout you choose: Full background surveys don't display the image. Instead, the survey background color will show. Partial background surveys will display the image by shrinking it to fit the device. Images larger than 600px may be cut off. TIP! When you select a background image, it's automatically used as your Thumbnail Image . You can further customize your Thumbnail Image & Text in the collector options. Colors You can change the color of the elements listed in the table below by using the color picker, or entering your own hex codes. Element Description Title Text The text color of your survey title . Quiz score text takes on the Title text color selection, so choose contrasting Title text and Survey background colors. Question Text The text color of your survey questions. Answer Choice Text The text color of a question's answer options. Accents Accents are things like buttons, progress bars, and selected checkboxes. Accent Text The text color for accents like buttons, progress bars, and selected checkboxes. This color will always appear on top of the Accents color, so make sure there’s enough contrast so it’s easy to read. Survey Background The background color that appears behind the questions in your survey. If you’re using a background image, this color is hidden. Secondary Background If you’re using a background image, this color overlays on top of the background image. You can control the Overlay Opacity in the Background settings to make the text in your survey easier to read.If you’re using a Split Background layout, this is the background color of the Third, Half, or Banner part of the layout. The Survey Background color will only show if you haven't added a Background Image. You can change the color of the elements listed in the table below by using the color picker, or entering your own hex codes. Previewing Your Theme As you customize your theme, you can view your changes on the right side of the page. However, to see the background image, you need to preview your survey. Editing Details and Limitations There are a few things to keep in mind when editing your themes: Fonts Font You can choose from several popular fonts for your survey. Choosing a font from the Font menu applies it to every text element in your survey. You can override the main font for the Survey Title or Page Title by selecting a different font in those specific sections. Font Size & Style For each of the following text elements in your survey, you can edit either the text size, style (bold, italic, or underline), or both—depending on the element. Element Text Size Style Survey Title ✅ ✅ Page Title ✅ ✅ Page Description ❌ ✅ Progress Bar ✅ ❌ Question Text ✅ ✅ Answer Text ✅ ✅ Error Text ✅ ✅ Font You can choose from several popular fonts for your survey. Choosing a font from the Font menu applies it to every text element in your survey. You can override the main font for the Survey Title or Page Title by selecting a different font in those specific sections. Font Size & Style For each of the following text elements in your survey, you can edit either the text size, style (bold, italic, or underline), or both—depending on the element. Colors You can change the color of the elements listed in the table below by using the color picker, or entering your own hex codes. Number Element 1 Survey Logo Background 2 Survey Title 3 Survey Title Background 4 Survey Background 5 Page Title 6 Page Title Background 7 Page Background 8 Progress Bar Text 9 Progress Bar Indicator 10 Progress Bar Border 11 Progress Bar Background 12 Page Description 13 Error Text 14 Required Asterisk 15 Question Text 16 Answer Text 17 Answer Text Highlight The Survey Background color will only show if you haven't added a Background Image. Button Colors The background and font colors of the Next button will always match the Survey Title Background and Survey Title settings, which you can edit in the Colors section of your theme. If these colors are the same, the buttons will default to grey with black text. However, you can't change the button color if you use the Sea Foam or Autumn themes. See the Editing Limitations sections below for more information. You can change the color of the elements listed in the table below by using the color picker, or entering your own hex codes. The Survey Background color will only show if you haven't added a Background Image. Button Colors The background and font colors of the Next button will always match the Survey Title Background and Survey Title settings, which you can edit in the Colors section of your theme. If these colors are the same, the buttons will default to grey with black text. However, you can't change the button color if you use the Sea Foam or Autumn themes. See the Editing Limitations sections below for more information. Logo When you add a logo you can choose to position your logo Above Title , Below Title , or Left of Title . When you add a logo you can choose to position your logo Above Title , Below Title , or Left of Title . Editing Limitations Depending on the theme you're using, there may be some elements that can't be edited. Theme Editing Limitations Autumn The theme is full width, so you can't add a Background Color or Background Image.You can't edit the shape or color of the Next and Previous buttons.You can't change the height of the Survey Title Background.You can't edit or remove the circles around the question numbers. Boardwalk You can't remove the drop shadow around the survey. Charcoal You can't remove the small horizontal line under the Survey Title.Editing options are limited for Matrix/Rating Scale or Matrix of Dropdown questions.You can't update the Font Type of Answer Text. City Lights You can't change or remove the header background image.You can't change the transparency of the Survey Title Background.Editing options are limited for Matrix/Rating Scale or Matrix of Dropdown questions.You can't update the Font Type of Answer Text. Jungle The theme is full width, so you can't add a Background Color or Background Image. Midnight Editing options are limited for Matrix/Rating Scale or Matrix of Dropdown questions. Moss You can't change the rounded corners of the survey.Editing options are limited for Matrix/Rating Scale or Matrix of Dropdown questions. Ocean Editing options are limited for Matrix/Rating Scale or Matrix of Dropdown questions. Sea Foam The theme is full width, so you can't add a Background Color or Background Image.You can't edit the shape or color of the Next and Previous buttons.You can't change the height of the Survey Title Background.You can't change the color of the question numbers. Sky You can't change the rounded corners of the survey Spring Editing options are limited for Matrix/Rating Scale or Matrix of Dropdown questions. Depending on the theme you're using, there may be some elements that can't be edited. Adding CSS Themes Enterprise Admins have the option to add a CSS theme to completely customize survey fonts, colors, and branding. Keep in mind, CSS isn’t the same as JavaScript and allows styling customization, but not logic changes. To add a CSS theme, see Managing Brand Assets in the Library . Editing a Custom or CSS Theme Changes made to a custom or CSS theme affect any surveys with that theme applied. If you need to edit an existing custom theme that’s already being used on other surveys, select the three dots next to the theme and choose Duplicate . This ensures you don’t change your existing surveys. If you share a survey with a custom theme, only the survey owner will be able to make edits. Classic Themes The following themes are considered classic themes: Jungle, Sky, Ocean, Sea Foam, Midnight, Spring, Autumn, Charcoal, Moss, Aqua, City Lights, Boardwalk, and Seashell. To use a classic theme on a new survey, you can make a copy of an existing survey with the classic theme applied and the styling will carry over. It isn’t possible to use a classic theme on a survey created any other way . Incompatible Features Some features aren’t supported when using a Classic theme. If you want to add incompatible features, like the Best Worst Scale, Name, Email Address, Phone, Address questions, confirmation emails for web link surveys, or MaxDiff questions, you need to update your theme to any Standard or Premium theme. To create a copy of your survey with a compatible theme to utilize all features: Add a new Best Worst Scale, Name, Email Address, Phone, or Address question to your survey that uses a Classic theme. Click Copy survey . This keeps the rest of your survey design intact and creates an exact copy but with a compatible theme. You’re able to change your theme to any other Standard or Premium theme after copying. Accessible Surveys You can use SurveyMonkey to create surveys that are accessible to people using screen readers. Learn more: Creating Accessible Surveys Related Articles Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice

title: Taxes on SurveyMonkey Purchases
body: Taxes on SurveyMonkey Purchases United States European Union & United Kingdom Brazil Other Countries Taxes on SurveyMonkey Purchases Taxes on SurveyMonkey Purchases United States European Union & United Kingdom Brazil Other Countries Depending on your billing location, taxes may be included in the price of subscriptions, renewals, and other purchases, or it may be added as a separate line item on your invoice. If you don’t see your billing country listed below, SurveyMonkey doesn't add taxes to your purchase price. It’s your responsibility as a consumer or business to pay any applicable taxes to your local government, as needed. Some organizations and businesses may be exempt from sales tax. If you're currently receiving a charity or nonprofit discount you aren't automatically exempt from paying sales tax, and need to complete the exemption process based on your location. Visit our Legal Center for more information on how we assess and charge sales tax. United States SurveyMonkey is required to charge sales tax in certain U.S. locations to comply with local laws. If the billing address for your current payment method is located in a region that collects sales tax, you'll see the tax on your SurveyMonkey invoice starting February 1st, 2019. This tax applies to all SurveyMonkey products, including SurveyMonkey Enterprise, SurveyMonkey Audience, and our other business solutions . Tax Rate Local tax rates vary depending on your state, county, and city. Make sure your current Billing Details are up to date so that we can charge the correct tax rate. SurveyMonkey may not assess tax in some locations or on some of its services. If you want to estimate your potential sales tax, the best way is to use an online sales tax calculator . Tax Exemption Some organizations and businesses may be exempt from sales tax. If you believe your organization qualifies for tax-exempt status, apply for tax exemption before you upgrade or renew your account. If you've already made a purchase and still need to provide a tax exemption certificate, you have a limited amount of time , depending on your billing location. Once your exemption status has been approved, future purchases will be exempt from tax where applicable. You can check your current exemption status in the Billing Profile section of the Billing Details page. If you're charged tax after your exemption status has been approved, please contact us . Tax Exemption Certificate Timelines The amount of time you have to submit a tax exemption certificate after upgrading or renewal varies based on billing location. If you don't see your billing location in the table below, you have 90 days from date of purchase to apply. Invoices You can find your invoices in the Transaction History tab of the My Account page. Invoices include the applicable tax for your billing location, the price of the plan, and the total amount you paid. European Union and United Kingdom If you're located outside of the United States, SurveyMonkey may be provided to you by our European subsidiary in Ireland, SurveyMonkey Europe UC. To comply with laws in the European Union (EU), Value Added Tax (VAT) is included in the price of subscriptions, renewals, and other purchases when applicable. The applicable VAT rate depends on your billing country. If you're a VAT-registered business in the EU (other than Ireland), you can add a VAT registration number to exclude it from your purchase. Adding a VAT Number To exclude VAT from your purchase, you need to add your VAT number before making a payment—you can't retroactively apply a VAT number to a paid invoice. If you're a VAT-registered business in the EU (other than Ireland), you can add a VAT registration number to exclude VAT from your purchase. There are two ways to do this: On the checkout page, scroll to the Billing Details section. Click Apply VAT Registration Number . It will be applied to that payment and future payments made by your account. In your account, go to your Billing Details . Scroll to the Billing Contact section and click Edit . From the window, click Add tax registration number . When you add or edit an existing VAT registration number here, it's applied to future payments. If your VAT registration number is invalid, please refer to the proper VAT ID formats by EU member state on the European Commission website or via the gov.uk website and try again. To exclude VAT from your purchase, you need to add your VAT number before making a payment—you can't retroactively apply a VAT number to a paid invoice. If you're a VAT-registered business in the EU (other than Ireland), you can add a VAT registration number to exclude VAT from your purchase. There are two ways to do this: On the checkout page, scroll to the Billing Details section. Click Apply VAT Registration Number . It will be applied to that payment and future payments made by your account. In your account, go to your Billing Details . Scroll to the Billing Contact section and click Edit . From the window, click Add tax registration number . When you add or edit an existing VAT registration number here, it's applied to future payments. If your VAT registration number is invalid, please refer to the proper VAT ID formats by EU member state on the European Commission website or via the gov.uk website and try again. VAT Invoices You can find your invoices in your Transaction History . To view an invoice, click the invoice number. To view a tax invoice, click the document icon next to an invoice number. Invoices are also emailed to the billing contact listed on the account. If you see a notice that your invoice is pending, please wait 48 hours then check your Transaction History. You can find your invoices in your Transaction History . To view an invoice, click the invoice number. To view a tax invoice, click the document icon next to an invoice number. Invoices are also emailed to the billing contact listed on the account. If you see a notice that your invoice is pending, please wait 48 hours then check your Transaction History. Other Purchases Team Purchases Role How VAT is Applied Where to Add a VAT Number Primary Admin If the Primary Admin of a team adds a VAT number to their account, it's applied to the team billing—any invoices after the VAT number was added to the account will have VAT excluded. Any one-time purchases the Primary Admin makes after the VAT number was added to the account will also have VAT excluded. The Billing Details tab in the Billing Contact - Team section or during checkout. Users For any one-time purchases made by individual Users in a team, the User needs to add a VAT number to exclude VAT from the purchase—it's not automatically applied based on the VAT number of the Primary Admin. The Billing Details tab in the Billing Contact - Individual section or during checkout. SurveyMonkey Audience Purchases If you already have a VAT number added to your SurveyMonkey account, we'll automatically apply it to your SurveyMonkey Audience purchase. If you don't have a VAT number added to your account, you can add one on the checkout page. SurveyMonkey Audience is offered in all countries, except Brazil. Team Purchases SurveyMonkey Audience Purchases If you already have a VAT number added to your SurveyMonkey account, we'll automatically apply it to your SurveyMonkey Audience purchase. If you don't have a VAT number added to your account, you can add one on the checkout page. SurveyMonkey Audience is offered in all countries, except Brazil. Irish Customers If you're a VAT-registered business in Ireland, you can add a VAT number to your SurveyMonkey account, but this will not remove VAT costs from your price—we're required to collect VAT on all transactions with our customers located in Ireland. You may be able to reclaim VAT by filing a VAT return with your government. If you're a VAT-registered business in Ireland, you can add a VAT number to your SurveyMonkey account, but this will not remove VAT costs from your price—we're required to collect VAT on all transactions with our customers located in Ireland. You may be able to reclaim VAT by filing a VAT return with your government. SurveyMonkey Address & VAT ID SurveyMonkey Europe UC 2 Shelbourne Buildings, 2nd Floor Shelbourne Road, Ballsbridge Dublin 4, Ireland VAT ID: IE 3223102GH SurveyMonkey Europe UC 2 Shelbourne Buildings, 2nd Floor Shelbourne Road, Ballsbridge Dublin 4, Ireland VAT ID: IE 3223102GH Brazil Starting July 8, 2015, all new customers whose billing country is Brazil pay in Brazilian Reals (BRL), and SurveyMonkey is provided to you by our Brazilian subsidiary in São Paulo, SurveyMonkey Brasil Internet Eireli. You'll need to add your CNPJ or CPF ID number on the checkout page when purchasing a SurveyMonkey plan. Adding your ID number does not exclude tax from your purchase. CNPJ : Identifies a business or company in Brazil. After adding a CNPJ, we'll display additional business-related fields, like company name and purchase order number. See Contact Information for Payments for SurveyMonkey's CNPJ. CPF : Identifies an individual consumer in Brazil. You can edit your tax ID at any time by editing your payment method information in your Billing Details . Edits you make will be applied at your next renewal—edits won't be applied to any existing invoices or Nota Fiscal (NFSe). Nota Fiscal (NFSe) A Nota Fiscal is an invoice and financial document that includes all tax-related information required for reporting to local tax authorities in Brazil for goods and services. Starting July 8, 2015, we'll be issuing Nota Fiscal Eletrônica for Services (NFSe) from the São Paulo municipality for customers whose billing currency is BRL. Your NFSe are stored in your Transaction History , along with your invoices and receipts. If you signed up by credit card, your NFSe may be immediately available on the payment confirmation page. If your NFSe is pending and doesn't appear on the confirmation page, please wait 48 hours then check your Transaction History. If you signed up by bank transfer, your NFSe will be available in your Transaction History within 48 hours after your payment is processed . When your plan renews, your new NFSe will be found in your Transaction History within approximately 48 hours after your payment is processed . A Nota Fiscal is an invoice and financial document that includes all tax-related information required for reporting to local tax authorities in Brazil for goods and services. Starting July 8, 2015, we'll be issuing Nota Fiscal Eletrônica for Services (NFSe) from the São Paulo municipality for customers whose billing currency is BRL. Your NFSe are stored in your Transaction History , along with your invoices and receipts. If you signed up by credit card, your NFSe may be immediately available on the payment confirmation page. If your NFSe is pending and doesn't appear on the confirmation page, please wait 48 hours then check your Transaction History. If you signed up by bank transfer, your NFSe will be available in your Transaction History within 48 hours after your payment is processed . When your plan renews, your new NFSe will be found in your Transaction History within approximately 48 hours after your payment is processed . Brazilian Payment Methods We support Brazilian Reals (BRL or R$) for Brazilian customers using the following payment methods: Payment Method Description Credit Card Visa, MasterCard, American Express, and Elo Bank Transfer Available when paying by invoice Unavailable payment methods : At this time, Boleto is not an available payment method, and it's not possible to pay with a Brazilian debit card. We're sorry for the inconvenience! We support Brazilian Reals (BRL or R$) for Brazilian customers using the following payment methods: Unavailable payment methods : At this time, Boleto is not an available payment method, and it's not possible to pay with a Brazilian debit card. We're sorry for the inconvenience! Other Countries SurveyMonkey includes tax on purchases in the following countries when applicable. In some countries, businesses may be able to exclude sales tax from the purchase price. Excluding Tax from Your Purchase If eligible, you can exempt tax from future purchases by entering your tax exemption number on the checkout page or in your account: On the checkout page, scroll to the Billing Details section and enter your tax registration number. It'll be applied to that payment and future payments made by your account. In your account, go to your Billing Details . Scroll to the Billing Contact section and click Edit . From the window, add your tax registration number. When you add or edit an existing tax registration number here, it's applied to future payments. title: Custom Roles
body: Custom Roles Roles Permissions Managing Roles and Permissions Assigning roles Filtering by role Custom Roles Custom Roles Roles Permissions Managing Roles and Permissions Assigning roles Filtering by role ENTERPRISE FEATURE : If you're interested, contact sales . If you already have an Enterprise account, contact your Customer Success Manager (CSM). The seat and role on a team controls what account permissions you have and how you work together with your team. Admins can create custom roles that will give team members a more customized experience and will cater to specific types of seats on your Team. Custom roles can be used to provide more Admin support, give Users access to certain features or to limit permissions on the team. Roles and Permissions Roles Here's a basic overview of the default roles that can be assigned to seats on your Team. The Primary Admin role can't be assigned to others on the team, if you need to change your Primary Admin, see Manage Seats on your Enterprise Team . Permissions The Primary Admin can pick and choose permissions from the areas below to create a custom role. Each area will have several permissions or administrative functions that can be selected, and the created custom role may have a variety of permissions spread across all areas. Admin Role When selecting Admin to start your custom role from, you can see both general and, team and account management permissions to assign. * Only available for Enterprise plans that have Divisions as an add-on User Role If you select User to start from, you can only see and choose from general permissions. Managing Roles and Permissions The Primary Admin will be able to create new roles and assign them to seats on the team. Once an Admin custom role is set up to allow management of roles and permissions, they will also be able to create and assign roles. Creating a New Role You can create as many custom roles as you need with a range of permissions. Go to My Team Click Settings Select Roles and permissions Click + Create role Choose a role to start from: Admin User Admin User Enter the Role name and Description (optional) Click Create Duplicating a role If there is a Custom Role that you have already customized and want to build from, you can duplicate it. All options configured in the permissions areas will carry over to the copied version. Once duplicated, you can then edit the name and permissions. From the Roles and permissions page, find the role you want to duplicate and click the 3 dots ( ... ) Choose Duplicate Edit the Role name , Description , and permissions . Click Save . If there is a Custom Role that you have already customized and want to build from, you can duplicate it. All options configured in the permissions areas will carry over to the copied version. Once duplicated, you can then edit the name and permissions. From the Roles and permissions page, find the role you want to duplicate and click the 3 dots ( ... ) Choose Duplicate Edit the Role name , Description , and permissions . Click Save . Editing a Custom Role Once a custom role has been created, you are able to change the role and its permissions. All changes will automatically be updated to those within that custom role. Find the role you want to change and click the 3 dots ( ... ) Choose Edit permissions . Review the Role name , Description , and permissions and make changes. Click Save . TIP! Default roles can only be viewed or duplicated . Deleting a Custom Role To better manage your custom roles, you can delete them when they aren't needed anymore. Deleting a custom role is permanent, it can't be restored. From the Roles and permissions page , find the role you want to remove and click the 3 dots ( ... ) Choose Delete. When you are sure you want to proceed, select Delete role . When you delete a custom role, any users with that custom role will be reassigned to the starter default role. Assigning Roles Now that custom roles are set up, you can start allocating seats on your teams to those roles. There are two ways in which you can assign a role, by selecting each seat individually or by CSV imports for multiples team members at a time. Individually Assigning a Custom Role Go to My Team . Click Manage Users Select the user Click on Change next to role Choose a new user role from the dropdown. Click Save . Assigning Multiple Custom Roles To adjust multiple roles and seats at once, follow the guidance for Importing Users by CSV . For the Role column, find the right role in the list below. Then, in your CSV file, use the CSV term listed: Filtering by role Admins can filter the team to easily see who on the team has default and custom roles. Go to My Team . Click Manage Users . Under Filters, select the Roles dropdown. Select Role Click Apply filters When a filter is applied, the default roles are first listed at the top, followed by custom roles. title: Exporting Survey Results
body: Exporting Survey Results Exporting Results Summary Data Responses Data Individual Responses Exporting Survey Results Exporting Survey Results Exporting Results Summary Data Responses Data Individual Responses Exports You can export survey data to download an offline copy of your survey results. From the Analyze Results section, access your exports by selecting the Exports icon. Also, your browser should save exports you've downloaded in your computer's Downloads folder. We have several example exports available to help you choose the export format that's right for you. See example exports » If your survey has more than 100,000 responses or the total number of respondents multiplied by questions equals over 100,000, only CSV exports are available. Exporting Results To export all survey results: Go to the Analyze Results section of your survey. Select Save As at the top of the page. Select Export files . Select an export type: All summary data , All responses data , or All individual responses . Choose an export format, select your export options, and select Export . To download your file, select Exports from the toolbar, then select the export. Exports are stored in your Exports menu for 14 days. The file you download may be a compressed file, commonly known as a ZIP. After you decompress or unzip the file, you can open the files containing your survey results. TIP! Follow these tips if you have trouble exporting your survey results. Summary Data Summary Data exports give you a presentation-ready overview of your survey results by question, known as question summaries. There are several formats available: PDF Summary Data PDF exports have eye-catching custom charts and data tables, making it really easy to share or present your results as soon as you have them—no additional calculations needed. Learn more about PDF exports » Summary Data PDF exports have eye-catching custom charts and data tables, making it really easy to share or present your results as soon as you have them—no additional calculations needed. Learn more about PDF exports » PPT Summary Data PPT exports are formatted for PowerPoint. The slides are presentation-ready, organized by question with the same custom charts and data tables you see in the Question Summaries tab when analyzing your results. Learn more about PPT exports » Summary Data PPT exports are formatted for PowerPoint. The slides are presentation-ready, organized by question with the same custom charts and data tables you see in the Question Summaries tab when analyzing your results. Learn more about PPT exports » XLS Summary Data XLS exports are formatted for Excel. The spreadsheet contains a data table summary for each question, with charts included. We calculate response counts and percentages for you. Learn more about XLS exports » Summary Data XLS exports are formatted for Excel. The spreadsheet contains a data table summary for each question, with charts included. We calculate response counts and percentages for you. Learn more about XLS exports » CSV Summary Data CSV exports can be used in many different analytics software, like Excel or Numbers. This export type is useful if you're sharing data with people who don't have the same software you do. The spreadsheet includes response counts and response percentages, but tables and charts are not included. Learn more about CSV exports » Summary Data CSV exports can be used in many different analytics software, like Excel or Numbers. This export type is useful if you're sharing data with people who don't have the same software you do. The spreadsheet includes response counts and response percentages, but tables and charts are not included. Learn more about CSV exports » Responses Data Responses Data exports let you see how each respondent answered the survey. This export type is also good if you want raw data to create charts or do analysis on your own. There are several formats available: XLS Responses Data XLS exports are formatted for Excel. The spreadsheet organizes all individual responses on separate rows. Questions are grouped by column to make it easy for you to perform your own analysis. Learn more about XLS exports » Responses Data XLS exports are formatted for Excel. The spreadsheet organizes all individual responses on separate rows. Questions are grouped by column to make it easy for you to perform your own analysis. Learn more about XLS exports » PDF Responses Data PDF exports download the same information and display you see in the Individual Responses tab. This is the best way to view the individual responses for particular respondents. Learn more about PDF exports » Responses Data PDF exports download the same information and display you see in the Individual Responses tab. This is the best way to view the individual responses for particular respondents. Learn more about PDF exports » CSV Responses Data CSV exports can be used in many different analytics software, like Excel or Numbers. This export type is useful if you're sharing data with people who don't have the same software you do. Learn more about CSV exports » Responses Data CSV exports can be used in many different analytics software, like Excel or Numbers. This export type is useful if you're sharing data with people who don't have the same software you do. Learn more about CSV exports » SPSS Responses Data SPSS exports are widely used in areas such as market research, health research, government, and education research. This export contains a .SAV file which requires special software to open. Learn more about SPSS exports » Responses Data SPSS exports are widely used in areas such as market research, health research, government, and education research. This export contains a .SAV file which requires special software to open. Learn more about SPSS exports » Individual Responses The same export formats are available for all individual responses. You can also export a single Individual Response as a PDF by clicking Export next to the response in the Individual Responses tab. title: Export Responses to a Google Sheet
body: Export Responses to a Google Sheet Exporting Responses to Google Sheets Editing the Google Sheets Quick Action Turning Off the Quick Action Export Responses to a Google Sheet Export Responses to a Google Sheet Exporting Responses to Google Sheets Editing the Google Sheets Quick Action Turning Off the Quick Action With a Connect apps quick action, you can automatically export your new survey results to either a new or existing Google spreadsheet, where responses populate in a new sheet in the spreadsheet. The Google Sheets quick action lets you keep your data synchronized for automatic sharing, analysis, and data visualization. Responses are added to your Google Sheet as they arrive. Existing survey response aren't able to be exported to Google Sheets using this quick action. Exporting Responses to Google Sheets The Google Sheets quick action in Connect apps lets you create a new or existing Google Sheet with your survey responses. To export responses to a new Google Sheet: Go to the Connect apps section. Find Google Sheets. Hover over the down arrow and select Create new sheet or Use existing sheet . Select Connect to sign in to your Google account. Type a new spreadsheet name or Select spreadsheet to use an existing. Manage the conditions for your quick action: Choose the data to include : Select Include survey data to choose the questions, answers, and metadata you want to send to the sheet. If you include open text questions, select I understand to acknowledge that respondent data exported may include personal identifying information. Filter the responses : Select Target specific responses to specify which responses will trigger this quick action. Choose the data to include : Select Include survey data to choose the questions, answers, and metadata you want to send to the sheet. If you include open text questions, select I understand to acknowledge that respondent data exported may include personal identifying information. Filter the responses : Select Target specific responses to specify which responses will trigger this quick action. Select Activate to save and turn on your quick action. Your Google Sheets quick action is turned on by default so you can test it and start collecting responses. You can always turn it off later. Editing the Google Sheets Quick Action You can edit the spreadsheet name, conditions, and filters of your SurveyMonkey quick action, at any time. This is useful if you need to change the criteria for which responses are exported or if you want to update the spreadsheet name. If you change the spreadsheet name within Google Sheets, the SurveyMonkey quick action will stop updating the existing spreadsheet and create a new one. To edit your Google Sheets quick action: Go to the Connect Apps section of your survey. Select Manage . Find your quick action. Select the three dots icon ... Select Edit action . Make any desired changes. Select Save . Turning Off the Quick Action If you want to temporarily stop exporting new responses to your Google Sheet, you can turn off the quick action. This is useful if you want to pause the export but might want to restart it later. To turn off the quick action: Go to the Connect apps section of your survey. Select Manage . Find your quick action, then turn off the toggle. Deleting the Quick Action Deleting a quick action permanently removes it. If you no longer need to export responses using this quick action and don't plan to use it again, you can delete it. Deleted automations can't be recovered. To use this automation again in the future, you'll need to create a new quick action. To delete the quick action: Go to the Connect apps section of your survey. Select Manage . Find your quick action. Select the three dots icon ... Select Delete . At the confirmation message, select Delete again. title: A/B Tests (Random Assignment)
body: A/B Tests (Random Assignment) A/B Tests (Random Assignment) A/B Tests (Random Assignment) A/B Tests Our A/B Test feature allows you to randomly display different versions of a question, image, or free-standing text, and set the percentage of respondents that will be shown each variable. When you analyze your results, you can assess how the different stimuli affected responses. Creating an A/B Test Set up your A/B Test on the Design Survey page. Image A/B Test Image A/B Tests allow you to display different images to different sets of respondents. The image will be independent of any questions, so you can add follow-up questions that refer to the image. You can add up to 20 image variations to a single Image A/B Test question. To add an Image A/B Test: From the Build section of the left sidebar, drag and drop Image A/B Test into your survey. Upload an image for each variable, or add an image via URL. (Optional) You can add the following labels to your variable: Image Label: Survey takers see this text with the image. Variable Label: This is how your image is labeled in the Analyze Results section. Survey takers won't see this text. Descriptive Text (Alt Text): Text that makes your image accessible for people using a screen reader, but isn't visible on the survey page. Click + to add another variable if needed. Image A/B Tests allow you to display different images to different sets of respondents. The image will be independent of any questions, so you can add follow-up questions that refer to the image. You can add up to 20 image variations to a single Image A/B Test question. To add an Image A/B Test: From the Build section of the left sidebar, drag and drop Image A/B Test into your survey. Upload an image for each variable, or add an image via URL. (Optional) You can add the following labels to your variable: Image Label: Survey takers see this text with the image. Variable Label: This is how your image is labeled in the Analyze Results section. Survey takers won't see this text. Descriptive Text (Alt Text): Text that makes your image accessible for people using a screen reader, but isn't visible on the survey page. Image Label: Survey takers see this text with the image. Variable Label: This is how your image is labeled in the Analyze Results section. Survey takers won't see this text. Descriptive Text (Alt Text): Text that makes your image accessible for people using a screen reader, but isn't visible on the survey page. Click + to add another variable if needed. Text A/B Test Text A/B Tests allow you to display variations in free-standing text to different sets of respondents. The text will be independent of any questions, so you can follow it with questions that ask respondents to refer to the text. You can add up to 20 variations in a single Text A/B Test question. To add a Text A/B Test: From the Build section of the left sidebar, drag and drop Text A/B Test into your survey. In the A and B fields, enter the two variables you want to show to respondents. Click + to add another variable if needed. Text A/B Tests allow you to display variations in free-standing text to different sets of respondents. The text will be independent of any questions, so you can follow it with questions that ask respondents to refer to the text. You can add up to 20 variations in a single Text A/B Test question. To add a Text A/B Test: From the Build section of the left sidebar, drag and drop Text A/B Test into your survey. In the A and B fields, enter the two variables you want to show to respondents. Click + to add another variable if needed. Question Text A/B Test Question Text A/B Tests allow you to display up to 20 variations in question text to different sets of respondents. To enable a Question Text A/B Test: Click an existing question to edit it. Or, add a new question to your survey. Click the Options tab. Click Enable Question Text A/B Test (Random Assignment) . Go back to the Edit tab. In the A field, enter the question text for the first variable. Click + to add another variable if needed. In the % field to the right of each variable, enter the percentage of overall respondents you want to show the variable to. Unsupported Question Types You can enable Question Text A/B Tests for any question type, except Net Promoter Score, File Upload, or Matrix of Dropdown Menus. Question Text A/B Tests allow you to display up to 20 variations in question text to different sets of respondents. To enable a Question Text A/B Test: Click an existing question to edit it. Or, add a new question to your survey. Click the Options tab. Click Enable Question Text A/B Test (Random Assignment) . Go back to the Edit tab. In the A field, enter the question text for the first variable. Click + to add another variable if needed. In the % field to the right of each variable, enter the percentage of overall respondents you want to show the variable to. Unsupported Question Types You can enable Question Text A/B Tests for any question type, except Net Promoter Score, File Upload, or Matrix of Dropdown Menus. Video A/B Test You can use the formatting toolbar in a Text or Question Text A/B Test to add a video into each variable field. You can use the formatting toolbar in a Text or Question Text A/B Test to add a video into each variable field. As you add variables, the respondent percentages will split evenly across all variables. However, you can enter your own percentages if you prefer. Variable percentages must total 100%. These percentages determine the probability of a new respondent seeing that variable when they take your survey. Previewing A/B Tests Before you send out your survey, preview your survey design a few times to see what your survey will look like to respondents. You'll be shown different A/B Test variables each time you preview your survey. As people take your survey, SurveyMonkey randomly assigns each respondent to be shown a certain variable based on the percentages you define. Analyzing A/B Test Results There are several areas in the Analyze Results section where you can view and analyze the results of your A/B test. Under the Question Summaries tab, you can see the number and percentage of respondents that viewed each variable. In the CURRENT VIEW section of the left sidebar, you can Filter by A/B Test or Compare by A/B Test . Under the Individual Responses tab, you can see which variable each respondent was shown. You can filter or compare by A/B test for these question types: Multiple Choice, Checkboxes, Star Rating, Dropdown, Matrix/Rating Scale, Ranking, and Image Choice. You may notice that the distribution of respondents that saw each variable doesn't exactly match the percentages you defined. The more responses you collect, the more likely it is that your results will reflect the percentages. Since variables are randomly assigned, we do not guarantee the split will be exact, particularly for smaller numbers of participants. We suggest collecting at least 50 responses. TIP! See if there are significant differences in how respondents who saw different variables answered your survey. Exports When a Filter by A/B Test rule is applied, you can only export summary data in PDF or PPT format. However, the A/B Test questions themselves are excluded from PPT exports since there are no charts and data tables to display in the presentation. When a Compare by A/B Test rule is applied, you can only export summary data in PDF format. title: Auto-Renew
body: Auto-Renew Auto-Renew Auto-Renew Paid plans are subscriptions that auto-renew by default to ensure you don't lose access to paid features at your next billing date. You can check your auto-renew setting in the Billing Details tab of your account. If auto-renew is enabled , the subscription renews at your next billing date and you keep access to paid features. If auto-renew is disabled , the subscription doesn't renew at your next billing date. Instead, your account downgrades to a free plan and you lose access to paid features. You can cancel auto-renew at any time. This prevents your payment method from being charged at your next billing date, or if you pay by invoice, prevents your next invoice from being issued. How You're Billed Payment for your renewal is due at your next billing date. The way you're billed for your renewal depends on your payment method: TIP! If you'd like to be emailed an invoice to pay for your renewal rather than be charged automatically on your next billing date, you can request to pay by invoice . Your Next Billing Date Payment for your subscription renewal is due at your next billing date. Most plans auto-renew on an annual basis (every 12 months) on the same day each year. We also offer a monthly plan , which has several billing frequency options. To check your next billing date: Log in to your SurveyMonkey account. Click your username in the upper-right corner. Select My Account . Click the Billing Details tab. Look for Next Billing Date . Teams The renewal amount is for your whole team and depends on your team size . Missed Payments To keep your paid plan or team active, you need to complete your payment before your next billing date. If you miss a payment, your account will downgrade to a free plan . If you miss a payment for a team , all accounts on the team will downgrade to a free plan and the team will be broken apart. title: Creating a Web Link for Your Survey
body: Creating a Web Link for Your Survey Video Overview Creating a Web Link Collector Options Tracking Survey Takers Create a Copy of a Web Link Creating a Web Link for Your Survey Creating a Web Link for Your Survey Video Overview Creating a Web Link Collector Options Tracking Survey Takers Create a Copy of a Web Link The Web link collector lets you share a URL or QR code linking to your survey. You can send or post your survey anywhere you want—like on social media, in an email (using your own email client), or print it on a newsletter. By default, your survey URL will look something like this, with a string of letters and numbers at the end: TIP! Download a QR code for your survey to print on pamphlets, flyers, or posters. Video Overview Creating a Web Link To create a Web Link: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Choose Send surveys your way and then Share a survey link . If you already have a collector created and don't see that option, click Add New Collector and select Web link collector . If you already have a collector created and don't see that option, click Add New Collector and select Web link collector . Choose your collector options . (Optional) Click Customize to use a custom URL ending or change the domain . (Optional) Edit the nickname of the collector by clicking the pencil icon—this nickname does not show to survey takers. Copy the survey link and paste it wherever you'd like. The link works as long as the collector is open —Web link collectors are open by default. Beta Experienc e: Some customers may see a Web link automatically created when they initially go to the Collect Responses section. To create a web link: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. A URL is automatically created for you under Share a link. If you already created another collector or don't see a Web link URL ready for you to use, you can click Share a link to create a new Web link. If you already created another collector or don't see a Web link URL ready for you to use, you can click Share a link to create a new Web link. Choose your collector options . (Optional) Click Link settings to: Use a custom URL ending Change the domain Edit the nickname of the collector by clicking the pencil icon—this nickname does not show to respondents, Use a custom URL ending Change the domain Edit the nickname of the collector by clicking the pencil icon—this nickname does not show to respondents, Under Share a link , click Copy and paste it wherever you'd like. The link works as long as the collector is open —Web link collectors are open by default. Web Links are Public Links Your Web link collector URL is a public link, meaning that anyone who has it will be able to access your survey and complete it. Web crawlers can also access public links, but they won't index your survey on a search engine. Tip! If you wish to use a Web link collector but do not want the link to be public, consider password-protecting your survey . Collector Options It isn't possible to transfer or reuse a SurveyMonkey generated URL ending. Depending on your plan, you can create a Custom URL Ending or use the White Label URL to remove SurveyMonkey branding from your web link. If you customize the URL after you send the survey out, both the old link and the new link will work. You can’t create a Custom URL Ending if you have the Recurrence collector option turned on. Tracking Respondents If you want to track respondents, choose the tracking method you want to use before sending your survey. By default, Web link collectors record IP addresses . However, this information can't really help you track respondents. Instead, you can add required questions to your survey to collect identifying information from respondents, or you can use Custom Variables . Or, you can use an Email invitation instead of a Web link to track respondents. Create a Copy of a Web Link Copying a web link creates a new link for you to share a previous survey at a different time or with new respondents. To create a copy of a Web Link collector: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click ... next to the Web link collector you want to copy. Select Copy Collector . A new Web Link starting with Copy of is added to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Most of your customized collector options apply to the copied web link. To review and edit your collector options before sending your survey, select Edit Collector from the survey's three dot dropdown. Copied Collector Options Collector option Copied from original web link Custom Thank You ✅ Survey End Page ✅ Multiple Responses ✅ Response Editing ✅ Anonymous Responses ✅ Instant Results ✅ Response Limits ✅ IP Restrictions ✅ Custom Disqualification ✅ Thumbnail Image and Text ❌ Recurrence ❌ Respondent Authentication ❌ Cutoff Date and Time ❌ Password Protection ❌ Related Articles Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice

title: Microsoft Teams Integration
body: Microsoft Teams Integration SurveyMonkey Setup Polling, Surveying, or Quizzing Your Team Sharing Results in a Tab Microsoft Teams Integration Microsoft Teams Integration SurveyMonkey Setup Polling, Surveying, or Quizzing Your Team Sharing Results in a Tab Limitations: This integration is available for US data center accounts only and the setup is only available in English. SurveyMonkey's integration with Microsoft Teams lets you: Add a personal app or use a messaging extension to create, view, edit, or share polls, surveys, or quizzes, and results Create, collect, and view responses directly in a Microsoft Teams channel, group chat, or private chat Share survey results collected in Microsoft Teams or SurveyMonkey in a Channel tab Set up notifications to let the team know when there are new responses or comments TIP! Based on your SurveyMonkey plan, you may need to upgrade to use some features or view all responses. Video Overview SurveyMonkey Setup Connecting your account The first time you install the SurveyMonkey app in Microsoft Teams, you need to log in to your SurveyMonkey account to connect to Microsoft Teams. Your account will store any polls, surveys, quizzes, and responses created and collected in Microsoft Teams. You can view results in the Analyze Results section of SurveyMonkey or a Microsoft Teams channel, chat, tab, or personal App. Adding SurveyMonkey as a Personal App The SurveyMonkey personal app is a private space for you to create, share, edit, or analyze results of all your polls or surveys. To add SurveyMonkey as a personal app: Click ... on the left side panel of Microsoft Teams. You can find all your apps here. Search for and select SurveyMonkey. Click Add to install and authorize your SurveyMonkey account. TIP! You can pin your SurveyMonkey personal app for easy access to your polls or surveys. Click ... on the left side panel, right-click on the SurveyMonkey icon, and select Pin. The SurveyMonkey personal app will appear on the left side panel. Adding SurveyMonkey as a Messaging Extension You can create and share a poll , survey , or quiz with others through a conversation in a channel, group chat, or private chat. To add SurveyMonkey as a messaging extension: Click New Conversation within a Microsoft Teams channel, or if you’re in a chat, move on to the next step. Click ... from the message menu. Search for and select SurveyMonkey. Click Add to install and authorize your SurveyMonkey account. TIP! You can pin your SurveyMonkey messaging extension for easy access to your surveys. Click ... on the bottom panel, right-click on the SurveyMonkey icon in the search modal, and select Pin. The SurveyMonkey messaging extension will appear on the bottom panel. Polling, Surveying, or Quizzing Your Team Creating a Poll, Survey, or Quiz You can create a poll, survey, or quiz to get feedback from your team. Share your poll, survey, or quiz with others in a channel, group chat, or private chat. To create and share a poll, survey, or quiz: Open SurveyMonkey in the personal app or messaging extension in a Microsoft Teams channel or chat. Click New and choose to create a poll, survey, or quiz, or start from a template. Add a Title . Select a Question type from the dropdown—Multiple choice, Dropdown, Checkbox, Comment box, Star rating, or Slider. Add your Question . Add your answer Choices . If you’re creating a quiz, assign points to answer choices in Score . If you want the question to be Required , click the toggle on. Click + Add Question to add additional survey or quiz questions. View the live Preview to make sure it looks good. Click Share . Click the toggles to control your settings. Keep responses anonymous : Don’t track and store info that identifies the survey takers. Schedule closing : You set when to close the survey. Keep responses anonymous : Don’t track and store info that identifies the survey takers. Schedule closing : You set when to close the survey. Click Share to teams and add a message to include with the card on the selected channel or chat. If you’re working from the Personal app, you can share the survey to multiple teams or channels. To share wherever you want, you can Copy URL . Your team can take the poll, survey, or quiz from the SurveyMonkey card added to the Microsoft Teams channel or chat to take it without having to leave Microsoft Teams. You can Edit any poll, survey, or quiz as long as there are only supported question types and no logic. Otherwise, you can edit the survey in SurveyMonkey. TIP! When you create a poll in Microsoft Teams, a web link collector is generated and can’t be edited. Errors may occur if you make changes to the web link. Viewing Results Open SurveyMonkey in the personal app or messaging extension and click Results to view charts right in Microsoft Teams. If your survey includes unsupported question types or logic, you can view results in SurveyMonkey. TIP ! If you are using the Free SurveyMonkey plan or are a Casual user, you'll be prompted to view results in your browser. Sharing Results in a Tab You can add a tab to any Microsoft Teams space to share results from surveys, polls, and quizzes created in either Microsoft Teams or SurveyMonkey. If you don't have access to this feature, you may need to update your Microsoft Teams app. From the Microsoft Teams channel menu, click the + Plus Icon. Use the search bar to find SurveyMonkey. Once a tab is added, you can update the default tab name. Check the box next to Post to channel about this tab if you want to let members know about the new tab. Click Save . Click + Share survey to tab and select which survey, poll, or quiz results you want to share. You can do this multiple times to share results from multiple surveys in one place, or share different results in different tabs. (Optional) Configure additional options like including Open-Ended responses, Data Trends, or Individual Responses with your survey results. Once you've added a survey to the tab, click on the survey card to view the results. Select the ... Icon to remove the card, or view more analytics in SurveyMonkey.
